title: IT Support Assistant
description: We are a fast-growing wealth management company based in the heart of the city. We have over 1,000 clients and provide comprehensive advice on a range of issues, including pension, mortgage advice and tax-planning. Our main purpose is to make lives better,  and we pride ourselves on our long-lasting client relationships and brilliant career opportunities. We aim to be one of the best businesses to work for in London and believe our culture makes us stand out.

This is a brilliant opportunity for an enthusiastic individual looking to start their career in IT. We are looking for a driven, committed, well -presented individual to join our expanding business. This is a support role, which will involve troubleshooting  any IT issues that may occur within the business and helping to set up and maintain IT infrastructure. A successful applicant will have great attention to detail, a strong work ethic and be able to work and solve problems independently.
You will receive structured and on the job training from our Technical Ops Manager, Luke.
Installing and configuring computer hardware, software, systems, networks, printers and scanners
Monitoring and maintaining computer systems and networks
Responding in a timely manner to service issues and requests
Troubleshoot system and network problems, diagnosing and solving hardware or software faults
Providing technical support across the company
Setting up accounts for new users
Repairing and replacing equipment as necessary
Testing, evaluating and reporting on new technology
Supporting roll outs of new technology and assisting with migrations
Liaising with third-parties to find solutions
An ability to work and find solutions independently

title: Représentante
description: Faire des rêves de vacances une réalité !

Notre vision, de nos jours, reste véridique aux ambitions de Thomas Cook – être la compagnie de vacances la plus aimée dans le monde entier. Qu’en pensez-vous de réaliser les vacances de rêves pour nos vacanciers ?

Dans cet emploi, c’est exactement ce que vous ferez pour nos vacanciers ! Nous vous demanderons de « mettre les tongs de nos vacanciers », afin de comprendre ce qu’ils recherchent pour des vacances parfaites.

Travailler en faisant partie de notre Equipe « In Destination Services » (iDS) et Jet Tours, vous tiendrez le client proche au cœur pendant chaque étape de leur vacances, dès leur arrivée à l’aéroport jusqu’à leur séjour à l’hôtel,  en fournissant des infos excellentes de vacances.
Pour obtenir de l'aide sur nos destinations aux pays européens pendant la saison estivale 2019, nous recherchons plusieurs:
Guide touristique (h / f) - Français et Allemand
Vous assurez le bon déroulement des vacances de nos clients, de l'arrivée au départ, y compris:
Soutenir nos clients dans toutes les possibilités dans les hôtels qui vous sont assignés
Conseils sur la planification de la (des) semaine (s) de vacances et des activités (excursions, voitures de location)
Parle couramment le français, allemand et anglais, d'autres compétences linguistiques telles que le néerlandais, le polonais, le tchèque ou le hongrois sont un avantage
Orientation de service élevée et plaisir d'offrir un service de classe mondiale
Empathie forte, sens aigu des responsabilités et capacité à travailler de manière autonome
Le permis de conduire de classe B est désiré (au moins 1 an d'expérience)
Une semaine de travail de 5 jours!
formation de guide (s) touristique (s) de 10 jours et formation d’initiation à destination
Une ambiance de travail agréable dans une équipe internationale d’une entreprise dynamique
Contrat de travail temporaire suisse avec assurance privée suisse (dans le monde entier)
l'hébergement gratuit à destination (garantie pour une chambre individuelle) et votre vol aller-retour à destination
Opportunités de carrière intéressantes du groupe Thomas Cook à l'étranger et à notre siège social
Possibilité de cours de langue gratuits
Réduction de personnel pour les vacances privées
Style de vie, divertissement et nouvelles expériences à l’étranger
à partir d’entre février et juin, durée: au moins jusqu'à fin octobre
Flexible sur l'une de nos destinations à l'étranger, comme l'Espagne, la Grèce, l'Italie, la Bulgarie
Inscrivez-vous maintenant pour commencer l'aventure avec Thomas Cook et faire 2019 l'été de votre vie.
Avez-vous des questions? N'hésitez pas à nous contacter par e-mail à l'adresse suivante:

title: Finance Analyst
description: Investigo are delighted to be exclusively supporting a Northamptonshire based Manufacturer with their recruitment of a Finance Analyst, on a permanent basis.

The role of Finance Analyst will act as a first point of contact to the relevant site GMs to help maximise the profitability by providing timely, relevant and insightful information to facilitate the continual improvement of operational efficiency, available  capacity and service levels.
They will work closely with the Finance Business Partner to ensure that suitable financial controls and processes (in line with Group policy) are in place, sufficient and adhered to consistently.

The Finance Analyst will work with the sector finance team and the SSC to ensure that working capital is actively managed and improved and the month end, budget and forecasting cycles to be managed accurately to schedule.

The successful Candidate will be a Professionally Qualified individual with 0-2 years PQE, and a strong analytical background. They will possess a good understanding of financial management, reporting, controls and processes.
Our Client is offering a salary of £40,000 - £45,000 + Benefits.

Working as a Customer Service Coordinator you will be responsible for:

title: Financial Planning Administrator
description: Our client is a leading provider of financial advisory services to a range of private client and corporate organisations. Due to sustained growth, they are currently seeking a competent Financial Planning Administrator / IFA Administrator to join their growing  team.
- Providing administration and planning support to Financial Planners and a professional service to new and existing clients
- Undertake client valuations and prepare information ahead of client reviews - Liaising with insurers / providers for new business quotations and updating software accordingly
- Ensuring all client records are kept up to stand and all relevant checks etc are completed

Candidates need to have experience of working within financial services administration. You will have strong verbal and written communication skills and have the ability to manage multiple tasks. Experience of using Adviser Office / First / Avelo would be  a distinct advantage.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary as well as a leading benefits and bonus package.

title: Security Officer
description: Cordant Security are currently looking for a Retail Security Support Officer to be based in the
You will be asked to cover multiple sites across our prestigious client base. Interested candidates must have a valid frontline SIA licences/SIA training certificates.
Responsibilities of the Retail Security Support Officer:
Ensure the safety and security of staff and customers within working environment
Liaising with police and other emergency services
Any other retail security support officer associated tasks as required
Requirements of the Retail Security Support Officer:
A full UK driving licence and access to own transport is essential for this role due to the sites you may be asked to cover
Experience in apprehension of shop lifters and subsequent reporting would also be an advantage
Incentives for the Retail Security Support Officer:
Working up to 40 hours per week as and when required covering a mixture days, lates & weekends
Applicants will need to be flexible
28 days annual leave per year inclusive of bank holidays
Full and ongoing training with a view for career development
A range of employee discounts for the purchase of goods and services
Cordant Security Ltd is a nationwide company with a diverse employee team and we welcome applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates.
We have opportunities available across the UK in a variety of roles and offer genuine paths to career progression and a range of employee benefits.
Cordant Group is an equal opportunities employer

title: Warehouse Supervisor
description: A leading supplier into the manufacturing sector has a fixed term contract opportunity for a Warehouse Supervisor to join their operations in Derby.

As Warehouse Supervisor you will report into the Warehouse Manager and be responsible for all aspects of the team's performance, specifically achievement of quality and delivery targets, process adherence to ensure all of the material handling processes from  the point of delivery of product through to receipt by the customer, ensuring that customer service, quality, and business requirements are met to the highest standards.
For consideration you will have relevant background experience within logistics / warehousing and have the ability to supervise a team efficiently and effectively.
Knowledge of continuous improvement, working to 5S standards would be an advantage coupled with the ability to communicate effectively with both internal and external stakeholders at all levels.
For further information, please apply attaching a full CV for consideration.

title: Primary Supply Teachers for Thurrock
description: Are you a Primary Supply Teacher in Thurrock looking for flexible work?

Pertemps Education are currently looking for qualified, enthusiastic and dedicated Primary Supply Teachers in order to fulfil daily supply, short term and long term contracts with partner primary schools in Thurrock.

We are currently increasing our agency presence in the Thurrock area and would like you to be part of our continual growth as one of our Primary Supply Teacher. There is an increasing demand for contract staff in education, including short and long term opportunities  to start immediately and for the rest of the year.
To work through Pertemps Education you must:
- Be a fully qualified teacher - NQT's are more than welcome
- Have up to date curriculum knowledge across all Key Stages
- Be flexible, reliable and conscientious and adaptable to changing situations
- Ability to travel to our partner schools in Thurrock
- Enhanced DBS dated within the last 12 months or on the update service
- Right to work in the UK
- Reference provisions in the last 2 years
By registering with Pertemps Education, we are able to offer you:
- Work locally to where you live
- Opportunities to secure longer term and permanent positions
- Support from a personal experience recruitment consultant
- Recommend a friend bonus scheme - £250 bonus!

Click 'Apply', upload your CV (including up to date telephone number and email). However, if you are interested in having a conversation regarding Primary Supply Teacher opportunities that we have available, then please call Sarah on or email

title: Senior Group Risk Administrator
description: Our client, a well established and award winning employee benefits consultancy, are currently seeking to recruit an experienced Senior Group Risk Administrator to provide a comprehensive administration service to clients and intermediaries whilst providing  support to more junior members of the team.

You will be the first point of contact for all client and provider queries and issues as they arise and will be expected to have the skills and knowledge to understand what actions are required to meet the expectations of all parties.

Candidates will need to have experience in administering Group Risk / Group Life schemes within either a provider, life office, consultancy or broking background. Candidates will ideally hold professional qualifications, ie GR1, although this is not essential.  You will have excellent communication skills and ideally experience of dealing with a range of Corporate clients.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary depending on experience as well as an excellent company benefits package.

description: Are you a Primary Supply Teacher in Basildon looking for flexible work?

Pertemps Education are currently looking for qualified, enthusiastic and dedicated Primary Supply Teachers in order to fulfil daily supply, short term and long term contracts with partner primary schools in Basildon.

We are currently increasing our agency presence in the Basildon area and would like you to be part of our continual growth as one of our Primary Supply Teacher. title: Trainee Mortgage Advisor
description: Our client is a highly reputable and established Mortgage and Loan intermediary based in Welwyn Garden City.

Owing to continued expansion as a result of increasing business volumes, they are currently seeking to recruit a Trainee Mortgage Advisors with a high amount of drive and determination to earn money to join their growing team.

We are seeking candidates who have ideally had some exposure to the mortgage / financial services market as well as some previous sales experience. Candidates need to be CeMAP qualified (or equivalent) already, although you will be given full training and support  as well as opportunities to progress your career within this award winning organisation.
In return our client is looking to pay a competitive basic salary with an excellent bonus structure.

title: Pensions Administrator
description: As a result of continued expansion our client, an independent firm of actuaries and employee benefit consultants, are currently looking for a Pensions Administrator to join their Administration team dealing with both DB and DC schemes.

Candidates will be responsible for dealing with enquiries from new and existing scheme members, clients, financial advisers, employers, HMRC and the Department of Work and Pensions etc. You will ensure the effective administration of clients’ pension schemes  on a day-to-day basis and delivery of excellent levels of service to clients. You will support the Pensions Administration Manager with day to day management of the team including the checking of work, including manual calculations, and identify potential  areas for improvement and change.

- Candidates need to have previous experience of working within the pensions industry, ideally having dealt with both Defined Benefit and Defined Contribution schemes within a TPA environment, although our client will consider candidates from an in-house  environment, or those with experience of only DB or DC schemes.
- Ideally you will have achieved, or be working towards, PMI or CII qualifications

In return our client is looking to offer a very competitive basic salary as well as an excellent benefits and bonus package and plenty of opportunities for career progression within this growing organisation.

title: Financial Advisor
description: Our client is one of the UK's largest Financial Service organisations and due to continued expansion they are presently looking to recruit a field based Financial Advisor to join their growing team.

Duties include advising clients on a range of financial products in their homes and will include regular evening work. Existing client base and all administration / compliance support will be provided.

Previous sales experience is required, preferably within a financial adviser role although our client will consider someone with mortgage or insurance sales experience. Financial Planning (FPC / CeFA) qualifications are preferred but not essential.
In return our client is offering a competitive basic salary as well as an uncapped and generous bonus structure, company car, pension, life insurance and 5 weeks holiday etc.

title: Senior Group Risk Administrator
description: Our client, a well established and award winning employee benefits consultancy, are currently seeking to recruit an experienced Senior Group Risk Administrator to provide a comprehensive administration service to clients and intermediaries whilst providing  support to more junior members of the team.

You will be the first point of contact for all client and provider queries and issues as they arise and will be expected to have the skills and knowledge to understand what actions are required to meet the expectations of all parties.

Candidates will need to have experience in administering Group Risk / Group Life schemes within either a provider, life office, consultancy or broking background. Candidates will ideally hold professional qualifications, ie GR1, although this is not essential.  You will have excellent communication skills and ideally experience of dealing with a range of Corporate clients.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary depending on experience as well as an excellent company benefits package.

title: Science Teacher Wirral
description: We are looking out for a dynamic, experienced and inspiring scientist for the demand of one of our clients in the Wirral area. The school is looking for a passionate and confident Science Teacher who has the ability to motivate students about science and  raise their achievement through delivering outstanding practice.

The suitable candidate will be working with an experienced team of education specialists whose sole focus is on the Secondary Sector and we welcome anyone who would love the opportunity to be part of that and want to develop their teaching skills.

The successful candidate will be an experienced Science Teacher. You will be expected to plan, prepare and deliver stimulating, innovative, challenging and enjoyable lessons that keep pupils engaged and encourage participation and progression. You will be  teaching Key Stages 3 -5 pupils so you will need to have successfully prepared pupils for GCSE and A Level examinations be able to cover all topics of Biology, Chemistry and Physics.
Qualified Teacher Status or a PGCE
An up to date DBS disclosure - cost will be covered by the applicant
At least 2 years' recent experience within in a classroom setting
Ability to plan, deliver and mark their own lessons
If you are interested in this opportunity please send across your CV and we will contact you. Alternatively you can call us on .

Exclusive Education have a number of roles within Primary, Secondary and Special schools covering both short and long term roles. If this role does not match what you are looking for then please contact us on to find out about the other opportunities  we have available.
Exclusive Education offer a referral scheme so recommend a friend for this or any other positions and you will receive a voucher*

title: Protection Consultant
description: Our client, a leading and multi-award winning mortgage broker, is currently seeking to recruit several Protection Advisors to join their busy and highly successful team.

Candidates will be responsible for speaking with clients and undertaking in-depth reviews of their financial / protection circumstances to run alongside their mortgage. You will analyse information and prepare plans best suited to individual client requirements  and ultimately help clients make informed decisions.

Candidates need to come from a financial services / banking / insurance background and ideally have experience of offering advice or selling protection / insurance / mortgage based products. Candidates need to hold RO5 or equivalent. You will be highly motivated  and able to thrive in a busy environment.
In return candidates can expect to receive a competitive basic salary, excellent benefits package and a market leading commission / bonus structure.

title: Nursery Room Leader
description: Our client is a well-established and respected day nursery in the Wimbledon area and they’re looking for an experienced Room Leader to join their team. This is an opportunity for someone to take the next step in their childcare career within a fun and vibrant  environment.
The Nursery Room Leader will be responsible in dealing with the day to day running of their designated room.
Overseeing a team of Practitioners and helping to ensure that their jobs are done to the highest possible standard.
Planning games and activities for the children to participate in.
The Room Leader will also be responsible for keeping parents informed of their child’s progress as well as any key events or changes regarding the nursery.
For this position you MUST have the following
A minimum of a Level 3 qualification in Childcare
Experience of working within a senior nursery position

title: Financial Adviser - Pension & Retirement Planning
description: Switch Recruitment are delighted to be recruiting for an award winning firm of Independent Financial Advisers with an excellent reputation for creating impartial financial solutions for both individuals and companies.

The Financial Adviser Pensions & Retirement Planning role will be suitable to someone who has experience of working as a Financial Adviser in Pensions & Retirement Planning within financial services, or an IFA or Insurance Company.
This is a nationwide role, all clients and leads will be provided.

The Financial Adviser Pensions & Retirement Planning role has arisen following the increase in demand of business, as our client continue to win new projects successfully. To be successful, you will be an experienced pension adviser within the financial  services; possess strong technical knowledge, and have gained the relevant experience, to apply this knowledge within the financial services role.
To be successful in the Financial Adviser Pensions & Retirement Planning role:
You must have experience in Pensions and Retirement Planning
Level 4 Qualified with Specialist Pension qualifications such as AF3 or G60
You will also be a good communicator and have a working knowledge of the financial services industry.
You will be computer literate and wish to use this unique opportunity to widen your skills and knowledge to progress to a senior adviser or management position.
This is a great opportunity for someone who is keen to join a dynamic team leading in Pensions and Retirement Specialists. This is an office based role.

title: Employee Benefits Administrator
description: Our client, a well established and successful intermediary operating within the employee benefits market, are currently seeking to recruit an experienced Employee Benefits Administrator (specialising with the administration of GPP / Auto-Enrolment schemes)  to provide a comprehensive administration service to consultants and clients.
Drafting of client direct offer letters
Establish and maintain client governance reports.
Liaising with Consultants and insurers for new business quotations.
Processing of new business applications within service standards.
Assisting clients with the monthly submission of contribution schedules.
Dealing with routine correspondence and annual review notifications.
Notification and organisation of documentation despatch by providers following deaths/leavers/fund switches.

Candidates will need to have experience in administering Group Personal Pensions (GPP’s) or Auto-enrolment or Group Stakeholder Schemes within either a provider, life office, consultancy or broking background. Candidates will ideally hold professional qualifications,  although this is not essential. You will have excellent communication skills and ideally experience of dealing with a range of SME and Corporate clients.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary depending on experience as well as an excellent company benefits package.

title: Senior Design Engineer - Berkshire
description: SALARY- £35,000 - £42,000 per annum dependent on experience (please advise what you’re looking for)
My client designs and manufactures electro-mechanical products, and they are looking to take on a Senior Mechanical Design Engineer on a permanent basis, in the Berkshire area.
will ideally have the following attributes:
Degree qualified in Mechanical Engineering / Product Design / Mechatronics or similar
Have 5 years or more experience in a development / design role for manufacture
Have experience of using 3D CAD software (SolidWorks ideal but other programmes will also be considered)
Any experience of working with different materials and with different manufacturing techniques: injection moulding and metal fabrication
Have the ability to work well alone as well as part of a team
Any experience in technical authorship would be an advantage
Being able to prioritise time to manage projects effectively
The ability to use Microsoft Office programmes
The Senior Design Engineer role will involve:
Designing and developing electro-mechanical products from concept through to production
Strengthening the NPD Project Management capabilities
Using 3D CAD – SolidWorks on a daily basis
Liaising with colleagues in different internal departments when required
Evaluating new designs using prototypes FEA, DFMA and FMEA
If you are interested in this position, please apply with an up to date CV as soon as possible, along with your availability and your salary expectation.

title: NQT positions - Outstanding Trust of Schools
description: Are you currently training to be a Secondary School Teacher?
Do you want to be ahead of your class by securing a permanent position in a school able to support your NQT year from September 2019 or sooner?
Sugarman Education are once again supporting an OUTSTANDING Secondary academy in Redbridge who are seeking NQT's in all curriculum subjects to join their modern and forward thinking school.
If you are currently completing your teacher training, or have already graduated but are yet to secure a position, then Sugarman Education can help you on your way to starting your teaching career.

Due to expansion, the school are able to offer NQT roles across all subjects including English, Maths, Science, Modern Foreign Languages, Geography, History, RE, Humanities, Social Sciences, Law, PE, Computing and Business Studies/Economics.
The academy are able to offer:
An impressive newly qualified teaching programme
State of the art technology and high spec classrooms
A financial incentive of being paid through the summer prior to September start
An opportunity to work with experienced colleagues who are among the best in their field.
Schools that boast modern facilities and state of the art technology in each classroom.
The ability to identify internal talent and progress them quickly on career development pathways
The appointed NQT's will meet the following standards;
Hold a 2:1 or higher in a subject related bachelor's degree
Currently be in their second placement and achieving "Good" or "Outstanding" feedback
Have a passion for their subject area and be determined to pass this on to inquisitive, academic students
Able to deliver, creative and engaging lesson that stretch learners to their full potential

With over 28 years experience within education recruitment, Sugarman Education are able to offer an unparalleled service in matching teachers to permanent posts. We understand that, when it comes to a permanent role, one size doesn't fit all and we therefore  tailor our approach to ensure we secure the right job for your career. Your dedicated permanent placement consultant will be on hand to offer CV writing assistance, comprehensive Interview preparation and support throughout the process to ensure securing an  NQT post is stress free and you can focus more time to completing your studies!
Interviews are taking place in the NOW for September 2019.

The Principle would like to secure the best NQT's in post ASAP so please send CVs to Danielle Nicholson or call Danielle on to hear further details of this job opportunity and to learn of all NQT job opportunities available.

Sugarman Education is committed to Safer Recruitment and currently holds the REC Education Accredited Status. Any job application is subject to an enhanced DBS check and satisfactory references in addition to any other safeguarding checks required
Cordant Group is an equal opportunities employer

title: Senior Analyst
description: Does banking interest you? Ready to make the move to a new Senior analyst position?

My client is one of the best-known names in financial services. This client has decades of experience and has an annual revenue of well over $100,000,000! They are always moving with the times and now want your expert skills to bring critical insight.

You are going to be working primarily with a focus on a key partner offering the best insights to stakeholders as a result of your work. This will involve serious commercial understanding and will look to progress into a managerial position where your skills  can be passed on to your team.
In particular, as the Insight Manager, you can expect to be involved with the following:
Work without micromanagement and always finish your work to a degree that exceeds expectations
Work as a key member of a large team
Utilise your SAS and Excel skills to deliver cutting-edge insight
Education: University educated with minimum - 2.1 grade
SAS and SQL - utilised in commercial environment
Experience of R a benefit not a requirement
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Greg Jerwood via the apply link on this page

title: Paraplanner
description: Our client, an expanding and award winning Wealth Management and Employee Benefit Groups who look after multiple FTSE100 clients, currently requires a Paraplanner to join their private client IFA division following continued growth.

Candidates will be responsible for a range of duties including undertaking technical research and preparation for client meetings (as well as attending client meetings where needed), preparing client reports / suitability letters / pension transfer analysis  reports, Handling technical client queries etc.

Candidates need to ideally be educated to degree level and be Level 4 / Diploma qualified. It is essential that candidates demonstrate a strong background within a similar environment as a Paraplanner as well as having an outgoing and aspirational personality.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary as well as an excellent benefits package.

title: Data Protection Manager
description: We are pleased to be representing a leading wealth management and employee benefits organisation who are seeking to recruit a Data Protection Manager to join their expanding compliance and risk team.

You will be responsible for maintaining a secure framework for the management of our clients data and ensuring compliance with data protection legislation. You will work in conjunction with various stakeholders within the business to ensure that appropriate  policies and procedures are developed and implemented in order to maintain effective control framework. You will also maintain the business continuity and associated crisis management framework for the business, ensuring that there is continuing awareness  of its requirements and that testing is undertaken on a regular basis.

Candidates need to be educated to degree level with a recognised data protection qualification. You will have an excellent understanding of the requirements of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and related legislation. Candidates ideally need  to have experience of operating within the wealth management or employee benefits market, although our client will consider broader financial services.
In return, candidates can expect to receive a competitive basic salary as well as an excellent benefits package.

title: Customer Insight Manager
description: Have you ever considered working for one of the largest global banking organisations in the world?

My client is one of the best-known names in financial services. This client has decades of experience and has an annual revenue of well over $100,000,000! They are always moving with the times and now want your expert skills to bring critical insight.

You are going to be working primarily with a focus on a key partner offering the best insights to stakeholders as a result of your work. This will involve serious commercial understanding and will look to progress into a managerial position where your skills  can be passed on to your team.
In particular, as the Insight Manager, you can expect to be involved with the following:
Work without micromanagement and always finish your work to a degree that exceeds expectations
Present and tell the story of insight using your key presentation skills to stakeholders
Improve revenue by engaging customers in new and effective ways
Education: University educated with minimum - 2.1 grade
SAS and SQL - utilised in commercial environment
Experience of R a benefit not a requirement
Strong ability to grow teams having managed in the past
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Greg Jerwood via the apply link on this page.

title: Science Teacher Liverpool
description: We are looking out for a dynamic, experienced and inspiring scientist for the demand of one of our clients in the Liverpool area. The school is looking for a passionate and confident Science Teacher who has the ability to motivate students about science  and raise their achievement through delivering outstanding practice.

The suitable candidate will be working with an experienced team of education specialists whose sole focus is on the Secondary Sector and we welcome anyone who would love the opportunity to be part of that and want to develop their teaching skills.

The successful candidate will be an experienced Science Teacher. You will be expected to plan, prepare and deliver stimulating, innovative, challenging and enjoyable lessons that keep pupils engaged and encourage participation and progression. You will be  teaching Key Stages 3 -5 pupils so you will need to have successfully prepared pupils for GCSE and A Level examinations be able to cover all topics of Biology, Chemistry and Physics.
Qualified Teacher Status or a PGCE
An up to date DBS disclosure - cost will be covered by the applicant
At least 2 years' recent experience within in a classroom setting
Ability to plan, deliver and mark their own lessons
If you are interested in this opportunity please send across your CV and we will contact you. Alternatively you can call us on .

title: Pensions Specialist
description: We are pleased to be supporting a multi-award winning financial services organisation in their continued expansion following recent successful new business wins.

Our client is seeking several Pensions Specialists to add to their pensions and retirement planning team advising corporate scheme members as well as individual members and pension trustees, regarding how to maximise the funds held within their pensions  when approaching or at retirement stage.

Candidates need to have experience of advising on pensions, corporate or individual, and hold Level 4 Diploma in Financial Planning (DipPFS) or equivalent. The addition of G60 OR AF3 is preferred but not essential as training and support will be provided  to achieve this. You must possess strong technical knowledge and have gained experience ideally within a comparable role / environment.

In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary combined with excellent bonus and benefits scheme. You will also be joining a market leader who are expanding as a result of successful project wins.

title: Mortgage Broker
description: Our client, a rapidly expanding mortgage broker, is currently seeking to recruit several Qualified Mortgage Advisors to join their busy and highly successful team.

Candidates will be responsible for providing quality mortgage and protection advice to a range of clients, working in a consistent and compliant manner to FCA standards. You will deal with a range of enquiries with both existing and new clients ensuring  you achieve sales targets by providing expert advice backed up by excellent customer service.

Candidates need to have previous mortgage advice experience, ideally within either an independent brokers, estate agency or banking environment, and hold a professional qualifications such as CeMAP, CF6, CeFA, MAQ. Candidates need to be hard-working with  a passion to perform and achieve within a target driven environment.
In return candidates can expect to receive a competitive basic salary of £30k+, along with a leading commission / bonus structure and an excellent culture and supportive working environment.

title: Professional Services Support Officer
description: Based London with some overseas travel likely

Make your work mean more - for you and the nation. As part of FCO Services, you’ll support various projects that protect the UK’s interests on an international scale. Every day you’ll grow your own career while at the same time helping us safeguard people  and information.
Support vital projects around the globe

Working within our Professional Services Centre, which comprises a wide range of technical building and construction teams, you will play a vital coordinating role in the delivery of large, multi-disciplined projects. Day to day, this will mean doing everything  from maintaining the project library to assisting with financial admin, from managing team communication channels to helping organise key stakeholder events. In all probability the role will involve overseas travel, although you are unlikely ever to be away  for more than one week at a time.
Take your technical skills to the next level

Ideally, we’re looking for someone with a technical qualification or equivalent experience providing technical support services. Some understanding of how construction projects are delivered would also be very useful. What matters even more than your previous  experience, however, is your ability to communicate and engage with all kinds of people and your outgoing approach. Strong IT skills are a must.
And start making real progress in your career

At FCO Services, you won’t just do work that has real impact, protecting information, assets and people all over the world. You’ll also be able to make real progress in your career, with opportunities to train in various aspects of project management and  gain exposure to some uniquely interesting project work.
All our employees have to be security cleared so you will need to undergo a vetting process before joining.
To find out more about this role, our benefits and our organisation, please click Apply Now.

title: Insurance Sales Executives
description: Our client, an expanding and award winning insurance brokers, currently requires 3 Sales Executives to join their growing team responsible for selling new private car, motor and home insurance policies.

Candidates will be responsible for responding to day to day client queries and adjustments and providing new business quotations. Day to day liaison with insurers, and maintaining good relations with Underwriters. Researching policies from different insurers  and arrange cover. Deal with renewals and collect any premiums due.

Candidates will ideally come from an insurance background, although this is not essential if candidates can demonstrate a strong sales background (either face to face or telephone based). You will have good attention to detail and be IT literate with a good  telephone manner. Candidates need to be highly motivated and have strong negotiation skills.
In return our client is offering a competitive basic salary, good benefits and bonus package and normal office hours.

title: Financial Advisor

Previous sales experience is required, preferably within a financial adviser role although our client will consider someone with mortgage or insurance sales experience. Financial Planning (FPC / CeFA) qualifications are preferred.
In return our client is offering a basic salary of circa £21k as well as an uncapped bonus structure, company car, pension, life insurance and 5 weeks holiday etc.

title: Senior Paraplanner
description: Our client is a well established and successful wealth management consultancy. Due to sustained growth they are looking to recruit an experienced and technical Senior Paraplanner to join their growing team.

Candidates will be responsible for dealing with more complex aspects including defined benefit transfers, IHT planning, cashflow modelling etc. You will undertake technical research and preparation for client meetings and attending client meetings where  needed. You will prepare client reports, suitability letters, pension transfer analysis reports etc as well as handle technical client queries.

Candidates need to be Diploma Qualified and ideally working towards or being Chartered. It is essential that candidates demonstrate a strong background within a similar environment as a Senior Paraplanner and have strong technical knowledge of all areas  of financial planning as well as being IT literate.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary as well as an excellent benefits and bonus package.

Please note, due to the single-sex nature of the lessons at this school, we are looking for female teachers only on this occasion.

title: Key Stage 1 Teacher - Year 1
description: An excellent Primary school in Bradford is looking for an enthusiastic, hard-working and high achieving Year 1 teacher to join their school in February 2019.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced Primary teacher who has high expectations of themselves and their students. You will be able to confidently and independently plan, prepare and deliver outstanding lessons that focus on progressing students through  informative and engaging class work. You will also need to be able to work as part of a team and will need to be confident whilst speaking with parents and external agencies.

Ideally you will be confident in teaching the core subjects and will feel passionate about extending pupil's academic abilities; this will provide you with the opportunity of progression and working alongside the Senior Leadership Team. You will be working  closely with ambitious and hard-working staff who will offer support and advice. This school is located closely to public transport links so the school is easily accessible. Newly Qualified Teachers (NQTs) and UK experienced Overseas Trained Teachers are encouraged  to apply too.

This school have an incredibly supportive Senior Leadership Team that enjoy working alongside their teachers to assist in teacher progression and also being there for their teachers throughout the year. The school encourages teachers to further their knowledge  by running internal CPD courses and also allow their teachers time to attend external CPD courses too. This has been a key factor in the rise in teaching standards across the school.

This school is a lovely 2 form entry school, with a close community ethos. The school has the luxury of having many resources available for their teachers to use and enjoy teachers being creative with the resources to engage all learners.
If you are an experienced and confident Year 1 teacher who is looking for an excellent position local to Bradford then please apply with an up to date CV

title: MHS Engineer
description: Solsbury Solutions are working with a global leader for the supply of Customer Shopping Trolleys, Shop Fitting Solutions, Logistics & Industry products. We are recruiting for a Field Service Engineer.
Key role and responsibilities for this role;
* You will be required to assist in the timely and effective completion of all reasonable requests made by the Service Office or your Area Supervisor / Line Manager.

* You will be required to undertake a comprehensive repair and maintenance service to mechanical/retail equipment at various locations throughout the UK. You will be requested to fit/strip retail equipment components, straighten and weld to the required standard  and carry out general maintenance duties at various sites of work. You may also be required to carry out special assembly works on a variety of products within our service sector and carry out reactive maintenance and planned preventative inspections and testing  on various electro-mechanical equipment.
* You will undertake completion of end of job reports, time sheets and any other documentation required, ensuring that you provide timely and accurate information on work activities.

* You will monitor and evaluate the service to the customer, highlighting any gaps in service/standards and/or issues and taking appropriate action to resolve them, involving escalation to your Manager if needed.

* You will be responsible for your own health & safety and the safety of all others working with you and members of staff, public and customers in your working vicinity; you must therefore ensure you abide by the provisions of all associated safe working procedures  for the repairs, maintenance and inspections you carry out. It is the responsibility of the employee's Line Manager to ensure all staff are trained and competent, but it also the responsibility of the employee to raise all concerns relating to training to  their line Manager. You will follow safe systems of work set out by the company in all instances and follow the company protocol for reporting accidents, near misses or store specific issues.

* You will be aware and comply fully with the Company Vehicle Information policy and report any incidents, accidents, theft, damage or faults as per policy to the Fleet Department and the appropriate forms are completed as per the policy.
* You will be aware of the Company Policy relating to provision of working equipment and ensure any damage to equipment is reported and any lost equipment is reported immediately.
* You will attend all relevant training sessions that are deemed necessary by the group subject to reasonable notice.
* You will also be required to offer full assistance to the Company when possible in the achievement of any reasonable requests.
The minimum requirements for this role are;
* Must have good electrical and mechanical fault finding ability coupled with maintenance skills with suitable qualifications.
* Must have experience with 230V and 415V electrical systems and hydraulics.

* Ideally suited to individuals from a heavy engineering background as much of the work will involve troubleshooting and repairing Dock Levellers, Scissor Lifts, Cardboard Balers and Industrial Compactors
Salary - £11 to £13.50 per hour depending on experience.
The role is a full-time position working 44.5 hours per week.
Applicants must meet the minimum requirements to be considered for the role.
If you would like to find out more about this position, please send us your CV by clicking 'apply now' and we will be in touch!

In return you will be offered:
• Various shifts to meet the hours you want. You let us now your available nights and we will fill them.
• Updates to mandatory training every twelve months – free of charge.
• Weekly pay direct to your bank.
• Ongoing feedback from the homes you work at.

You will also have the support of our team at the office – we know your work/life balance is important and we will work with you to ensure that you get the balance right by building a strong relationship with you.

Enhanced DBS is required for this role. Cost to be paid by Applicant £50. However applicants registered with Update Service for DBS will not to have incur this cost. We may accept a smaller contribution than £50 depending on your experience.
Please apply now or call us for more information.
We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Store Manager
description: Over 175 years ago, our founder Thomas Cook began this company with a vision to
‘broaden the mind of others and break down the partition walls of prejudice.'
‘the willing and devoted servant of the travelling public,’

Thomas Cook was a true pioneer of the travel industry, opening up a world of new destinations and new travel experiences to everyone. By obtaining the best services and prices for his customers, he laid the foundations of the company that still bears  his name today.
Thomas Cook is now one of the world’s leading leisure travel groups, supported by around 22,000 colleagues and operating from 15 countries.
Our vision today remains true to Thomas Cook’s ambitions -
to be the world’s most loved holiday company.
Discovery Store Manager - London Stratford - 37.5 hours per week - Permanent

Do you want be part of something big? Be the leader of a new experience? Come and be a part of our brand new Discovery Store experience. This is no ordinary store management role; this is an opportunity to run a modern store equipped with the latest technology,  lead and inspire a team of travel experts and bring holidays to life for your customers, all in your store! You’ll also be overseeing an array of exciting events and other activities taking place in your store’s wide open spaces.

As a Thomas Cook Retail Store Manager you’ll be coaching, developing and mentoring a team of Sales Consultants to make sure that our Customer is at the heart of everything we do! You’ll be role modelling our customer promises, values and behaviours by putting  yourself in your customers flip flops to deliver exceptional service every time. You will be responsible for achieving Sales and Revenue targets with extras including holiday money, travel insurance, car insurance and excursions. This role will allow you to  experience the full range of leadership responsibilities, with the support and guidance of a Regional Manager and is a great opportunity to develop and expand on your skills and knowledge.

You’ll be responsible for all aspects of the day to day running of the store whilst building and sustaining loyal and repeat customers. You’ll be using your commercial skills to make sure that all of your local marketing opportunities are utilised in your  location.
You’ll receive on-going development and have great future career opportunities within our retail network and beyond.

We have nearly 800 shops across the UK and put our customer at the heart of everything we do. To make sure we are available when our customers need us some of our stores are open in the evening and over the weekend, so you’ll need to be flexible with your  working hours. We operate on variable shifts to cover this but we’ll make sure you know your shift pattern at least 4 weeks in advance.
What will you need to succeed?
Experienced people manager with an inspirational, motivational and approachable leadership style
Commitment and passion to delivering excellent customer service consistently
Results focused with experience of driving team performance
Sound commercial acumen and the ability to make sense of cost control and profit data
Experience in developing people through strong leadership and sales management
Ability to support the team to be solution focused
Be able to work as part of a team; we’re one Thomas Cook and love to achieve targets together
This is a sales target environment so you’ll need to be motivated
Travel experience and knowledge of foreign exchange isn’t necessary but would be really useful
A confident and fun approach is essential
Willingness to learn and a commitment to personal development
23 days holiday, rising to 25 after 2 years
Excellent holiday concessions (including last minute employee offers giving you the opportunity to pick up a holiday at unbelievable prices!)
Great flexible benefits package (including childcare vouchers & discounted gym membership)
Chance to take part in exciting educational visits (such as attending the launch of new cruise ships, flights & hotel experiences)

Your career development is really important to us, so we’ll invest in a five week induction plan for you from the day you start in your new role. During this time, you’ll need to be available to work up to 37.5hrs a week (5 days over 7) to make sure you  have all the knowledge you’ll need to work as a travel expert. In week two of your five week induction, you’ll spend four days at our Peterborough Head Office (overnight accommodation will be booked for you if needed) where you’ll meet other new retail colleagues  and complete your training together. We’ve planned start dates each month throughout the year. If you’re invited for an interview, your interviewer will be able to explain more about this and answer any questions that you might have.

As a large global travel business, including overseas, tour operations and an airline, the sky really is the limit for your career progression. If you’re looking to start a fantastic new career journey with a leading international travel company and you’ve  got what it takes to be part of our winning team, then we’d love to hear from you.

Thomas Cook Co-operative Travel is the largest high street travel business in the UK. Our business started in 1841 and, as a pioneer with a trusted heritage, we have shaped the modern travel experience by understanding what our customers want and inspiring  their dreams. We employ over 21,000 employees around the world and are very proud to serve more than 20 million customers each year.

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that give

title: Operations engineer
description: IT-avdelningen på Ving/Thomas Cook Northern Europe sysselsätter idag 160 medarbetare som stöttar verksamheten med allt från design, utveckling, implementation och drift av IT-lösningar med Microsoft i fokus. Vi fortsätter att växa och har ett stort fokus  på digitala satsningar, 80% försäljning online och ökat samarbete inom Thomas Cook gruppen, därför behöver vi nu förstärka teamet Infrastructure & Service Operations med fler tekniker.

Infrastructure & Service Operations ansvarar för ett modernt Datacenter byggt på Microsoft-teknologi, som sträcker sig över flera siter. Här hanterar man allt från server, lagring, nätverk till ovanpåliggande plattform. Man ansvarar också för cloud lösningar  baserat på Azure samt infrastrukturen för våra fyra nordiska huvudkontor och ca. 70 branchkontor och hotell över hela världen.

Som Operations Engineer kommer du att vara huvudansvarig och driva vår övervakningsplattform till nästa nivå. Det handlar även om att tillsammans med våra utvecklingsteam och affärsverksamheten sätta upp nya larm och anpassa övervakningen efter behoven.  Vi har större del av vår övervakning idag i Microsoft System Center Operations Manager.
Du kommer även att arbeta med:
Drift och underhåll av MS Windowsplattform
Driftsättning av externa webbar och interna egenutvecklade system
Skapa och underhålla instruktioner och dokumentation
Planera och initiera förbättringar av serviceinnehåll, standarder eller funktioner relaterat till arbetsuppgifterna nämnda ovan
Du kommer jobba tätt med övriga på avdelningen för att stötta projekt/utvecklingsteam med infrakompentens.

Vi ser att du har mångårig erfarenhet av arbete inom IT Operations och breda kunskaper inom områden såsom nätverk, kommunikation, datacenter och Microsoft Azure. Du har djup kunskap inom Microsoft System Center och förståelse för systemutveckling och drift  av webserver-miljöer.

Du är driven, strukturerad och förstår vikten av att arbeta med ständiga förbättringar. Du fungerar både individuellt och i grupp. Du har förmåga att dokumentera, tänka och agera processorienterat samt en förmåga att föra över kunskap till andra. Eftersom  du kommer ha många kontaktytor är det viktigt att du är utåtriktad.

Meriterande om du har erfarenheter från större företag och/eller arbetat i flera olika roller inom IT, certifieringar inom IT, drift av Linux, kunskaper inom ITIL och erfarenhet av processorienterade organisationer samt automatisering.
Kontaktperson: Johan Romert, chef över Infrastructure & Platform, nås på

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vi sitter i nyrenoverade lokaler på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm med goda kommunikationer. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är  viktigt att du ska få se den produkt som du arbetar med. Du får tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet till vinstdelning om alla våra insatser leder till ett bra ekonomiskt resultat. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar  sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning Every Voice. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa på Thomas Cook!

title: Stage
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, à travers notre réseau, nous permettent d’offrir une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.
Thomas Cook propose les meilleures offres sélectionnées auprès de plus de 50 partenaires fidèles et procure, à nos clients, de véritables conseils d’experts en agence comme sur internet.

La marque Thomas Cook compte plus de 400 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 200 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages inspirationnel et immersif est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie omni canal, donnant la  possibilité aux clients de réserver leurs vacances par téléphone, en agences ou sur Internet.

Au sein du département Contrôle de Gestion, vous êtes en charge d'assister les différents Responsables du Contrôle de Gestion (Reporting Groupe, Suivi des coûts centraux, Réseau de distribution, Activité Tour Operating) dans la réalisation de reporting financier  et commercial, de clôtures mensuelles, et d'accompagnement des équipes opérationnelles. Vous serez notamment en charge de la préparation et de la diffusion de reportings internes.
Par ailleurs, à travers votre rôle transversal, vous assurez les tâches suivantes :
– Assister les différents Responsable du Contrôle de Gestion dans la réalisation des travaux périodiques et ponctuels
– Suivi et analyse des indicateurs clefs de l’activité et de la performance en collaboration étroite avec les directions opérationnelles
– Evolution des bases de données, des outils de reporting et des tableaux de bord dans un processus d’amélioration permanente
– Participation aux clôtures mensuelles en liaison avec les équipes comptables et contrôle de gestion
– Elaboration de business plan pour la prise de décision des actions à engager
De formation supérieure Bac + 5 de type Grande école de commerce ou Master 2 contrôle de gestion, vous maîtrisez l’anglais et les bases de la comptabilité.
Vous êtes très à l’aise avec les outils informatiques et les outils de gestion : vous maîtrisez Excel (tableaux croisés dynamiques et macros) et si possible Business Object.

Garant de la confidentialité des données, vous êtes apprécié(e) pour votre esprit d'analyse et de synthèse. Votre état d’esprit est dynamique et positif et vous aimez le travail collectif. Votre disponibilité, votre réactivité, votre autonomie seront les  clefs de votre réussite à nos côtés.
Stage de 6 mois à pourvoir immédiatement.

title: Flughafensachbearbeiter m/w/d München Voll/Teilzeit
description: Was für den Urlaub gilt, gilt auch für die Arbeit: Auf ein gutes Klima kommt es an! Deshalb legen wir Wert auf einen lockeren und respektvollen Umgang, bei dem offene Kommunikation an erster Stelle und Humor auf der Tagesordnung stehen. Unsere Mitarbeiter  unterstützen sich gegenseitig und gehen kollegial miteinander um.
Wir suchen für unsere Thomas Cook Airportstation mehrere
Einsatz im Schichtdienst inkl. den Wochenenden und Feiertagen
Hilfestellung bei Unregelmäßigkeiten im Reiseverlauf und Gepäckverlusten
Erstellung und Ausgabe von Reisedokumenten im Charter- oder Linienbereich
Inkasso von Reisepreisen, Sonderleistungen und Gebühren sowie Kassenführung
Erstellung von Abflugberichten, Überwachung der Thomas Cook Flugbewegungen
Beratung/Bearbeitung telefonischer Anfragen aller Art (z.B. zu Abfertigungsverfahren, Sonderleistungen, etc.)
Neben der Servicetätigkeit aktiver Verkauf von Flügen und Zusatzleistungen (z. B. Upgrades)
Abgeschlossene Berufsausbildung, idealerweise in der Touristik oder einschlägige Erfahrung im Dienstleistungs- und Servicebereich
Hohe Kunden- und Serviceorientierung, sowie sicherer Umgang mit Kunden
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse; weitere Sprachen sind wünschenswert
Kenntnisse der Angebots- und Leistungsarten der TC; Kenntnisse der Angebots- und Leistungsarten weiterer Veranstalter wünschenswert
Interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich gerne online!

title: Fitness instructor and Massagetherapist
description: Drömmer du om att arbeta utomlands? Vi söker nu dig som är utbildad gruppträningsinstruktör och Spa/Massageterapeut och som vill ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året!

Vi erbjuder våra gäster professionell gruppträning tillsammans med SATS Elixia. Ett utbud som ger både barn och ungdomar, nybörjare och mer avancerade vuxna motionärer möjligheten att träna på sin semester. Som kombinerad instruktör/terapeut på Sunwing &  Sunprime kommer du att leda klasser som
Powerstep, Core, Crosstraining, Yoga och Water aerobics
. På våra Sunwing Family Resorts leder du också klasser för barn i olika åldrar

När du inte instruerar klasser arbetar du med att utföra olika typer  av behandlingar som aromamassage, klassisk massage, kroppsbehandlingar, och mycket mer. I jobbet ingår också försäljning av produkter och viss receptionstjänstgöring. I ett team hos oss förväntas du vara en glädjespridare, flexibel, nyfiken på att lära nytt  samt professionell och personlig i ditt möte med våra gäster och kollegor.

Du är utbildad/licensierad gruppträningsinstruktör och utbildad spaterapeut eller massageterapeut. Vi ser det som ett plus om du har erfarenhet av att leda gruppträningsklasser som t ex aerobic, vattengympa, styrkeklasser och Yoga samt erfarenhet av att  utföra olika spa/massage behandlingar.
Du talar flytande skandinaviska och har ett brinnande intresse för människor och service samt även försäljning. Yrkeserfarenhet är meriterande.
Svenska eller något av de nordiska språken flytande i båda tal och skrift
Kallelser till intervju kommer att ske fortlöpande.
Gå gärna in på vår hemsida och läs mer om Du kan också följa våran personal i utlandet på Instagram under våran hashtag #workatsunwing
Övriga frågor besvaras av Nora Fretheim på telefon .
Startdatum av tjänst: Sommarsäsongen 2019 starat mars/april.

title: First Officer  / Unmotivated application
description: We are looking for pilots, who are eager to join a company that is known for its high quality and safety standard.
As a pilot with Thomas Cook, you will play a vital part in delivering the best weeks of the year for our guests.

You will be based in Copenhagen, but you will operate out of Scandinavia to our tour operators preferred destinations. You will be expected to have many days away from base, due to the nature of our operation.
has got 1.500 hours of total time and jet experience.
is living in the Copenhagen area or Southern Sweden.
has got an airbus rating (is an advantage, but not a requirement).
We are hiring for knowledge, skills and attitude.

We offer a highly competitive package with great staff travel opportunities. The remuneration is according to the collective labour agreement between Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia and Thomas Cook Pilot union.

Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia is Scandinavia’s largest charter carrier with more than 2 million annual guests. Our headquarter is located within Copenhagen Airport in Denmark. Our modern and eco-friendly Airbus-fleet operates from Denmark, Norway,  Sweden and Finland to destinations within Europe, as well as Africa, the Far East and the Caribbean. In corporation with Thomas Cook Group’s other airlines in the UK, Germany and Spain, we are part of the Thomas Cook Group plc with more than 28.000 employees  worldwide and 96 aircraft. Almost 19 million people are annually travelling with Europe’s second largest travel company.

description: Was für den Urlaub gilt, gilt auch für die Arbeit: Auf ein gutes Klima kommt es an! title: SPEECH AND LANGUAGE PATHOLOGIST
description: Are you considering overseas job opportunities? We are a progressive therapy center based in Singapore and currently recruiting both senior and junior Speech and Language Pathologists! Our talented, highly motivated team players hail from different corners  of the world including Singapore, Australia, New Zealand, the United Kingdom and Ireland. We are privileged to have varied and interesting caseloads that involve treating children and teenagers with specific language impairment, autism spectrum disorders,  literacy, articulation and motor speech disorders (not exhaustively).

Traditionally, we have attracted highly motivated and driven individuals who seek to acquire valuable top-quality international experiences and excel in their clinical skills. Our rigor in the selection of the best individuals have contributed in our becoming  one of the most respected private practice in Singapore. We collaborate productively and extensively with international schools, and are known amongst parents and teachers for the high quality work we do. We have also been active hosts to professionals who  are experts in their field. In 2019 we will be hosting "Learn to Play" by Professor Karen Stagnitti of Deakin University. We are honored to have had the opportunity of providing summer clinical placements for speech pathology students of well-known universities.

If you are a hardworking, flexible, and possess great work ethics….. If you possess a confident and outgoing personality ….. If you are have a mindset that continually seeks to learn and to provide the best of services to the clients, we would love to speak  to you.
The selected candidate can look forward to:
An enriching work experience where evidenced based and best practices is the order of the day
Comprehensive range of therapy resources and tools
Experienced supervisors from both private and hospital settings
Quality training programs for SLPs and OTs
Semi-structured environment with room for everyone to develop leadership skills
Well organized center with efficient administrators
Competitive remuneration which commensurate with experience
Higher take-home pay thanks to lower taxes in Singapore
Assistance with AHPC application and employment pass application process
The selected candidate must possess the following qualities
A recognised Bachelors’ Degree or Master Degree in Speech Pathology. Please refer to "List of Recognised Qualifications" on AHPC Singapore's website

At least 2 years of relevant clinical experiences. New graduates with prior experiences of working with the pediatric population albeit in a different capacity, or have shown outstanding clinical performance in pediatric placements will be seriously considered
Hardworking, flexible and creative team player who is prepared to "roll with the punches"
Comfortable working independently as well as part of a team
High level of interpersonal, written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management skills and self -monitoring skills
A great attitude for learning at every stage
New Graduates must be committed at least to a term contract of at least 30 months.

Selected candidate will go through the state's Allied Health Professions Council registration exercise and work with an AHPC registered supervisor. This supervisory experience is recognized in the back in home countries of UK, Ireland and Australia
Hear what an ex SLP said about us

"At Total Communication, the team of Speech and Language Pathologists assess and manage a varied and dynamic caseload of children and adolescents with speech, language and communication needs and are motivated to deliver a high standard of clinical practice.  The clinicians work closely with Occupational Therapists and Educational Therapists in the clinic as well as Psychologists, Paediatricians and Teachers externally to ensure strong collaboration within a multidisciplinary team. Collaborating with these professionals  and the clients’ families serves as a highly valuable experience that enables the clinicians to have a holistic view of their individual clients. In addition, the clinicians engage actively in pursuing Continuing Professional Development by attending conferences,  workshops and in-service programs and delivering talks to other professionals. This provides rich and exciting learning opportunities and adds to their repertoire of skills as developing clinicians. I will look back on my experience at Total Communication  as a fulfilling learning journey which has helped me grow as a clinician"
Instructions for Interested Applicants: Please write in with the assurance that your application will be kept strictly confidential to recruitment at totalcommunication.com.sg.

title: Administrator
description: Als onderdeel van het in Destination Management Team (iDM) doe jij dat precies! Je glijdt in de flip-flops van onze gasten om echt te begrijpen wat ze verwachten van hun perfecte vakantie.

Trouw aan het motto ,,Customer at our Heart", ligt de focus bij de gast in elk stadium van zijn vakantie, van aankomst op het vliegveld, de tijd in het hotel tot het verstrekken van uitstekende vakantie-informatie. Als lid van de Thomas Cook-familie  heb je de kans om de wereld rond te reizen, nieuwe vrienden te maken en onvergetelijke momenten te beleven.
Voor ondersteuning op onze bestemmingen in andere Europese landen in het zomerseizoen 2019 zijn wij op zoek naar verschillende:
Medewerker administratie op bestemming/Destination Admin (m/v) – Nederlands en Frans talig

Ondersteuning van onze reisleid(st)ers in administratieve zaken en in verschillende gastzaken op de bestemming, zoals: de toewijzing van aankomst- en vertreklijsten of contact opnemen met verzekeringsmaatschappijen
E-mailverkeer en oproepen van gasten, reisleiders en partners zoals hotels en agentschappen
Je staat in contact met onze verschillende hoofdkantoren en je geeft allerlei soorten informatie
Je biedt oplossingen en hulp aan onze gasten in geval van wijzigingen, klachten en noodsituaties
Vloeiend Nederlands en Frans gesproken en goed Engels, andere taalvaardigheden zijn een voordeel
Hoge servicegerichtheid en plezier om eersteklas service te leveren
Zeer goede organisatorische en communicatieve vaardigheden en assertiviteit
Ervaring in het omgaan met telecommunicatiesystemen en office programma's, evenals een snelle begrip van IT
Hoge flexibiliteit en veerkracht, en een onafhankelijke manier van werken
Ervaring in de administratie is een voordeel
Internationaal werken in een internationaal team dat zich voortdurend ontwikkelt
10-daagse training vooraf en een inwerk training op de bestemming
Een aangename werksfeer in een internationaal team van een dynamisch bedrijf
Tijdelijk Zwitsers arbeidscontract inclusief Zwitserse particuliere ziekteverzekering (wereldwijd)
Gratis accommodatie op de bestemming (garantie op een eenpersoonskamer) en je heen- en terugvlucht van en naar de bestemming
Interessante en uitdagende carrièremogelijkheden binnen de Thomas Cook Group in het buitenland en op ons hoofdkantoor
Lifestyle, plezier en nieuwe ervaringen in het buitenland
Begin maart of mei, duur: tot minstens eind oktober
Flexibel op een van onze bestemmingen in het buitenland, zoals Spanje, Griekenland, Italië of Bulgarije
Meld je nu online aan om het avontuur met Thomas Cook te beginnen en maak van 2019 de zomer van je leven. Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan gerust contact met ons op via e-mail op:

Welkom en vaarwel op de luchthaven
Ondersteun onze gasten in alle mogelijkheden in de hotels die aan jou zijn toegewezen
Advies over de planning van de vakantieweek(en) en activiteiten (excursies, huurauto's)

Hoge servicegerichtheid en plezier om service van wereldklasse te bieden
Sterke empathie, groot verantwoordelijkheidsgevoel en het vermogen om zelfstandig te werken
Plezier in het verkopen van excursies

10-daagse Reisleid(st)er training vooraf en een inwerk training op de bestemming

title: Contact Centre Agent
description: Contact Centre Agent - Tweetalig Nederlands en Frans
Als onderdeel van het in Destination Management Team (iDM) doe jij dat precies! Je glijdt in de flip-flops van onze gasten om echt te begrijpen wat ze verwachten van hun perfecte vakantie.
Trouw aan het motto ,,Customer at our Heart", ligt de focus bij de gast in elk stadium van zijn vakantie.

Je assisteert onze gasten 24/7 overal ter wereld. Als lid van de Thomas Cook-familie heb je de kans om de wereld rond te reizen, nieuwe vrienden te maken en onvergetelijke momenten te beleven. Help ons de populairste vakantieprovider ter wereld  te worden.
Voor ondersteuning van onze Connected Service Centers op Mallorca, Kreta en in Portugal in het zomerseizoen 2019 zijn wij op zoek naar verschillende:
Contact Center Agent (m/v) – Nederlands en Frans talig
Verwerking van wereldwijde vragen van gasten, suppliers en collega’s via telefoon, e-mail, WhatsApp, livechat en social media
Vlotte omgang met verschillende software en andere tools, zodat je snel informatie en antwoorden op vragen kunt bieden
Informatie geven aan onze gasten over de verschillende vakantieregio's
Het reserveren van excursies en huurauto's
Ondersteun onze gasten met vakantie aanpassingen, klachten en noodsituaties
Vloeiend Nederlands en Frans gesproken en goed Engels, andere taalvaardigheden zijn een voordeel
Hoge servicegerichtheid en plezier om service van wereldklasse te bieden
Zeer goede organisatorische en communicatieve vaardigheden en assertiviteit in stressvolle situaties
Ervaring in het omgaan met telecommunicatiesystemen en office programma's, evenals een snelle begrip van IT
Hoge flexibiliteit en veerkracht en een onafhankelijke manier van werken
Internationaal werken in een internationaal team die zich voortdurend ontwikkelt
Ervaring in een callcenter is een voordeel, geen vereiste
Bereidheid om in ploegendienst te werken, inclusief nachtdiensten
10-daagse training vooraf en kennismaking met het contactcentrum
Een aangename werksfeer in een internationaal team van een dynamisch bedrijf
Tijdelijk Zwitsers arbeidscontract inclusief Zwitserse particuliere ziekteverzekering (wereldwijd)
Gratis accommodatie op de bestemmingen (garantie op een eenpersoonskamer) en je heen- en terugvlucht van en naar de bestemming
Interessante en uitdagende carrièremogelijkheden binnen de Thomas Cook Group in het buitenland en op ons hoofdkantoor
Mogelijkheid van verschillende toeslagen zoals nachtdiensttoeslag en servicetoeslag
Lifestyle, plezier en nieuwe ervaringen in het buitenland
Beginnend in maart of mei, duur: tot minstens eind oktober
Meld je nu online aan om het avontuur met Thomas Cook te beginnen en maak van 2019 de zomer van je leven.
Heb je nog vragen? Neem dan gerust contact met ons op via e-mail op:

title: Estimator
description: £30,000 to £40,000 DOE + Bonus + Progression + Pension + Holiday

Excellent opportunity for an estimator from an engineering background to join a growing SME that is offering an interesting and challenging position with long term progression opportunities into senior roles.

This business have steadily been increasing headcount over the past 5 years and 2019 is set to be an exciting time as they forecast to break all company records in terms of turnover and growth. Due to the increase in contracts they are now looking for an  experienced estimator to join their busy team.
In this role you will deal with enquiries, quotations, tendering, customers, suppliers and continuous improvements in an enjoyable manufacturing environment.

The ideal candidate will have previous experience in an estimating position. Experience from an engineering, technical or manufacturing environment is vital. Any hands on experience with machining, milling, turning or grinding would also be beneficial.
This is a fantastic opportunity to join a successful growing business where you can take on a varied and challenging role and progress your career.
- Working in a busy manufacturing environment
- Come from an engineering, technical or manufacturing background
- Any hands on experience from machining, milling, turning, grinding & CNC would be beneficial
- Knowledge of manufacturing techniques and the ability to read engineering drawings

Estimator, Engineering, Manufacturing, Production, Machining, Technical, CNC, Machinist, Milling, Turning, Grinder, Estimating, Buyer, Buying, Estimating Manager, Sales, BDM, Admin, Quotes, Enquiries, Process, Tender, Costs, Orders, Material, Supplier, Customer,  Quality, Continuous Improvement, CI, Health, Safety, LEAN, FMEA, PPAP, Estimating, Aerospace, Factory, ONC, HNC, HND, Mechanical, Engineer, CAD, CAM, Edgecam, SolidCam, MasterCam, Vericut, MRP, CMM, Programming, Programmer, Setting, Operating, Bristol, Speedwell,  Fishponds, Hanham, Brislington, Emersons Green, Keynsham, Warmley, Longwell Greem, Filton, Stoke Gifford, Bradley Stoke, Patchway, Little Stoke, Barrow Gurney, Bishopsworth, Long Ashton, Abbots Leigh, Westbury on Trym, Pucklechurch, Yate, Saltford, Corston,  Bath, Wick, Winterbourne, Almondsbury,
This vacancy is being advertised by Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd. The services of Rise Technical Recruitment Ltd are that of an Employment Agency.
