title: Bar Manager
description: Casa Cook Ibiza está buscando un Jefe de Bar cualificado y entusiasta para brindar una excelente experiencia de degustación de bebidas para los huéspedes. La principal responsabilidad del Jefe del bar es vender y promover nuestro concepto único de  bar, liderar y motivar al equipo (quitar - del bar) y ser la cara y el alma del bar. El objetivo final es lograr superar la experiencia y la degustación de bebidas previas de cada huésped con nuestro concepto único de bebidas.
Gestión del control de costes a través de la planificación y supervisión de los costes de compra, producción y mano de obra y gestión de almacenamiento, asegurando que se cumplan los presupuestos.
Responsable del personal de servicio en el bar, asegurando que promuevan nuestro concepto de bar.
Liderar y desarrollar al personal, incluidas reuniones informativas y diarias.
Estar presente en el bar, para establecer relaciones con los clientes mientras se explica nuestro concepto y se recomiendan nuevas bebidas.
Analizar resultados, hacer planes de acción y proporcionar informes.
Participar en auditorías internas y externas.
Participar en reuniones de administración en el hotel y cooperar estrechamente con los otros departamentos del hotel.
Respetar las normas de saneamiento, HAACP y las normas de salud y seguridad.
Aplicar las mejores prácticas y estar al día con las tendencias en bebidas.
Experiencia laboral comprobada como camarero de bar y en administración de bares, preferiblemente dentro de un hotel internacional o “hospitality business”.
Experiencia en gestión de F&B, cálculo de costes, control de costes, planificación de personal y regulaciones laborales locales.
Excelente conocimiento en coctelería clásica así como en nuevas tendencias.
Inglés fluido, buen conocimiento del español. Se valorarán otros idiomas.
Fuertes habilidades de comunicación y liderazgo.
Certificado de hotel / escuela gastronómica, bar educación o equivalente.
Únete al equipo de Casa Cook y ayúdanos a continuar nuestra historia de éxito en Ibiza.
Trabaja en un entorno único, emocionante e inspirador.
Haz carrera en un entorno internacional con hoteles ubicados en todo el mundo.

Casa Cook es la nueva generación de hoteles de Thomas Cook, diseñada para atender a los viajeros que buscan tendencias y una experiencia de vacaciones relajada y auténtica. Casa Cook ofrece un hogar lejos del hogar, con un diseño individual que crea  un ambiente cálido y relajado.
Los huéspedes pueden disfrutar de su diseño fresco, de los productos locales y su cultura, mientras escuchan lo último en la música de la mano de nuestros DJ.

Como aventureros, creativos, amantes de la comida y soñadores, hemos viajado por todo el mundo reuniéndonos con almas de ideas similares. Con Casa Cook, nuestro objetivo es crear lugares que reúnan a personas con intereses e ideales compartidos.  Retiros para que una comunidad se conecte y crezca. Con ricas experiencias moldeadas por las culturas urbanas de todo el mundo.

Lanzada en 2016, Casa Cook es parte de Thomas Cook Hotel & Resorts (parte del Grupo Thomas Cook), con 200 hoteles en 47 destinos. Casa Cook es una de las ocho marcas de hoteles de Thomas Cook y está programada para expandirse internacionalmente en  los próximos años.

title: Bar Manager
description: Casa Cook Ibiza is looking for an enthusiastic and qualified Bar Manager to provide an excellent guest drinking experience. The Bar Manager’s main responsibility is to sell and promote our unique bar concept, lead and motivate the bar team and be  the face and soul of the bar. The ultimate goal is to succeed in exceeding each guests’ previous taste and drinking experience with our unique drinks concept.
Managing cost control through planning and supervision of purchasing, production and labour costs, storage management, ensuring budgets are met.
Responsible for service personnel in bar ensuring they promote our bar concept.
Leading and developing the staff, including daily briefings and meetings.
Being present in the bar, to build relationships with customers whilst explaining our concept and recommending new drinks.
Analyze results, make action plans and provide reports.
Participate in internal and external audits.
Participate in management meetings at the hotel and cooperate closely with the other departments at the hotel.
Uphold sanitation rules, HAACP and health and safety regulations.
Apply best practices and be up to date with trends in drinks and beverages.
Proven work experience as bartender and in bar management, preferably within an international hotel or hospitality business.
Experience in F&B management, cost calculation, cost control, staff planning and local labour regulations.
Excellent knowledge in classic bartending as well as in new trends.
Fluent English, good knowledge in Spanish, other language is an advantage.
Certificate of hotel/gastronomic school, bar education or equivalent.
Join the Casa Cook team and help us continue our success story on Ibiza.
Work in a unique, exciting and inspiring setting.
Grow your career in a fast-paced international environment with hotels located around the world.

Casa Cook is Thomas Cook’s newest breed of hotels designed to cater for trend-conscious travelers who seek a laid-back and authentic holiday experience. Casa Cook provides a home away from home, with an individual design that creates a warm and relaxed  atmosphere.
Guests can indulge in their love for fresh, locally produced food, culture and design whilst listening to latest DJ sounds.

As adventurers, creatives, foodies and dreamers, we’ve travelled the world meeting like-minded souls along the way. With Casa Cook we aim to create places that bring together people with shared interests and ideals. Retreats for a community to connect  and grow. With rich experiences shaped by urban cultures across the globe.

Launched in 2016, Casa Cook is part of Thomas Cook Hotel & Resorts (part of the Thomas Cook Group), with 200 hotels in 47 destinations. Casa Cook is one of Thomas Cook’s eight hotel brands and is set to expand internationally over the coming years.

title: Lifeguard- Sunwing Sandy Bay, Cyprus
description: Har du alltid drömt om att få arbeta utomlands? Föreställ dig en vardag där sol och palmer är mer självklart än regn och rusk. Vi söker nu dig
som är utbildad badvakt och vill spendera en lång sommar på Cypern.

På Sunwing Sandy Bay Beach på Cypern finns ett 975 kvadratmeter stort poolområde med sex pooler, varav en solskyddad babypool samt vattenrutschbanor . Här är det ditt jobb som badvakt att finnas till för våra gäster både om olyckan skulle vara framme men  framförallt jobba proaktivt för att inga incidenter ska inträffa. Du är vårt ansikte utåt och ska ha lätt för att prata med människor och trivas i en miljö där mycket saker händer samtidigt.
Du kommer att ingå i ett stort Skandinaviskt team bestående av ca 45 personer från Sverige, Norge, Danmark och Finland. Utöver de kommer du även att jobba nära den lokala personalen på hotellet.

Vi söker dig som är utbildad/licensierad badvakt/livräddare genom SLS och som minst har genomgått SLS utbildningssteg 1 till badvakt. Vi tror att du är en glädjespridare med hög social kompetens som trivs i att arbeta i team samt älskar sol och värme.
Tidigare erfarenhet av yrket, antingen i Sverige eller utomlands
Behärskar svenska flytande, i både tal och skrift
Om du har kunskaper i något/några av de nordiska språken

Tjänsten är en säsongsanställning och sträcker sig från 26 mars 2019 – 5 november 2019. Vi tillämpar lokala avtal med månadslön och arbetstiden uppgår till 40 timmar per vecka fördelat på 6 dagar. Boende, mat, försäkring och transport ingår i din anställning.  Efter avslutat kontrakt finns möjlighet till fortsatt anställning på våra Sunwinghotell i Thailand under vintersäsongen.
Vi kommer löpande att kalla till intervjuer och kontakt kommer att tas när du skickat in din ansökan.
Har du frågor om tjänsten är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Karl Käck,
Gå gärna in på vår hemsida Ving.se. Där kan du läsa mer om oss och våra hotell:

title: Mortgage Broker
description: Our client, a leading and multi-award winning mortgage broker, is currently seeking to recruit several Qualified Mortgage Advisors to join their busy and highly successful team.

Candidates will be responsible for providing quality mortgage and protection advice to a range of clients, working in a consistent and compliant manner to FCA standards. You will deal with a range of enquiries with both existing and new clients ensuring  you achieve sales targets by providing expert advice backed up by excellent customer service.

Candidates need to have previous mortgage advice experience, ideally within either an independent brokers, estate agency or banking environment, and hold a professional qualifications such as CeMAP, CF6, CeFA, MAQ. Candidates need to be hard-working with  a passion to perform and achieve within a target driven environment.

In return candidates can expect to receive a competitive basic salary, excellent benefits package and a market leading commission / bonus structure. Excellent working hours meaning no weekends or evening working!

title: Global Category Manager m/f/d
description: You will be managing a number of highly complex, strategic procurement projects for Thomas Cook Group. You will need to use your skill and knowledge to maximise cost performance and efficiencies. Your ability to communicate and influence at all levels, throughout  our global organisation, needs to be of the highest level. Your key strategic stakeholders include Thomas Cook business leaders across Europe with whom you will share your knowledge, experience and expertise around best practice. You will manage existing and  potential new suppliers relationships for goods and services. With some services currently outsourced, you will work with internal stakeholders to identify opportunities and analysis the benefits of insource versus outsource for some services.
Develop, implement and lead strategic sourcing plans for Global Indirect expenditure consistent with Thomas Cook Group’s Procurement policy and business requirements.

Keep updated in relation to relevant management and procurement techniques as well as anticipating developments within relevant supply markets to enable the development of strategic sourcing plans and development of the Group Procurement function.
Ensure acceptable practices are achieved or exceeded in the procurement of the designated goods and services and ensure delivery of breakthrough results.
Plan and lead negotiations which are of significant impact to the business, with in-depth legal and senior business management participation.
Proactively manage relationships with strategic suppliers to deliver required performance and continuous improvement.
Execute market and competition analyses, benchmark of goods and services.

Lead group category initiatives and interdisciplinary sourcing teams; manage complex, high value global sourcing projects for the area of Indirect Spend such as Professional Services, HR, Finance and Insurance/Legal topics.
Collaborate with key business stakeholders in the group and/ or within local subsidiaries.
Ensure market information is up to date to enable competitive analysis and enable the development of risk management and mitigation plans for the Global Procurement Category.
Degree/or equivalent standard of education, ideally within Procurement.
Extensive strategic procurement and supplier relationship management experience in the area of Indirect Spend such as Professional Services, HR, Finance and Insurance/Legal topics.
Team player with strong interpersonal/-cultural, influencing and communication skills.
Track record of strategic results delivery under pressure.
Track record of successfully leading a procurement and/ or project team including project management and organisational skills.
Financially literate – able to create and manage budgets, able to understand profit and loss accounts and balance sheets.
High level of ‘ownership’ with an ability to think outside the box, innovate and constructively challenge the status quo.
Category Manager, Merchandising, Relationship Manager, Marketing, Retail, Customer Service

title: Fitness instructor
description: Drømmer du om å jobbe i utlandet? Sunwing Family Resorts og Sunprime Hotels er på utkikk etter en fleksibel, erfaren og dyktig gruppetreningsinstruktør som vil bidra til å gi våre gjester de beste ukene i året!

Vi tilbyr gjestene våre profesjonell gruppetrening i samarbeid med SATS Elixia, sånn at treningsentusiaster i alle aldre, og uansett nivå, får mulighet til å trene i ferien. Som instruktør på våre Sunwing- og Sunprime-hotell kommer du til å lede timer som
Powerstep, Core, Crosstraining, Yoga, Water Aerobics

På Sunwing-hotellene vil du også lede aktiviteter for barn i forskjellige aldre. Når du ikke jobber som treningsinstruktør jobber du i sparesepsjonen, med service eller med barneaktiviteter i Mini Land.
Vi forutsetter at du er en gledesspreder med sosial kompetanse som er vant til å lede grupper. Utover det har vi følgende grunnkrav:
Du er utdannet som (eller lisensiert) gruppetreningsinstruktør.
Du er sterk i norsk eller noen av de andre nordiske språkene, både muntlig (flytende) og skriftlig.
Det er en fordel om du har hatt lengre utenlandsopphold i forbindelse med for eksempel studier eller jobb.
Det er en fordel om du har øvrige språkkunnskaper.
Stillingen er sesongbasert, og arbeidstiden er normalt 40 timer pr. uke. Akkurat nå søker vi instruktører til sommersesongen 2019, som varer fra mars/april til oktober/november.

De som går videre i prosessen og blir tilbudt en stilling på et av hotellene våre bil bli bedt om å delta på vår Fitness-skole. Den holdes i samarbeid med SATS Elixia på et av våre hotell i mars og varer i omtrent 2,5 uker.
Gå gjerne inn på nettsidene våre og les mer om treningstilbudet vårt på og . Du kan også følge vårt utenlandspersonale på emneknaggen #workatsunwing og #workatving på Instagram.
Øvrige spørsmål om stillingen rettes til Nora Fretheim, 0046 31-725 3906.
NB! I noen perioder har vi flere jobbannonser ute samtidig. Vi ber deg derfor om å søke kun på den stillingen som du er mest motivert for og kvalifisert til.
Innkallelser til intervjuer og auditionrunder skjer fortløpende i løpet av vinteren.
Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!
Er dette noe for deg? Registrer søknaden din med det samme!

title: Fitness instructor
description: Drømmer du om at arbejde i udlandet? Lige nu søger vi dig, der er en dygtig holdinstruktør, og som vil give vores gæster de bedste ferieuger på året.

Vi tilbyder vores gæster professionel holdtræning i samarbejde med SATS ELIXIA. Et tilbud som giver både børn og unge samt nybegyndere og mere avancerede voksne motionister mulighed for at træne i ferien. Som kombineret instruktør/terapeut på Sunwing Family  Resorts og Sunprime Hotels skal du lede klasser som
. På vores Sunwing Family Resorts leder du også hold for børn i forskellige aldre.
Når du ikke har holdtræning, arbejder du i SPA-receptionen eller med vores børneaktiviteter i Mini Land eller service.
Vi leder efter dig, som er en glædesspreder med gode sociale kompetencer og evnen til at lede grupper. Vi har desuden følgende grundlæggende krav:
Flydende dansk eller et af de andre nordiske sprog, både i skrift og tale
Længere udlandsophold, fx i forbindelse med studie eller job
Du arbejder sæsonvis, og arbejdstiden er som regel 40 timer om ugen. Lige nu søger vi instruktører til sommersæsonen 2019, som strækker sig fra marts/april til oktober/november.

Går du videre i processen og bliver tilbudt en stilling på et af vores hoteller ude i verden, kræves det, at du deltager på vores Fitnessskole. Skolen holder vi sammen med Sats Elexia på et af vores hoteller i udlandet i løbet af februar/marts. Skolen varer  ca. 2,5 uger.

title: Deputy Head of Legal  Central Europe m/f/d
description: Deputy Head of Legal – Central Europe (m/f/d)

Reporting to the Head of Legal, Continental Europe, the Deputy Head of Legal, Central Europe holds a senior legal position for the Central and Continental Europe legal teams. The role is responsible for all legal aspects of the German Tour Operator and supports  the Head of Legal Central Europe in all legal matters and the management of the Central Europe legal team. Additionally, the role supports strategic projects.
Act as key legal advisor to the Central Europe leadership team providing commercial and strategic advice
Draft, review and negotiate a wide variety of commercial contracts

Manage litigation matters, working with external legal counsel to determine strategy/tactics and ensure that cases are properly and appropriately prosecuted or defended to protect relevant rights and assets, driving demonstrable cost savings
Deputise for the Head of Legal as required, for all aspect of their role
Take a senior legal and commercial role in all strategic initiatives, projects and assignments
German qualified lawyer having trained and/or worked in a law firm
Proven leadership experience in respect of legal matters within a law firm and/or company

Analytically astute and demonstrates an understanding of how one issue may be part of a much larger system; identifies common themes across multiple issues and moves to resolve, handling situations and problems with innovation and creativity
Combines excellent technical legal knowledge with a keen commercial focus and practical judgement
Adept in combining compliance and risk management requirements with delivery of an ambitious business transformation agenda
Demonstrates financial awareness, controls cost and thinks in terms of profit, loss and added value
Resilient and able to work at considerable pace
Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers high quality legal service to the business segments/markets
A true team player, able to work with a variety of personalities and manage peers and stakeholders

title: Financial Planning & Analysis Manager
description: Starting with a single train journey from Leicester to Loughborough in 1841, we’ve grown into a travel company that’s constantly thinking about new and innovative ways to take you places: not just on holiday, but in your career too.

Whether you dream of working abroad or want to help create the next marketing campaign, there’s a range of roles across our retail stores, head office, Thomas Cook Airlines and far beyond. From Product Managers to pilots, there’s one thing we all have in  common: keeping the customer at our heart.
With a team of over 22,000 colleagues, operating across 15 countries, the opportunities are endless, whether you’ve worked in travel before or are looking to start a new adventure today.
A message from the Head of FP&A:
“I am looking for an analytical and commercially astute Chartered Accountant to join the Group Financial Planning and Analysis team here at Thomas Cook.

This role would be great for someone with post qualification experience who is looking to move out of accounting practice into industry, or for someone already in a similar role looking for a new challenge in the Central London Group Head Office of a  global Plc.

The Group FP&A team has ownership for analysing the historical and future performance of all of our divisions and, crucially, responsibility for providing senior business leaders with insight as to what the implications are. You’ll be working closely  with divisional FDs throughout the business as well as Investor Relations, Corporate Finance, Group Treasury, Group Communications and Group Tax. Once you’ve mastered this role, there are many viable routes for you to progress, be that within Group Finance,  within the Corporate Office, or internationally.

Thomas Cook is one of the largest travel companies in the world with annual revenues of over £9bn, operating in 16 different countries with 21,000 employees and a listing on the London Stock Exchange. It is also a great place to work. The finance team  is full of switched on and ambitious people, and the atmosphere is energetic, friendly, and sociable. Our central London location is super convenient, and our office has recently been modernised. We also benefit from staff discounts on flights and holidays!
If this sounds like it could be for you, why not apply today - we’d love to invite you in to meet the team!”

Co-ordinates and leads Group wide medium term (3-5yr) business planning and monthly re-forecasting processes. Guides and challenges vertical and horizontal business units during planning process ensuring Group-wide strategic  and transformation initiatives are consistently included. Summarises forecast and plan data into meaningful and insightful analysis to support Board level discussions. Supports the Group Head of Financial Analysis on ad hoc projects to improve understanding  of business performance and strategic initiatives in order to improve the clarity of the messages delivered to senior management and the Board to assist with decision making
Leads Group wide business planning and monthly re-forecasting processes
Maintains high-level strategic and financing model to assist in the setting of P&L and cash flow targets and strategic guidance;
Co-ordinates timetable and requirements for business planning and re-forecasting process to ensure that deliverables are timely and in line with expectations;
Supports, reviews and challenges individual business plans and forecast submissions with vertical and horizontal finance teams; and

Creates clear financial analysis and presentations/board papers for CFO, Board and other stakeholders which summarise and insightfully outline the Group’s financial business plan and re-forecast, supporting by strategic KPIs and transformation initiatives

Lead discrete ad hoc projects to critically analyse and evaluate Group wide strategic/operational/commercial proposals and be responsible for analysis and presentations to provide explanations both internally (through Group Finance Report and other mediums)  and external reporting (quarterly)
Experience of running financial planning and budgeting processes within a large corporate environment
Strong background and understanding of financial analysis and reporting, including knowledge of reporting to senior executive levels and Boards
Highly logical, analytical approach to working and capable of presenting complex financial information in an easy-to-understand format to Board level standards
Ability and desire to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment with experience of managing multiple demands under time pressure
Advanced proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint
Professional accountancy qualification (ACA, CA, ACCA, CIMA), experience in commercial or operational finance role

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.

title: Merchandising Specialist
description: Voor ons hoofdkantoor in Hoofddorp zijn wij voor de afdeling E-Commerce op zoek naar een ervaren en ambitieuze:

De merchandising specialist is verantwoordelijk voor de verkoop van de juiste producten op de websites van Thomas Cook Nederland. Je bepaalt welke producten waar gepromoot moeten worden en geeft aan in welke volgorde producten aan een klant worden getoond  bij een specifieke zoekopdracht. Je onderhandelt met je collega’s over beschikbaarheid en prijzen van de producten. Ook geef je terugkoppeling over producten die knelpunten ondervinden in hun online verkoop en ondersteun je productmanagement in het oplossen  hiervan. Je rapporteert aan de Commercial Owner E-commerce.
Analyse van verkoopresultaten van de producten die verkocht worden op de website (omzet, boekingen, bezoeken, conversie, bounce rate) en het initiëren van bijsturing;
Identificeren knelpunten bij de online verkoop van specifieke producten en het uitwerken van verbeter mogelijkheden;
Bijdragen aan de verkoopdoelstellingen van Thomas Cook Nederland wat betreft omzet, marge en conceptproducten;
Beheer van het zoek& rankingsalgoritme voor het gehele productassortiment, uitgesplitst naar klantgroepen;

In afstemming met de Commercial Manager en met collega’s van Yield/Channel Management (TCI), Flight Sourcing & Trading, het Online Marketing team en Site Editors zorgen voor een optimalisatie van online sales (prijs en beschikbaarheid);
Identificeren van verbetermogelijkheden aan het rankingsalgoritme, uitschrijven change requests, testen van verbeteringen en accepteren van changes;
Bestaande algoritme toepasbaar maken op nieuwe platforms;
Beheer van de on site zoekmodules (en analyse van zoekwoorden voor continue verbeteringen).
Uitvoeren van online concurrentie-analyses op productniveau en het spotten van kansen om de conversie te verbeteren;
Het coördineren van on site doorvertaling van acties en campagnes, in samenwerking met Marketing, en zorg dragen voor evaluatie van acties en campagnes.
Initiëren van verbeteringen in de boekingsflow en A/B tests ten behoeve van de conversie ratio.
Samen met andere leden van het Site team het testen van nieuwe functionaliteiten die worden gereleased op de verschillende boeking platforms.
Is beschikbaar voor consignatiediensten (tijdens piekperiodes) om in te kunnen grijpen bij incidenten.
Afgeronde HBO-opleiding (bij voorkeur communicatie of commercieel);
3-4 relevante werkervaring binnen een B2C E-commerce omgeving;
Ruime kennis van Excel en Google Analytics, bij voorkeur kennis van CMS, merchandisingtools en ticketing systemen (JIRA, Trello);
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.Analytisch zeer sterk;
Draag jij de klant in het hart, ben je gedreven om met het team het gewenste succes te behalen en herken jij je in voorgaande, dan ben jij wellicht de juiste kandidaat voor deze rol.

Wij bieden voor deze functie een prettige, informele werksfeer in een enthousiast team bij een zeer dynamische organisatie met goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden. Wil jij werken bij een reisorganisatie met spirit en voldoe je aan bovengenoemde criteria?  Reageer dan nu op deze vacature via de link. Voor meer informatie kun je bellen met onze afdeling HRM op nummer 023-5135150. Je sollicitatie wordt vertrouwelijk behandeld.
Merchandising, Online Marketing, Interactive Marketing, Retail, Marketing

title: Stage  Audit et Projets Financiers H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, à travers notre réseau, nous permettent d’offrir une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.
Thomas Cook propose les meilleures offres sélectionnées auprès de plus de 50 partenaires fidèles et procure, à nos clients, de véritables conseils d’experts en agence comme sur internet.

La marque Thomas Cook compte plus de 400 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 200 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages inspirationnel et immersif est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie omni canal, donnant la  possibilité aux clients de réserver leurs vacances par téléphone, en agences ou sur Internet.

Rattaché(e) au Manager Audit & Projets Financiers, le stagiaire Audit & Projets Financiers joue un rôle pivot et transversal au sein de la Direction Financière, dans le contexte d’une organisation européenne, stimulante et en évolution permanente. Soutien  opérationnel de la Direction Financière au jour le jour, il est un interlocuteur clé vis à vis de toutes les fonctions financières de l’entreprise (Comptabilité locale, Centre européen de Services Partagés, Contrôle de gestion, etc…) ainsi que vis-à-vis des  différentes fonctions opérationnelles.
Ses diverses missions visent à définir, renforcer et optimiser les process financiers tout en contrôlant la correcte application des procédures en interne :

: réalisation d’études d’audit et d’interventions ponctuelles de contrôle selon les besoins identifiés par le Comité Exécutif Thomas Cook France et en liaison avec son Manager direct. Ces missions pourront s’exercer sur toutes les fonctions  de l’entreprise en complément des travaux récurrents réalisés par le Contrôle de Gestion.
participation au développement et à l'implémentation de nouveaux projets – initiés localement ou par le Groupe- pour la Direction Financière (Ex : changement outil de suivi des frais généraux,…)
: fluidifier et stabiliser les process financiers entre la Filiale française et les Centres européens de Services partagés. Investiguer dans le détail et résoudre les points de dysfonctionnement.

: participation à des analyses financières et à des études « ad hoc » pour le compte des différentes fonctions opérationnelles en liaison avec son Manager. Son action vise à aider à la prise de décision et à une meilleure compréhension  des enjeux économiques ( ex : analyses cash management, études Thomas Cook Money,…)
De formation supérieure Bac + 5 de type Grande école, Master 2 contrôle de gestion, vous maîtrisez l’anglais et les bases de la comptabilité.
Vous êtes très à l’aise avec les outils bureautiques (Excel avec notamment les tableaux croisés dynamiques, Powerpoint) et la découverte de nouveaux outils IT ne vous fait pas peur.

Vous êtes apprécié pour votre esprit d'analyse et de synthèse. Votre état d’esprit est dynamique, autonome et positif et vous aimez le travail collectif. Vos qualités humaines vous permettent de créer du lien et de fédérer les énergies autour de vos projets.  Votre disponibilité, votre réactivité, votre autonomie seront les clefs de votre réussite à nos côtés.
Stage de 6 mois (ou plus) à pourvoir ASAP.

title: Fitness instructor and Massagetherapist
description: Drømmer du om å jobbe i utlandet? Vi leter etter en erfaren gruppeinstruktør og spa- / massasjeterapeut som vil bidra til å gi våre gjester de beste ukene i året!
Vi tilbyr gjestene våre profesjonell gruppetrening i samarbeid med SATS Elixia, sånn at treningsentusiaster i alle aldre, og uansett nivå, får mulighet til å trene i ferien.
Som kombinert instruktør og terapeut på våre Sunwing- og Sunprime-hotell kommer du til å lede timer som

På Sunwing-hotellene vil du også lede aktiviteter for barn i forskjellige aldre. Når du ikke jobber som treningsinstruktør vil du utføre forskjellige typer spabehandlinger som aromamassasje, klassisk massasje, kroppsbehandlinger og mye mer. Salg av produkter  og noe resepsjonsarbeid er også en del av stillingen.

Når du jobber i et av våre team forventes det at du er en gledesspreder, at du er fleksibel og at du er nysgjerrig og lærevillig. Det forventes også at du er både profesjonell og personlig i møtet med gjestene våre og kollegene dine.

Du har utdannelse som (eller er lisensiert) gruppetreningsinstruktør, og er i tillegg utdannet spaterapeut og/eller massasjeterapeut. Det er en fordel om du har erfaring med ledelse av gruppetreningstimer som aerobic, vanngymnastikk, styrketrening og yoga,  samt erfaring med utførelse av ulike spa- og massasjebehandlinger. Du snakker flytende norsk og engelsk, og er svært opptatt av menneskers velvære, service og salg.
Du er sterk i norsk eller noen av de andre nordiske språkene, både muntlig (flytende) og skriftlig.
Du har erfaring fra eller utdannelse i massøryrket
Det er en fordel om du …
Hvis du er aktuell for stillingen blir du kalt inn til neste steg i rekrutteringsprosessen. Innkallelser til intervjuer og auditionrunder skjer fortløpende i løpet av vinteren.

De som går videre i prosessen og blir tilbudt en stilling på et av hotellene våre bil bli bedt om å delta på vår Fitness-skole. Den holdes i samarbeid med SATS Elixia på et av våre hotell i mars og varer i omtrent 2,5 uker.
Gå gjerne inn på vår nettside og les mer om våre spa- og treningstilbud på . Du kan også følge vårt utenlandspersonale på emneknaggen #workatsunwing på Instagram.
Øvrige spørsmål rettes til Nora Fretheim, 0046 31-725 3906.
Vi ser frem til å høre fra deg!

description: Was für den Urlaub gilt, gilt auch für die Arbeit: Auf ein gutes Klima kommt es an! • Zentraler, Controlling-seitiger Ansprechpartner für das Management, sowie Finanz- und Fachabteilungen der einzelnen Quellmärkte/ der Segmentorganisation in
Kontinentaleuropa und Bearbeitung und Koordination aller entsprechenden Anfragen
• Koordination des Planungs- und Abschlussprozesses zwischen Thomas Cook Group (UK), Segment (Kontinentaleuropa) und Quellmarkt (Deutschland/ Österreich)
• Begleitung der Quellmärkte bei der Erstellung der Planung sowie monatlichen Forecasts
• Analyse und Kommentierung der Monats-, Quartals- und Jahresabschlüsse hinsichtlich der Abweichungen, Chancen und Risiken
• Monitoring und Analyse von betriebswirtschaftlich relevanten Kennzahlen
• Schnittstellenfunktion zwischen Quellmarkt und Segment, sowie anderen Controlling- und Finanzabteilungen innerhalb des Konzerns
• Weiterentwicklung von Controlling Tools und Kennzahlensystemen insbesondere von Bewertungstools, Mehrjahresbetrachtungen etc. zur Verbesserung der Transparenz und Prozessoptimierung
• Kaufmännische Begleitung von Projekten, auch auf internationaler Ebene
• umfangreiche Berufserfahrung im Bereich Controlling oder in der Unternehmensberatung
• Selbstbewusstes, souveränes, diplomatisches und verbindliches Auftreten
• Sehr sicherer Umgang mit den gängigen MS-Office-Programmen, insb. sehr gute Kenntnisse in MS Excel und Power Point
• Kenntnisse in TM1 oder anderen OLAP-Datenbanken von Vorteil
Interessiert? Dann bewerben Sie sich gerne online!

title: Reiseverkäufer m/w/d im Reisebüro Darmstadt in Teilzeit

Deshalb legen wir Wert auf einen lockeren und respektvollen Umgang, bei dem offene Kommunikation an erster Stelle und Humor auf der Tagesordnung stehen. Unsere Mitarbeiter  unterstützen sich gegenseitig und gehen kollegial miteinander um.
suchen wir ab dem 1. März 2019 eine/n
Verkauf und serviceorientierte Beratung von Reisen aller Veranstalter
(persönlich, telefonisch, per E-Mail, Internet & Social Media)
Ausbildung zur/m Reiseverkehrskauffrau/-mann bzw. Tourismuskauffrau/-mann oder langjährige Verkaufserfahrung in der Touristik
Interesse für moderne Technik und multimediale Kommunikation

Neben einem netten Team in einem modernen Arbeitsumfeld bieten wir Ihnen umfassende Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten (Seminare, weltweite Inforeisen, Tagungen, Coaching & individuelle Aufstiegschancen zum Büroleiter), ein attraktives Gehaltsmodell, 30 Tage Urlaub  sowie attraktive Rabatte auf private Urlaubsreisen.

title: Spa/Massagetherapist
description: Drömmer du om att arbeta utomlands? Sunwing Family Resorts & Sunprime Hotels letar efter dig som är en flexibel och driven person som vill ge våra gäster de bästa veckorna på året!

När man arbetar hos oss innebär det att man med glädje utför olika typer av kropp- och massagebehandlingar från vår SPA-meny. Bemanning av vår Spa reception ingår i arbetet, där man tar emot gäster, bokar in behandlingar, rekommenderar och säljer våra hudvårdsprodukter  och tillsammans i teamet arbeta mot att nå våra försäljningsmål. Vi arbetar med internationella märken samt ett svenskt ekologisk märke – Maria Åkerberg. Våra underbara hotell ligger i Spanien (Mallorca, Gran Canaria o Teneriffa), Grekland (Rhodos och Kreta)  och på Cypern. Du arbetar i ett team av varierande storlek. Du arbetar normalt 40tim i veckan. Generellt jobbar man ca 6 månader.
Kul att du är intresserad av att bli en del av vår familj! Vi har några grundkrav som du måste uppfylla för att vara med i urvalet inför kommande säsong
Vi vill att du minst är diplomerad friskvårds massör som älskar att göra kropps/massage - behandlingar
Vi vill att du har erfarenhet av yrket, antigen i Sverige eller utomlands
Vi vill att du har erfarenhet av försäljning in någon form

Utöver din kompetens inom Spa så vill vi att du ska älska att ge service! Vi arbetar med service i hela vårt kundhjul och det ska finnas ett genuint intresse hos dig att vara en god servicegivare. Vi ber dig även tänka igenom om du är beredd att lämna vänner  och familj i Sverige för en längre utlandsvistelse.
Hos oss arbetar du säsongvis och arbetstiden en en heltidstjänst. Just nu söker vi Spa/massage och hud terapeuter för sommarsäsongen 2019. Säsongen sträcker sig från mars/april-oktober/november.
Har du frågor om tjänsten, läs gärna igenom vår FAQ som du hittar på:
övriga frågor besvaras av nora fretheim på telefon 031-725 3906
övriga frågor besvaras av nora fretheim på telefon 031-725 3906

title: Web Analyst & Implementation Specialist
description: Är du redo att bli en del av vår framgångsrika och spännande resa i vår ständigt växande e-handel? Vill du tillhöra ett dedikerat team av Webbanalytiker och konverteringsoptimerare som arbetar dagligen med att driva utvecklingen av digitala kanaler framåt?  Sök då tjänsten som webbanalytiker till VING/Thomas Cook!

Som webbanalytiker hos Ving/Thomas Cook Northern Europe tillhör du E-Commerce-avdelningen vars fokus ligger på affärsutveckling och användarupplevelsen i de digitala kanalerna för våra nordiska sajter. Du blir som Webbanalytiker en del av ett prestigelöst team  som består av fem Webbanalytiker och Konverteringsoptimerare, och har ett tätt samarbete med produktägare, utvecklare, UX Designers och BI-avdelningen. Du är en av teamets experter på Google Analytics och Google Tag Manager och erbjuds en betydande roll i  företaget då du har förmåga att analysera och förstå kundernas behov och beteenden. Du får i rollen ta stort eget ansvar och arbeta brett inom främst implementation, analys och visualisering av data inom Ving/Thomas Cooks nordiska sajter.

Du kommer att vara ansvarig för implementation och konfiguration av Google Analytics och Google Tag manager och säkerställer datainsamling med hög datakvalitet. Du agerar som webbanalytiker i olika utvecklingsprojekt och ansvarar för mätbarhet och uppföljning  av den funktionalitet projektet levererar. Du kan ta mätning från ax till limpa, dvs. från egna idéer och verksamhetens önskemål om mätbarhet till att själv implementera mätpunkterna på webben. I dina arbetsuppgifter ingår också att ta fram rapporter och analyser  på våra webbplatser och föreslå förbättringar utifrån analysen som sen ligger till grund för utvecklingen av vår digitala plattform. Som expert kommer du även att supportera verksamhetens användare i Google Analytics.

Vi söker dig som är en analytisk person och trivs i en mer teknisk roll, med erfarenhet av att arbeta med Google Analytics och Google Tag Manager. Du ska ha erfarenhet av att arbeta med implementation, datalager och kunna skriva implementationsinstruktioner  till utvecklarna. Du har också förmågan att översätta affärsmässiga krav till teknisk implementation. Du känner passion för webbanalys och håller dig löpande uppdaterad inom ditt område. Du är utåtriktad, engagerad och har ett affärsorienterat förhållningssätt  samt en förmåga att sprida lärande och kunskap om kundernas beteende vidare ut i organisationen.

Du kommer arbeta självständigt vilket ställer krav på struktur, kommunikation och driftighet. Med det som bakgrund ser vi framför oss att du trivs med att ta stort ansvar och leda dig själv i projekten. Som person är du noggrann, prestigelös och flexibel  och har en hög förmåga att driva ditt arbete med ett lösningsorienterat mindset!
Du är bekväm med en teknisk roll fokuserad på implementation, rapportering och analys.
Du har djup teknisk kompetens inom Google Analytics och Google Tag Manager. BigQuery och SQL är ett plus.
Examen från en teknisk högskola eller liknande
Erfarenhet av visualisering av data via Google Data Studio eller Tableau eller Power BI
Goda kunskaper i Excel och PowerPoint
Goda kunskaper i engelska då jobbet till stor del sker i ett globalt team
Startdatum av tjänst: Tillträde så snart som möjligt
Tillsvidareanställning med placering på Vings/Thomas Cook huvudkontor i Stockholm

title: Junior Controller
description: Voor de afdeling Finance zoeken we een nieuwe collega (m/v) :

Het team van Planning & Controlling staat in voor het rapporteren en analyseren van de financiële cijfers en verschaft op die manier het Belgische en internationale management van Thomas Cook inzicht in de huidige en toekomstige financiële situatie van  onze organisatie.
Je ondersteunt het controlling team bij het opstellen van de budgetten en de opvolging van de varianties.
Je assisteert het team bij de maandelijkse afsluiting en rapportering.
Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende business departementen en bespreekt eventuele afwijkingen van budget of forcast.
Je voert variantie-analyses en andere ad hoc financiële analyses uit.
Je behaalde een masterdiploma in een economische richting.
Je hebt een eerste (2-3 jr) relevante werkervaring achter de rug, in audit of controlling.
Je ben analytisch ingesteld, onderscheidt vlot hoofd- van bijzaken en legt makkelijk verbanden.
Je bent een zeer vlot gebruiker van MS Office. MS Excel kent voor jou geen geheimen.
Je communiceert uitstekend in de Nederlandse en Engelse taal (mondeling en schriftelijk).
Je bent een dynamische en flexibele teamspeler.
Je werkt resultaatgericht en gaat vlot om met gezonde stress.
Je kent je weg op het web en in de sociale media.
een boeiende uitdaging binnen onze innovatieve en dynamische organisatie
een marktconform salarispakket aangevuld met interessante extralegale voordelen (maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, dertiende maand, woon-werkverkeer)
flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheid tot occasioneel thuiswerk

title: Sales Consultant
description: Starting with a single train journey from Leicester to Loughborough in 1841, we’ve grown into a travel company that’s constantly thinking about new and innovative ways to take you places: not just on holiday, but in your career too.

Whether you dream of working abroad or want to help create the next marketing campaign, there’s a range of roles across our retail stores, head office, Thomas Cook Airlines and far beyond. From Product Managers to pilots, there’s one thing we all have in  common: keeping the customer at our heart.
With a team of over 22,000 colleagues, operating across 15 countries, the opportunities are endless, whether you’ve worked in travel before or are looking to start a new adventure today.
Retail Sales Consultant - Macclesfield - 18 hours per week - Permanent Contract

How would you like to make someone’s holiday dream come true? In this role, that’s exactly what you’ll be doing for our customers! We’ll ask you to put yourself in your customer’s flip flops, to truly understand what they’re looking for from their perfect  holiday.

We offer a huge range of holidays in destinations all over the world; one day you could be helping a family plan their dream trip to one of our Sentido Hotels in the Mediterranean and the next, it could be a two week safari in the wilds of South Africa for  a couple. We can also help our customers with all the extras like holiday money, travel insurance and car hire, so there’ll be lots to keep you busy!
To make sure we’re here when our customers need us, our stores are open in the evening and over the weekend, so you’ll need to be flexible with your working hours.
What you’ll need to succeed in this role:
A real passion for delivering consistent, outstanding customer service
Experience in a sales or customer service target driven role would be great
Fantastic communication, persuading, influencing, learning & researching skills
Be able to work as part of a team; we’re one Thomas Cook and love to achieve targets together
This is a sales target environment so you’ll need to be motivated
Travel experience isn’t necessary but would be really useful
A confident and fun approach is essential
Willingness to learn and a commitment to personal development
We will ask a lot of you, but in return you’ll get:
Excellent holiday concessions (including last minute employee offers giving you the opportunity to pick up a holiday at unbelievable prices!)
Great flexible benefits package (including the opportunity to buy & sell annual leave, childcare vouchers & discounted gym membership)
Continuous learning with industry leading training with our brand new Retail Check-In Programme
The opportunity to take part in educational trips to support your learning & development, so you can experience our products first-hand
23 days holiday, rising to 25 after 2 years

As a large global travel business, including overseas, tour operations and an airline, the sky really is the limit for your career progression. If you’re looking to start a fantastic new journey with a leading international travel company, and you’ve got  what it takes to be part of our winning team, then we’d love to hear from you.

Your career development is really important to us, so we’ll invest in a five week induction plan for you from the day you start in your new role. During this time, you’ll need to be available to work up to 37.5hrs a week (5 days over 7) to make sure you  have all the knowledge you’ll need to work as a travel expert. In week two of your five week induction, you’ll spend four days at our Peterborough Head Office (overnight accommodation will be booked for you if needed) where you’ll meet other new retail colleagues  and complete your training together. We’ve planned start dates each month throughout the year. If you’re invited for an interview, your interviewer will be able to explain more about this and answer any questions that you might have.

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.

title: CDD  Attaché commerciale Ventes Indirectes H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, nous permettent d’offrir à travers notre réseau une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.

Le réseau Thomas Cook compte plus de 450 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 180 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages totalement intégré dans un parcours cross-commerce est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie  omni-canal, donnant la possibilité à ses clients de réserver leurs vacances sur Internet, en agence ou par téléphone. Thomas Cook entend ainsi répondre aux exigences des clients d’aujourd’hui sur un marché en pleine mutation, en mettant l’accent sur l’excellence  de la relation clients, la mobilité et la dimension digitale.

Sous la responsabilité de la Direction Commerciale, vous assurez physiquement le suivi commercial d’un portefeuille d’agences sur un secteur géographique avec l’objectif de développer le chiffre d’affaire et la part de marché des marques du Tour Opérateur  Jet tours.
Vendez la production en fonction des priorités commerciales ;
Aidez les agences à vendre au travers de formations et opérations commerciales ;
Assurez une visibilité optimale des marques du Tour Opérateur ;
Organisez un plan de tournée optimal de vos agences ;
Mettez en place une stratégie et un plan d’action sur votre secteur, en adéquation avec la politique commerciale ;
Organisez et/ou participez à des salons, soirées clients;
Agissez avec efficacité et économie : respect des budgets alloués, limitation des gestes commerciaux ;
Etes un point de contact privilégié pour les partenaires régionaux (Aéroport).
Diplômé(e) de formation supérieure en commerce/Tourisme, vous avez minimum 2 ans d’expérience en tant que commercial(e) dans une entreprise de distribution idéalement du secteur touristique.
Vous maitrisez les outils bureautiques (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) et êtes à l’aise avec les outils de réservation.
Vous avez le sens de l’organisation, vous êtes très réactif(ve) et rigoureux(se).
De nature dynamique, vous êtes force de propositions et aimez travailler en équipe. Doté(e) d’un très bon relationnel, vous avez des talents d’argumentation et de persuasion afin de pouvoir vendre.
Permis de conduite obligatoire. Nombreux déplacements à prévoir dans Rennes et ses alentours.

title: Retail Director
description: Als Retail Director ben je verantwoordelijk voor ons

met 300 enthousiaste commerciële talenten in bijna 100 Neckermann Vakantiewinkels in Wallonië, Brussel en Vlaanderen. Je bent eindverantwoordelijk voor het  financiële resultaat van de Neckermann Vakantiewinkels en de aansturing van je Sales Management Team.
Als lid van het Directie Team en het Commercial Management Team, neem je de verantwoordelijkheid over onze Neckermann vakantiewinkels en bouwt deze verder uit.
en vertaalt deze in concrete actieplannen en meetbare KPI’s.
Je zin voor innovatie en creativiteit, gekoppeld aan sterke analytische skills laat je toe om
te nemen, deze te implementeren en succesvol te laten verder groeien in de Belgische markt.

Je stelt verkoopstargets en budgetten op, bewaakt deze en stuurt bij waar nodig (full P&L responsibility). Je volgt je salescijfers op de voet op, analyseert deze grondig en neemt gepast actie waar nodig.
Je drijft je verkoopsorganisatie naar optimale resultaten en geeft daarbij zelf het voorbeeld.
Je ontwikkelt en implementeert innovatieve, commerciële initiatieven om Neckermann nog sterker te onderscheiden van de concurrenten.
operationele leiding van het Sales Management Team
Je vertaalt de algemene bedrijfsstrategie in een concrete retailstrategie, -visie en projecten en volgt deze op.
Je standaardiseert het verkoopsproces, de kwaliteitsnormen en klantenservice en optimaliseert waar nodig.
Je vertaalt de behoeften vanuit je retailnetwerk in concrete doelstellingen voor interne afdelingen, waaronder Touroperating, Marketing, PR, E-Commerce, …
Je bent frequent aanwezig in je Neckermann Vakantiewinkels in het hele land. Zo hou je de vinger aan de pols en weet je echt wat er leeft bij jouw teams.
, je staat voor je business en je enthousiasme werkt aanstekelijk. Je inspireert en coacht je Sales Management team dynamisch en resultaatgericht naar marktleidende performance.
Je rapporteert aan de Managing Director van Thomas Cook Belgium.
Je behaalde een masterdiploma, bij voorkeur in een commercieel-economische richting.
Je hebt minimum 10 jaar commerciële ervaring, een aantal jaren ervaring in de aansturing van één of meerdere retailkana(a)l(en) is een sterke plus.
Je beschikt over de capaciteiten om op strategisch (C-level) niveau na te denken, te analyseren en samen te werken.
Kennis van het retail landschap in België is een must.
Je bent analytisch sterk, verdiept je graag in de verkoopscijfers (op nationaal, regionaal en winkelniveau) en neemt ownership van je P&L.
Ervaring in business omgevingen met uitdagende marges en een focus op cost efficiency is een pluspunt.
Je bent een salesvrouw/man in hart en nieren, je engageert en motiveert je interne en externe stakeholders en draagt je passie voor je klant uit.
Je ben een ondernemende, resultaatgerichte initiatiefnemer, werkt pragmatisch en doordacht en draagt klantensatisfactie hoog in het vaandel.
Je bent flexibel, assimileert snel en houdt ervan te werken in een dynamische en snel-veranderende omgeving.
Je bent een charismatisch, dynamisch en enthousiast people manager. Je hebt ervaring in het aansturen van multi-location teams.
Je woont bij voorkeur centraal in België, je werkterrein ligt in Wallonië, Brussel en Vlaanderen.
Je communiceert professioneel (mondeling en schriftelijk) in Frans, Nederlands en Engels.
Je werkt vlot met MS Office toepassingen (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook, OneNote).
een boeiende uitdaging op director niveau binnen onze innovatieve en dynamische organisatie

een marktconform salarispakket aangevuld met interessante extralegale voordelen (firmawagen + tankkaart, maaltijdcheques, hospitalisatieverzekering, dertiende maand, woon-werkverkeer, pensioenplan, representatievergoeding, bonus )
flexibele werktijden en mogelijkheid tot occasioneel thuiswerk

title: CDI  Incident Manager H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, nous permettent d’offrir à travers notre réseau une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.

Le réseau Thomas Cook compte plus de 450 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 180 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages totalement intégré dans un parcours cross-commerce est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie  omni-canal, donnant la possibilité à ses clients de réserver leurs vacances sur Internet, en agence ou par téléphone. Thomas Cook entend ainsi répondre aux exigences des clients d’aujourd’hui sur un marché en pleine mutation, en mettant l’accent sur l’excellence  de la relation clients, la mobilité et la dimension digitale.

Sous la responsabilité directe du directeur IT, vous veillez à la qualité de fonctionnement des infrastructures déployées et du traitement des incidents, problèmes et demandes selon les délais contractuels.
Il/Elle assure les différentes tâches suivantes :
Gestion et pilotage quotidien des incidents et problèmes liés aux infrastructures
Escalade interne et auprès du fournisseur
Gestion de capacité des infrastructures (réseau, disque, etc.)

De formation supérieure type Ingénieur ou équivalent, vous justifiez d'une bonne expérience opérationnelle et maitriser techniquement les domaines mentionnés ci-dessous ainsi que la production et les activités d'exploitation.
Les compétences essentielles pour la mission :
- Connaissance générale de l’infrastructure IT (serveurs Windows, VMWare, Citrix, TOIP,réseaux, télécom)
- Autonomie / Bon relationnel /esprit d’analyse et Résistance à la pression
Vous êtes capable de formuler des propositions d’évolutions des processus qui sont soumises à validation, d’avoir un regard critique sur les résolutions et réponses apportées.

title: Head of Legal Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia TCAS
description: Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia is looking for an ambitious and fully qualified lawyer with at least 10 years of relevant experience gained in an international law firm and/or in-house legal function to take the position as Head of Legal TCAS.

Reporting directly to the Group Airlines - Head of Legal, the Head of Legal-TCAS Airlines holds a senior legal position at Thomas Cook Group Airlines and is a member of the Legal Leadership Team. He/she is providing the lead legal advice and support to the  TCAS Airlines’ business, and oversees and supports the Group’s strategy for profitable growth as well as Thomas Cook’s mission to be a trusted pioneer in global travel.

In addition to reporting to the Group Airlines - Head of Legal, the Head of Legal - TCAS has a close working relationship with various legal team personnel within the Scandinavian Airline Segment and the Group Legal team. The Head of Legal – TCAS will also  provide regular updates to the Head of Legal Group Airlines , the General Counsel (as per request) and the TCAS Airlines management team.
Head of Legal on Board of Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia takes a senior legal and commercial role in respect of all TCAS Airlines legal matters.
Provide legal advice to Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia and affiliates
Develop solutions to complex legal questions
Work with external bodies such as the CAA (Civil Aviation Authority) on regulatory matters.
Establishing, managing, negotiating and maintaining contracts

Support to management board and all business departments on all commercial legal topics (e.g. data protection, aircraft procurement/lease, maintenance, distribution, IT, airport relations, terms & conditions)

Handling of different claims (e.g. damage and compensation, insurance) as well as responsibility for flight delay claims brought against TCAS by passengers under EC Reg 261/2004 providing effective and practical legal advice. Support the implementation  of the Group Airlines’ strategy for the handling of EU261 claims for TCAS.
Providing of employee trainings on substantial legal topics
Further responsibilities upon replacement to be discussed.
Appropriately, efficiently and cost effectively manage TCAS relationships with external lawyers.
Manage other projects and assignments as determined from time to time by the Head of Legal - Group Airlines or the Group General Counsel.
Management of a legal team of 2-3 employees.
Transactions undertaken by TCAS’ Legal teams are completed successfully with added value and risks appropriately managed.
The TCAS’ legal team are adequately trained, supervised, motivated and developed.
Play a key role in helping to drive a culture across the TCAS legal function where the highest standards of legal and regulatory compliance and awareness are expected and delivered.

Supports the Head of Legal - Group Airlines in respect of all airline group legal matters with a view toward assisting the Group Airlines - Head of Legal in building a cohesive airline group-wide legal team and implementing best practices across the Group.
The new Head of Legal TCAS reports directly to: Head of Legal, Group Airline and has a dotted line reporting into Managing Director.
The Head of Legal TCAS has direct report from two employees; a Commercial Lawyer and a Litigation Lawyer.
The Head of Legal TCAS is a member of the Group Airline Legal Leadership Team.
Thomas Cook Airlines HQ in Copenhagen.
20-40 travel days can be expected annually.

Analytically astute and demonstrates an understanding of how one issue may be part of a much larger system; identifies common themes across multiple issues and moves to resolve, handling situations and problems with innovation and creativity
Combines excellent technical legal knowledge with a keen commercial focus and practical judgement
Adept in combining compliance and risk management requirements with delivery of an ambitious business transformation agenda
Resilient and able to work at considerable pace
Demonstrates financial awareness, controls cost and thinks in terms of profit, loss and added value
Focuses on customer satisfaction and delivers high quality legal service to the business segments/markets
Danish qualified lawyer with strong academic record and 10+ years post-qualification experience
Significant in-house experience as a corporate/commercial lawyer is required
Experience with the airline industry is considered an advantage
Exposure to a wide variety of legal practice areas
Business focused with a good understanding of the business strategy and the key drivers of growth/performance
An excellent team player and team builder and good to cooperate cross functional in a large matrix organization
Behaves consistently with clear professional values that complement those of the organisation.
Is an ambassador for “Groupness” across the various business segments/markets and espouses the Thomas Cook values and behaviours.
Excellent at juggling and duly prioritising among many tasks
An excellent business partner with the ability to adapt to the Thomas Cook Airlines Scandinavia company culture
Passionate about leading, motivating and developing others, a believer of trust and empowerment, leads by example and open to change and new ideas
Flexible and adaptable with a sense of urgency and ability to quickly focus on priorities
An excellent networker who is strong at building relations at all levels. Excellent motivating and delegating abilities
Friendly, empathic and with a good sense of humor
Influence, drive and a high level of integrity
Good understanding of relevant cultural differences in the Group
Fluency in Danish and English (negotiation level)
An exciting job in a busy, dynamic and international environment
An attractive salary package, including attractive travel arrangements.

title: Reiseverkäufer m/w/d in Vollzeit, Reisebüro Coburg
description: Was für den Urlaub gilt, gilt auch für die Arbeit: Auf ein gutes Klima kommt es an! Deshalb legen wir Wert auf einen lockeren und respektvollen Umgang, bei dem offene Kommunikation an erster Stelle und Humor auf der Tagesordnung stehen. Unsere Mitarbeiter  unterstützen sich gegenseitig und gehen kollegial miteinander um.
Verkauf und serviceorientierte Beratung von Reisen aller Veranstalter
(persönlich, telefonisch, per E-Mail, Internet & Social Media)

title: Controlling Team Member
description: Starting with a single train journey from Leicester to Loughborough in 1841, we’ve grown into a travel company that’s constantly thinking about new and innovative ways to take you places: not just on holiday, but in your career too.

Whether you dream of working abroad or want to help create the next marketing campaign, there’s a range of roles across our retail stores, head office, Thomas Cook Airlines and far beyond. From Product Managers to pilots, there’s one thing we all have in  common: keeping the customer at our heart.
With a team of over 22,000 colleagues, operating across 15 countries, the opportunities are endless, whether you’ve worked in travel before or are looking to start a new adventure today.

Working within the Shared Services team the FSSC Controlling/Management Information Team Member Senior shall perform end to end processes of Controlling/Management Information in a timely and accurate manner, in accordance with defined  Thomas Cook operating procedures.
Perform daily, weekly, monthly or ad hoc activities/processes
Achieve performance objectives agreed with assigned Supervisor
Reporting on volumes processed and timeliness of processing
Contribute to FSSC process improvement initiatives as required
Front office mindset with internal customer (Thomas Cook Group)
Keeping the lines of reporting on time and quality required
Able to work under pressure and with all levels of people to achieve objectives
Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Business Administration, Tourism or related studies
At least 2 years’ experience in similar role in a finance department
High level of computer literacy and advanced knowledge of MS Office, particularly Excel
Team player, details oriented, results oriented and self-motivated
Fluency in English, both written and spoken, is essential
Excellent communication skills both verbal and oral with ability to work effectively at all levels and with adherence to Thomas Cook values
Willing and being able to travel in accordance with operational requirement
Ability to work and manage different sources/databases to present results
Concerned with the quality and deadlines of the work produced.
Experience in creating / amending databases in MS Access and use of macros

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.

Working within the Shared Services team the Accounts Payable team member shall perform Accounts Payable transaction processing responsibilities in a timely and accurate manner, in accordance with defined Thomas Cook operating procedures.
Review, check validity (including Tax treatment) and completeness and process Accounts Payable invoices / credit notes ready for processing
Return exceptions (e.g. unmatched invoices) suppliers and business users
Maintain record of all returned invoices / credit notes
Enter coding , tax treatment and reconciliation details as appropriate
Reconciliation of Vendor statements, handling vendor queries (emails and calls)
Payment proposal preparation, review and exception handling, Month-end activities – clear down, write offs, write backs etc.
Analysis of price variance, exceptions and aged creditors
Ensure all valid documents (invoices, claims etc) are accurately input into system
Resolve rejected items, sending to business for resolution
Provide electronic notification of payment to vendor (e.g. remittance advice / tax invoices)
Follow-up and resolve payment issues / queries, stopping payments where appropriate
Produce reconciliations of supplier statements to ledgers and to sub ledgers
Generate standard reports as defined within AP process and ad hoc, as required by Team Leaders / Managers
Respond promptly to queries from TC employees / external suppliers, ensuring queries are logged and escalated as appropriate
Collect, sort and follow-up payment reminders received from suppliers
Achieve performance objectives agreed with assigned Team Leader
Perform other duties as required within AP area as agreed with assigned Team Leader
Contribute to Accounts Payable process improvement initiatives as required
Delivers Accounts Payable reports timely and according with the business needs
Contributes to the Accounts Payable team to continually improve operations
Ability to give and receive feedback from key stakeholders
Excellent communication skills both verbal and oral with ability to work effectively at all levels and with adherence to Thomas Cook values
Able to work in a fast-paced environment but also capable of working on your own initiative with the ability to ensure compliance with detailed requirements
Ability to build and maintain good working relationships with stakeholders
Conscientious and methodical approach to work
Evidence and aptitude of problem solving including the ability to gather and analyse facts, draw conclusions, define problems, and suggest solutions
Experience of working within Accounts Payable process, or other core financial process, within complex, large volume environment
Experience of working in a shared services environment
Working knowledge of SAP, Coupa and Payments Systems
Experience of working within the travel industry
Strong English language skills are preferred for the role.
Working knowledge of most Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and SharePoint)
Finance background, including good understanding of finance systems
Educated to at least GCSE standard, 5 C or above passes

title: Employee Benefits Administrator
description: Our client, a well established and rapidly expanding employee benefits consultancy, is currently looking to recruit an experienced Employee Benefits Administrator into their team.

Candidates will be responsible for providing administration and general support to an Employee Benefits Consultant in the day to day running of client accounts accross a range of pensions, group risk, group healthcare, flexible benefits etc. You will co-ordinate  and undertake all administration in relation to the schemes including updating member data, renewals, claims data, communication materials and other associated queries.

Candidates need to come from an employee benefits background and have experience in administering Corporate pensions or Group Healthcare or Group Risk schemes including GPP’s, Group Private Medical insurance, Group Risk and flexible benefit schemes. Candidates  will ideally hold professional qualifications although this is not essential. You will have
excellent communication skills and ideally experience of dealing with a range of SME and Corporate clients.
In return our client is looking to offer a competitive basic salary depending on experience as well as an excellent company benefits package.

title: CDI  Commercial groupe H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 27 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, à travers notre réseau (environ 250 points de vente intégrés), nous permettent d’offrir une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits,  offres premium, etc.
Thomas Cook propose les meilleures offres sélectionnées auprès de plus de 50 partenaires fidèles et procure, à nos clients, de véritables conseils d’experts en agence comme sur internet.

Sous la responsabilité du Responsable Régional Groupe, vous fidélisez et développez votre portefeuille client sur les différentes cibles (Comités d’entreprises, association, collectivités, etc.) pour les départements dont vous avez la charge.
Mettre en place le plan d’actions sur les différents départements
Réaliser les devis clients suite au démarchage sur le terrain
Transmettre les dossiers signés au plateau technique pour la gestion du suivi
De formation supérieure en Tourisme / Commerce, vous avez acquis une solide expérience au sein d’un service commercial Groupe et avez une très bonne connaissance du secteur du tourisme groupes.

Reconnu(e) pour votre sens de la relation commerciale, vous êtes autonome, rigoureux(se) et fin négociateur. Votre parfaite connaissance des techniques de vente vous permet d’être totalement autonome dans le développement et la fidélisation de votre portefeuille  client.

title: Store Manager
description: Starting with a single train journey from Leicester to Loughborough in 1841, we’ve grown into a travel company that’s constantly thinking about new and innovative ways to take you places: not just on holiday, but in your career too.

Whether you dream of working abroad or want to help create the next marketing campaign, there’s a range of roles across our retail stores, head office, Thomas Cook Airlines and far beyond. From Product Managers to pilots, there’s one thing we all have in  common: keeping the customer at our heart.
With a team of over 22,000 colleagues, operating across 15 countries, the opportunities are endless, whether you’ve worked in travel before or are looking to start a new adventure today.
Store Manager - Wollaton Bramcote Lane - 37.5 hours per week - Permanent Contract

As a Thomas Cook Retail Store Manager you’ll be coaching, developing and mentoring a team of Sales Consultants supporting them to become travel experts and provide an unforgettable experience for customers! You’ll be inspiring the team to make someone’s  dream holiday come true.

You’ll also be leading the team in putting themselves in the customers flip flops to deliver on the perfect holiday, whilst ensuring Sales and Revenue targets are achieved with our range of extras including holiday money, travel insurance and car hire. This  role will allow you to use your full range of leadership skills, displaying your creativity and innovation to bring an array of exciting ideas and concepts to life in your store.

You’ll be responsible for all aspects of the day to day running of the store whilst building and sustaining a loyal and repeat customer base. Exceptional service should be delivered consistently to our customers, and you’ll use your commercial skills to  make the most of local marketing opportunities and promote our fantastic brand. There’ll be excellent on-going development, providing you with great future career opportunities within our retail network and beyond.

We have nearly 600 shops across the UK and put our customer at the heart of everything we do. To make sure we are available when our customers need us some of our stores are open in the evening and over the weekend, so you’ll need to be flexible with your  working hours. We operate on variable shifts to cover this but we’ll make sure you know your shift pattern at least 4 weeks in advance.
What you’ll need to succeed in this role:
Experienced people manager with an inspirational, motivational and approachable leadership style
Results focused with experience of driving team performance
Sound commercial acumen and the ability to make sense of cost control and profit data
Commitment and passion for delivering excellent customer service consistently
Experience in developing people through strong leadership and sales management
Ability to support the team to be solution focused
Be able to work as part of a team; we’re one Thomas Cook and love to achieve targets together
This is a sales target environment so you’ll need to be motivated
Travel experience and knowledge of foreign exchange isn’t necessary but would be really useful
A confident and fun approach is essential
Willingness to learn and a commitment to personal development
We will ask a lot of you, but in return you’ll get:
Excellent holiday concessions (including last minute employee offers giving you the opportunity to pick up a holiday at unbelievable prices!)
Great flexible benefits package (including the opportunity to buy & sell annual leave, childcare vouchers & discounted gym membership)
Continuous learning with industry leading training with our brand new Retail Check-In Programme
The opportunity to take part in educational trips to support your learning & development, so you can experience our products first-hand
23 days holiday, rising to 25 after 2 years

Your career development is really important to us, so we’ll invest in a five week induction plan for you from the day you start in your new role. During this time, you’ll need to be available to work up to 37.5hrs a week (5 days over 7) to make sure you  have all the knowledge you’ll need to work as a travel expert. In week two of your five week induction, you’ll spend four days at our Peterborough Head Office (overnight accommodation will be booked for you if needed) where you’ll meet other new retail colleagues  and complete your training together. We’ve planned start dates each month throughout the year. If you’re invited for an interview, your interviewer will be able to explain more about this and answer any questions that you might have.

As a large global travel business, including overseas, tour operations and an airline, the sky really is the limit for your career progression. If you’re looking to start a fantastic new career journey with a leading international travel company, and you’ve  got what it takes to be part of our winning team, then we’d love to hear from you.

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.
