We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.

title: Stage  Marketing Retail et CRM H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22.000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, à travers notre réseau, nous permettent d’offrir une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.
Thomas Cook propose les meilleures offres sélectionnées auprès de plus de 50 partenaires fidèles et procure, à nos clients, de véritables conseils d’experts en agence comme sur internet.

La marque Thomas Cook compte plus de 400 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 200 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages inspirationnel et immersif est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie omni canal, donnant la  possibilité aux clients de réserver leurs vacances par téléphone, en agences ou sur Internet
Au sein de la direction Marketing Thomas Cook, le/la stagiaire Chargé(e) de Marketing & CRM travaille sous la responsabilité de la Responsable Marketing Thomas Cook et de la Responsable CRM.
Participation à la conception et à la mise en œuvre des opérations commerciales du réseau Thomas Cook : campagnes vitrines, brochures saisonnières, création de supports d’aide à la vente, édition…
Gestion du community management sur la marque Thomas Cook (Facebook, twitter et instagram) et les campagnes de sponsoring
Mise à jour très régulière du contenu promotionnel et institutionnel des totems digitaux.
Conception et réalisation d’une newsletter hebdomadaire destinée à plus de 4000 agences de voyages, ainsi que d’une newsletter hebdomadaire destinée au réseau Thomas Cook et Jet tours (Infocom).
Collaboration dans la mise en place du plan d’activation clients : conception et exécution des campagnes, suivi des tests & validation avant envoi, et mesure des actions menées.
Accompagnement sur des projets de développement CRM : développement d’actions spécifiques, mise en place de nouveaux outils.
Actuellement en formation supérieure bac+4/5 en Marketing type Ecole de commerce, vous avez déjà réalisé un stage en marketing.
La fonction nécessite des connaissances en marketing, des qualités d’analyse et de synthèse, ainsi qu’un bon sens créatif.

Vous êtes très réactif(ve), rigoureux(se) et organisé(e). De nature dynamique, vous êtes force de propositions et aimez travailler en équipe, vous êtes également passionné par les nouvelles tendances et le monde du digital en général. Logiciels maitrisés  : Pack office, Photoshop. La connaissance de la chaîne graphique et du langage HTML serait un plus.

title: Assistant Manager
description: Starting with a single train journey from Leicester to Loughborough in 1841, we’ve grown into a travel company that’s constantly thinking about new and innovative ways to take you places: not just on holiday, but in your career too.

Whether you dream of working abroad or want to help create the next marketing campaign, there’s a range of roles across our retail stores, head office, Thomas Cook Airlines and far beyond. From Product Managers to pilots, there’s one thing we all have in  common: keeping the customer at our heart.
With a team of over 22,000 colleagues, operating across 15 countries, the opportunities are endless, whether you’ve worked in travel before or are looking to start a new adventure today.
Assistant Manager - Barnsley 10a Eldon Street - 37.5 hours per week - Permanent Contract

As a Thomas Cook Retail Assistant Manager you’ll be coaching, developing and mentoring a team of Sales Consultants, supporting them to become travel experts and provide an unforgettable experience for customers. You’ll be inspiring the team to plan our customers  dream holidays, ensuring Sales and Revenue targets are achieved. This role will allow you to experience the full range of managerial responsibilities, with the support and guidance of a Store Manager, and is a great opportunity to develop and expand on your  skills and knowledge. You’ll receive on-going development and have great future career opportunities within our retail network and beyond.

We have nearly 600 shops across the UK and put our customer at the heart of everything we do. To make sure we are available when our customers need us some of our stores are open in the evening and over the weekend, so you’ll need to be flexible with your  working hours. We operate on variable shifts to cover this but we’ll make sure you know your shift pattern at least 4 weeks in advance.
What you’ll need to succeed in this role:
Fantastic communication, persuading and influencing skills
Experience in either a senior sales or supervisory post in a retail/customer facing environment would be great
Results focused with experience of driving team performance
Passion and commitment to delivering consistently outstanding customer service
Experience in developing people through strong leadership and sales management routines
Able to work effectively in a fast paced environment with unpredictable customer flow
Ability to support the team to be solution focused and creative
We will ask a lot of you, but in return you’ll get:
Excellent holiday concessions (including last minute employee offers giving you the opportunity to pick up a holiday at unbelievable prices!)
Great flexible benefits package (including the opportunity to buy & sell annual leave, childcare vouchers & discounted gym membership)
Continuous learning with industry leading training with our brand new Retail Check-In Programme
The opportunity to take part in educational trips to support your learning & development, so you can experience our products first-hand
23 days holiday, rising to 25 after 2 years

As a large global travel business, including overseas, tour operations and an airline, the sky really is the limit for your career progression. If you’re looking to start a fantastic new career journey with a leading international travel company, and you’ve  got what it takes to be part of our winning team, then we’d love to hear from you.

Your career development is really important to us, so we’ll invest in a five week induction plan for you from the day you start in your new role. During this time, you’ll need to be available to work up to 37.5hrs a week (5 days over 7) to make sure you  have all the knowledge you’ll need to work as a travel expert. In week two of your five week induction, you’ll spend four days at our Peterborough Head Office (overnight accommodation will be booked for you if needed) where you’ll meet other new retail colleagues  and complete your training together. We’ve planned start dates each month throughout the year. If you’re invited for an interview, your interviewer will be able to explain more about this and answer any questions that you might have.

Life at Thomas Cook is fast-paced and full of opportunities. We’re a leading international travel company that believes in empowering our people, so when you join us, you’ll be given the chance to create, learn and innovate. You’ll also be given the support  and training you need to develop your career in the direction you choose.

As you might expect, our holiday benefits are something special. We’ll give you an allowance towards your holiday every year, depending on how long you’ve been with us. There are also special last minute employee deals, which give you the opportunity to  pick up a holiday at an outstanding price. Working for Thomas Cook, you can travel the world for less.
We also offer a flexible benefits package that gives you a range of options to ensure your benefits match your lifestyle.

First point of contact/support for accommodation suppliers and Bedbanks
Resolving invoice discrepancies and queries from suppliers
Reconciliation of vendor statements and accounts
Amending Ebilling error lists on a daily basis
Follow-up and resolve payment issues (block accounts, payment stop, escalations, VIP suppliers)
Perform other duties as required within GHS as agreed with assigned Supervisor/Team Manager
Organizing and prioritizing workload according guidelines fixed by Team Manager/Supervisor
Ability to communicate with TC Group colleagues and suppliers
Fulfilment of agreed Service Level Agreements (SLA’s)
Contribution to process improvements across the department
Achieve performance objectives agreed with assigned Team Manager/Supervisor
Excellent communication skills both verbal and written with ability to work effectively at all levels and with adherence to Thomas Cook values
Ability to build and maintain good working relationships with stakeholders
Conscientious and methodical approach to work with ability to adapt to a wide range of situations.
Evidence and aptitude of problem solving including the ability to gather and analyse facts, draw conclusions, define problems, and suggest solutions
Ability to collaborate and work in a team to achieve objectives
Commitment to compliance with internal deadlines and SLA’s
Experience of working in a dynamic shared services environment
Experience of working within Accounts payable role or other core financial process
Working knowledge of SAP and other payment systems
Experience of working within the travel industry
Working Knowledge of most Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook and Sharepoint)
Educated to at least secondary school (E.S.O.) level or above

title: Sales Consultant
description: Over 175 years ago, our founder Thomas Cook began this company with a vision to
‘broaden the mind of others and break down the partition walls of prejudice.'
‘the willing and devoted servant of the travelling public,’

Thomas Cook was a true pioneer of the travel industry, opening up a world of new destinations and new travel experiences to everyone. By obtaining the best services and prices for his customers, he laid the foundations of the company that still bears  his name today.
Thomas Cook is now one of the world’s leading leisure travel groups, supported by around 22,000 colleagues and operating from 15 countries.
Our vision today remains true to Thomas Cook’s ambitions -
to be the world’s most loved holiday company.
Retail Sales Consultant - Warrington Stockton - 16 hours per week - Permanent Contract

How would you like to make someone’s holiday dream come true? In this role, that’s exactly what you’ll be doing for our customers! We’ll ask you to put yourself in your customer’s flip flops, to truly understand what they’re looking for from their perfect  holiday.

We offer a huge range of holidays in destinations all over the world; one day you could be helping a family plan their dream trip to one of our Sentido Hotels in the Mediterranean and the next, it could be a two week safari in the wilds of South Africa for  a couple. We can also help our customers with all the extras like holiday money, travel insurance and car hire, so there’ll be lots to keep you busy!
To make sure we’re here when our customers need us, our stores are open in the evening and over the weekend, so you’ll need to be flexible with your working hours.
What you’ll need to succeed in this role:
A real passion for delivering consistent, outstanding customer service
Experience in a sales or customer service target driven role would be great
Fantastic communication, persuading, influencing, learning & researching skills
Be able to work as part of a team; we’re one Thomas Cook and love to achieve targets together
This is a sales target environment so you’ll need to be motivated
Travel experience isn’t necessary but would be really useful
A confident and fun approach is essential
Willingness to learn and a commitment to personal development
We will ask a lot of you, but in return you’ll get:
Excellent holiday concessions (including last minute employee offers giving you the opportunity to pick up a holiday at unbelievable prices!)
Great flexible benefits package (including the opportunity to buy & sell annual leave, childcare vouchers & discounted gym membership)
Continuous learning with industry leading training with our brand new Retail Check-In Programme
The opportunity to take part in educational trips to support your learning & development, so you can experience our products first-hand
23 days holiday, rising to 25 after 2 years

title: CDD  Agent de Voyage H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, nous permettent d’offrir à travers notre réseau une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.

Le réseau Thomas Cook compte plus de 450 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 180 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages totalement intégré dans un parcours cross-commerce est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie  omni-canal, donnant la possibilité à ses clients de réserver leurs vacances sur Internet, en agence ou par téléphone. Thomas Cook entend ainsi répondre aux exigences des clients d’aujourd’hui sur un marché en pleine mutation, en mettant l’accent sur l’excellence  de la relation clients, la mobilité et la dimension digitale.
En qualité de conseiller voyages, vous assurez le conseil et la vente au client des services et produits (circuits, séjours, forfaits, locations proposés par les TO, billetterie, etc.) :
Accueillir et conseiller le client : compréhension des attentes, sélections de produits et de services, et formulation de propositions, argumentation en vue de la concrétisation de la vente.
Réaliser les opérations de réservation et de vente.
Concevoir l’assemblage de prestations (transport, hébergement, restauration, animation…) en vue de réaliser un forfait simple ou une demande complexe de la clientèle.
Participer à la création de prospects afin de développer le portefeuille

De formation touristique et/ou commerciale, vous justifiez d'une expérience réussie d'au moins 2 à 3 ans dans la vente de produits et services touristiques en agence de voyages et maitrisez les outils informatiques nécessaires à la vente de ces produits  (Amadeus indispensable).
Thomas Cook est proche de ses clients et s'attache à répondre au mieux à leurs attentes.
Venez partager votre passion du voyage avec nos équipes et nos clients !
Rémunération sur 13 mois selon profil + variable sur objectifs + mutuelle + tickets restaurants

title: CDI  Contrôleur de Gestion H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, nous permettent d’offrir à travers notre réseau une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.

Le réseau Thomas Cook compte plus de 450 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 180 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages totalement intégré dans un parcours cross-commerce est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie  omni-canal, donnant la possibilité à ses clients de réserver leurs vacances sur Internet, en agence ou par téléphone. Thomas Cook entend ainsi répondre aux exigences des clients d’aujourd’hui sur un marché en pleine mutation, en mettant l’accent sur l’excellence  de la relation clients, la mobilité et la dimension digitale.

Rattaché au responsable du Contrôle de Gestion, le contrôleur de gestion participe à l’amélioration de la rentabilité de l’Entreprise avec des rôles d’alerte et d’analyse permettant de piloter l’activité.

Il/elle est responsable des informations opérationnelles et financières utiles à la prise de décision sur son périmètre d’activité. Il participe à l’élaboration des budgets et des forecasts en lien avec les opérationnels et le management, suit les objectifs  opérationnels et vérifie l’application de la stratégie.
Dans ce cadre, il/elle assure les tâches génériques suivantes :
– Suivi et analyse des indicateurs clefs de l’activité et de la performance en collaboration étroite avec les directions opérationnelles,
– Evolution des bases de données, des outils de reporting et des tableaux de bord dans un processus d’amélioration permanente,
– Participation aux clôtures mensuelles en liaison avec les équipes comptables et contrôle de gestion,
– Elaboration de business plan pour la prise de décision des actions marketing
Il/elle a toute autonomie pour effectuer son travail dans le cadre des procédures appliquées au sein de l’Entreprise.

De formation supérieure Bac + 5 de type Grande école, Master 2 contrôle de gestion, vous possédez impérativement une première expérience en audit, en finance ou en contrôle de gestion. Vous maîtrisez l’anglais et les bases de la comptabilité.
Vous êtes très à l’aise avec les outils informatiques et les outils de gestion : vous maîtrisez Excel (tableaux croisés dynamiques et macros), et la connaissance de BO, SAP et/ou Essbase est un plus.

Garant de la confidentialité des données, vous êtes apprécié pour votre esprit d'analyse et de synthèse. Votre disponibilité, votre réactivité, votre autonomie seront les clefs de votre réussite à nos côtés.

title: Lead Developer
description: Vill du arbete som Lead Developer och applikationsarkitekt inom Business Intelligence? Gillar du arbeta agilt och i en internationell miljö? På Thomas Cook/Ving söker vi nu en senior BI utvecklare som vill arbeta med utveckling och arkitektur i ett av  våra Business Intelligence team.

I rollen kommer du ha det övergripande ansvaret för applikationer och lösningsdesign i ditt team. Du arbetar dagligen i ett nära samarbete med andra utvecklare, kravanalytiker och arkitekter med att designa lösningar som är robusta, skalbara och framtidssäkrade.  Dina sociala egenskaper är viktiga i samarbetet med andra team och som mentor för att stötta andra i utvecklingsprocessen. Du kommer till stor del att arbeta med utvecklingsteam i en internationell nearshore/offshore-miljö.

Vår BI-plattform utgör en strategisk viktig del av våra beslutsstödsprocesser inom finans, commercial, marknad och e-commerce. Våra team inom BI stödjer både den Nordiska marknaden samt marknader inom Thomas Cook Group.

Inom Thomas Cook Group jobbar vi agilt och med kontinuerliga leveranser. Våra kundmöten och resebokningar sker via vår e-handelsplattform och i alla våra digitala kanaler. Detta ställer höga krav på tillgänglighet och prestanda i våra system samt att vi  har en organisation med högt i tak, där våra medarbetare stimuleras att ta egna initiativ och eget ansvar.
Du har flera års erfarenhet av utveckling inom Microsofts BI-plattform samt erfarenhet av att jobba i utvecklingsteam med förmåga att inspirera, leda och stötta andra tekniskt.
Du har gedigen bakgrund inom utveckling och speciellt inom teknikerna SSIS, SSAS och SSRS.
Då visst integrationsarbete förekommer är det bra om du även har erfarenhet av utveckling inom C# och .NET.
Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
Erfarenhet av SharePoint, Power BI eller Azure
Tjänsten är en heltidstjänst och vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning

Vår IT utvecklingsavdelning bygger system primärt i Microsoft miljö, med moderna tekniker, ramverk och verktyg såsom ASP.NET MVC, ASP.NET Core, C#, Node.js, Angular, React, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, Visual Studio etc. Vår BI-plattform byggs med tekniker så  som SSRS, SSAS, SSIS, PowerBI, Microsoft SQL Server. Våra mobila applikationer utvecklas för iOS och Android.

Vi erbjuder en spännande och utvecklande miljö där du får möjlighet till en intern karriär. Vi sitter i nyrenoverade lokaler på Kungsholmen i centrala Stockholm med goda kommunikationer. Hos oss får du som anställd unika reseförmåner då vi tycker det är  viktigt att du ska få se den produkt som du arbetar med. Du får tjänstepension, friskvårdsbidrag samt möjlighet till vinstdelning om alla våra insatser leder till ett bra ekonomiskt resultat. Vi har dessutom ett högt medarbetarengagemang som år efter år visar  sig i vår interna medarbetarundersökning Every Voice. Vi älskar vårt jobb och välkomnar dig ombord på vår resa på Thomas Cook!

title: CDI  Yield Analyst H/F
description: Jet tours, tour opérateur de Thomas Cook, est un acteur de référence depuis 1968. Véritable créateur d’expériences, il offre des voyages de qualité et au meilleur prix à ses clients : essentiellement des séjours, des vacances en clubs avec ses Club Eldorador,  des circuits, des offres de week-ends ou des vacances au ski.
Jet tours offre à ses clients la possibilité de personnaliser leurs vacances pour que chaque voyage soit à l’image de leurs envies.

Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe avec un chiffre d’affaires de 9 milliard de Livres Sterling et regroupe aujourd’hui 27 000 collaborateurs dans 17 pays et fait voyager 20 millions de clients à travers le monde.

Sur un marché en mutation, le professionnalisme et l’attachement à l’entreprise de nos plus de 1 millier de collaborateurs nous offrent aujourd’hui un réel et important potentiel de consolidation en France.

Sous la responsabilité du Responsable Yield, l’Analyste est en charge du suivi des risques et de l’optimisation des revenus sur sa zone géographique. Il met en place les tableaux de bord et réalise les forecasts nécessaires aux prises de décisions lors des  comités destinations.
Définition des plans de vols prévisionnels en avant saison.
Pricing stratégique des blockbusters et benchmark début de saison.
Calcul des prix anticipés et définitifs groupes.
Pricing différentiel provinces, différentiel vol reg, compensation sans transport.
Prévision des ventes sur le périmètre global de la destination (inclus non risque).
Prévision du flight result et risques vol reg (€).
Recommandations vol (relâches, rachat, promo) et suivi des actions.
Recommandations reallot hôtel, gestion des stocks terrestres (stop sales, release).
Gestion des quotas (BMKO promo, EB…) (inclus 14 nuits).
Pricing suppléments ou réduction vol pour rachat/baisse.
De formation en finance / études statistique, vous avez une première expérience sur un poste similaire, idéalement dans le tourisme.
Vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre esprit de synthèse, votre goût pour les chiffres et votre maîtrise de Microsoft Office et notamment d’Excel.

title: CDI  Agent de Voyage H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 22 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, nous permettent d’offrir à travers notre réseau une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits, offres premium, etc.

Le réseau Thomas Cook compte plus de 450 agences de voyages en France, dont environ 180 intégrées. Un nouveau concept d’agence de voyages totalement intégré dans un parcours cross-commerce est en cours de déploiement. L’entreprise a développé une stratégie  omni-canal, donnant la possibilité à ses clients de réserver leurs vacances sur Internet, en agence ou par téléphone. Thomas Cook entend ainsi répondre aux exigences des clients d’aujourd’hui sur un marché en pleine mutation, en mettant l’accent sur l’excellence  de la relation clients, la mobilité et la dimension digitale.
En qualité de conseiller voyages, vous assurez le conseil et la vente au client des services et produits (circuits, séjours, forfaits, locations proposés par les TO, billetterie, etc.) :
Accueillir et conseiller le client : compréhension des attentes, sélections de produits et de services, et formulation de propositions, argumentation en vue de la concrétisation de la vente.
Réaliser les opérations de réservation et de vente.
Concevoir l’assemblage de prestations (transport, hébergement, restauration, animation…) en vue de réaliser un forfait simple ou une demande complexe de la clientèle.
Participer à la création de prospects afin de développer le portefeuille

De formation touristique et/ou commerciale, vous justifiez d'une expérience réussie d'au moins 2 à 3 ans dans la vente de produits et services touristiques en agence de voyages et maitrisez les outils informatiques nécessaires à la vente de ces produits  (Amadeus indispensable).
Thomas Cook est proche de ses clients et s'attache à répondre au mieux à leurs attentes.
Venez partager votre passion du voyage avec nos équipes et nos clients !
Rémunération sur 13 mois selon profil + variable sur objectifs + mutuelle + tickets restaurants

title: CDI  Commercial groupe H/F
description: Thomas Cook est un acteur incontournable du tourisme en Europe et regroupe aujourd’hui 27 000 collaborateurs et fait voyager 20 millions de clients.

Parmi les leaders en France, nos deux métiers de production de voyages (Tour Opérateur) et de distribution, à travers notre réseau (environ 250 points de vente intégrés), nous permettent d’offrir une gamme complète de voyages : clubs de vacances, circuits,  offres premium, etc.
Thomas Cook propose les meilleures offres sélectionnées auprès de plus de 50 partenaires fidèles et procure, à nos clients, de véritables conseils d’experts en agence comme sur internet.

Sous la responsabilité du Responsable Régional Groupe, vous fidélisez et développez votre portefeuille client sur les différentes cibles (Comités d’entreprises, association, collectivités, etc.) pour les départements dont vous avez la charge.
Mettre en place le plan d’actions sur les différents départements
Réaliser les devis clients suite au démarchage sur le terrain
Transmettre les dossiers signés au plateau technique pour la gestion du suivi
De formation supérieure en Tourisme / Commerce, vous avez acquis une solide expérience au sein d’un service commercial Groupe et avez une très bonne connaissance du secteur du tourisme groupes.

Reconnu(e) pour votre sens de la relation commerciale, vous êtes autonome, rigoureux(se) et fin négociateur. Votre parfaite connaissance des techniques de vente vous permet d’être totalement autonome dans le développement et la fidélisation de votre portefeuille  client.

title: Courier Driver
description: Are you a trustworthy, committed and customer focused individual with the ambition and drive to work independently in your local area?..... if the answer is yes then we have the ideal opportunity for you!

Hermes is the UK's largest home delivery courier network handling more than 260 million collections and deliveries each year. We provide a flexible and professional service to businesses and consumers across the country that relies on us to deliver life’s  little essentials on-time, every time.

courier driving job gives you the flexibility and autonomy to be your own boss - perfect if you like your own company and a sense of independence and it will give you the freedom to work around your own existing schedule  too!
Rates are negotiated but typically you would have the opportunity to earn
delivering parcels in your local area!
Please note: You are required to have your own vehicle for this role
· Great earning potential per day based on the size of the round you service and number of parcels you deliver

· A variety of round options including 'round holder’ providing a consistent delivery service 6 days per week, Weekend Courier or Cover Courier where you can work flexibly around your current commitments
· Convenience of delivering in and around your local area
· On-going training and support from our dedicated Field Manager Team
· Access to the Hermes Partner Rewards Plus Programme
In order to apply you’ll need:
A car or van with a valid MOT and insurance
A full, valid UK driving license
The right to work in the UK
The ability to plan your own workload and driving routes

title: Key Stage 2 Teacher
description: A Good Primary school in Bradford is looking for an enthusiastic, hard-working and high achieving Year 4 teacher to join their school after February half term.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced Primary teacher who has high expectations of themselves and their students. You will be able to confidently and independently plan, prepare and deliver outstanding lessons that focus on progressing students through  informative and engaging class work. You will also need to be able to work as part of a team and will need to be confident whilst speaking with parents and external agencies.

Ideally you will be confident in teaching the core subjects and will feel passionate about extending pupil's academic abilities; this will provide you with the opportunity of progression and working alongside the Senior Leadership Team. You will be working  closely with ambitious and hard-working staff who will offer support and advice. This school is located closely to public transport links so the school is easily accessible. Newly Qualified Teachers (NQTs) and UK experienced Overseas Trained Teachers are encouraged  to apply too.

This school have an incredibly supportive Senior Leadership Team that enjoy working alongside their teachers to assist in teacher progression and also being there for their teachers throughout the year. The school encourages teachers to further their knowledge  by running internal CPD courses and also allow their teachers time to attend external CPD courses too. This has been a key factor in the rise in teaching standards across the school.

This school is a lovely 2 form entry school, with a close community ethos. The school has the luxury of having many resources available for their teachers to use and enjoy teachers being creative with the resources to engage all learners.
If you are an experienced and confident Year 4 teacher who is looking for an excellent position local to Bradford then please apply with an up to date CV
All applications are subject to an Enhanced DBS Disclosure, professional reference checks, Overseas Police Clearances (if applicable) in line with our stringent safeguarding policy
Your CV must cover the last 10 years of employment history where possible and all employment breaks must be explained
You must have legal right to work in the UK
You must be willing to attend a registration interview

Veritas Education work with a variety of schools covering a wide geographical area. We deal with teaching placements at Primary, Secondary and college level as well as support staff positions also within these.

'Nothing within the above advert was in any way designed or intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, gender, race, colour, religion, disability or sexual orientation. Veritas Education is an Equal opportunities employer and is proud in the knowledge  that all placements are made on merit and suitability. We accept applications from all sections of the community.'

title: Science Teacher Required in Leeds
description: Teachers for EASTER Vacancies at our partner schools throughout the LEEDS LEA.
Successful candidates must show the drive, ambition and enthusiasm to help make a positive impact to the students learning.
Candidates who specialise in individual Science Subjects (Chemistry/Biology/Physics) are encouraged to apply as well as those with a General Science background.
A PGCE in either Chemistry/Physics/Biology or Secondary Science with QTS Status
Routinely assessed as a "good" or "outstanding" teacher
Taught the subject in a UK Secondary School
The ability to inspire and enthuse students to their full potential
Competitive Daily Rate equivalent to scale
Variety of Full Time/Part Time Contracts
Regular support from your Branch and the School's SLT
If you are interested in Teaching with Veritas Education then please apply, initially, with your CV or contact the Leeds Branch.
All applications are subject to an Enhanced DBS Disclosure, professional reference checks, Overseas Police Clearances (if applicable) in line with our stringent safeguarding policy

title: Customer Service Assistant
description: Sales and Customer Service Assistant - International Decorative Surfaces (IDS) -
Winners of 'TOP EMPLOYER UK AND GLOBAL 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019'
Are you organised, personable and looking for the next challenge in your career? If so, we may just have the opportunity you've been looking for!

We have an exciting opportunity for a highly customer focused Sales and Customer Service Assistant to join our team at IDS Rosyth. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing sales and maximizing branch profitability through link selling,  both in the showroom and over the phone, and by providing exceptional customer service.
As a Sales and Customer Service Assistant with IDS, you will:
Achieve showroom targets set by the business and Branch Manager.
Continuously improve customer service to include exceptional customer after sales care.
Complete training activity for core skills, own role and multi-skilling.
Demonstrate flexibility and team-working in order to improve efficiency and effectiveness of the overall business.

First and foremost, we always want to recruit talented people that align well with our values and way of working; we innovate, we collaborate, we're agile, we act with entrepreneurial spirit, and we're supportive of and close to our customers.
Excellent customer service skills and experience.
Product knowledge relevant to the industry sector.
...we may just be the right fit for each other! Does this sound like you?
We also offer some fantastic benefits, including:
Flexible Holiday buy-sell scheme (allowing up to 3 days holiday to be bought or sold).
As an employee with IDS, you are automatically covered by the Saint-Gobain Life Assurance Scheme.
Staff discounts on high street and leisure activities and various other benefits.
If you're up for a new challenge, we would love to hear from you!
Saint-Gobain encourage and welcome diverse applications AND ARE COMMITTED TO SUCCESS THROUGH OUR DIVERSE COLLEAGUE COMMUNITY.

We're committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of ethnicity, colour, race, religion, national origin,  sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, neurodiversity, taste in music, fashion sense or any other characteristic that makes you unique. If you have a disability or special need that requires support or adjustments  to working or interview arrangements, please let us know.
On occasion we need to close advertisements earlier than expected, we therefore strongly encourage you to make your application promptly to avoid disappointment.

Please note that we have our own recruitment marketing and search functions alongside an already agreed set of agency partners and will not accept any third party CV's/Applications from anyone unless invited to do so. Saint-Gobain  accepts no responsibility for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

title: Group Scheme Underwriter
description: We are pleased to be working on behalf of a global specialist insurance provider, who require a Scheme Underwriter to join their growing division dealing with primarily group income protection and group life schemes.

Candidates will be responsible for the underwriting of cases to ensure profitable business whilst providing full technical support for other departments. You will ensure accurate and timely submission of quotations whilst negotiating rates and terms with  intermediaries and clients to maximise new business levels.

Candidates need to come from a Group Risk / Group Life / Health background. You will have excellent team and communication skills and be confident and competent in dealing with a range of intermediaries and clients. Ideally candidates will hold professional  CII qualifications, although this is not essential.
In return candidates can expect to receive a competitive basic salary and excellent benefits package including ongoing funding and support for studies.

title: Primary School Teacher
description: Full & Part time supply teachers required across Leeds and Bradford, covering all Primary year groups EYFS, Key Stage 1 & 2.
Regular Daily Supply in Leeds and Bradford- Primary
- Supply work (full time and part time)
Veritas Education are searching for strong supply teachers offering both full and part time work, with a variety of schools across Leeds and Bradford on daily supply, short and long term contracts.

Veritas Education works with a broad scope of schools including Early Years, Primary, Secondary and Special Educational Needs School. We are looking to build a strong pool of candidates that are able to work locally on a daily basis and supply our schools  with a high standard of teaching and professional conduct.

As a supply teacher you require the ability to form relationships with schools and pupils quickly and be able to adapt to differing circumstances. Being able to use your initiative is key, this is due to working off another teacher's lesson plans and working  in a mixture of schools and areas.
We welcome newly qualified and experienced teachers to apply!
If you are a fully qualified Primary Teacher with UK experience and an excellent knowledge of the present National Curriculum, please apply with an up to date CV or call Aimee on .
All applications are subject to an Enhanced DBS Disclosure, professional reference checks, Overseas Police Clearances (if applicable) in line with our stringent safeguarding policy

title: Valuations Administrator
description: A well established and highly successful IFA firm is currently recruiting for a new team member for the Valuations Team.

In this new role you will provide a valuation support service to all advisers within the company, enabling the adviser to track performance and carry out full client reviews as part of the ongoing client service You will learn and understand the back-office  system, updating and maintaining accurate data both manually and electronically. On a regular basis you will be producing a suite of reports to form the client valuation pack and ongoing internal reporting tracking productivity and the team's performance.  Adhering to strict FCA regulations and internal policy and procedure.

Ensuring client reviews are completed in a timely manner on a quarterly, half yearly or annual basis depending on the requirements of the adviser and client categorisation, Carrying out ad-hoc valuation requests, either for client meetings or for the adviser's  own review purposes.
Ideally you will need a financial services background, however this is not essential. If you have a Degree or equivalent qualification we would also be interested to speak to you.
Please call for further information and ask for Chloe or apply on the Dynamite Recruitment website.
Dynamite Recruitment Solutions Ltd is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Assistant Manager
description: Could you be the key to real team spirit?
, you’ll take charge of our bar team and help to create a special atmosphere for customers.
You’ll still be out there on the floor, right at the heart of the action - but you’ll be more than just ‘one of the team’. While the General Manager drives the business, it’s
that manages the day-to-day running of the pub…
Enjoy the fast-paced fun of pub life
Learn new skills to enhance your career with our industry leading training and development.
Belong to a supportive, close-knit team
Benefit from a competitive salary and great discounts including 20% in all Fuller's pubs and heavily discounted stays in our hotels.
We will reward you every time you introduce a friend to the Fuller’s family who successfully passes their probation.
A great benefits package including enhanced sick pay.
Assistant Manager is a rewarding role which sees you take responsibility for the happiness of customers
You’ll need to take ownership of problems, and you’ll live by a mantra of ‘always doing the right thing’ – even if it occasionally means bending the rules.

In supporting the General Manager, this is also a great way to learn the business side of running a pub. It’s a chance to develop your skills, and garner the knowledge you need to progress your career even further.
The great thing about Fuller’s is that we hire on the basis of potential, more than previous experience. All we need to know is that you’ve got the right character for the role:
You should be a confident, capable leader
Please understand that we will need proof of your right to work in the UK.

The Hydrant is a bustling craft beer hangout in the heart of the city. Boasting an unobstructed view of the Monument. From city workers to tourists, we attract an array of customers, offering a unique small plates menu and a huge selection of draught and  bottled beer. The Hydrant is seeking passionate, enthusiastic individuals with an emphasis on teamwork, who let their personalities shine.
Enjoy the fast-paced fun of pub life
Learn new skills to enhance your career with our industry leading training and development.
Belong to a supportive, close-knit team
Benefit from a competitive salary and great discounts including 20% in all Fuller's pubs and heavily discounted stays in our hotels.
We will reward you every time you introduce a friend to the Fuller’s family who successfully passes their probation.
A great benefits package including enhanced sick pay.

title: Reception Teacher
description: An Ofsted 'Outstanding' school in Bradford is looking to recruit an EYFS Teacher to take on one of their Reception class.

An Ofsted 'Outstanding' School is looking to recruit an EYFS teacher to take on one of their lovely Reception class part time. The school pride themselves on their supportive and inclusive nature, where each teacher is supported and listened to throughout the  academic year by the Senior Leadership team (SLT).

The school itself is a 2 form entry school and provides internal and internal CPD courses which are there for all teachers to develop their knowledge and focus on areas they require further understanding.
The SLT are always looking to promote creative teaching and are in a great position to provide their teachers and pupils with numerous resources to do so.

The school are looking for either an experienced or Newly Qualified teacher to join their team. The will be working alongside one of the current Reception class teachers who has been established at the school for over 6 years and has been praised by Ofsted  for their effective planning and delivering of lessons.
For a NQT working alongside this teacher would be hugely beneficial and would provide you with the direct support and influences you will need as a Newly Qualified Teacher.
If you are interested in this position please respond with your CV and you will be contacted as soon as possible.

title: Operations Projects Manager
description: Operations Projects Manager - Surrey - up to £65k + Package!

We are looking for a passionate and ambitious Operations Projects Manager to move our business forward and make the company the best in its sector. If you are an experienced Programme/Project Manager in a Retail/Hospitality/Leisure/ environment and you are  looking for a new challenge where you will be able demonstrate your commercial verve as well as your relationship building skills, read on.
So what does the role involves?
As the Operations Projects Manager you will:
Review & improve operations to make the business faster, better and more efficient
Will own and manage substantial budget and play key contact role with colleagues
Project manage a variety of programmes with the aim of making the business the best in the UK
Communicate clearly to stakeholders any changes and manage issues
Closely work with the engineering team to understand processes
Reduce the total spend of the business on equipment and services year on year
What qualities will you need for this role?
You will have experience in Programme/Project Management/Operations in a Retail/Hospitality environment
You will have excellent communications and stakeholder management working across a diverse business environment
As the Operations Projects Manager, you will also have experience of holding budgetary responsibility and have a passion for driving results
You will have experienced projects that require change and very tight deadlines
You will be able to demonstrate exceptional leadership behaviours
Basic salary of up to £65,000 + Car Allowance + Bonus + Pension + Healthcare
We will also provide personal development for you to broaden your skills and experience and grow with us.
We will give you more freedom and autonomy in order to get your creativity flowing!

We will offer flexibility for you to successfully initiate, plan and monitor multiple projects in order to continue to make our business a significant profit contributor and one of the best brands in the world.

The school welcome applications from talented NQT's as well as experienced teachers.
A routinely good to outstanding Teacher of English and looking to start and/or develop your career in a supportive environment
Able to encourage and enthuse students to achieve their full potential
Inspirational to colleagues and students - sharing best practice
A school and senior leadership team that will allow you to be inspirational, proactive and play an active part in our school improvement

description: We are on the hunt for a superstar retailer with a Food, Fashion or Homewares background who will be responsible for one of our clients major stores.

You will lead and motivate a team to offer a customer experience which is second to none. You will be professional and commercially astute, with experience in a dynamic retail environment. With fantastic brand recognition, and an iconic stance in the great  British High Street, this really is a dream role for any experienced Store Manager.
Charismatic, dynamic and enthusiastic with a track record of managing a high volume sales environment with a large team
Driven and passionate, you'll be willing to get your sleeves rolled up and have a hands on presence on the shop floor whilst maintaining a commercial and strategic focus

Leading one of their multi-million pound operations, you’ll drive the business from the front in delivering a service people talk about

Inspire the team to achieve store targets through mentoring, delivering constructive feedback and teamwork
Contribute to ideas that drive positive results in KPIs including sales and service

Our client is one of the UK’s leading retailers. title: VAT Manager In-House - Commodities
description: Are you CTA qualified, experienced in indirect Tax and looking for a progressive VAT opportunity?
Attracted to a global asset manager with scope for progression and flexible working?
Interested in a large team committed to developing and upscaling employees?
The opportunity: VAT Manager In-House - Commodities

This opportunity is based in a large team covering the provision of advice and risk-management on a global scale, with clients across trading, investment/private banking, asset management, treasury, custody/fund services and commodities.

Your role will be advisory-led and draw on a minority of compliance responsibilities across the EMEA region. You will work closely with the President of indirect tax on advisory functions for the business lines across the major European jurisdictions, including  reviewing partial exemption methods, new products, business initiatives (e.g. around Brexit). Broad, varied, project focused and internal-client oriented, your role will offer balanced conditions of remote working and flexible hours.
What the VAT Manager In-House - Commodities will need to succeed:
ACA/CTA qualified (indirect tax route) with demonstrable financial services experience acquired in a top accounting/legal practice
Strong technical knowledge of EU VAT law - language skills advantageous
In-house experience (including secondments) preferential, not essential
Attention to detail, strong interpersonal and influencing skills.

title: SENIOR FRONT-END ENGINEER - CMS
description: Reed Exhibitions is the world's leading events business, enhancing the power of face-to-face through data and digital tools. Every year they run over 500 events in 30 countries, bringing together over 7 million event participants worldwide. With 4000 employees,  we serve 43 industries in 38 offices around the globe.

Working as part of a highly motivated, collaborative, close-nit, enthusiastic cross-functional team. You will be creating components within Adobe AEM CMS and integrations with services and APIs from other teams. You will partner closely with the Product & UX  team to design, implement, A/B test, iterate and deploy winning experiences in production. If you love product ideation, owning, collaborating, building, and constantly raising the bar, you will thrive in this role.
* Knowledgeable, confident, collaborative and customer focused with respect to Agile Delivery.
* Skilled in Front-End Web UI development, but capable with some backend development.
* Able to work collaboratively with Product Owners, Analysts, UX Designers, Backend Developers and Testers to deliver high quality features and products.
* Skilled and passionate Front-End Developer with a flair for graphic design and usability, and an eye for detail.
* Expert at creating Mobile first, Responsive/Adaptive Designs, and highly competent with CSS Pre-processors, BEM, SMACSS, Templating
* Solid experience developing themes on large scale CMS and web facing applications
* Solid experience with building reusable modular JavaScript components with modern Frameworks
* Experience in an agile environment practicing XP methodology with strong exposure to Scrum or Lean, DevOps & CALMS cultures
* A polyglot, confident to develop the full stack from through multiple application tiers.
* Experience of software testing processes including the creation and execution of test scripts, including cross browser / device testing and debugging techniques
* Knowledge of good practice around usability, localisation and accessibility
* Build automation (Grunt / Gulp), Web Components, WebSockets, WebRTC
* Experience developing front-end templates on the Adobe AEM platform.

* Knowledge of development and configuration of the AEM 6.x platform. Including Adobe AEM building blocks, including templates, components, dialogs, widgets etc., and the AEM development and deployment process
* Cloud and network aware with AWS Experience
* Native and Hybrid Mobile App Development
* Experience in developing c# or Java based applications
* You actively participate in the development community.
You will have experience in at least some of the following technologies & practices, or equivalent, and be ready to learn the technology where gaps exist.
* CMS:Adobe AEM 6.x platform, OAK repository, Apache Sling, Apache Felix, Tag Management, Google/Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target
* Languages: JavaScript, Handlebars, Sightly, ReactJS, CSS (BEM, SMACSS), ReactNative, PWA, Java, c#/.netcore
* Testing: Pair Programming, TDD, BDD, Selenium Web Driver, mocha, Browser Stack, WebpageTest, google lighthouse, Gatling, (SOLID Principles, Pair Programming).
* CI/CD: Git, Bitbucket, Bamboo, maven/proget, Sonaqube, green-blue deployments, canary releases, Docker

title: Experienced Service Advisor
description: MOTOR TRADE EXPERIENCED SERVICE ADVISOR NEEDED
We have an exciting opportunity for a Service Advisor looking to join a busy team within a successful main car dealership.

We are looking for an experienced Service advisor who understands the demands of the role and who has the ability to meet the demanding standards that this position brings. Working as a Service Advisor, you will be responsible for delivering an outstanding  customer experience ensuring that all work carried out is communicated in a clear and precise manner. Selling additional products, services and repair work is essential to maintain profitability and meet targets set. You must have the ability to upsell and  have a consultative approach to selling.

Your main duties will include meeting and greeting, booking in vehicles, keeping the customer updated and informed of the technician’s progress, up selling additional work and accurately invoicing and documenting all work completed.
You will be able to deal with customer enquiries over the phone and in person building rapport to ensure repeat business.
Ensuring a consistent level of excellent customer service in line with company and manufacturer standards.
Providing customers with accurate estimates and invoices, whilst fully explaining the work carried out by the service department.
Ensuring that the service reception is staffed at all times to be able to greet customers at any time during business opening hours.
Selling additional products, services and repair work in a professional manner and within set targets.
Identifying any areas of lost sales and revenues and bringing them to your line manager’s attention.
Ensuring all job cards are raised accurately, detailing the work needed and ensuring that they have met the manufacturers’ standards required for warranty.
Ensuring all customers have sufficient credit to enable all work advised to be carried out and authorities for work to be carried out are gained, where applicable.
Ensuring all work has been carried out as detailed and charged for.
Keeping customers updated of any changes to agree completion times and additional work required.
Ensuring all Company Health & Safety procedures are strictly adhered to.
Maintaining a high standard of personal appearance, ensuring corporate workwear is worn at all times and kept in good condition.
The ability to up sell additional work and service plans
Excellent computer literacy and administration skills
Great organisation and ability to communicate well
Ability to work within a team frame work
Can deliver a world class customer experience
You will need be very well presented

If you are interested in applying for this role, please contact Karen at Just Recruitment Solutions. You must have recent or current experience within a Service Advisor role within a main car dealership to be considered

title: Revenue Controller
description: Are you a proven communicator with the ability to form strong relationships both externally and internally?
Can you demonstrate success in a results driven environment?
Do you want to manage a portfolio of key Brokers relationships with the opportunity to drive high quality delivery?

If so, we may have the role for you. Hiscox are recruiting for a Revenue Controller to focus on managing key accounts in the UK, in the main for binding authority agents. You will focus on building and maintaining strong relationships with our Brokers, as  well as the day to day reconciliation of cash received to a number of binding authority accounts.

You'll need a "whatever it takes" attitude and will suit someone who is excited by rolling their sleeves up and building strength within the team. You will then have the energy and enthusiasm to maintain high quality delivery and service in a BAU environment.
Manage a portfolio of key Brokers/Managing General Agents to resolve cash flow issues arising from written and paid premium bordereaux processing and settlement;
Building robust relationships with your key accounts, including visits to build plans that work for both parties;
Provide recommendation to the Credit Control Team Leader and the Area Manager on the best and most pragmatic action plans to reach resolution of issues;
Provide recommendations to the wider Credit Control team on focus areas for the team and work with the Credit Control Team Leader to make these happen;
Production of reconciled binding authority accounts to enable allocation of cash received against booked debt ahead of month end system closedown;
Preparation of pre and post month end performance reporting;
Preparation of monthly focused tasks for credit control team. Support the preparation of the monthly debtor packs ahead of internal business unit, underwriter and management meetings;
Maintain and develop pre-defined agent and cover holder scorecards, used by the business to assess credit risk;
Obtain regular analysis of broker financial accounts, record data received from providers and manage the payment process for the resource within budget;
Support the wider Credit Control team with queries and represent Credit Control as an expert to the business.
Work alongside with the Regions, making sure that the regional overdue debt is align with the strategy of the company.
This role can be based in either Colchester or London and will involve up to 50% travel to regional offices/broker meetings as required
Educated to at least A Level standard with previous experience on a similar role;
Good computer literacy, including intermediate/Advanced Excel and PowerPoint;
A positive can-do attitude to work, results driven, with the energy and determination to succeed in a very fast paced environment where the pace and quality of response are critical to success;
Pragmatic in decision making and action plans, human in delivering them, with experience in commercial negotiations;
Strong attention to detail in producing high quality output and maintains this when under pressure;
Ability to prioritise workload in order to meet tight deadlines, with previous experience of multi-tasking to achieve multiple deliverables;
Confidence to work unsupervised and as part of a team to achieve personal and team objectives;
Excellent communication skills with confidence to build good working relationships at all levels, and ask questions to ensure requirements and rationale are understood.
Previous experience in a busy Insurance Operations environment, ideally with Lloyd's background;
Previous experience with AS400, Cognos or Magic.

Working life doesn't always have to be 'nine to five' and we support flexible working wherever we can. No promises, but please chat to our resourcing team about the flexibility we could offer for this role.

title: Part Time Sales Advisor
description: A big Company that feels small
Most jobs require you to make compromises. Often you have to weigh up things like whether you
want the security of a big, established company, or the close knit family feel of a small one. But at
Big Yellow, you don't have to choose. We pride ourselves on making sure every employee, in every store, feels at home, from their first day with us and throughout the rest of their career.
A career as individual as you are

At Big Yellow, we put you before your experience. So, if we choose you, it's for your personality and passion, not just your past jobs. Why? Because every day at Big Yellow is different and you'll be dealing with people facing a range of unique, exciting  or stressful times. So we look for people with a human touch and the enthusiasm to approach every day as a new one and in return you get a unique career where you're valued for being you.
The opportunity to make a big impact

Working alongside a small team, you will be enthused about supporting the Managers in your store and will be the first point of contact for most of our customers. You will work to achieve store KPI's, selling merchandise and insurance, following up on enquiries  and advising customers on the best solution for their particular needs. There is a great balance of customer service, sales and administration within the role, as well as ensuring that all store standards are maintained.

Whilst we ideally require you to have experience at a similar level in the retail or sales sectors, we are looking for confidence, flexibility, a team player, and a great attitude and ability to learn. At Big Yellow, we love a big personality!

In this role, you'll be required to work for 8 hours per week, on Saturdays. Ideally you'll also be flexible in terms of providing additional cover throughout busy periods (which will be paid as overtime).
Monday to Friday: 8.00 am to 6.00 pm Saturday: 9.00 am to 6.00 pm Sunday: 10.00 am to 4.00 pm
Ideally, you'll be located within 30 minutes travelling time of the store.
A big company that nails the little things

We believe you can tell a lot about a company by the little things we do for our staff - the things that make life whether it be inside or outside of work, so much better for everyone who works for us. Like a day off on your birthday, vouchers to recognise  personal events such as engagements, weddings and births, a Christmas party and plenty of other social events and time off to volunteer with our charity partners through the Big Yellow Foundation. These are the little ways we try to show our staff how much  we value them every day.
Some of the other fantastic benefits we offer include:
Competitive rates of pay, reviewed on an annual basis.
Excellent bonus calculated against operational and sales targets.
WOW awards for delivering great customer service.
Family friendly policies to include enhanced maternity, paternity and adoption leave.

description: Tradewind are looking to recruit a teacher from February half term for a mall early years class. This school is for children with SEMH they have small class sizes and each class has 6 children and 2 Teaching Assistants. As this is an SEMH school but some  of the children may have SEMH the children will have challenging behaviours, they offer a nurturing and structured environment to support their pupils.
The school want all pupils to enjoy their days and feel happy and supported in their learning.

The school are looking for a highly motivated, creative and enthusiastic teacher to join the dynamic team. Ideally you will have experience working with SEN pupils in mainstream or a SEN school. You will be supported by a team of experienced teaching assistants  to deliver highly personalised teaching and learning, therapy programmes and personal care.
The school has parking and is very close to the main train lines and bus routes.
You will be supported by a dedicated team that who are all trained in ASD and offer outstanding practices on site.
By registering with Tradewind, we can offer you:
*We attract top education talent and in return offer top rates of pay

*We care about your training and development more than any other agency - which is why we can offer you more certified CPD courses than any other education recruitment agency, 25 to be exact! That's 18 more than our next nearest competitor

*Help with lesson planning - our support doesn't stop once we've secured you a placement
*Online Portal for your timesheets and log your availability
*Free social and networking events to get to know your peers and consultants
To join us and be successful in this Early Years Position role you will need to:
*This position is subject to an Enhanced DBS Disclosure, Overseas Police Clearances (if applicable) and professional reference checks
*Your CV must cover the last 10 years of employment history where possible and any employment breaks must be explained
*You must have the legal right to work in the UK
*QTS is essential, also previous experience with Autism and challenging behaviour
Please send through your resume to Linzi on or you can call me on and press option 3.

title: Director of Cyber Security & Information Assurance - Government
description: Oliver James Associates are mandated by their global consulting client based in London to help find a Director of Cyber Security & Information Assurance with deep experience within the UK public sector (i.e. central government, transport, national infrastructure)  to join and build a new capability. The basic salary range falls between £130-£150,000 plus bonus, pension, extras, car allowance.

Oliver James Associates are mandated by their global consulting client based in London to help find a Director of Cyber Security & Information Assurance with deep experience within the UK public sector (i.e. central government, transport, national infrastructure)  to join and build a new capability. The basic salary range falls between £130-£150,000 plus bonus, pension, extras, car allowance.
Essential experience required and responsibilities involved:-
An outstanding pedigree in information & cyber security and risk management.
A thorough and current awareness of UK central government trends, issues and developments.
Proven track record in Public Sector; from sales and marketing through to defining key functional processes.
Understanding and anticipating needs based on a strong understanding of Public Sector specific requirements
Leading and guiding teams in selecting and applying the most appropriate tools, techniques and approaches to deliver work.

To have a broader perspective of potential issues encountered when managing diverse teams and the strategies to overcome them; have a clear understanding of the firm's commitment to creating a more inclusive culture
Building business relationships to execute sales opportunities
Defining a security strategy and target operating model for an information security function
Conducting security risk, capability and/or maturity assessments
Defining, mobilising and managing security enhancement projects and programmes
Designing and implementing specific information security solutions covering people, process and technology
Excellent interpersonal skills and a track record of developing strong client relationships
Delivery of client engagements, typically leading delivery using a team of resources and planning and staffing projects for clients based on complex deliverables and programmes of work
Taking responsibility for budgets, and client deliverables
Evidence of working with leadership teams to identify, generate, develop and execute sales opportunities

Broad range of security experience though with a distinct specialism in at least one area, e.g. cyber strategy, security target operating models, security transformation programmes, security change initiatives, security technologies (such as information  protection, firewall rule set review, network segregation etc), privacy, security standards such as ISF, ISO, SANS etc.
Strong technical abilities, combined with business acumen
Preferably internal or external consultancy experience
Qualification such as CCP, CISSP, CISM, CCNP, CIPP/E preferred
Holds (or is able to hold) at least SC national security clearance

title: Transfer Pricing Director - London - £125k
description: An opportunity has arisen for a Transfer Pricing Senior Manager or Director to take lead of the business unit at a distinguished client of mine. Based in London, the independent practice has a strong Corporate Tax team, a history of consistent, annual, double-digit  growth and has identified their Transfer Pricing offering as an area of key investment.

I've done a lot with the practice over the past 12 months, having assisted with a merger and placed a Corporate Tax Partner, which has given a clear insight into the determination of the practice to continue this trajectory.
Headed up by an excellent Head of Tax and senior leadership group, support filters through the organisation and staff are recognised and rewarded based on merit.
It's a growing practice and an opportune time to get involved.

In order to champion the Transfer Pricing business, you'd be expected to bring strong experience and be able to demonstrate a robust skillset in dealing with complex tax matters for significant multinational organisations.
In addition, you'd offer leadership skills and have the willingness to grow and build a team around you in order to deliver on work.
Above all, you must be ambitious and charismatic in your approach to clients, with an awareness of the market and a desire to win in this competitive environment
To date, the Transfer Pricing offering has been relatively reactive, with advice being given on a case by case basis, as and when clients need it.

In the medium-long term, you'll be expected to take a proactive approach in client's portfolios, identifying areas of benefit for all parties. You'll have the full assistance of an ex-Big 4 Partner who joined to help lead the International Corporate Tax  team, and resources throughout the firm.
Clients vary from industry to industry, so you'll gain exposure to interesting work from FMCG through manufacturing with some household names.

The opportunity is ideal for a candidate - Senior Manager or Director - looking for an autonomous role, with the end-goal of lending your name to the success of the team. Ambition is key on this Partner-track route and a desire to reach the top will set  you in good stead.
For information on this prospect, call Chris on or email your CV to and let's discuss today.
The Pro-Recruitment Group consists of four distinct brands: ProTax, ProLegal, ProFinance and ProHR

title: Buyer - Home
description: , you’ll keep us one step ahead of our competitors – introducing new products, negotiating exclusive products and the best possible terms. You’ll also have two direct reports and with your product knowledge deliver exactly what our  customers want. Maintaining excellent relationships with suppliers and the wider business, your commercial focus will mean you take interest in your products right through to point of sale.

You’ll already have great experience as a buyer Home, so we’ll expect you to hit the ground running. Creative in your approach, you’ll have an eye for the product and your relationship management skills will be exceptional.
We are a shop run on imagination: a place where the world’s most covetable brands combine with the most extraordinary spectacles, events and ideas for an experience like no other.

We have challenged the rules of retail from day one, whilst demonstrating our unwavering commitment to sustainability. In 2016, we were the first to be awarded with recognition for the ‘World’s Best Sustainability Campaign by a Department Store’ at the IGDS  Global Department Store Summit, in-line with its focus on buying better and inspiring change. We are also recognised as the Best Department Store in the World (2010, 2012, 2014 & 2018) underlining our place at the forefront of retail. In 2018 we were recognised  as a LinkedIn Top Company to work for.

Our vision is to be the destination for the most extraordinary customer experience, and our people are central to us achieving this. As an employer we are committed to making Selfridges an exciting, inspiring and fun place to work

title: Tax Technology Partner - Top 10 - London
description: A Top 10 accounting practice are looking for a specialist in tax technology to join their London office, in the advent of the changing MTD environment within VAT and other tax areas.

Having met with the Head of London Tax last week, it's clear that the practice is in a favourable position to invest aggressively into this side of their business, where they have identified key areas of their client portfolios to strengthen and generate  value.

Joining as a "direct-entry" Partner in the team, you'd be expected to demonstrate a refined understanding of the changing landscape and regulations, with the commercial acumen to identify new business opportunities.
Working with the Head of VAT, an impressive leader and tax professional, you'll have the resources to hit the ground running upon arrival, with your key responsibilities being:
Managing, leading and building the tax technology team
Developing software and systems for businesses ranging from large OMB to FTSE 100 multinationals
Business development and proactively engaging with clients to understand their businesses and needs
Defining the tax strategy with the other Partners regarding "making tax digital"

With exciting changes on the horizon for the business, it's an exceptional time to join the team and make the offering your own, heading up a team with strong technical abilities and backing from a collegiate Partnership group.

title: Primary Teacher - fixed term to June 2019 - Gylemuir Primary School
description: Primary Teacher - fixed term contract until 28/6/19
An exciting opportunity has arisen for a full time Class Teacher at Gylemuir Primary School from March 2019.

Within our caring community, Gylemuir Primary School aims to promote a love of learning that will evolve and continue for life. Our school values encourage us to be Welcoming, Happy, Supportive and Creative.

Gylemuir Primary School is organised into eighteen classes from P1-P7. There is a nursery which caters for 60 children in the morning session and 60 children in the afternoon session and an Early Years Hub for 2 year olds. Pupils are supported by a nurture  base and a variety of nurturing and therapy groups.

The school is led by a leadership team of a Head Teacher, three part time Depute Head Teachers, a Principal Teacher and a part-time Business Manager. This session there is an Acting Principal Teacher and opportunities for devolved leadership are available to  teachers and PSA’s to facilitate the implementation of the School Improvement Plan. There are two part-time Support for Learning Teachers. The leadership team is ably supported by a School Administrator, a team of Pupil Support Assistants and a Facilities  Technician.
The school benefits from an active and supportive Parent Council and Parent Teacher Association, called Friends of Gylemuir.
Teaching assigned classes together with associated preparation and correction.
Assessing, recording and reporting on the work of pupils.
Preparing pupils for examinations and assisting with their administration.
Providing advice and guidance to pupils on issues related to their education.
Promoting and safeguarding the health, welfare and safety of pupils. Working in partnership with parents, support staff and other professionals.
Undertaking appropriate and agreed continuing professional development
Participating in issues related to school planning, raising achievement and individual review.
Contributing towards good order and the wider needs of the school.
Interviews will be held on Monday 18 February 2019 at Gylemuir Primary School.
Salaries will be in accordance with the Scheme of Salaries and Conditions of Service for Teaching Staff in School Education.

This post is considered Regulated Work with Vulnerable Children and/or Protected Adults, under the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007. Preferred candidates will be required to join the PVG Scheme or undergo a PVG scheme update check prior to  a formal offer of employment being made by the City of Edinburgh Council.

title: Homecarer
description: Provide care and support to service users and their families within their own homes to manage aspects of daily living, allowing service users to live independently, and promoting their rights, autonomy and choices. This role will require flexible, evening  and weekend working. There is a responsibility for the post holder to demonstrate a commitment to quality service delivery through continuous improvement for the benefit of the Service and the organisation.
The 18 hours are worked over 3 days on a 2 week rolling rota: 1 week being Wednesday, Thursday, Friday early shift and the other being Friday, Saturday, Sunday late shift.

This post is regulated work with Children and/or Protected Adults under the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007. The preferred candidate will be required to join the PVG Scheme or undergo a PVG Scheme update check.  Where an individual has  spent a continuous period of 3 months or more out with the UK in the last 5 years, an Overseas Criminal Record Check will be required. You will be required to provide this check. A confirmed offer of employment and commencement in the post will be subject  to the outcome of both these pre-employment checks being deemed satisfactory.
The majority of posts within Aberdeenshire Council fall into one of the categories as detailed on the Worksmart website - http://worksmart.aberdeenshire.gov.uk/
This post has a minimum requirement of two references, one of these must be your current or most recent employer.

description: A vacancy has arisen for a Public Convenience Cleaner  to be responsible for opening and closing premises, cleaning premises to required` standard. This role may require flexible, evening and weekend working.
There is a responsibility for the post holder to demonstrate a commitment to quality service delivery through continuous improvement for the benefit of the Service and the organisation.

This is a 26 week contract and the shift pattern is 1 week on and 1 week off, Monday to Sunday.  The hours of work are 7.45 to 8.00 and 18.00 to 18.45 in the winter and 7.45 to 8.00 and 20.00 to 20.45 in the summer.

title: Streetscene Operative Seasonal

Applications are invited from experienced and qualified persons, for the above seasonal positions.

This role will include the undertaking of frontline operations to meet the councils requirements in relation to Streetscene operations involving street cleansing, cemetery operations, grounds maintenance, and the care of gardens service.
Previous experience in the use of grounds maintenance plant and associated equipment is essential for this post.
A full driving licence with trailer towing entitlement is desirable, although not essential.
The hours of work will be 37 hours per week, Monday to Friday.
Applicants must be flexible and able to report to any depot across East Dunbartonshire as required.
