title: School Support Assistant - Broughton High School
description: Salary: £15,285 - £17,191 (Pro-rata for part-time and sessional 39 weeks)
Hours: 26.25 per week (39 weeks per year)

We are looking for an enthusiastic and organised person to join our busy team. The role will include working in our welfare room, duty in the foyer / playground area at breaks and lunch times and general administrative support for various teams across the  school.

The successful candidate will have experience of working in a busy office environment and be willing to work flexibly in order to meet the needs of the service. They will also be competent users of ICT and have knowledge and experience of using databases,  spreadsheets and word documents. Excellent communication skills and experience of working to tight deadlines is essential.

Candidates will be expected to provide basic first aid and administer medication as appropriate. A suitable qualification in first aid or considerable experience in this area along with a willingness to undertake any necessary training is essential.
Commitment to providing the best care and support to our students
Ability to quickly form positive relationships with staff and students
If you feel you would enjoy this rewarding role we would love to hear from you.

This post is considered Regulated Work with Vulnerable Children and/or Protected Adults, under the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007. Preferred candidates will be required to join the PVG Scheme or undergo a PVG Scheme update check prior  to a formal offer of employment being made by the City of Edinburgh Council.

The City of Edinburgh Council applies a Living Wage allowance to ensure that all employees earn at least £8.51 per hour. Successful applicants will be paid the hourly rate for the role, plus the allowance, in order to bring their earnings to £8.51 per hour.

title: Early Learning & Childcare Practitioner, Auchinleck Early Childhood Centre
description: Contribute as part of a management team to the provision of a quality early learning and childcare service for children aged 0 – 8 years and their families, working to the principles of the national care standards for early education and childcare, abiding  by the Code of Practice for Social Service Workers and assisting in the supervision and development of Early Learning and Childcare Practitioners.

The duties of the post involve Regulated Work with children and/or protected adults, as specified in the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007.  Successful applicants for such posts will be required to become a Protecting Vulnerable Groups  (PVG) Scheme member in respect of Regulated Work with either or both of these groups as appropriate, or if they are already a Scheme member, be subject to a PVG Scheme Record Update, before any formal offer of employment can be made by East Ayrshire Council.

Please note:- PVG members' records are constantly updated with any new vetting information that arises.  Any information that is disclosed on a PVG Scheme Record or Scheme Record Update, if relevant to the post being applied for, will be discussed with the  applicant prior to any formal offer of employment being made.

This is a temporary part time (term time) post based at Auchinleck Early Childhood Centre, Auchinleck.  The working hours are 21 hours per week, working every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 8.30 am until 4.00 pm.  The salary for the post is £22,350  - £24,352 per annum (pro rata).

title: Secondary Supply Teacher
description: The duties of a teacher working in East Ayrshire Council are defined in Annex B of the national agreement “A teaching profession for the 21st century” and the Standard for Full Registration (SFR).

We welcome applications from all subject specialisms and general supply teachers, however of particular interest are the subjects of Maths, English, Music, Chemistry, Physics, Biology, Home Economics, Technical and Business Education.
Our schools are located within the geographical areas of Kilmarnock, Cumnock and Dalmellington.

title: Seasonal Museum Attendant
description: We are looking to recruit 2 seasonal attendants to work at the Castle of St John for 4 months (1 June – 28 September 2019). These fixed term posts are up to 30 hours per week including weekend working.

Working front of house we need reliable, trustworthy and enthusiastic individuals who are passionate about providing a high standard of customer service. This will involve greeting customers, facilitating tours, answering telephones, providing customer information,  operating the gift shop, basic record keeping and maintaining building security and cleanliness and participating in the Castle’s living history events. Excellent communication and customer care skills are essential as is working with members of the public.
Educated to Standard Grade Level or equivalent and some local knowledge of the area would be an advantage.
These posts are subject to basic candidate vetting through Disclosure Scotland.
The above salary includes a current living wage supplement.
To apply please log onto myjobscotland.gov.uk
For further information please contact: Stranraer Museum on.

title: Teacher of Primary
description: We are looking for enthusiastic teachers who are committed to excellence and ready to work in a dynamic part of Scotland to deliver quality education to assigned pupils and contribute, within collegiate ethos, to the professional life of the school in relation  to pupils, staff and appropriate external bodies within the agreements of the Local Negotiating Committee for Teachers and the Scottish Negotiating Committee for Teachers.
There is a responsibility for the post holder to demonstrate a commitment to quality service delivery through continuous improvement for the benefit of the Service and the organisation.
Salary for this post will be in accordance with SNCT agreements. Applicants must be or eligible to be fully GTC Scotland registered.

We are proud of our diverse range of schools and environment and relocating to Aberdeenshire for the next exciting stage in your career is easier than you think.   You will receive an upfront payment of £5k settling in allowance (less tax and national insurance)  as part of an overall relocation package of up to £8k (subject to criteria*)  NB This incentive will only apply to permanent appointments from applicants who are not currently employed by Aberdeenshire Council.

title: Streetscene Operative 1
description: An exciting opportunity for 4 Streetscene operative 1 posts based from Abercromby depot Castle Douglas but working in various locations within the Stewartry You will work every other weekend throughout the year 14hrs per weekend during the spring/summer (13weeks)  and 8 hrs per weekend during the autumn winter (13 weeks)
Working in public parks & playing fields, cemeteries, landscaped and open spaces, grass cutting, hedge trimming and clearing leaves and litter.
Assisting in all aspects of the burial service and to assist senior grounds operatives in more skilled tasks as required e.g. care of plants and site preparation and construction.
Use of power tools, light plant and operation of tractor mounted equipment will be required.
Driving of Community Asset vehicles and operation of equipment.
Cleaning of bins and other street/grounds furniture.
General maintenance work in public areas including streets, roadsides, parks, playing fields, cemeteries, landscaped areas and similar public open spaces.
Other tasks relating to the Community Assets Service, e.g. school crossing patrols, street and open space cleaning and assisting at community facilities.

You must be a team player, able to work on own initiative and be prepared to work outside and in all weather conditions. You will be expected to carry out various duties as instructed by Supervisor and have a working knowledge of Health and Safety requirements.
You will be educated to Standard Grade Level.
These posts are subject to candidate vetting through Disclosure Scotland.

We are looking for an enthusiastic individual to join our busy Development Applications team. The team supports the Council’s planning and building standards service, processing applications and warrants.

(Salary will be pro-rated for part-time hours)
The above post have become available for Early Years Support Worker on a permanent basis

title: CS2030 - Early Years Officer
description: We have an exciting opportunity for Early Years Officers. You will have knowledge of current early learning and childcare provision and procedures. With experience of working with children, you will have an HNC/SVQ Level 3 in Education and Childcare or equivalent.  You must be registered with or currently seeking registration with the Scottish Social Services Council (SSSC).
You will work 30 hours per week.
This post is temporary until 28 June 2019 due to budget restrictions.
If you are the successful candidate, you will be required to gain/maintain PVG scheme membership.

title: Early Years Lead Officer FIF12956
description: Contract type : Temporary until Friday 3 April 2020
The job pack for this vacancy is attached at the bottom of the page. It provides more detailed information about the job and the type of person we are looking for.
All employees are expected to display and promote certain behaviours in the workplace.  Our ‘How We Work Matters’ behaviour framework contains more information and is available via this link.
Before applying, it is important that you read the ‘Candidate Information’ by clicking on this link. The main Terms and Conditions and employment are available via the same link.
The role of the Early Years Lead Officer involves:
Providing more children who face the greatest disadvantages with increased access to highly quality support.
Providing additional support for those children who need it most in order to close the attainment gap.
Help narrow the gap in cognitive development that opens up before children start primary school.
Develop high quality relationships and interactions with children that promote wellbeing, and extend thinking and concept development.
Contribute towards the wider programme of work in the ELC setting to reduce inequality.
Manage ELC services open full year across a locality during school holiday periods, if required.

You must be Educated to SCQF level 9, which includes a Degree or equivalent, e.g. BA Childhood Practice or PDA Childhood Practice or a relevant teaching qualification (SCQF level 9) within the first period of registration. You must also be qualified to HNC  / SVQ3 Early Learning and Childcare or equivalent (SCQF level 7).
Registration with SSSC at manager level (SCQF 9) (or achieve and maintain registration within 6 months of taking up post) is essential.

You must possess excellent leadership skills, demonstrate the ability to manage additional responsibilities, have extensive team working experience and be able to provide an efficient and effective service.
Extensive experience of statutory early years provision is essential, as well as significant knowledge of Curriculum for Excellence, Pre-Birth to Three and GIRFEC – national and local guidance.
Relevant knowledge of a broad and balanced understanding of children and childhoods is essential.
Experience in the development and implementation of plans and programmes for service users is required as well as excellent planning and organisation skills.
Significant experience of working with parents and families and report writing is essential, as well as excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
You should possess good IT skills and demonstrate the ability to negotiate and influence.
Before confirming appointment, you will be required to obtain Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme Membership through Disclosure Scotland for working with children.
For further information, please contact: Jill McArthur onext 493932 or email

title: ES4116 - Teacher of Pupil Support
description: Falkirk Council is seeking to recruit class teachers who are highly skilled practitioners, committed to delivering the very best learning and teaching experiences for our children and young people.

The key policy document for Falkirk schools is Learning to Achieve. This was co-created by headteachers, teachers, early years practitioners, support staff, parents/carers, pupils and other partners. It sets out clearly our expectations for our class teachers,  namely that they are practitioners who demonstrate commitment to meeting the needs of all learners by:
• being proactive in seeking professional learning opportunities that further enhance their skills and knowledge
• adopting flexible, creative approaches to meet the needs of all learners
• using current educational thinking to inform their practice
• making good use of professional collaboration in school and beyond
• be fully registered with the General Teaching Council, Scotland (GTCS)
• be able to demonstrate that they possess the commitment, knowledge and skills outlined in the Standard for Full Registration
Applicants for a permanent post, who progress to the next stage of the recruitment process, will be invited to participate in a classroom observation and attend a formal interview.
Applicants are encouraged to be explicit in detailing their skills, experience and attributes that they can bring to this post.
If you are the successful candidate, you will be required to gain/maintain PVG scheme membership

title: Teacher FIF12939
description: Interview Date: week commencing Monday 18 February 2019
Before applying for this job, it is important that you read the Applicant Guidance by clicking on this
link and the attached Job Pack. These explain the job role and the type of person we are looking for. The main terms and conditions  of employment are also available via the above link.

As a member of the school community, the role of the teacher is to lead learning for, and with, all learners with whom they engage and also to work with and support the development of colleagues and other partners and work to the benefit of the pupils, their  parents and the community the school serves, through pursuing the objectives and implementing policies set by the Headteacher and Fife Council Education Children’s service, under the overall direction of the Executive Director of Education and Children’s Services.

Before confirming appointment, you will be required to be registered with the General Teaching Council (GTCS) and obtain Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme Membership through Disclosure Scotland.

You will be required to provide contact details of at least two referees on the application form that cover your employment or academic history for the past 3 years. Depending on your circumstances you may be asked to provide more than 2 references.

You shall be accountable to the Headteacher/Senior Leadership Team and Education and Children’s Services and for the following list of duties and for such other duties as can reasonably be attached to the post. In carrying out these duties you will be responsible  for:
Having knowledge and understanding of the nature of the curriculum and its development
Having knowledge and understanding of the relevant area(s) of pre-school, primary or secondary curriculum
Having knowledge and understanding of planning coherent and progressive teaching programmes
Having knowledge and understanding of contexts for learning to fulfil their responsibilities in literacy, numeracy, health and wellbeing and interdisciplinary learning
Having knowledge and understanding of the principles of assessment, recording and reporting
Planning coherent, progressive and stimulating teaching programmes which match learners’ needs and abilities
Communicating effectively and interact productively with learners, individually and collectively
Employing a range of teaching strategies and resources to meet the needs and abilities of learners
Having high expectations of all learners
Creating a safe, caring and purposeful learning environment
Developing positive relationships and positive behaviour strategies
Using assessment, recording and reporting as an integral part of the teaching process to support and enhance learning.

Fife Council is looking to recruit a talented and committed teacher who is willing to apply new learning with enthusiasm.  They should be confident and able to demonstrate they are an innovative practitioner. They should have a sound and detailed knowledge  and understanding of the relevant aspects of the Curriculum for Excellence 3-18 as well as possessing strong interpersonal skills and be able to demonstrate they have a commitment to the vision, values and core priorities in the development of education, teaching  and learning which meets the needs of all pupils.

Whilst demonstrating these competencies, in Fife Council our How We Work Matters’ framework is at the heart of our local authority. Our teachers will be responsible for being a role model by displaying and promoting behaviours that are expected of all council  employees:
For further information please contact: David Green - or

title: Graduate Engineer FIF12816
description: Working Location: Based at Bankhead Central but working Fife Wide
The job pack for this vacancy is attached at the bottom of the page. It provides more detailed information about the job and the type of person we are looking for.
All employees are expected to display and promote certain behaviours in the workplace. Our ‘How We Work Matters’ behaviour framework contains more information and is available via this link.

The role involves you working within the Roads & Lighting Contracts team within Roads & Transportation Services based in Bankhead Central, Glenrothes.

You will assist in the planning, design, contract specification and implementation of a wide and varied nature of primarily road orientated projects. You will be expected to work collectively and individually on the delivery of these projects.

Although a high level of mental agility is evidently required, this work will also be physically demanding at times as it will require site work such as inspections and construction supervision.  This may include working adjacent to live traffic, in inclement  weather and lone working.
Educated to SCQF level 10, which includes an Honours Degree or equivalent preferably in Civil Engineering.

You will have good communication skills and be able to transfer these in different circumstances e.g. dealing with members of the public. You should be a good team player as well as being able to work alone and unsupervised at times. IT skills are relevant  to the role.
You will have some understanding of the role of a Civil Engineer in the public sector and a desire to pursue a career in this field including progression to professional qualification.
You should be able to work as part of a team or on your own as required.
Mark Dewar, Service Manager, Roads & Lighting Contracts -

title: Community Occupational Therapist 4 Posts Including 3 Temporary
description: We are a high performing service and Council, as evidenced in our Care Inspectorate, HMIe inspections, Best Value Audit of Community Planning and national awards recognition. We are committed to innovative and highly personalised approaches.

If successful you could be joining one of our teams based either in Cumbernauld or Wishaw. Wherever you are, you will be central to our assessment and care management services with a lead responsibility for the provision and promotion of independent living,  consistent with National, Council and Service policies, procedures and practice. You will contribute to the development and implementation of relevant statutory plans, including Service policies and procedures, and liaise with other services, agencies, service  users and carers to contribute to the identification of need.  You will also undertake assessment and planning with people affected by/living with ill health, disability, long term conditions and general ageing to provide profession specific information, advice  and interventions.
In return we can offer you a positive professional working experience with a commitment to continuous professional development, including access to senior practitioner status.

Possession of a BSc in Occupational Therapy or Diploma in Occupational Therapy and registration with the Health and Care Professions Council are essential. In addition, you must have experience of care planning for individuals’ and managing a case load in a  range of settings working with people with disabilities and experience of multi disciplinary/multi agency working.  A sound knowledge of medical conditions and understanding of the social model of disability and ability to maintain a professional manner at  all times and demonstrate anti discriminatory practice are also essential.
You will require to become a Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme member prior to commencing in this role.
Temporary posts are temporary for three months and may be subject to review.
Alternative Application Packs can be requested in other formats for example, Large Print, Braille, and Audio. To request an alternative Application Pack please phone.

title: Childcare Practitioner FIF12994
description: Fife Childcare services offers childcare to children and their families in their 60 out of school clubs based across Fife.

As a Childcare Practitioner you will be working with primary school aged children.  You will facilitate high quality play and informal learning experiences for children and at the same time have great opportunities for personal learning and development.

Ideally, you will hold an SVQ III in Playwork or HNC in Childcare and Education or HNC in Childhood Practice, but if you do not hold these currently then you can be considered if you have the recent relevant experience and are willing to work towards a recognised  qualification.

You should have a minimum of 3 Standard Grades at credit level 1/2, to include English and Maths or 3 Intermediate 2’s, to include Maths and English or equivalent Core Skills at SCQF level 5 OR 3 National 5s, to include English and Maths.
Previous experience can be considered as equivalent see SCQF Framework
Before confirming appointment, you will be required to obtain Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme Membership through Disclosure Scotland
Workers new to role must gain registration with the Scottish Social Services Council (SSSC) within six months of start date in this role and maintain registration throughout the period of employment.

You will work as a member of the team, supporting the delivery of a broad variety of informal learning opportunities through play and leisure activities for children and young people aged between 4 and 12 years, taking account of Getting it Right First for  Every Child (GIRFEC) principles and the Well-being Indicators: Safe, Healthy, Achieving, Nurtured, Active, Respected, Responsible, Included (SHANARRI).   As part of this job role the post holder will be expected to hold or work towards an SVQ Level 3 in Social  Services (Children and Young People).
You will have an appreciation of a childcare service and knowledge of the support and tasks undertaken by a Childcare Practitioner.
In Fife Council How We Work Matters and you will be responsible for being a role model by displaying and promoting behaviours that are expected of all Council employees:
Contact Details for vacancy: Irene Roberts onor Email

Assist the Administrative Assistant with all aspects of the day to day running of the office. You will have an individual responsibility for keeping  up to date with changes in procedures and technology.

Fife Council pays the Scottish Local Government Living Wage Rate to employees earning less than £8.75 per hour. If the hourly rate of pay for the post is less than the Scottish Local Government Living Wage Rate a supplement will be paid.
4 Standard Grades (Grade level 3) or equivalent including English and Mathematics.
Previous experience within an administrative environment.
Before confirming appointment, you will be required to obtain Protection of Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme Membership through Disclosure Scotland
This post is subject to a disclosure check which will be undertaken by Disclosure Scotland.

Under the direction and supervision of the Admin Assistant or Senior member of staff, you may be required to undertake any of the following tasks which may be delegated to Clerical Assistants. It is not intended as a complete list of tasks that a Clerical  Assistant could perform, nor is it intended that a single Clerical Assistant would be able to take on all these tasks.

         Provide clerical support under the supervision of the Admin Assistant in the operational aspect of establishment/office activities and issues, such as:  photocopying, producing professional office documents including letters, memos, notices, spreadsheets,  minutes etc.
         Provide an efficient clerical/banking service in respect of trips, uniforms, etc.
         Record and maintain accurate records of outgoing mail on daily basis
         Assist in the maintenance of efficient office systems to enable prompt retrieval of data, completion of returns, as required
         Assist in the operational aspects of the recruitment and selection process in relation to the Council’s guidelines, as directed by the Admin Co-ordinator.
         Ensure that staff supply cover is arranged by assisting in the processing of requests through the supply messaging system.

title: Track Cycle Coach BMX
description: Glasgow Life is the charity responsible for inspiring Glasgow’s citizens and visitors to lead richer and more active lives through culture, sport and learning.  We believe in the transformational power of the services we provide for the citizens of and visitors  to the City of Glasgow.

As the BMX coach of the new BMX Facility you will require to have your Level 2 BMX Certificate in Coaching Cycling (Qualified by 31st January 2019) , you will also require to have previous experience working within a cycling environment such as planning  and delivering fun and safe sessions to a variety of audiences, good customer service skills and excellent communication skills.  Your ability to work on a flexible shift pattern, including evening and weekend working is essential as well as being peripatetic  and able to work in locations across the city.

Following the success of Glasgow European Championships in 2018, Glasgow Life will welcome a host of world class events in the coming years including; European Indoor Athletics Championships 2019, LEN European Short Course Swimming Championships 2019, World  Men’s Curling Championship 2020 and UEFA Euro 2020.  This is in addition to the wealth of events on offer throughout the year, with the annual programme including the World Pipe Band Championships, Glasgow Mela, HSBC Let’s Ride and the Merchant City Festival  amongst many others.

We offer a range of employee benefits such as an opportunity to join the Strathclyde Pension Fund, generous holiday entitlement, annual leave purchase scheme, childcare vouchers, staff discounts (including Glasgow Club), flexible retirement, family friendly  policies, flu vaccination programme and career break policy…just to name a few!
At Glasgow Life we value diversity and inclusion.  We are particularly interested in receiving applications from BAME groups who are currently under-represented in our organisation.
Membership of the Protection of Vulnerable Groups Scheme will be essential on taking up appointment.

description: Applications are invited for the post of a full-time maingrade educational psychologist to join Stirling’s Educational Psychology Service (EPS). The post provides an opportunity to become part of a creative team who are  integral to the Children’s Service and who work closely with families, schools, partners and the local authority in securing better outcomes for Stirling’s children and young people. The successful applicant will have a key role along with team members in  promoting evidence based practice, with a focus on early intervention and prevention. The post holder will be a motivated and reflective practitioner, contributing creativity and psychological knowledge and skills to drive forward local and national priorities  in raising attainment and closing the poverty related attainment gap for Stirling's children and young people. The service is currently leading on key priorities within Stirling Council such as whole school nurturing approaches, improving mental health and  wellbeing, PEEP, video interactive guidance and action research at a local and national level. The service collaborates with a range of partners and with young people to improve outcomes.

When an employee has a negative balance on starting, the following action will take place:

If the employee has commenced from another Scottish Local Authority, they will have received a balancing payment through that Local Authority’s leaver payment. In these circumstances, the negative balance should be recovered as quickly as possible.

If the employee has commenced and has not joined from another Scottish Local Authority, the negative balance should be spread equally amongst the remaining months of the year.  We will inform any employee in this situation before pay day advising them of  how the negative balance will be recovered.

title: Social Worker Family Placement and Adoption Team - 181 Whitletts Road Ayr SOA03983
description: An opportunity exists for an experienced, motivated and qualified social worker to join our Family Placement and Adoption Team.

If you have a strong commitment to delivering quality services and promoting the best possible outcomes for children and young people then we would like to hear from you. You should have a minimum of 2 years post qualifying experience within a statutory  Children and Families setting and evidence your ability and understanding, in practice, of child development, trauma, abuse and recovery. Additionally, you should be able to demonstrate your knowledge of the role, responsibilities and needs of a range of carers  within a Family Placement setting.

The successful applicant will work as part of the Family Placement and Adoption Team with a focus on recruitment, assessment, and support to foster carers, adopters and kinship carers. You will work in partnership with a range of carers and associated services  in meeting the needs of Looked After and Accommodated children and young people.

As part of this role, you will undertake comprehensive Form F assessments of potential Foster Carers and Adopters in line with Council Policy and Procedure. You will participate in the recruitment and training of potential carers. You will also ensure that  all carers are supported, supervised and trained to a level required to undertake their roles and responsibilities.

You should have an understanding of key legislation and standards and apply this in line with our duties and responsibilities under the Children and Young People (Scotland) Act 2014, Adoption and Children (Scotland) Act 2007 and the Looked After Children  (Scotland) Regulations 2009.
As part of our continued commitment to Service Improvement and your professional development opportunities will be provided to support you in this role through training, supervision and CPD.

description: Nationwide Recruitment Service NRS - is looking for an inspirational financial or management accountant.
This may suit someone who has been a Finance Manager / Financial Accountant / company accountant or similar.

Due to the nature of the work you shoud have an accountancy qualification or degree, happy to be involved with all of the accounts production, sales reporting, reconciliation work and day to day running of the business.

You will be enthusiastic about your work, strong numbers person, excellent business acumen, with passion and drive to succeed and generate income for the business. This may suit someone who has been an Accountant/ Finance Manager/ Company Accountant / financial  accountant / management accountant/ cost accountant, managed a team of non accountants and assisted to run a business.

You will be self motivated and willing to deal with all aspects of running the business. So it is important you are flexible and be proactive as well as reactive.

title: Customer Consultant Llandaff
description: Based in our branch network, our Customer Consultants are at the heart of our business. You will be a friendly face for our customers in branch and pride yourself on maintaining an excellent level of customer service!

We need hard working and energetic people to take on a busy and varied role - building strong relationships with our customers, understanding their needs and providing them with information to choose the right products for them
Reporting into your Branch Manager and working closely with the Senior Customer Consultants, you will be responsible for:
Achieving the right customer outcome whilst adhering to our service standards
Deal with all customer enquiries efficiently.
Have focused conversations with customers to identify their needs for savings, insurance and protection products
Process customer transactions and identify mortgage and investment needs and referring to specialist colleagues

We are looking for enthusiastic, ambitious and customer focussed people with a proven record of success in a retail or customer focussed environment, ideally within financial services. You should have experience of face to face sales and service and ensuring  your customers are happy. You must be able to pass a credit and criminal record check.

It’s official! We’re a Great Place to Work! We are delighted to announce that in our first year of participating, we have been named one of the best workplaces in the UK in the large category on the Best Workplaces™ list for 2018.

With 53 branches and 18 agencies across Wales and the borders, Principality is the 6th largest Building Society in the UK. As a mutual society, we’re owned by and run for the benefit of our 500,000 members.

It’s an exciting time to join us as we’re currently on a Group wide transformational journey that will see our brand, technology, colleague and customer offerings updated and enhanced to really put Principality on the map and make us a brand and employer  of choice within Wales and beyond. This is supported by our recent sponsorship of the iconic Principality Stadium which has put us on a global stage.

Steve Hughes, CEO, said: “Principality is a unique organisation. We are big enough to have large ambition, but small enough to value, respect and engage everyone as individuals. Our colleagues live and work in the communities they serve and have developed  a strong connection with them. We strive to be an inclusive business with colleagues who are passionate about doing the right thing for Members.

As a business, Principality is keen to recruit talented individuals who are interested in joining a company in which they can really make a difference. Although the Society has been established for nearly 160 years, we pride ourselves on a progressive culture,  which encourages its employees to thrive.

Our culture is renowned for being friendly, open and inclusive where we actively encourage everyone to bring themselves to work. Our people are our most important asset and make us stand out in the finance sector. They're the driving force behind our success  and we're committed to creating and maintaining a great place to work

As well as a great working environment with a strong family feel and plenty of opportunities for development and growth, you can expect a generous package that includes pension, bonus and incentive schemes, free life assurance cover, critical illness protection,  private healthcare and the option to buy extra holiday each year. You can also be a part of our Sports & Social club which gives our colleagues access to discounted theatre, sporting and family events and to top it all off, we always have tickets up for grabs  for the latest events at Principality Stadium.

As Principality colleagues, we want you to walk a mile in our customer’s shoes. This is why we provide all staff with £100 to open a savings account at your local branch to really feel a part of our core business. £100 also grants you voting rights at the  Principality Annual General Meeting.
For more information about our Reward & Benefits, visit

title: Head of Retail
description: Brewster McBride are looking for a Head of Retail for a successful FMCG retail business in South Yorkshire. Managing a network of 20 stores across the country you will be able to have a real impact on driving sales and work with enthusiastic committed Store  and Retail Area Managers. You must have previous experience of working as a Retail Area Manager for an FMCG Retailer.
Reporting into the board of Directors you will manage 3 Reatil Area Managers your role will be;
To Assist in the redesign and stocking of the stores
Set sales targets for all the areas and stores you manage
Ensure all operational aspects of the stores are managed properly
Maximising sales and profitability across all stores
Providing a supportive environment for Area Managers and Store Managers and staff
Assisting in recruiting new team members
Training and development of area managers
You must be an experienced of being a Head of Retail for a national business
You must be hands on enthusiastic and sales driven
Ideally you will have experience of working in a specialist FMCG retail market.
This is an exciting opportunity to make an instant impact on a growing and changing retail business where you will work with like-minded driven retail specialists
Salary circa £65,000 - £80,000 + car or allowance + Bonus + further benefits package

Brewster McBride Search & Selection is a division of the Brewster Partners Recruitment Group focusing on the recruitment of executive talent. Please visit our website at www.brewstermcbride.co.uk for more details about how we may be able to assist you in  your job search.

title: Finance Manager
description: are currently recruiting on behalf of an exciting and ambitious client of ours, to recruit a permanent
The client is looking for a
Establish and maintain robust controls, accounting policies and best practice within the finance team.
Manage the day to day of the team.
Own the month end process, including preparation & presentation of monthly management pack to FD, ensuring the highest levels of integrity & accuracy are maintained.
Provide insight & understanding into business performance through detailed variance analysis taking ownership of any work-streams that arise.
Manage outsourced payroll provider to ensure accuracy of monthly payroll & PAYE.
Manage outsourced accountants in delivery of year-end financial reports.
Business owner for Sage accounting software.
Own monthly balance sheet recs, quarterly VAT returns.
Reconcile bank accounts, supplier invoices, expenses claims & intercompany transactions.
Ad-hoc analysis to enhance stakeholder understanding of the financials.
Lead ad-hoc finance projects as required.
Fully Qualified Accountant (ACA,ACCA,CIMA) - Newly Qualified or 1-2 years PQE.
Strong and positive mindset to work through challenges and inspire other team members.
Experience in Sage is an advantage but not essential.
Highly organised and able to demonstrate excellent attention to detail, working to a high level of accuracy.
Highly numerate and ability to work to tight deadlines.
Willing to adapt to changing priorities, and flexible enough to respond to the demands of a growing and non-hierarchical organisation.
Excellent English written and oral communication skills.
Free yearly parking paid for by the company.

title: Accountant
description: Nationwide Recruitment Service NRS - is looking for an inspirational financial or management accountant/ company a. Ointment finance manager to work in the Birmingham office. HR/ Recruitment/ sales and marketing experience, is useful but unnecessary; being  able to produce accounts and be responsible for ledger and reporting is essential!

This service sector business is varied and interesting; due to the nature of the work you will have an accountancy qualification or degree, experience of running a service sector business and happy to be involved with all of the accounts production, sales  reporting, reconciliation work and day to day running of the business.
You will be enthusiastic about your work, strong numbers person, excellent business acumen, with passion and drive to succeed and generate income for the business.

This may suit someone who has been an Accountant/ Finance Manager/ Company Accountant / financial accountant / management accountant/ cost accountant, managed a team of non accountants and assisted to run a business.
You will be a go-getter, with entrepreneurial flare and the gravitas to liaise with clients and ensure the smooth accurate running of the business.
You will be an excellent user of excel spreadsheets and accounting packages. You should be able to do pivots what ifs and look ups on excel.

You will be excellent on producing presentations and be able to use Microsoft / PowerPoint etc. You should be able to produce and deliver accounting and associates business presentations to our clients.

The role is a hands on, stand alone, autonomous role, varied and interesting. Wholly responsible for all of the company accounts, reconciliations, budgets, sales order processing, cost accounting, accounts receivables, accounts payable and financial reporting.
You will be self motivated and willing to deal with all aspects of running the business. So it is important you are flexible and be proactive as well as reactive.

title: Customer Management Agent
description: As a Customer Management Agent, you will effectively manage interactions with customers experiencing financial difficulty to identify the most effective solution for both the customer and the Society/Nemo.

Responsible for ensuring interactions with customers, the Customer Management Agent will communicate with customers over the telephone and by writing ensuring consistently fair outcomes. This will be achieved by fully understanding customer individual circumstances  through fact finding, providing an appropriate level of support and implementing forbearance where suitable

The successful candidate will need to identify indications of potential or actual vulnerability and provide the right level of assistance whilst complying with any applicable procedural or regulatory requirements.
Reporting into your Customer Services Manager, you will:
Provide excellent customer service to both internal and external customers with the primary focus on fair customer outcomes
To agree and negotiate solutions with customers in order to bring mortgage arears up to date, making commercial decisions within mandate, where necessary
Working with the team to ensure daily administrative tasks are actioned within agreed timescales and to required standards
Complete all tasks in adherence with approved process manuals and within internal Service Standards and regulatory timescales
Work with the rest of the Customer Service teams and other key stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve the customer journey
Understanding of the UK mortgage market and the financial services regulatory system
Competent in use of MS Office
Working within a customer facing regulated financial services environment
Good verbal communication skills and the ability to talk to customers in a clear and articulate manner
Demonstrable experience of building and maintaining effective relationships
A track record of being able to consistently provide fair customer outcomes
Able to communicate effectively at all levels
Able to build rapport with all levels within the organisation

title: Data Analyst
description: Cambridge Assessment is Europe's largest educational assessment agency, responsible for delivering qualifications to more than 8 million learners across the globe.

Our assessments need mature data architecture to support end-to-end processes, and we are building the Data Architecture capability in our Architecture team. We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to play a major part in this work.

The Data Analyst will be our expert on recording the data analysis for our complex application landscape to support continual data integration, data analytics and support the architecture team with all aspects of data analysis as part of project activities  and Cambridge Assessment Data and Analytics Strategy initiatives.

This brand new position provides a unique opportunity for a highly motivated self-starter, who will relish the opportunity to make a significant personal impact in a high profile team with challenging priorities. You will be able to build strong collaborative  working relationships to enhance your profile across the business whilst having responsibility for data analysis to support strategic projects and initiatives.
Working as part of a team: Design and document data solutions that meet functional & non-functional requirements as part of Project Delivery
Evaluation & analysis of requirements, help with development of functional specifications and test strategies. Support for users, developers and functional consultants during the project lifecycle.
Collaborate with others to keep data models and data flows up to date and available for auditors and business.
Support the architecture team to capture Risks, Issues, Assumptions and dependencies around data designs and work with stakeholders to mitigate.
STEM degree or relevant industry experience.
Demonstrate strong skills in problems solving methods and evidencing solutions
In-depth knowledge of how to communicate and visualise data
Strong data modelling skills – both relational and dimensional
Knowledge of foundational information management disciplines, such as Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Architecture, and Data Integration.
Understanding of how to work with data and share data in a responsible and secure way
Excellent communication skills, ability to translate technical terminology to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work on a number of projects simultaneously to tight deadlines
Knowledge / experience of data modelling, creating a database schema from a logical or physical models
Experience of turning functional specifications and change requests into technical specifications
Knowledge / experience of data life cycles, data governance, data privacy frameworks
Experience of project life cycles – ability to work within an agile team or to work to a Waterfall or Prince II project plan
Experience with Tableau, Power BI, SAS, SSRS
Experience with Big Data analytics platforms like Hadoop/HIVE and Cloud solutions for data analytics

Cambridge Assessment is Europe's largest assessment group, incorporating three major awarding bodies. It plays a leading role in researching, developing and delivering assessment to eight million candidates in 170 countries every year. The Group is a department  of the University of Cambridge and a not-for-profit organisation.
This is an excellent opportunity to join a market leader and be rewarded with valuable learning opportunities, a competitive salary and benefits.
In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive package of benefits to help with your life both inside and outside of work:
28 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
Annual performance related bonus and increases (discretionary)
Enhanced maternity/paternity pay and childcare voucher scheme
Employee discount and cash back scheme at 2,500 retailers
Discounted access to the University of Cambridge Sport Centre, along with various other local gyms

We know that diversity of thinking, backgrounds and approaches leads to innovation and creates an atmosphere where everyone’s contribution is valued. As well as wanting to create diverse teams, we also value diversity in the way our people approach their  work. Work/life balance is important to us at Cambridge Assessment and we offer our colleagues a range of flexible working options according to the needs of the business and the individual, so please let us know of any flexible working requirements when applying  and we can see how we can support you.
The closing date for receipt of applications is 12/02/2019
and interviews will be held on the following week

If you’re successful at interview stage we will ask you to undergo background screening (carried out by Credence Background Screening Ltd), to ensure that all information provided to us is accurate. We wish you all the very best with your application.
CAMBRIDGE ASSESSMENT IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITIES EMPLOYER

title: Adults Senior Social Care Assistant - Royal Surrey County Hospital - Guildford
description: £25,821 per annum for 36 hours per week, based at Royal Surrey County Hospital, Egerton Road, Guildford, GU2 7XX.

From flexible working to job sharing (where possible) we are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. A laptop and mobile will be supplied if applicable to your role. You will benefit from 24 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’  service (pro-rata for part-time staff), a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey  County Council staff.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

We are a very busy social care team working in an acute hospital setting. We work closely with other health professionals to identify person centred services and support to ensure safe discharges back home or to residential or nursing placements for people  aged over 18.
You will be part of a team and will have access to direction, support and supervision from a qualified professional.

You will undertake assessments for patients on the ward, or in A&E, and work in partnership with individuals, their carers and professional staff in order to support vulnerable adults and their families to identify and arrange services that meet their needs  and promote independence, choice and control.

You will have a caseload and work with individuals who need additional support or guidance in order to identify their needs, or where best interest decisions need to be made on their behalf. You will have a sound knowledge of the Mental Capacity Act. You  will be involved in supporting safeguarding investigations and attending safeguarding meetings with the support of qualified practitioners.

As a Senior Social Care Assistants will have substantial experience of working directly with people with social care needs. You will be confident and competent in working with people with a variety of physical and cognitive impairments. There may be times  when you may need to visit patients in the community,
You will need to have competent basic IT skills and be able and willing to learn to use a variety of software systems.

You may work with any combination, or all, of the following care groups: older people, people with physical, sensory, cognitive impairments, people with a learning disability and people with mental health problems.
Please refer to the attached job description when making your application.
This job advert closes at 23:59 on 25th February 2019.
All short-listed applicants will be required to complete an IT assessment as part of the interview process.

Please do not apply if you have been unsuccessful at interview stage previously for this role for any team across Adult Social Care in Surrey County Council as your application will not be considered for 2 months from your interview date.

title: Adults Assistant Team Manager - Frimley Park Hospital, Camberley
description: £44,229 per annum for 36 hours per week with Frimley Park Hospital Adult Social Care Team, Portsmouth Road, Camberley. GU16 7UJ.

From flexible working to job sharing (where possible) we are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. A laptop and mobile will be supplied if applicable to your role. You will benefit from 24 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’  service, a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role
This is an exciting opportunity to work with our integrated Hospital and Community Team, promoting choice and control which is at the heart of everything we do.

We are looking for an Assistant Team Manager, who will be able to demonstrate a high level of understanding and commitment to the personalisation agenda, and be able to demonstrate an applied knowledge of Adult Social Care legislation including the Mental  Capacity Act and the NHS Continuing Healthcare National Framework.

They will be an excellent communicator and demonstrate the skills and ability to manage and support the day to day running of a busy, dynamic team effectively prioritising daily challenges and expectations. They will be confident in making sound decisions  that respond flexibly and quickly to changing needs that arise in a high pressure acute hospital environment. You will be able to develop effective partnership relationships with individuals, carers and families and positive relationships with professional  health staff both within and outside the hospital.

You will work within Frimley Park Hospital supporting the team manager to promote timely, safe and effective hospital discharges. You will continue to support people following hospital discharge for the completion of assessments and deliver high quality  personalised adult social care.

You must have significant post qualification experience, including some management experience in a social care setting, and be able to demonstrate good understanding of both the health and social care agendas. A key accountability of the role is developing  staff practice and therefore applicants must be able demonstrate evidence of providing effective professional supervision to less experienced colleagues.

You must also be able to demonstrate an applied and effective knowledge of safeguarding vulnerable adults’ procedures and be able to evidence this. You will have an understanding and commitment to supporting carers and a demonstrable commitment to providing  management that supports and promotes Surrey County Council’s equality and diversity policy.

Applicants must hold a professional social work, occupational therapy, nursing or other relevant allied health qualification, have completed any post qualification practice or training requirements and have current professional registration with their relevant  registration authority.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.

You will need to have competent IT skills and be able and willing to learn to use a variety of software systems. All short-listed applicants will be required to complete a basic IT skills test as part of the interview process.

Applicants will need to have the willingness and ability to travel across Surrey in accordance with the demands of the work and the job profile. Therefore a full UK driving licence is essential as well as access to a motor vehicle.
We look forward to receiving your CV application and personal statement.
For more information please find attached to the bottom of this advert a full job profile.
The job advert closes at 23:59 on 3rd March 2019.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.
Kickstart your career in health and social care
Are you looking to start a career in health and social care but not quite sure where to begin? Did you know you can get paid whilst you work and study as an apprentice?

The Surrey Heath Health and Adult Social Care team are looking to recruit apprentices to join our team in Spring 2019. Join us as a Reablement Assistant and experience first-hand what it’s like to work in a number of settings and gain a national qualification.

This is an exciting opportunity for you to work in Health and Adult Social Care and assist people to maintain basic needs and achieve the highest levels of independence with daily living skills. The role includes spending time in social care, out in the  community an in hospitals.
Spend time in social care, the community and in hospitals
Gain on the job experience whilst working towards an accredited qualification
Learn how to support individuals with their day to day activities and tasks
Promote physical and mental health and wellbeing
Maintain accurate records of the care and service provided
Learn how to preform clinical tasks e.g. taking blood pressure levels

You will be fully supported throughout the apprenticeship with a view to achieve a nationally recognised qualification (Adult Care Worker Level 2). Your mentor will help you to develop the skills necessary to carry out your day-to-day duties.
All you need is a caring and compassionate attitude with a willingness to learn. Experience of working in health and social care would be desired but it is not essential.

The apprenticeship programme is delivered in partnership by Virgin Care Services and Adult Social Care, Surrey County Council. The role is split equally across both organisations with candidates working on a rotational basis within the Surrey Heath area  in Community Services and Adult Social Care.

title: Adult Learning Tutor - Surrey Wide
description: Great opportunities to teach for Surrey Adult Learning.

Surrey Adult Learning employs up to 300 part time tutors to deliver learning for adults.  The role is focussed on teaching, inspiring and supporting adult learners to successfully complete their course/qualification.

We offer a wide range of courses including English, maths, Arts & Crafts, EFL, Languages, Humanities, Cookery, Exercise, Dance, Work Skills & IT and ESOL.  In addition we have specific courses run by our Supported Learning, Family Learning, Outreach and  Passport to Wellbeing teams.

We can offer you an hourly rate of £20.44 to £24.52 per hour, plus 14% or 16% annual leave entitlement dependent on length of service with Surrey County Council. This rate includes preparation time and travelling. We also offer many other benefits such as  a local government salary-related pension and an annual training programme offering continual learning where applicable.

This is a zero hours (bank) contract. The amount of work you are offered will depend on the number and type of courses scheduled. A typical course could run over one, two, or three terms for up to two hours per week (day and/or evening classes) as well as  occasional Saturday workshops. Please note that in some cases courses might not be viable due to low enrolments and may be cancelled.

Classes run in the north and south west of Surrey and are based around seven main centres: Guildford, Camberley, Farnham , Woking , Esher Green, Sunbury and Molesey. Family Learning and Outreach courses are run across Surrey in schools and Community Centres.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check may be required for some roles.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

Tutors are required to have qualifications/expertise in their subject area as well as a teaching qualification (or be working towards one), such as the Level 3 award in Education & Training, and to have experience of teaching adults.
Please note, due to the number and variety of positions available, this advert is ongoing and applications will be considered upon receipt rather than the advert deadline.
*current experience of teaching the subject in a classroom is essential

Dance, T’ai Chi, Cookery – Other Countries (Camberley, Woking)
ESOL, maths, English, Cookery Early Years and Wellbeing, Cookery across Surrey in schools and children’s centres.

English, maths, Arts & Crafts, IT, Cookery and Wellbeing. A rewarding and exciting opportunity to work as a sessional tutor delivering Outreach courses in the community to vulnerable groups of adults involved with homeless hostels,  ex-service organisations, Job Centre Plus, Older People’s Community Mental Health teams, substance misuse and alcohol support.  You will receive additional support from your line manager.
Tutors required to teach adults with learning disabilities in the following subjects/areas (at Entry Level):
Arts & Crafts including Pottery, Mosaics and Gardening,
Travel Training & Personal Safety (Woking, Sunbury, Guildford).

title: Approved Mental Health Professional- Redhill
description: £39,270 per annum plus AMHP supplement of £1,500 per annum for working 36 hours per week, based with our East AMHP Team in Redhill, RH1 1TA.

From flexible working to job sharing (where possible) we are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. A laptop and mobile will be supplied if applicable to your role. You will benefit from 24 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’  service, a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.

Surrey County Council delivers high-quality care for service-users with mental health and substance misuse needs. We are leading the way in implementing new ways of working in personalisation, and a recovery-focused approach. Our goal is for customers to  be able to make informed choices about the services they use, be more in control of their care, and to become active citizens within their community.

Mental Health services are delivered through the integrated partnership of Surrey County Council and Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust. We currently have a vacancy in our AMHP team East based in Redhill for an Approved Mental Health Professional.  This posts offers exciting opportunities to help us provide a multi-disciplinary service, raise social work standards, and promote social inclusion within an integrated setting. We are looking for an enthusiastic qualified Approved Mental Health Professional  (AMHP) who will be responsible for undertaking statutory duties as part the Approved Mental Health Professional (AMHP) service covering east Surrey.

We will offer clear professional leadership and great opportunities to develop your career. You will have regular supervision, and be responsible for your own personal training in order to maintain up-to-date knowledge of mental health issues. To join us,  you should have a Professional Qualification in Social Work, and Approved Mental Health Professional (AMHP) status and post qualifying experience that should include direct work with those who have mental health needs. In addition to this, you should have  a working knowledge of legislation, assessments, preparation of care plans, monitoring and reviewing outcomes. You should also hold a current full driving licence and have use of a vehicle to undertake this role.
You must maintain your personal Approved Mental Health Professional status (Warranted) to be eligible for this role.
The role holder will need to have the willingness and ability to travel around the county to meet the demands of the role.

where possible, laptop and mobile supplied. 24 days annual leave, local government salary-related pension offered, discounted child care vouchers as well as the option to join the car lease scheme. For more information,  please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

You will need to be motivated and flexible with high professional standards and sound knowledge and experience of current legislation, including the Care Act, the Mental Capacity Act and the NHS Continuing Healthcare National Framework and its application  to practice in a social care setting.

title: Legal Support Officer - Kingston upon Thames
description: £19,875 per annum for 36 hours per week based at County Hall, Penrhyn Road, Kingston upon Thames KT1 2DN. This position is based inside one of our main area offices, click
of the building and surrounding area along with a view of the reception.

For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

Since April 2016 Surrey County Council Legal Services have been working in partnership with Brighton & Hove City Council, East Sussex County Council and West Sussex County Council as part of Orbis Public Law. The vision is to create ‘A single, resilient,  sustainable cost effective legal service with a public service ethos with an ability and ambition to grow’ This partnership creates one of the largest public sector legal services in the UK and presents unrivalled opportunities to share our knowledge, experience  and understanding across teams and Authorities.

Working in a busy open plan office this role requires you to work cooperatively as part of a team to deliver a seamless business support and administrative service to more than 45 lawyers in Surrey County Council’s legal department. The post is situated  in a sensitive and confidential legal environment and requires exceptional organisational and IT skills, the ability to prioritise work and to clear focus on meeting deadlines.

You will be expected to make straightforward decisions relating to your role and will be responsible for the production and management of Court litigation bundles which includes photocopying, updating and indexing evidence. You will be expected to meet strict  Court deadlines so ability to cope under pressure is essential. You will also need to liaise with Courts, other parties and agencies in relation to litigation bundles. You will provide secretarial support to lawyers e.g. typing correspondence, reports and  documents and answering telephone calls, and other some of your other duties will include maintaining information databases, administration work with regards to loaning and return of the county’s deeds and legal library subscriptions.

You will be responsible for opening files for lawyers and the physical retrieval and archiving of such files. Access to files and books are located on three different levels within County Hall. You will be required to organise, locate, retrieve, and lift  such materials and climb stepladders to access these. You will also handle incoming mail and answer the department’s reception telephone line.

title: Mental Health Support Worker - Surbiton
description: You will earn £16,419.00 – £17,491.76 per year for working 9am to 4.30pm Monday to Friday based at The Fircroft Trust, Fircroft, 96 Ditton Road, Surbiton, Surrey.
The position is full time (9am - 4.30pm) Monday to Friday with some out of hours working when required.

We are a small friendly local Charity which has been established for over 50 years. We provide a safe and calm environment in which clients living in the community can relax, find friendship and support on their road to recovery.

An opportunity has arisen to join our small dedicated team of support workers at our Resource Centre which provides support for people in the community with mental health issues and/or learning difficulties.

The people we support are at the heart of everything we do and deserve to be treated with respect, dignity and choice. Our main priority, therefore, is to find support workers with values, behaviours and attitudes to match our own.

You will be providing support for day to day living, such as social activities, training, finding employment,booking holidays etc. Supporting clients in the community to enable them to more easily manage their personal lives and sustain their independence.
Your duties will be varied and no two days will be the same.

We believe that a successful Support Worker doesn't always have experience, but shares our vision to ensure that 'every moment has potential' for the people we support to learn new skills and to achieve their goals.
A good standard of general education in numeracy and literacy as well as spoken English are a must.
A full clean driving licence would be an advantage
Flexibility and reliability are essential in this very varied position.
Be Passionate about the care of vulnerable people with various mental health/learning disability conditions and demonstrate empathy, kindness and patience when communicating with clients.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

Surrey Adult Learning delivers a wide range of daytime, evening and Saturday courses and learning opportunities for adults.  The provision includes leisure courses, like arts and crafts and languages; qualification courses such as GCSE’s in English and Maths;  classes which support those with learning difficulties and/or disabilities and classes aimed at parents/carers to help them support their children and improve their own skills.  Surrey Adult Learning has seven centres across North and South West Surrey and  is looking to appoint a Cafe Supervisor for its Camberley Centre.
The Cafe operates during the daytimes, providing a range of hot and cold drinks, food and snacks to a range of learners and Cafe users, and is seen as the welcoming hub of the Centre.

Applicants should have a strong customer service background, and proven experience serving and preparing food for the public.  Applicants should be able to demonstrate some knowledge of cash handling and banking procedures, and a working knowledge of good  health and safety practice in a kitchen environment.  A willingness to undertake a Food Hygiene Level 2 Certificate is an essential part of the role.
