title: Ceremonies Registrars- Bank Staff- Guildford and Leatherhead
description: As a bank worker, you will be engaged on a permanent, zero hours contract on the basis that your services will be required regularly on a long term basis. Any hours to be worked will be mutually agreed in advance with your manager.

The hourly rate will be £13.50 per hour which includes a 14% annual leave payment. Availability on weekends and bank holidays is essential, and weekdays is desirable. We are looking for individuals who are able to work from our
. Please state on your application when applying which location you have a preference for. You may be asked to travel to any of the register offices or licensed venues within Surrey.

You will benefit from 24 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’ service, a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can  take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.  Due to the nature of this role, annual leave will be paid as part of your normal salary.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.

The Surrey Registration Service are recruiting Ceremonies Registrars. You will have a professional appearance and a positive outlook to represent Surrey Registration Service at ceremonies. You will be personally involved with customers in both a professional  and sensitive manner at a life defining and emotional moments in their lives.
Previous ceremony experience would be beneficial but not essential as full training will be provided.

The role of Ceremonies Registrar is to register and/or conduct ceremonies at a register office located at Guildford, Leatherhead or Weybridge, or at licensed venues within the area.  There are approximately 120 licensed venues in Surrey.  You will ensure  that the ceremony can legally take place by asking specific questions prescribed in law, and that the legal vows are said correctly before recording the legal entry into the Marriage / Civil Partnership register.

The security of the marriage register, certificates and legal paperwork is paramount to this role and it is the responsibility of the Ceremonies Registrar to ensure that this documentation is kept secure at all times.

Registering at couple’s ceremonies is a wonderful job, however, we do have to stress that attention to detail and the ability to work under pressure is essential to this role, as you may have other ceremonies to attend that day, and there is only a short  amount of time to complete the registration.
You must also be able to deal with flash photography, and understand that your photograph may be taken and shared on social media, as you are part of a couple’s special day.

The Surrey Registration Service conducts approximately 4,000 civil ceremonies each year, the majority of these take place between the months of April - October, bank holiday weekends and Christmas/New Year, and so this is when you need to be available.   Within the first year, you will be trained to register marriages/civil partnerships; you may then be considered for further training to conduct ceremonies. Once this training is complete you will also be expected to be on a standby rota to cover sickness or  emergencies across Surrey.
You will need to have the willingness and ability to travel around the county to meet the demands of the role.
For more information please find attached a full job description and person specification.
We look forward to receiving your application.
The job advert closes at 23:59 on Sunday 24th February 2019.
– Initial group assessment centre on Tuesday 26th February (approx. 1 hour) at Weybridge Register Office.

Successful candidates from the group assessment centre will then be invited to attend a panel interview, to include a spelling and handwriting assessment on Thursday 28th February or Friday 1st March at Guildford Register Office.
Comprehensive training is provided across 5 days - 3 days technical training in a block, followed by 2 separate sessions of role plays and shadowing (you will be paid for this at your normal rate).
Training will begin mid-March with a view to candidates being operational by 1st April 2019.
Our values are what support our vision, shape the culture and are crucial in delivering our corporate strategy. For more information about our values and behaviours please follow this link.

title: Caterer- St Anne's Heath School - Virginia Water
description: This role is a 6 month fixed term contract.

£10,035.99 per annum for 25 hours per week, 38.4 weeks per year working 5 hours over the lunch time period, Monday to Friday, based at St Anne's Heath School Kitchen, Sandhills Lane, Virginia Water, Surrey, GU25 4DS

Local government salary-related pension offered, discounted child care vouchers as well as the option to join the car lease scheme. For more information, please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.
Do you have experience of working in catering?
Do you have the skills required to run a busy kitchen?
Need a position that fits in with school holidays? Then look no further as we have the right position for you!
Lead our friendly catering team at St Anne's Heath, where you can be at the forefront in providing healthy school lunches for the children.
We offer the opportunity for you to gain, build and develop your current supervisory and management skills, whilst offering further options to work towards a Level 3 qualification in Food Hygiene.
The ideal person for this position will have a great attitude to working in a team, experience of prepping, cooking and service of meals in addition to ordering supplies.
- Our St Anne's Heath Catering team consists of a Caterer and three Catering Assistants. Working collectively as one team they take pride in the quality of the food provided.
Our values are what support our vision, shape the culture and are crucial in delivering our corporate strategy. For more information about our values and behaviours please follow this link.

title: Team Manager
description: To manage the team providing functional, technical and operational aspects of the Solutions and Services delivered by IT to the business. To provide assistance with technical, functional and process related projects, operations, improvements and support  cases associated with core Business Systems including but not limited to SAP Retail, SAP WMS and bespoke business applications.
You will be repsonsible for project management nationally and internationally in compliance with international project rules.
Ensuring smooth, nationwide use and integration of standard international systems according to project / system overview
Overall responsibility for testing of the systems and processes in regard to changing regulatory requirements, together with national departments
Responsibility for specifications for system changes and coordinating with International IT / PO department on their implementation
Ensuring that those using the systems provided have the necessary skill levels
Managing between the technical team / technical equipment department / operations and other departments within the country
Applying, integrating and complying with the company standards.
Managing the members of the team including setting personal and business objectives for continuous improvement and development.
Ensuring system stability (availability) and quality (performance) in accordance with the administration guidelines
Experience of managing large scale, and multi-disciplined projects
Capable of working well under pressure
Proven track record of managing budgets
Capable of developing relationships at all levels
Team player with a positive attitude
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, along with good planning and organisational skills
Strong analytical skills and the ability to work effectively on your own and in a team environment
35 days holiday per annum (pro rata, including Bank Holidays)
10% discount on all Lidl products, in all stores throughout the UK
Access to corporate discounts on a range of products and services (including holidays, home and garden products, leisure activities and more)
Initial training and on-going development from an experienced team member
Brilliant opportunities to take on more responsibility and long-term career prospects

title: Warehouse Operative
description: At Lidl, we have over 700 stores that rely on the round-the-clock hard work of our warehouse teams to make sure they have all the products they need to sell to customers. As a warehouse operative, you’ll quickly become a dab-hand at the job once you’ve completed  your basic training. That’s because the core tasks of order picking, repacking and shipping our stock to stores remain the same every day of the year. The challenge comes from working quickly, listening to your headset, picking the right stock every time,  stacking it perfectly for deliveries and wrapping it tightly to be loaded onto the lorries. You’ll need to take pride in a job well done. Making sure the products arrive at our stores in perfect condition takes great concentration all the way through a demanding  shift.

Please note that as part of your application you will be asked to complete three online exercises taking less than 20 minutes, designed to provide us with a more in-depth understanding of you and your potential as a member of our team. Should you  be successful at this stage, someone from the recruitment team will get in touch to chat about your application over the phone and following this you may be invited to face to face interview.
Pick a variety of products including meat, wine, fruit, frozen and chilled items
Listen carefully to picking instructions through your headset and carry them out at pace
Make sure your deliveries are perfectly stacked and secure
Report any damaged items to your manager
Take responsibility for working through your orders independently
Help out in any team tasks, such as cleaning equipment and checking stock
Some experience of working in a fast-paced, target driven environment
Willingness to work with all different types of stock, in temperature-controlled areas
Good attention to detail when working quickly
Self-motivation to work hard and do everything to the best of your ability
Flexibility to work a range of different shift options, during the day or night

You will be well-rewarded for your work at Lidl. Not only will you be part of a secure, growing business, we’ll make sure you have quality training and progression opportunities if you want to develop a career with us. As well as your competitive hourly  rate, starting from £8.75 with the ability to earn up to £9.87 (*dependent on experience -
moving to £9.00 to £10.10 per hour after 1st March 2019
), you will also get 30 days’ holiday, a pension scheme, discount on our products and corporate discounts on holidays, days out, cinema tickets and plenty more.

title: Barista
description: At Caffè Nero, it’s our teams that make us special. That’s why we’re looking for warm, positive people who love working with others to come and join us.

We don’t ask for previous experience, because we give brilliant training. Whether that’s with our dedicated in-store Maestros, or our training team, you’ll soon know how to make everything from a flat white to a decaf soya latte.

When you join us, you’re joining a family - whether that’s your team, your regular customers or your local community. At the same time as giving fantastic service you’ll have loads of fun along the way, whether that’s at a pizza night, a Caffe Nero Club  party or even at the Barista of the Year event. There’s something for everyone.

Because we are passionate about making our teams feel valued, our benefits are pretty great too. Through Bean Box, you’ll have access to hundreds of discounts and freebies at the touch of a button. You might want cheap cinema tickets or savings at one of  your favourite brands – there’s so much choice!
On top of that we give our teams great employee discount (enhanced when you’re on shift); our pension scheme; life assurance and a range of flexible opt-in benefits.

If you have a great attitude, bags of energy, love interacting with customers, have the Right To Work in the UK and speak good English this could just the right job for you. As a part-time Barista you could work up to 30 hours a week, and as our stores are  open 7 days a week great flexibility is important.

title: Team Member - Night Reception
description: At Premier Inn, World class customer service matters 24/7. Accountable for keeping both our guests and our hotel building safe and secure, you’ll be the guardian of a great night’s sleep. This is a role with big and serious responsibilities. On duty between  11pm and 7am, you’ll work solo. You’ll take responsibility for everything from inspecting the hotel and making sure entry points are secure, through to checking in late arrivals with a warm welcome. If there’s an incident or a guest has any issue at all, you’ll  take care of it. And you’ll make sure the details are logged, so we can all learn from it.

You’ll bring proven experience of being responsible for people’s safety and security. We’ll expect you to demonstrate an understanding of health and safety, and of basic information technology. Comfortable working alone, you are organised yet flexible, calm  in a crisis, and good at solving problems. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll work hard for them. Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

At every venue in the Whitbread family, everyone is welcome. That goes for our customers, and it goes for our people too. Whatever level you start at, we’ll help you reach your full potential. You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit  from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.

title: Customer Assistant
description: The variety and pace that comes with every shift as a Customer Assistant at Lidl needs dedication and flexibility. Our stores are open Monday to Sunday so you’ll need to be able to work weekends, as well as weekday shifts. You’ll put in a shift as part of  the team to check and unpack deliveries, work on the tills, stock our shelves and, most importantly, help our customers. We’ll train you to be multi-skilled in the many different areas of the store and show you what it takes to keep a store running smoothly  – and once you’re up to speed you’ll be a vital part of ensuring every shift runs like clockwork.

Please note that as part of your application you will be asked to complete three online exercises taking less than 20 minutes, designed to provide us with a more in-depth understanding of you and your potential as a member of our team. Should you  be successful at this stage, someone from the recruitment team will get in touch to chat about your application over the phone and following this you may be invited to face to face interview.
Delivery arrived? You’ll start unpacking the stock.
Queue at the tills? You’ll jump on a spare one to help.
Notice a spillage? You’ll get the mop.
Customer can’t find the apples? You’ll leave what you’re doing to show them the way.
Bakery items popular today? You’ll get some more cooking in the oven.
Fruit and vegetables looking fresh? You’ll carry out regular quality checks
Some knowledge or experience of working in a fast-paced environment
The flexibility to start an early shift at 5am or finish a late shift at 11pm
The ability to react positively to changing priorities
The initiative to identify tasks that need to be completed
The drive to work hard and contribute to the success of your store
A friendly communication style with your team and customers.

You will be well-rewarded for your work at Lidl. Not only will you be part of a secure, growing business, we’ll make sure you have quality training and progression opportunities if you want to develop a career with us. As well as your competitive hourly  rate, starting from £8.75 with the ability to earn up to £9.87 (*dependent on experience -
moving to £9.00 to £10.10 per hour after 1st March 2019
), you will also get 30 days’ holiday (pro-rata), a pension scheme, discount on our products and corporate discounts on holidays, days out, cinema tickets and plenty more

title: Team Member - Bar/40016985
description: Beefeater is one of the UK’s best-loved and best-known restaurant brands. Customers love us because we’re ideal for any occasion - from a quick bite, to a celebration with friends or family. Serving up great food and warm welcomes every day, we’ve grown  to have restaurants all across the nation. We are proud to be part of the Whitbread family of brands. As the UK’s largest operator of hotels, restaurants and coffee shops, Whitbread makes everyday experiences special for millions of customers. And creates  excellent career opportunities for people like you.

You’ll be the friendly face of our establishment. But your important role is about much more than greeting and seating people with a smile. It’s about creating great memories. A warm welcome is just the beginning. You’ll make sure every moment - from noting  orders, to delivering drinks and dishes, and taking payment with a genuine ‘thank you’ - is timely, efficient and delivered with enthusiasm. Along the way, you’ll add the little touches that make a customer’s visit an experience to savour - like recommending  the perfect drink or side dish to complement a main course.

You don’t need previous experience to join us in this role. It’s all about what you can bring as a person. Comfortable and confident working at a fast pace, you take real pride in everything you do - from setting the table, to cleaning the bar. You’re a  skilled multi-tasker, and you’re always ready to adapt when priorities change. And you make sure you know our latest food and drinks menus inside-out. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll  work hard for them. Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.
Ready to make a difference for customers, colleagues and your career?

title: Graduate Account Excutive Brand Management £21K + £4,200 bonus, Gym, subsidised restaurant, Pension
description: The role is working for a newspaper group, which is the largest and most famous publisher in terms of digital, print, and across national and regional titles.
Full training is given by way of a 2 week (paid) training course and continual development thereafter.
Identify potential new Business Partnerships, with input from the Commercial team, to maximise revenues
Develop and deliver the strategic plan designed to maximise performance, within resource budget and achieve against sales/revenue targets
Increase the business partnership base through effective call management
Secure new business partnerships across the designated region
Managing client accounts, keeping in regular contact and making any relevant adjustments
Ensure that all activity and expenditure is assessed in terms of profitability
Liaise with Editor and editorial team regarding sponsorship of selected platform over the course of the partnership
Identify and develop persuasive business partnership campaigns in line with clients business goals
Responsible for all potential business as directed with the exclusion of existing main advertising clients
Complete regular customer service calls to existing Business Partnerships
Monitor editorial and social media opportunities to ensure clients receive full requirement over the course of the partnership
Monitor and report on all aspects of the Business Partnership function e.g. Sale, revenue and expenditure

Graduate 2.1 or above, ideally a candidate who has combined their studies, with extra curricular activities, i.e. Duke of Edinburgh Award, sports, Cancer Research. The Mirror newspaper continually promotes from within, which results in a happy, collaborative  working environment; therefore key, above academia is the requirement for a people person a real team player, who both clients and colleagues like.
Please email your CV and a daytime phone number.

title: Senior Technical Project Manager
description: As a Senior Project Manager within our Group Marketing Platform (GMP) programme you will be responsible for the implementation of the GMP within our largest source market, the United Kingdom & Ireland. The GMP, powered by a state of the art Big Data solution,  delivers personalised, multi-channel marketing communications to TUI’s customers in a timely and relevant manner.

At TUI, we never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.

TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. The Group umbrella consists of strong tour operators, 1,800 travel agencies and leading online portals, six airlines with more than 130 aircraft, over 300 hotels with 210,000 beds, twelve cruise  liners and countless incoming agencies in all major holiday destinations around the globe.  All this enables us to provide our 30 million customers with an unmatched holiday experience in 180 regions.

We are currently looking for a delivery focussed Senior Project Manager with experience of CRM and customer data related projects (ideally IBM Campaign/IBM Marketing Cloud or a leading competitor such as Exact Target or Neolane plus data warehousing/BI/Big  Data) to lead the implementation of our new multi-channel marketing platform across the UK & Ireland.  As a Senior Project Manager you will work closely with key stakeholders to produce and then manage implementation plans and schedules. This will involve  developing and maintaining a project plan to give visibility to timescales, resource requirements, key deliverables/milestones, risks and progress to date.

In partnership with the UK&I you will quantify and agree the success and quality criteria for the project deliverables, ensuring that the solutions meet the agreed business requirements. You will also control changes to project scope and ensure that impact  to the project and benefits is clearly understood and correctly authorised.

You should be experienced working within an agile environment, however, this is a role for a practical and pragmatic delivery focussed individual and not an agile theorist.  You will be responsible for managing all aspects of the rollout including both technology  and business-focussed tasks
As a Senior Project Manager you will work with stakeholders to get agreement on the prioritisation of requirements and detailed scope to help drive our platform to the next level
Minimum of 10 years experience of project managing large and difficult projects
Self-starter and proactive – able to drive through issues to resolution
Experience of managing and delivering projects in an agile environment
Excellent communicator with good influencing skills and the ability to make yourself understood to a wide range of staff including staff based offshore
Experience working with documentation and workflow tools such as Confluence and Jira.
Experience of managing remote development groups or third parties.
Proven decision making ability – excellent commercial judgement
Able to understand technical concepts and communicate to technical and non-technical audiences
Work will require travel – including some overseas travel (primarily the Netherlands).

TUI Travel’s vision is to make travel experiences special. To fulfil this vision, we never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to  creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.

is one of the world’s leading leisure travel groups, with over 220 trusted brands in 180 countries and more than 30 million customers.  Help make our customers smile and in return you’ll be exceptionally rewarded with competitive  salary, pension scheme, additional benefits include holiday, flight and foreign exchange discounts, a childcare voucher scheme and free annual travel insurance*
Please visit our website for more information.
To apply for this role, please log on to where you will be required to log-in, provide personal details and complete an online application form.

title: Graduate Marketing Exec (Trainee role)
description: Trainee Account Exec - £ 20,500 with another £4K in Christmas Bonus and commission
Fantastic Graduate Sales Opportunity within the magazine industry.
This is the number 1 magazine company in the UK, chances are, you have been buying their magazines for years.
Now is the chance to join their online division.

Through company growth and being part of a blue chip International organisation, this online website is currently expanding their sales team and looking for high calibre individuals to work across the following specialist interest sectors; music, fashion,  auto-motive and equestrian.
As well as learning how to pitch the website at the relevant marketing managers you will also be given the opportunity to progress your career into sales management.

You can really plot your career here, the promotional opportunities are both structured and transparent, i.e you start off your career at entry level, next promotion is senior sales, after that you become Assistant Advertising Manager, then Ad Manager, Group  Ad Manager, culminating in Magazine Publisher, where you will have responsibility for the entire magazine, both advertising and editorial content. It’s certainly an achievement, as to salary, well a good Publisher in today’s market place would expect to earn  in excess of £100,000.

Full training is given, in fact the training at this company is award winning and an industry standard, you don’t need experience but you do need to be a self starter, team player, have bags of enthusiasm with an entrepreneurial outlook, an appetite for  the social side of the media industry is also a bit plus.
Key Responsibilities for the Online Sales Executive:
- Carry out direct marketing and sales activities in order to maintain and develop sales of online products
- Promote and sell the services to potential clients and arrange sales meetings where necessary
- Account Management - upgrade, cross sell and build relationships with existing clients
- Plan and prioritise sales activities in order to achieve personal targets
- Compose sales proposals for potential clients
- Work closely with the senior business development managers and sales managers to help develop the sales services and products
Please send your CV over to be considered for the March 2019 intake, if we think you are suitable we will send a job spec and arrange an interview.

title: Graduate Account Excutive Brand Management £21K + £4,200 bonus, Gym, subsidised restaurant, Pension
description: The role is working for a newspaper group, which is the largest and most famous publisher in terms of digital, print, and across national and regional titles.
Full training is given by way of a 2 week (paid) training course and continual development thereafter.
Identify potential new Business Partnerships, with input from the Commercial team, to maximise revenues
Develop and deliver the strategic plan designed to maximise performance, within resource budget and achieve against sales/revenue targets

Secure new business partnerships across the designated region
Managing client accounts, keeping in regular contact and making any relevant adjustments
Ensure that all activity and expenditure is assessed in terms of profitability
Liaise with Editor and editorial team regarding sponsorship of selected platform over the course of the partnership
Identify and develop persuasive business partnership campaigns in line with clients business goals
Responsible for all potential business as directed with the exclusion of existing main advertising clients
Complete regular customer service calls to existing Business Partnerships
Monitor editorial and social media opportunities to ensure clients receive full requirement over the course of the partnership
Monitor and report on all aspects of the Business Partnership function e.g. Sale, revenue and expenditure

Graduate 2.1 or above, ideally a candidate who has combined their studies, with extra curricular activities, i.e. Duke of Edinburgh Award, sports, Cancer Research. The Mirror newspaper continually promotes from within, which results in a happy, collaborative  working environment; therefore key, above academia is the requirement for a people person a real team player, who both clients and colleagues like.
Please email your CV and a daytime phone number.

title: Barista
description: As a Barista, naturally you'll be serving expertly crafted coffee, but at Costa there's more to the role than that. Born of dedication, passion and pride, you'll deliver a coffee shop experience that is full of warmth, charm and community spirit. The kind of  experience that will make customers smile and colleagues inspired.

Inspiring the world to love great coffee and never serving a dull cup, doesn't just happen. It takes a little crafting, testing and fine-tuning. That's why you'll need a zest for life and a passion for customer service. Your flexible approach will see you turn  your hand to a multitude of tasks, whether it's making irresistible coffee, maintaining stock or encouraging customer feedback. While your willingness to learn, personable approach and ability to read our customers will have you delivering coffee experiences  that are simply unbeatable.

Costa offers a wide range of benefits and schemes that can help you to save money, and there’s something for everyone. Bring us an enthusiastic, reliable and confident approach, plus a genuine interest in our business, and in return we'll offer you;
• Starting wage of £7.83 per hour (£8.83 in London & Most Airports) rising with training.
• Full and part time flexible hours available.
• 50% off food and drink in the store while you are on shift.
• 25% to 50% discount across the Whitbread Group.
• Access to a wide range of shopping discounts via our Costa Perks website.
• Various incentives including a team member reward programme.
• Plus and a whole lot of opportunity to develop and progress.
*Independent survey of 5000 people published in December 2016 by Allegra Strategies. For further details see

title: Shift Manager
description: As a Shift Manager, you’ll be responsible for the store when you’re running a shift in the absence of the Store Manager and Deputy Store Manager. Supervising a team of Customer Assistants, ensuring store processes run like clockwork and keeping an eye on  targets – it's a job that'll keep you on your toes. Hands-on and proactive, you'll be a natural at delegating tasks, boosting performance and satisfying customers. We'll give you all the responsibility you need to prove yourself as an adaptable leader - and  plenty of challenges to keep your career growing too.
Supervise your store in the absence of the Store Manager and Deputy Store Manager, taking responsibility for day-to-day operations
Keep on top of inventory and stock volumes, manage cash and oversee the rota to ensure shifts run smoothly
Lead and motivate your team, delegating as needed and solving problems swiftly
Follow company processes to maintain your store’s performance
Keep everything tidy and clean, on the shop floor and behind the scenes
Experience of leading a team to achieve targets in a fast paced environment
The ability to effectively delegate tasks and motivate a team
A customer-focused manner, remaining level-headed in any situation
Willingness to work as a key part of the store team, completing daily tasks on every shift
A responsible approach to holding the store keys and managing the tills

You'll be well rewarded as a key player in the Lidl team. As well as being part of a strong, fast-growing business, we'll make sure you have quality training and real opportunities to build your career. On top of your competitive salary, starting from £9.75  with the potential to earn up to £10.87, you'll get 30 days' holiday, a pension, discounts on all Lidl products and on a range of holidays, days out, cinema tickets and plenty more.

title: Office Coordinator
description: Our Communications and CSR department is one of the most dynamic here at Lidl GB and we are looking for an experienced Office Manager to join this fast paced team.

The department is made up of Corporate Communications, Consumer Communications, Social Media community management, Internal Communications, and CSR, with all teams working to promote and protect the company’s reputation and enhancing its responsible business  practices.

This is an ideal role for a positive and enthusiastic team player who thrives in a busy environment. You will support the Head of Department and wider teams with administrative tasks. As an exceptionally organised and dedicated member of the team, you will  take pride in maintaining the efficiency of this central function.
Office management duties including equipment / stationary management
Assisting the teams with new starter set ups
Strong communication skills both written and verbal
Advanced Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel skills required
A genuine passion for performing administrative tasks effectively, efficiently and to a high standard
The ability to work well in a team or on your own
The ability to multi-task and handle conflicting deadlines
Self-motivated with an eagerness to learn and develop
Previous experience in a secretarial, administrative or PA role would be advantageous
An additional 10% of your annual salary as a non-contractual London weighting benefit
30 days holiday per annum pro rata (including Bank Holidays) rising to 35 after 2 years’ service
10% discount on Lidl products, in all stores throughout the UK
Access to corporate discounts on a range of products and services (including holidays, home and garden products, leisure activities and more)
Initial training and on-going development from an experienced team member

title: Outdoor Education Worker - Richmond
description: £19,875 per annum pro rata. This is a six month fixed term contract commencing 1st April 2019.

The role will be primarily based at Thames Young Mariners Outdoor Education Centre. There is a requirement and opportunity to work at other Surrey Outdoor Learning and Development (SOLD) centres as required.

We are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. You will benefit from 24 days annual leave pro rata, rising to 28 days after 2 years’ service, a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme.  For more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.

We are looking for instructors who are experienced in delivering high quality outdoor learning experiences. You will be a skilled facilitator, able to adapt your style to work with a variety of different clients from primary school pupils through to youth  groups and graduate students. You will have knowledge in how outdoor learning can benefit all aspects of education and personal development.
Applicants should have previous centre experience and hold National Governing Body qualifications. A current first aid qualification is essential.
Applicants should hold at least one of the following awards:
British canoeing Paddlesport Instructor (as a minimum) or
Plus any of the following qualifications or in house qualifications relating to these activities.
A walking / expedition qualification: such as LEL/ML

Surrey Outdoor Learning and Development (SOLD) is a provider of high quality, outcome led, outdoor learning experiences.  We are committed to inspiring and engaging young people and adults, improving and enriching personal and social development and raising  achievement, success and aspirations in life.
See SOLD’s website for more information and a virtual tour of the individual centres, For more information please find attached to the bottom of this advert a full job profile.
The job advert closes at 23:59 on 1st March 2019.
Our values are what support our vision, shape the culture and are crucial in delivering our corporate strategy. For more information about our values and behaviours please follow this link.

title: Outdoor Education Worker Apprentice - Guildord, Dorking and Richmond
description: £11,117.40 per annum for 36 hours per week with Surrey Outdoor Learning and Development.

The apprenticeship will be Surrey wide and therefore it is essential for the role holder to be able to travel to all centres within Surrey. Our centres are located in Guildford, Mickleham (near Dorking) and Ham (near Richmond).
This is a 13 month fixed term contract.

We are committed to providing a healthy work life balance.  You will benefit from 24 days annual leave, rising to 28 days after 2 years’ service, a generous local government salary related pension, as well as the option to join our car lease scheme. For  more information about the wide variety of benefits you can take advantage of please visit MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all under represented groups.
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.
Are you passionate about the outdoors? Would you like to help people develop and grow using a range of outdoor activities such as climbing, paddling, walking or team building?
Then why not become an outdoor professional?!
Apprenticeships are now available to anyone over the age of 18, there is no age restriction. For individuals starting out on their career pathway or for those looking for a career change.

Surrey Outdoor Learning and Development offers a supportive environment with a comprehensive training package to learn new skills and provide opportunities to gain various national governing body (NGB) qualifications.

title: Specialist Speech and Language Therapist - Surreywide
description: £30,904 per annum (NHS Band 6 equivalent) for 36 hours per week, across 42 weeks of the year. The role is term time, plus an additional 15 days per year. You will have a Surrey base and work in schools.

All therapy staff are provided a laptop and mobile phone to allow flexible working. From flexible working to job sharing(where possible) we are committed to providing a healthy work life balance. You will benefit from a generous Local government salary-related  pension offered, discounted child care vouchers, and the option to join the car lease scheme. For more information, please visit
MyBenefits for Surrey County Council staff
An enhanced DBS ‘Disclosure and Barring Service’ check for regulated activity (formerly known as CRB) and the Children’s and Adults’ Barred List checks will be required for this role.
Our school-based SLT service is expanding! We are innovative, supportive, and outcome-focused, and have posts for
Specialist Speech and Language Therapists working in mainstream schools, and specialist centres in Surrey (NHS Band 6 equivalent).

The School-Aged Speech and Language Therapy Service is part of Surrey County Council’s local offer to support the Special Educational Needs and Disabilities of children and young people within mainstream schools and specialist provision. The Service is part  of the Vulnerable Learners Team in Surrey Children, Schools and Families Directorate, and as such works collaboratively with other teams such as educational psychology, learning and language support, REMA and Behaviour Support.

The main function and aim of the service is for children and young people in schools with speech, language and communication needs to receive the right support at the right time. This is achieved through assessment and intervention, equipping families and  professionals with the skills and resources to work together to help and support children with SLCN. We work with children and young people with EHCPs (Education, Health & Care Plan) and those at SEN (Special Education Needs) support. In order to achieve these  aims the service follows the ‘balance model’, offering universal, targeted and specialist support for families, the school environment, the school workforce, assessment and intervention

Within Surrey we work across the four geographical quadrants, each managed by a Quadrant Lead. The teams in each quadrant are made up of a skill mix of speech and language therapists and speech and language therapy assistants. We are offering four posts,  working in either:
Epsom & Ewell, Spelthorne, and Elmbridge (base: Fairmount House, Bull Hill, Leatherhead KT22 7AH)
Reigate & Banstead, Mole Valley, and Tandridge (base: Consort House, 5-7 Queensway, Redhill RH1 1YB)
Woking, Runnymede, and Surrey Heath (base: Quadrant Court, 35 Guildford Road, Woking GU22 7QQ)

This is a great opportunity to work across our mainstream and specialist centres teams. You would be responsible for working with the centre team to support the students and staff in these settings, working alongside and guiding any existing SLT  / SLTAs who work in the settings. In addition to working in the centre you would also have allocated time to work with students in the mainstream part of the school and other local mainstream schools.
Your main duties in the role of a Specialist Speech and Language Therapist will include but not be limited to:
Clinical decision making in conjunction with school staff around the level of support needed to achieve the best possible outcome for the children on your defined caseload.
Providing support, training and shadowing opportunities to more junior colleagues, and formally line managing a junior member of the team.
Working with speech and language therapy assistants, setting targets for the children and young people they are supporting, and monitoring of the delivery and outcomes of their work.
for this position your application will
2 years experience working as a Speech and Language Therapist
Experience in working with specialist settings or with specialist client groups, and appropriate formal and informal training in evidence based approaches used
Flexibility to adapt both clinical approach and communication style to ensure that therapy inputs and outcomes are functional and client centered
A BSc (Hons) degree or equivalent in Speech and Language Therapy
Registered membership of the Health and Care Professions Council
Registered membership of the Royal College of Speech and Language Therapists
For more information please find attached to the bottom of this advert a full job description and person specification.
The closing date for this advert is 23:59 on 25th February 2019, although we will be looking at applications as they come in and may shortlist in advance of closing date.

Surrey County Council is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults and expects all staff and volunteers to share this commitment.  We want to be an inclusive and diverse employer of first choice reflecting  the community we serve and particularly welcome applications from all underrepresented groups.

The Project Manager will be responsible for delivery of enterprise wide programmes and projects, ensuring that all change initiatives  meet business requirements and are handed over to business as usual teams as appropriate. The Programme Management Office team manages the firm's strategic programme of work; the resulting programmes and projects are broad in range and are likely to include  business process improvements, business transformation and systems and technology implementations and upgrades.

Pinsent Masons is an international law firm that ranks amongst the top 75 law firms globally, with a long-standing reputation for delivering high-quality legal advice rooted in its deep understanding of the sectors and geographies in which its clients operate.

We know that our culture sets us apart, and with over 1,500 lawyers operating from 24 locations throughout the UK, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa and the Middle East, it is at the heart of our success as a leading international law firm. title: Senior Inspector, Quality
description: REPORTS TO Team Lead / Associate Manager, Inspection

Working with one of the world's leading medical technology companies offering innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical equipment. Reporting directly to the Team Lead / Associate Manager, Inspection.

Under general supervision, the Quality Inspector will perform inspection and testing activities of product in the incoming receipt, manufacture, packaging and /or release of Medical Devices, ensuring product quality and throughput goals are met. Ensure compliance  to procedures and practices, at all times.
Working within the Inspection Team, you will be responsible for inspection related activities, specific to each sites' requirements, may include but not limited to the following,
* Perform dimensional and/or visual inspection to blueprint using gauges and other reliant inspection equipment
* Assess inspection methodology and initiate changes to improve processes and/or procedures.
* Assist in improvement projects to optimize inspection processes.
* Perform First Article Inspection (FAI) and verify FAI data (incl. statistical analysis) is acceptable.
* Read and inspect to blueprints and/or inspection guide sheets / instructions
* Perform Document Review, analyse, inspect and archive DHRs (paper-based and/or electronically) in compliance to GMP/GDP requirements prior to release to finished goods.
* Perform computer system transactions related to router inspections, etc.
* Segregate quarantine and complete documentation for non-conforming materials when necessary.
* Initiation and ownership of quarantine tickets (non-conformance reports)
* Assist in Quality investigations, provides input to correction resolution, rework, problem solving of issues, and process improvements, across multiple areas
* Perform product release disposition tasks in the ERP system
* Support and report on the achievement of Inspection Team KPI's
* Responsible for management and control of quarantined material.
* Support supplier investigations related to Quality issues
* Assist and support in the documentation, specification, standard form or Inspection Guide Sheet development process.
* Provide on the job support and guidance to other Inspectors as needed in accordance with any changes in product, process or cell staffing.
* Leaving Certificate /High School/Realschule Diploma or equivalent.
* Formal GD&T training (Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing) preferred.
* 5+ years of product inspection experience in an ISO 13485 / cGMP manufacturing environment.
* Experience in site specific specialised processes and technology preferable.
* Sustained performance in an ISO 13485 / cGMP manufacturing environment.
* Demonstrated performance in both quality and productivity.
* Demonstrated expertise in inspection methods/processes, e.g. CMM and/or OGP operation.
* Demonstrated ability to assist and support in the development process for document specifications and Inspection Guide Sheets.
* Demonstrated ability to read and interpret complex blueprints
* Demonstrated proficiency with Inspection Sampling Plans
* Demonstrated expertise in the use of all standard inspection tools including calipers, micrometers, height gages and comparators
* Demonstrated proficiency in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T)

* Demonstrated communication and interpersonal skills and the ability to work in a team-based environment that heavily emphasized quality, performance, cross-training, customer service and accountability
* Demonstarted strong initiative and contribution in correction resolution, and problem solving of issues
If you are interested and feel you have relevant experience then please contact Rosie Carden for a confidential discussion on .

description: Working with one of the world's leading medical technology companies offering innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical equipment. Reporting directly to the Logistics & Customs Team Leader.

description: IT Technical Specialist - Networks and Security.
IT Team. Welcome Break Support Centre
Competitive salary plus excellent benefits. Full Time.

We are currently recruiting for an IT Technical Specialist - Networks and Security. Welcome Break is an exciting, dynamic and successful organisation, managing Food, Retail, Hotels, Fuel and Gaming operations. Increasingly we’re using technology to drive  and grow the business. You will be an individual with the skills, experience and dynamism to work with our business and IT Dept to monitor, manage, support and improve the infrastructure on which our key technologies depend, in order to help us to significantly  grow our sales and profits.
This role will manage & improve Welcome Break’s -
Security systems and suppliers (firewalls, proxies, VPNs, monitoring systems, services and suppliers).
Keep abreast of wider industry developments in networking and security and the wider technical space, providing input to technical strategy development as well as tactical improvements.

Deliver key network and security projects, including wireless implementations, WAN upgrades, traffic optimisation solutions.
Provide support to a range of business and technical IT projects.

Work with wider business teams to ensure Welcome Break remain compliant in areas such as PCI and GDPR

Be responsible for the management of network and security suppliers (account reviews, incident response, etc) and network and security projects, focused on new / enhanced security systems, network improvements, wireless network implementation, comms room  improvement.
Provide reporting on network and security health.
Provide expert level support for networking and security problems.
Ensure the smooth transition of network and security changes into BAU support including documentation and training.
Support the implementation of business / technical projects including travel to various locations around the UK.
Form part of the technical on-call support rota.
To make it as an IT Technical Specialist, you’ll need to have:
Excellent analytic skills - is able to evaluate information effectively.
Excellent technical analysis problem solving skills.
The ability to work well under pressure
A focus on deliver and proactivity
The ability to challenge at all levels
Network and security experience in a multi-site / head office environment.
General skills in supporting Windows 7/10, Windows Server 2003/8/12,16 Citrix XenApp, Microsoft SQL Server 2000/5/8/12, Office 365.
Deep technical knowledge of networking architecture - LAN’s, WAN’s, Wireless, including VRRP, HSRP, VLANs, ACLs.
Deep technical knowledge of security architecture - firewalls, IPS, proxies, site to site and client VPNs, web & email filtering.
Experience of working in a formally compliant security environment (eg ISO 27001, PCI).
Experience of cloud & mobile worker security approaches (including BYOD)
Experienced IT network and security specialist in a comparable multi-site business ideally from a Retail / Hospitality / Leisure background.
Educated to (IT) degree level or relevant technical qualifications

title: Fleet Technical Stores Manager (Ship/Sea based)
description: Ever thought of taking your logistics and supply chain experience to sea? Be part of a specialist technical team and have a big role to play in the running of our iconic uxury cruise ships. Gain new skills in an excellent working environment.

As a market leader in the cruise industry, we operate spectacular ships all over the world. Join us as a Technical Stores Manager and you will understand that working at sea is more than just a job: it’s a way of life. You will be responsible for the day  to day management of the Technical Stores team, providing an efficient and effective stores service to the Technical and Deck departments. Meanwhile, you will visit different places, explore new worlds and gain experiences that stay with you for a lifetime.
To apply for the Technical Stores Manager role you will need:
- A strong background in logistics preferably within a large, complex environment;
- Knowledge of working with technical stores parts;
- Experience of managing a small team;
- Excellent communication skills, with experience of negotiating with external suppliers;
Experience at sea is desirable, but not essential. We believe in hiring people with the right attitudes and strengths over their competencies.

In addition to a strong logistics/inventory management background, you will have maintained appropriate stock levels and managed stock order planning and asset management. You will be comfortable liaising with supply chain regarding ordering parts and deliveries  as well as senior management in order to manager your team effectively, whilst maintaining and monitoring your respective budgets.

You will be self-motivated and dependable, and always keen to take on more work whilst helping those around you. You will be a strong communicator, keen to ask questions and sharing knowledge, and able to easily adapt your style to suit the situation.
If this sounds like you, we would love to hear from you.

'Better together’ is one of Carnival UK’s core values. This means we are working hard to build a flexible and inclusive culture. As part of our culture difference is valued and our people can be themselves. We welcome applications from everyone because inclusivity  is at the heart of everything we do. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, gender, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, marriage & civil partnership and pregnancy & maternity.
Carnival UK is the operating company for P&O Cruises and Cunard. We provide unforgettable holiday happiness and operate a winning culture to achieve standout success.

Our Cunard ships have been defining sophisticated ocean travel for over 175 years. Our ships are known as The Most Famous Ocean Liners in the World. We continue our legacy with Queen Mary 2, Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth. Our flagship, Queen Mary 2,  provides the only regularly scheduled transatlantic service between Southampton and New York. In 2022 our 4th Queen will join our Cunard fleet.

P&O Cruises have seven ships, including our flagship Britannia which joined our fleet in March 2015. Our two new ships, the largest in the UK market, will join the fleet in 2020 and 2022. We offer experiences tailored towards British tastes by combining  genuine service, a sense of occasion and attention to detail. We ensure all passengers have the holiday of a lifetime, every time.

It takes great passion and real dedication to maintain our position at the top. That’s why people are at the heart of our journey delivering the highest standards to our valued customers. With support to help you reach your potential, attractive company  benefits and incredible employee offers on discounted cruises we want your career with us to be successful and fun. Join us on our journey, apply now.

Their continued growth is due to their high levels of repeat business, framework agreements  providing several years of roll outs across the UK, diversification into new sectors, award winning projects giving them the recognition and exposure across the built environment that they deserve and referrals. title: Scrub Practitioner - Orthopaedics
description: The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest private hospitals, where we pride ourselves on our values, and putting the patient at the heart of everything we do.
We have an exciting opportunity for an Orthopaedic Scrub
Practitioner to join our Theatres team, based at The London Clinic main hospital site in London (W1G 6BW).

Established in 1932, The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest independently owned non-profit hospitals, with state-of-the-art facilities located on Harley Street. We have circa 1200 employees, a total of 8 premises, and we are dedicated to providing  the best, personalised healthcare with a breadth of surgical and medical expertise.

Our main hospital spans 8 floors comprising of 234 beds and 10 theatres, including a Hybrid theatre and two minimally invasive and day surgery theatres. Specialist areas include, General surgery; ENT; Gynaecology; Hepatobiliary; Neuro-spinal; Ophthalmic;  Orthopaedic; Plastic and reconstructive; Robotic; Urology; Vascular & Weight loss surgery (bariatric surgery).

As part of the multidisciplinary team you will support in the management and organisation of care provision within the operating department, responsible for the delivery of the highest standards of care and services.
Shift: Mixed Shifts - Early / Late inc. Weekends & On-call rota.
Benefits: Private Medical Healthcare, Pension Scheme (total annual contribution up to
17%), 25 day’s annual leave, Life Assurance, discounted gym membership and a season ticket loan for your travel, plus much more.

As a scrub practitioner you will undertake all activities in a professional and proficient manner, including mandatory surgical checks prior to the start of the procedure, during and pre wound closure.
Carry out scrub duties according to policies and procedures, contributing to quality improvement, and promoting best evidence based practice.
Assemble, check, prepare, and coordinate the use of surgical equipment, drugs and consumables for a wide range of operative procedures.
Act in the circulating role, and assist in the safe transfer and positioning of the patient.
Promote a patient focused approach to care in collaboration with all relevant healthcare professionals.
Registered Practitioner with NMC or HCPC registration.
Proven experience in an operating theatre environment with relevant experience in orthopaedic, scrub procedures.
General scrub & circulating skills, with experience of applying clinical reasoning skills across a varied patient case mix.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in sensitive and challenging situations.
Highly motivated individual who has a friendly disposition, and the ability to work as part of a team.
The London Clinic has an excellent clinical training and practice development department and strongly supports continuing professional development and education.
Join a supportive and warm working culture, where your contribution is valued,
and you can help us deliver our three core values: Caring, Inspiring and Pioneering.

title: Oncology Docter
description: Oncology Clinical Fellow - ST3 to ST8 Level
The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest private hospitals, where we pride ourselves on our values, and putting the patient at the heart of everything we do.

We have an exciting opportunity for an Oncology Clinical Fellow to join our state of the art facility located at The London Clinic’s Duchess of Devonshire Wing (Cancer Centre), in London (W1G 6JA). Our consultants are leaders in their respective  fields; almost all hold NHS teaching posts, which makes this an excellent opportunity to develop your skills and form part of a dedicated and forward-thinking team.

The London Clinic is one of the UK’s largest independently owned non-profit hospital, and we have been providing exceptional care since 1932. We have 8 premises, where we perform highly complex procedures as well as routine surgery and medicine.

Our main hospital spans 8 floors comprising of 234 beds and 10 theatres, and The Duchess of Devonshire Wing which is our award-winning cancer centre specially designed for patients receiving cancer treatment. The facility also has 8 floors, which includes  state-of-the-art radiotherapy, chemotherapy suites and 47 dedicated patient bedrooms.
The London Clinic won the award of International Cancer Centre of the Year at this year’s IMTJ Medical Travel Awards.

The Oncology Clinical Fellow will help us treat thousands of patients using cutting-edge technology and a progressive approach to care. You’ll work across inpatient and outpatient acute oncology wards, as well as Radiotherapy Services, building your expertise  at the heart of a superb team.
Job Type: Full-time, 12 month fixed term contract with the option to extend annually
Shifts: Variable shifts; Monday to Sunday. Days: 8am to 6:30pm & Nights: 6pm to 8:30am.
Salary: £60,000 - £70,000 plus comprehensive benefits package & support with bench fees.
Benefits: Private Medical Healthcare, Pension Scheme (total contribution up to 17%), 25 days
annual leave plus bank holidays, Life Assurance, discounted gym membership and a season ticket travel loan.

Responsible for the clinical care and supervision of Oncology inpatients and outpatients (Chemotherapy and Radiotherapy) in conjunction with the Consultants and multidisciplinary team, including rewriting of drug charts, writing up TTOs etc.
Work closely with the Consultants and nursing staff to support patient treatments and management of symptom control, as appropriate.
Support management of acute oncological conditions including neutropenia sepsis, treatment related toxicities and other oncological emergencies.
Participate on daily ward rounds and unit meetings, as well as ensuring all records are efficiently and accurately maintained and utilised, for reporting and audit procedures.
Attend to emergencies and urgent requests from the Senior Nursing Staff in the absence of the admitting Consultant and to be part of the Acute Oncology Steering Group.
Assist the Haematology fellows which may include participation in weekend and out of hours cover, liaising with the Consultant Haematologist.
Support on Level 3 Outpatients ward with go-aheads for Outpatients Chemotherapy when necessary.
Full GMC Registration with License to Practice
MBBS Degree or equivalent, and an MRCP or equivalent is desirable.
Medical and/or Surgical Oncology experience to ST3 and above in a multi-specialist hospital. Experience at Specialist Registrar level is desirable.
Ability to assess and manage patients presenting with acute oncological symptoms, as well as performing all routine clinical procedures including; Intravenous cannulation & Emergency CPR
Effective communication and clinical decision making skills, with the ability to form strong relationships with patients, colleagues and consultants.
Highly self-motivated, confident, articulate, diplomatic and tactful.
Join a supportive and warm working culture, where your contribution is valued,
and you can help us deliver our three core values: Caring, Inspiring and Pioneering.

The Manufacturing Engineering Manager will lead his/her team, working with supply chain, product development and across the business to ensure quality products and components meeting clearly defined standards are supplied to the production  process.

Responsible for installation, maintenance and improvement of production lines, managing contractors and ensuring that Health, Safety and Environmental requirements are adhered to Implement and manage continuous improvement principals by highlighting deficiencies  and recommending changes in training, working practices and processes.
Ensure BOM accuracy to enable the production process to produce the correct variant and the right time.
Aid in the creation of the overall work flow and build operations.
Identify improvements to the builds that drive ease of assembly, improve quality, reduce cost and drive business efficiencies
Ability to collate, digest and present data effectively to aid in Continuous Improvement Programs
Relevant manufacturing/engineering degree is preferred, or HND, BTec Professional Level 5 Award or equivalent NVQ Level 5 qualifications Or equivalent Electronics Degree

In depth knowledge and experience of Design Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (DFMEA), Failure Mode and Effect Analysis (FMEA), Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP), Production Part Approval Process (PPAP), and Lean Manufacturing techniques. Six Sigma  desirable
Enthusiasm for the job with a strong desire to learn and improve.
Strong working knowledge of 2D and 3D CAD

title: Accounts / Finance Manager - Flexi-Working Hours Potential
description: Up to £40,000 onsite parking, generous holiday and potential for flexible hours
We are a close knit and informal creative company offering a relaxed working environment that is driven by self-management and self-motivation. We are now looking to hire an experienced Accounts /

Finance Manager who wants to join like-minded individuals and grow with us. If you have relevant experience and are 100% focused on tight and efficient financial management then we want to hear from you.

As a company, our most important goal is to find the right personal fit for the people we hire. You might have a recognised financial qualification which will open up the full scope of this role. However, we also welcome applications from non-qualified accounts  professionals who have an inherent skill and talent for business finance, and who can still help us reach our end goals with the additional assistance of qualified third party suppliers. In either case, you will have proven experience as a Finance Manager  or Controller. Group accounting experience would also be highly beneficial.
The full scope of the role includes:

The preparation of timely, accurate Monthly Management and other Financial Information for the Directors of the Company. You will lead the Finance function and take responsibility for the financial control and transaction processing within the Group. You will  also be required to work closely with the senior management team on ad hoc projects. Your regular responsibilities will include:
- Developing financial strategy, including risk minimisation plans and opportunity forecasting
- Develop budgets and financial plans for the company based on research and data reports
- Review all financial plans and budgets regularly to look for efficiency opportunities
- Create monthly and annual reports to identify results, trends, and financial forecasts
- Work closely with the management team to share reports and analysis findings
- Improve efficiencies and reduce costs where possible across the business
- Preparation of company tax and accounts
- Ensure compliance with statutory law and financial regulations
- Manage cash flow by tracking transactions and regularly reviewing internal reports
- Ensure that all financial transactions are properly recorded, filed, and reported
- Maintain a strong focus on controls and processes
- Suggest updates and improvements for accounting systems, including payroll and invoicing
- Implement and manage systems to prevent errors in data collection and calculations
- Supervise and manage external suppliers involved in the financial function of the business

As a senior-level role you will have lots of responsibility. Ideally you will hold a related Degree qualification or be qualified by experience. You will also be fully AAT qualified and/or Part or Full ACCA, CIMA ICAEW or ACA qualified.
You will also need to have solid experience of managing the finance function for a busy and growing SME.

The skills that we see as essential for this role are: leadership; interpersonal skills; outstanding mathematical skills; honesty; integrity; reliability; solid written and verbal communication skills; high attention to detail; organisation; critical thinking  and problem-solving skills; research & analytical skills.
This is a full time role working five days per week. However, we can offer a flexible working arrangement, the details of which can be discussed and agreed.
Interested? Apply here for a fast-track path to the Hiring Manager

title: Learning Design Lead
description: Becoming a Learning Design Lead with Knowledgepool:

As a Learning Design Lead, you will lead and manage a team of learning designers in designing outstanding learner experiences in line with our client's needs and strategic objectives. You will also be hands on and work in partnership with other parts of  Capita Learning, associates and vendors to develop cutting edge learning solutions that are innovative and fit for purpose. This is a twelve months fixed term contract.
Provide direction, support and development in delivering performance excellence to a team of learning designers and digital content developers.
Oversee the teams learning design project plans, ensuring that the team consistently delivers high quality products, on time and within budget.
Ensure your design team and their skills are fully and appropriately utilised.
Consistently check efficiency and effectiveness of learning design and the portfolio to meet the requirements of Knowledgepool and our clients.
Share insight and expertise around suitable learning technologies and modalities that support blended delivery and drive innovation.
Further develop standardised and consistent approaches to design, assessment and evaluation.
Your experience and skills will include:
Demonstrable experience in learning design and with learning technologies.
Strong instructional design of face to face/instructor led materials.
Proven track record of translating customer requirements into clear, actionable goals and delivering excellent results.
Exposure to working across multiple projects and programmes, and to working with a variety of stakeholders.
Adept at managing competing and conflicting priorities.

Knowledgepool, part of Capita plc, is a leader in Learning and Development Transformation. Our expertise covers everything from strategic learning consultancy to managed learning services, curriculum design and training delivery to digital and competency  management. We also specialise in apprenticeships and pre-employment programmes. You'll be joining a team who are passionate about innovation and who take pride in making learning and training the best experience possible.

Knowledgepool are part of Capita Plc, the UK's leading provider of business process management and integrated professional support service solutions. Through quality solutions, tailored to our customers' needs, we've helped countless organisations unlock  value and maximise their potential. With access to our range of unique and diverse opportunities, offering real career advancement and progression, we can unlock your potential too.
At Capita, we believe an open, transparent working environment that encourages ingenuity and collaboration - with colleagues, customers and clients - is what makes us so effective at what we do.

As well as a generous basic salary, we also give you 23 day's holidays, company matched pension scheme and access to a variety of voluntary benefit options. These include a share save scheme, life assurance, holiday buy and many more designed to suit your  own personal lifestyle, such as retail, health & wellbeing and leisure discounts.

You'll be joining a network of some of the most experienced, innovative and dedicated people in the country - the opportunities to learn new skills, develop in your career and grow and as we grow are almost endless. Our mission is to help you realise your  potential - whatever that means to you.

title: Sales Advisor
description: At New Look we all stand by our brand values; keep it simple, be brave, think customer, act with pace and take responsibility- That’s the New Look way!

In 1969 New Look contributed to fast fashion and things are about to get even faster. We’re a team united with a clear purpose – to be the most loved and trusted high street retailer and bring some much needed fun back to the high street.

Every person makes New Look the incredible place it is to work, and together, we’re unstoppable. Within our buzzing environment all our talented people work hard but we ensure some fun is thrown in too!
Fashion is personal and we want everyone to celebrate self-expression, helping our customers to look good, feel great and express themselves with fashion.

At New Look we spend our days working to improve the way we do business , our only rule is that there are no rules and we want people who can make a difference, think big, think brave and aren’t afraid to make mistakes.

As a Sales Advisor with New Look, you will work with your Management team to implement the ultimate shopping experience for our customers, ensuring they are given the highest level of service and they want to return back to us. You will inspire our customers  look good and can express themselves with the latest fashion wherever and whenever they want. You will achieve by being an ambassador for brand on the shop floor putting our customers at the heart of everything you do.

Every single person makes New Look the incredible place it is, and together we’re unstoppable. You are someone who expresses your style your way with an eye for the latest trends who champions our customers to express their own unique style.

You will be passionate about service and your own development, seeking out innovative ways to improve your own performance with tailor made development plans from our Online Academy training and support from your Store Manager.

At New Look we take pride in career progression, offering internal promotions to candidates who are ready to step up the career ladder.  We also offer a huge staff discount of 40%, holiday days and access to our New Look Rewards which include some amazing  discounts across a number of different businesses.
Come join us and see it for yourself. You have to experience it to truly believe it.
We know that job descriptions do not always let your unique work history show- if you do not meet all of our requirements but you still think you’d be a great fit for this role… apply anyway!

title: Trainee Recruitment Consultant
description: If you are money motivated, driven by success and thrive in a fast paced, lively and competitive environment - Premier Group Recruitment want to hear from you!
Working with an exciting mix of clients within IT, Digital and Finance industries
Managing entire recruitment process from day one, including both candidate and client work
Sourcing and qualifying suitable candidates for roles via headhunting, advertising and networking

40% uncapped commission structure, with predicted first year earnings of between £35-45k
Office based directly opposite Liverpool St station

title: Company Secretary Assistant
description: 1 Year FTC with a view to permanency

An exciting opportunity for a candidate who can demonstrate a genuine desire to pursue ICSA qualification whilst working for an international FTSE 250 company. The role is based in Cambridge and will report to the Assistant Company Secretary and would be suited  to someone with a Law or Business degree along with experience of working within a corporate or legal environment.

You will assist in the successful delivery of two key company secretarial projects in a varied role which offers the opportunity to work with various departments across the Group. It will also provide the opportunity to develop knowledge of subsidiary governance  and to gain listed company experience.

You will be proactive, a key team member, and confident in liaising with colleagues at all levels of the business, in addition to demonstrating high standards of organisation and attention to detail. You will need to quickly develop an understanding of the  Group’s various businesses, key individuals and priorities.
For further information and a confidential discussion please contact Hollie Preston at Errington Legal Recruitment.

Errington Legal is a legal specialist recruiter covering Solicitor and Legal Support vacancies.
