description: Vanta Staffing are recruiting for a Courier Operations Clerk for our client based in Colnbrook. You will report directly to the transport manager.
Pick and Packing of Daily Stock Orders and processing via the right agent/driver
Using a keyboard to input addresses and correct details and weights and dimensional weights so must be 100% correct keying in with no Mistakes
Receiving and sending Courier Shipments through agents shipping systems using keyboard skills for entering on the computer when using the different courier programs.
Ensuring stock is kept in the correct locations and ensuring the warehouse is kept in good order for H & S
Helping other areas within the operations when required.
Administration tasks as and when requested
Ensuring all shipments are sent on the correct service method and job sheets are dealt with someday
Ensuring all shipments that arrive in from our drivers are sent out asap and on time and with the correct couriers
This position will be monitored on the following key results areas
Ability to deal with client account requests.
Working as part as a team
Vanta Staffing Limited is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: Graduate Sales Consultant Various Sectors!
description: With sales being one of the fastest growing sectors, there isn't a better time to kick start your career. With valuable experience as well as a tasty salary (£35K OTE in your first year, to be exact), what's not to like? We're working with a market-leading  sales company based in Central London who are looking to grow exponentially over the next year. They are aiming to continue expanding the team with money-hungry, sporty, and resilient graduates for their first intake of the year! With a sizeable investment  into training you really will become an expert in your chosen field! (Which could be almost anything e.g. Media/Tech/Education/Healthcare/Business Intelligence/Sport/Fashion and many more!)

The role will initially be business development; you will be bringing on new clients for the company to begin business with. When you consistently hit targets, you will be given more responsibility and your commission structure will continue to rise, the  accounts you bring on will then become your own and you will be in charging of managing them on a daily basis. Meaning more out of office duties such as client meetings and executive lunches!
£24,000 basic salary with uncapped commission structure.
Plenty of company-funded incentives such as: Nights out, days at the races and lunch clubs!
Monthly target-based incentives such as; Rolex targets, gift cards and even trips abroad!
Discounted gym membership to the onsite gym.
Tired of applying for countless roles and never hearing back? If you like the sound of this role then why not apply? Everyone will get a response within 2 days!

title: Mid-level Visual Designer UI
description: Commercial Team, Holborn, A15 & up to 10% bonus and benefits.

As a Mid-Level Visual Designer (UI), you will be an integral part of driving Premier Inn, Hub and other sub hotel brands success by shaping the visual design of our web-based platforms and native apps to ultimately drive brand awareness. You will take pride  in your work, installing the highest quality in all your output. With the support of Senior Designers, you will produce detailed documentation (specs) to support your work, accurately estimating timings. Collaboration is key, working with groups such as Product  and UX to ensure all briefs are robust and evidence based. This exciting role provides an environment that promotes development and be exposes you to the wider digital business.

We work in an inclusive environment, based in Holborn, London. With a non-corporate feel, the digital team is co-located, including engineers, designers, product, delivery, content, Q/A, marketing and brand. There are many interesting design challenges and  a great work culture.
Why we would like you to apply
You have Competent level skills in design software including - Sketch app, invision, CC suite.
You get excited by working in a collaborative environment, where you bring your colleagues and wider teams together. You have a problem-solving mentality when looking to form a robust brief.
Curious by nature you are confident in challenging ideas, whilst constantly thinking of new product feature enhancements and interaction improvements.
The idea of working for a brand that is straight forward, not too serious, genuine and committed stands out to you.

At Whitbread, we are fully committed to growing legendary brands through building a strong customer heartbeat and innovating to stay ahead.  Our winning teams delight customers, so they come back time and time again which, along with our focus on everyday  efficiency, drives profitable growth.

Every day our fantastic team members serve up great memories in our restaurants and wow guests through a great night’s sleep in our hotels. We pride ourselves on providing consistent quality and service. We’re continually innovating to meet our guests’ evolving  needs whilst being committed to creating a great place to work for our team members.

Premier Inn and hub by Premier Inn currently have over 750 hotels across the UK offering over 70,000 rooms.  Our aim is to make this 85,000 by the end of 2020!  We have hotels in the Middle East and having opened our 1st hotel in Germany with more sites  in the pipeline.

Our much loved restaurant brands include Beefeater, Brewers Fayre, Table Table and Whitbread Inns.  Alongside these, our new propositions Bar + Block and Cookhouse & Pub are both growing at pace.  We have over 420 restaurants across the UK offering the highest  level of service.

We have recently celebrated our 275th anniversary when Samuel Whitbread founded our business on a set of principles and although our core business has changed over the years we stay true these with our values:
- we strive to be the best at what we do
- we work hard for each other
We are excited about what the future holds and would love you to join us on this exciting journey!

title: Team Member - Night Reception/44521610
description: At Premier Inn, World class customer service matters 24/7. Accountable for keeping both our guests and our hotel building safe and secure, you’ll be the guardian of a great night’s sleep. This is a role with big and serious responsibilities. On duty between  11pm and 7am, you’ll work solo. You’ll take responsibility for everything from inspecting the hotel and making sure entry points are secure, through to checking in late arrivals with a warm welcome. If there’s an incident or a guest has any issue at all, you’ll  take care of it. And you’ll make sure the details are logged, so we can all learn from it.

You’ll bring proven experience of being responsible for people’s safety and security. We’ll expect you to demonstrate an understanding of health and safety, and of basic information technology. Comfortable working alone, you are organised yet flexible, calm  in a crisis, and good at solving problems. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll work hard for them. Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

At every venue in the Whitbread family, everyone is welcome. That goes for our customers, and it goes for our people too. Whatever level you start at, we’ll help you reach your full potential. You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit  from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.

title: Management Accountant, Chelmsford 30k-35k
description: I am recruiting on behalf of a growing company based in Chelmsford who are seeking a Management Accountant to join their growing finance team to oversee monies for the Payroll and Purchase ledger service.
You will need to have previous experience within a Management Accountant role and a proven finance background in which you are either full or part qualified and with AAT Level 4 as a minimum.
I am looking to speak with driven, motivated candidates who are ready for a new challenge, joining this forward thinking company as they continue to expand throughout 2019.

My client is passionate about what they do; providing an excellent service and striving for excellence and team work so the successful candidate will need to enjoy a challenge, want to work hard and be part of something great. This is a role in which you  can make a real difference to the wider community, so this would sit someone like minded to this vision.
Duties will be varied within this role and you will be responsible for two direct reports, so management experience within an Accounts team is essential.

On a daily and monthly basis you will be directly responsible for Accounting, monitoring and reviewing of incoming and outgoing monies and overseeing of reconciliations, KPI monitoring and the preparation of quarterly returns.

I have worked with this company for a number of years and can offer you a real insight into the company structure and ethos and discuss ultimately if this is a good move for you and your career goals.
For more information, and a confidential conversation, get in touch with me on the Huntress. Chelmsford branch number and ask to speak with Kate.
Difficult during the day? Send me an email with your CV and contact details and we can arrange a time to discuss this role at a time that best works for your working schedule.
Huntress Search Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of 'protected characteristics' as defined under the Equality Act and other relevant UK legislation.
Huntress Search Ltd acts as a Recruitment Agency in relation to all Permanent roles and as a Recruitment Business in relation to all Temporary roles.

title: TUI Retail Travel Advisor
description: Joining the TUI Retail Team as a Travel Advisor, we will help you become a destination expert so that you can recommend and sell holidays and additional products such as airport hotels, parking and excursions to enhance our Customers experience.

You will put all customers at the heart of our business and constantly ‘go the extra smile’ by creating unforgettable holiday experiences that make us famous for service and create customers for life. This role has variable shift patterns each week which include  weekends. In return for your flexibility you’ll usually know your shift pattern 4 weeks in advance.

TUI Group is the world’s number one integrated tourism business. We continue to build a single customer facing team across our airline, contact centre, overseas and retail service teams that will deliver a consistent, contemporary service to every single customer.  Joining us will not only provide opportunities for you to grow your career, but the benefits of being part of an exciting multi-cultural united team.

As a TUI Retail Travel Advisor you will help to create unforgettable holidays for all of our customers with your personality, professionalism and personalised service. You will understand our customers and adapt your style using information provided to help  you find ways to improve customer satisfaction and loyalty. Your knowledge will help us collaborate and answer questions for our international colleagues and customers. There will be modern technology to work with so you can discuss, recommend and sell suitable  products and services, and promote and assist our customers to self-serve online.

You will inspire and respect your colleagues whilst sharing a great amount of fun. If things do not go quite right, you will be pro-active and confident to investigate and resolve every question or complaint straight away. You will enjoy change and challenges  taking opportunities to assist with incidents and emergencies, but regardless you will always ‘go the extra smile’. Your desire to achieve will lead you to exceed your company, sales and service targets.

In addition to TUI and First Choice, your scope will include our range of Cruise, UK and other exciting holiday products and with these comes a varied administration role. Finally, you will be comfortable to handle multiple currencies and comply with the procedures,  upkeep and responsibilities of operating your local shop.

Should you be under 18 and applying for a role in England you will be required to be in part time education or voluntary work and including your paid employment both responsibilities cannot exceed 40 hours a week, proof of this will be required
A customer driven and positive individual with a passion for delivering contemporary service
Confident and fun personality with a strong commitment to achieve targets and overcome challenges
Willing to engage and collaborate at all times with customers and colleagues of varying nationalities
The highest personal standards and pride in attitudes and behaviours displayed
A passion to work within tourism and actively grow and share knowledge

TUI UK and Ireland is the UK’s largest tour operator with key brands including TUI, First Choice, and Marella Cruises. Sub brands include Sensatori, Sensimar, and Family Life, as well as First Choice Holiday Villages and SplashWorld Resorts. Our airline,  TUI Airways is the UK’s third largest airline with 62 aircraft operating to over 88 destinations in 30 countries. We have a team of more than 10,000 employees serving over 5.5 million customers each year.

TUI UK and Ireland is a member of TUI Group, the world’s number one integrated tourism group. Covering the entire touristic value chain under one roof we employ 63,000 people in over 100 countries and offer 20 million customers comprehensive services in around  180 destinations worldwide.

Help make our customers smile and in return you will receive a competitive salary, pension scheme and further benefits such as generous holiday discounts, great rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers.

Throughout your career, we will continuously invest in your development starting with a 3 day residential course alongside your store induction. This is to ensure you are provided with all the skills and tools you need to become a destination expert.
Apply online, we just need a few details from you and your CV.

title: Transport and Logistics Executive
description: With a high level of accuracy and attention to details this role would best suit a confident, motivated, flexible team player. Working closely with the turnarounds department, the candidate will ensure all transportation requirements have been documented  and booked using our in house database, whilst adhering to strict deadlines. Must be able to maintain and develop relationships with suppliers, aiming to provide a faultless service, in order to achieve maximum client satisfaction, as well as the highest level  of profitability.

TUI Destination Experiences, or TUI DX for short, is the world’s leading provider of destination experiences. With 9,000 diverse employees in 49 countries and head office locations including Palma de Mallorca, Luton and Hannover. We offer 14million guests  a portfolio of excursions, activities, tours, transfers and guest services. TUI DX is part of TUI Group, the world's leading tourism group.
Print relevant reports and plan transportation assignments
Book all transportation requirements using in house database
Monitor transportation requirements, additional bookings and cancellations
Liaise and effectively communicate transport requirements to suppliers
Make sure all transfer bookings have been confirmed by suppliers
Make sure supplier or flight changes are followed up
Produce transportation daily summaries and file
Check supplier invoices match related booking
Fluent English both written and spoken
Very organized, with the ability to work independently or in a team
High customer service and communication skills
High level of concentration, accuracy and flexibility
Ability to solve problems and multitask
Experience using databases is desirable, but not essential as training will be provided, competency in Microsoft Office essential
You are a qualified finance professional with experience of reporting in a large organisation (ideally >£1bn turnover per annum)
You are a self-starter and able to think and work analytically, including strong problem solving skills
You always drive for results, ability to work through obstacles, persistent in identifying quality recommendations and solutions in a timely manner
You are able and comfortable to challenge senior leaders on assumptions
You have proven experience delivering high quality business partnering and strong approach to dealing with high levels of ambiguity and considerable change
You have a high level of systems literacy, working with large volumes of disparate data
Excellent Excel & presentational skills will be an advantage
You are a talented team player who wants to learn, grow and drive their career while spreading smiles across the globe
You have experience within the TUI Group or knowledge of tour operating (advantageous)
To apply for this role you will be required to login, provide personal details, answer any application questions and attach a CV in English.

title: Team Member - Bar/40014640
description: Beefeater is one of the UK’s best-loved and best-known restaurant brands. Customers love us because we’re ideal for any occasion - from a quick bite, to a celebration with friends or family. Serving up great food and warm welcomes every day, we’ve grown  to have restaurants all across the nation. We are proud to be part of the Whitbread family of brands. As the UK’s largest operator of hotels, restaurants and coffee shops, Whitbread makes everyday experiences special for millions of customers. And creates  excellent career opportunities for people like you.

You’ll be the friendly face of our establishment. But your important role is about much more than greeting and seating people with a smile. It’s about creating great memories. A warm welcome is just the beginning. You’ll make sure every moment - from noting  orders, to delivering drinks and dishes, and taking payment with a genuine ‘thank you’ - is timely, efficient and delivered with enthusiasm. Along the way, you’ll add the little touches that make a customer’s visit an experience to savour - like recommending  the perfect drink or side dish to complement a main course.

You don’t need previous experience to join us in this role. It’s all about what you can bring as a person. Comfortable and confident working at a fast pace, you take real pride in everything you do - from setting the table, to cleaning the bar. You’re a  skilled multi-tasker, and you’re always ready to adapt when priorities change. And you make sure you know our latest food and drinks menus inside-out. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll  work hard for them. Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.
Ready to make a difference for customers, colleagues and your career?

title: AP Payments Co-Ordinator
description: You will be part of a team of AP Payments co-ordinators who are based within the UK, Cyprus, Turkey, Greece and mainland Spain. The role also requires cover of the Assistant Account Payable Manager for Hotels during annual leave or sickness. The positions  we are recruiting for will be based in Luton, UK and will report directly into the Assistant Account Payable Manager for Hotels.

You will be working as part of the AP Hotels team to ensure invoices are verified, processed and paid within the supplier agreed payment terms. Your day to day duties will include supplier query resolution by maintaining a ticketing systems, statement reconciliations.  You will be required to assist and cover the Assistant Hotels Manager and Finance Manager during annual leave or sickness

Someone with a good Accounts Payable background and strong influencing skills. Excellent customer service and telephone manner and excellent communication skills, both written and oral. You must have strong interpersonal skills including persuasiveness and/or  assertiveness skills with excellent problem solving skills and attention to detail. You will be required to work to tight deadlines and show excellent communication skills. We also require a candidate with good commercial awareness.
TUI Group is one of the world’s leading leisure travel groups, with over 220 trusted brands in 180 countries and more than 30 million customers.

TUI UK and Ireland is the UK’s largest tour operator with key brands including TUI, First Choice and Marella Cruises. Sub brands include TUI Sensatori, TUI Couples, TUI Family Resorts, First Choice Holiday Villages and Splash World Resorts.

TUI UK and Ireland’s airline, TUI Airways, is the UK’s third largest airline with 61 aircraft operating to over 73 destinations in 20 countries. TUI Airways was the first airline in the UK to take delivery of Boeing’s 787 Dreamliner and is flying the aircraft  on long haul flights.
We employ a team of 13,300 colleagues, serving 5.2 million customers each year.
Please click on the link below, the application process consists of answering a few questions and uploading your CV.

title: Merchandising & Buying European Graduate Programme 2019
description: Variety and Challenge. Growth and Opportunity.
In the retail business, we move fast. We’re always adapting, evolving and innovating. And the fast pace brings variety and challenge, along with continued growth and opportunity.

Welcome to TJX, a Fortune 100 company and the world’s leading off-price retailer of clothing and homeware worldwide. Our retail chains include TK Maxx in the United Kingdom, Ireland, Germany, Poland, Austria and the Netherlands, as well as HomeSense and  tkmaxx.com in the United Kingdom; TK Maxx in Australia; TJ Maxx, Marshalls, HomeGoods, Sierra Trading Post and Homesense, as well as tjmaxx.com and sierratradingpost.com in the United States; and Winners, HomeSense and Marshalls in Canada. In 2016, TJX had  over $33 billion in sales, more than 3,800 shops and 235,000 Associates. As a retailer committed to growth, success is always in style at TJX!
Thank you for your interest in TJX Europe and your application to our Merchandising & Buying Graduate Programme.
Due to an overwhelming volume of amazing applications so far, we have now filled all spaces on our Merchandising & Buying Graduate programme for 2019

Our advert will remain open until the end of December 2018 for applications to join our programme in February 2020, July 2020 or September 2020; and potentially Sept 2019.  If you are interested in joining us at TJX Europe on these forthcoming intakes,  please do continue to submit your application for us to review. If successful we will then contact you as soon as we are running further Assessment Centres.
If circumstances change and spaces do become available for our 2019 intake, we will be in contact to let you know
Many thanks again for your continued interest in TJX Europe
Open to discovering a new way?
Become the force behind buying and selling all of our great products out in the market.

You might not have heard of TJX Europe, but you’ve probably heard of our brands – TK Maxx and Homesense. We’re part of the world’s leading off-price apparel and home fashions retailer – TJX Companies, Inc. Last year, our annual revenue was over $35 billion
*. But we don’t want to stop there. We’re confident that we can continue to grow.
Merchandising and Buying are the areas that make our business unique, and so they’re vital to our future success.
As a graduate your journey will begin in the merchandising team, where you’ll learn about our business fully and begin to drive results in an entrepreneurial way from day 1.

This will begin with a comprehensive induction and training plan, including both classroom and practical workshops for you to understand how fundamental the partnership between Merchandising and Buying is in delivering value to our customers online and in  store.

As you progress within Merchandising you’ll develop the knowledge, skills and relationships essential for you to reach your goal and make decisions that contribute to profitable sales. You will do all of this with the support of a huge network; including  your manager, mentors and buddy.

We are an ambitious business with exciting expansion plans.  We nurture and develop our people, we see the talent in everyone and consider everyone a potential leader of the future.  You are encouraged and empowered to make decisions from the outset and  learn quickly in our fast-paced   You will drive your own development and be fully supported along the way. We believe that by acquiring the skills needed in these early roles, you’ll set yourself up to be a great Merchandiser or Buyer in the future.  At TJX  it is important to us that our people gain a broad experience of the business, working in a number of different product areas, building relationships and communicating with lots of different Merchandisers and Buyers to learn what and how we do it!
•            Curiosity and passion for our business and retail
•            Able to build strong and trusting relationships
•            Ability to think outside the box and take risks
•            Comfortable admitting your mistakes and learning from them
•            Sharp commercial thinking and analytical skills
•            Flexibility and able to thrive in a constantly changing where decisions happen quickly

Alongside the requirements listed above, if you have European language skills - particularly business level German or Italian – that would be great. And if you’ve lived and worked in Europe, outside of the UK, even better. In a business like ours, these  are great assets to have.
Discover more at and apply for our 2019 intake.

As proud as we are of our past success, it’s our future that excites us most. We strive to provide opportunities for growth, recognition and a competitive salary and benefits package. Share our determination to think bolder and bigger, and be part of our  future. Apply now.

title: Team Member - Housekeeping
description: At award-winning Premier Inn, we’re proud to be the UK’s biggest hotel brand. There are three keys to our success: comfy accommodation of real quality, truly affordable prices, and dedicated teams of brilliant people. Join one of those teams and you’ll help  us achieve our ambitions to grow - in a big way. We are proud to be part of the Whitbread family of brands. As the UK’s largest operator of hotels, restaurants and coffee shops, Whitbread makes everyday experiences special for millions of customers. And creates  excellent career opportunities for people like you.

You’ll be at the heart of our mission to make sure every guest feels they can relax and enjoy being in their room. With you in control of linen, and keeping rooms spotlessly clean, a great night’s sleep is almost guaranteed. But your responsibilities don’t  stop there. You’ll keep other, public areas of the hotel clean and tidy too. If you spot anything hazardous, you’ll tell a manager right away, to make sure everyone stays safe. And every day, you’ll go to a meeting about guest feedback. Add in the full training  we provide, and you’ll have everything you need to provide a fantastic service.

You don’t need previous experience to join us in this role. It’s all about what you can bring as a person. There’s a lot to achieve every day, so you’ll need to be highly organised. A great eye for detail is really important, so you can take care of the  little details. You’re also a great communicator, always happy to engage enthusiastically with customers and other members of staff. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll work hard for them.  Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

At every venue in the Whitbread family, everyone is welcome. That goes for our customers, and it goes for our people too. Whatever level you start at, we’ll help you reach your full potential. You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit  from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.

title: Team Member - Bar/40014640
description: Beefeater is one of the UK’s best-loved and best-known restaurant brands. Customers love us because we’re ideal for any occasion - from a quick bite, to a celebration with friends or family. Serving up great food and warm welcomes every day, we’ve grown  to have restaurants all across the nation. We are proud to be part of the Whitbread family of brands. As the UK’s largest operator of hotels, restaurants and coffee shops, Whitbread makes everyday experiences special for millions of customers. And creates  excellent career opportunities for people like you.

You’ll be the friendly face of our establishment. But your important role is about much more than greeting and seating people with a smile. It’s about creating great memories. A warm welcome is just the beginning. You’ll make sure every moment - from noting  orders, to delivering drinks and dishes, and taking payment with a genuine ‘thank you’ - is timely, efficient and delivered with enthusiasm. Along the way, you’ll add the little touches that make a customer’s visit an experience to savour - like recommending  the perfect drink or side dish to complement a main course.

You don’t need previous experience to join us in this role. It’s all about what you can bring as a person. Comfortable and confident working at a fast pace, you take real pride in everything you do - from setting the table, to cleaning the bar. You’re a  skilled multi-tasker, and you’re always ready to adapt when priorities change. And you make sure you know our latest food and drinks menus inside-out. Like all of us, you really care about our customers. You’re committed to your colleagues too, and you’ll  work hard for them. Crucially, you always strive to be the best in everything you do.

You’ll enjoy the chance to shine every day. And you’ll benefit from the best training and development programmes in the industry. So wherever you’re coming from, we will help you get to anywhere you want to go.
Offering competitive pay rates, excellent discounts across our Premier Inn, restaurant and Costa Coffee brands! Not forgetting additional benefits that come part of the package.
Ready to make a difference for customers, colleagues and your career?

title: Head of HR
description: My client is undoubtedly a leader in their field; with clear commercial objectives and a commitment to bettering themselves. As Head of HR and reporting into the Group HR Director, you will be instrumental in driving though change impacting performance  and people processes to move to a more commercial and leading-edge business.

Managing, coaching and developing an operational HR team and working closely with the leadership team; you will have the opportunity to 'roll up your sleeves' whilst also supporting the HR Director in creating and delivering the people strategy. You will establish  and build strong relationships with key stakeholders across multiple sites and be instrumental in managing specific projects such as employee engagement, talent management and development and HR process and policy reviews.

Experience of working at a senior HR/Head of HR level and within a blue collar and highly commercial environment is essential. You will also have the capability to lead a team whilst still deliver and maintain a hands-on approach and challenge the status quo  in a supportive yet constructive manner.

This is a great opportunity to be part of the organisation's success story, although based out of Rugby, there will be national travel required on a weekly basis. For further details, please apply via the link.

They are looking for a Part-time Store Assistant for their New Malden Store and whilst you do not need previous retail experience you need to be self- motivated, enthusiastic and someone who always wants to provide customers with an excellent level of service  and an enjoyable shopping experience. The Part-Time Store Assistant needs to have a helpful and cheerful manner essential and a professional and personable approach.

The Part-Time Store Assistant's responsibilities will include serving customers, providing information on store products to customers and daily reconciliation and banking. You will receive full training when you start and there is an excellent support network  throughout this family run company.
The company places a lot of emphasis on personal training and development however more importantly they want you to be happy and enjoy your job !

All overtime is paid at x1.5 after 40 hours and up to 12pm Sat, After 12pm Sat and Sunday x 2.
No vehicle as this is a static site

Our client is a leading provider of facilities maintenance and support services in the built environment. Working in partnership with some of the UK's best known companies & public sector contracts. They are a market leader in mechanical, electrical and fabric  maintenance for both the private and public sector. They have offices throughout the UK.

An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Maintenance Supervisor providing a Facilities support service covering Planned & Reactive Maintenance for the servicing, breakdown and repair of all associated commercial works on a large Police station.
Supervising up to 2 x M&E static engineers and 2 x Fabric Engineers

title: Business Development Manager - Engineering Apprenticeships
description: Our client has an exciting opportunity to join them in the role of Business Development Manager for Engineering Apprenticeships.
The role will be based from their world-class state of the art facility in Aston, Birmingham, with regular travel in the Midlands and occasional national travel.

As the UK’s leading trade body focused in the Manufacturing Sector, our client offers a range of professional services, as well as having an extensive apprenticeship programme, with training taking place at their facilities in Aston, Birmingham.

In the role of Business Development Manager for Apprenticeships, you will be involved in the development and delivery of a Sales Plan to generate increased revenue from new and existing clients in terms of their apprenticeship vacancies, in line with the needs  of the company's existing facility and future growth plans.

We are looking for candidates with Business Development/Sales experience, ideally within the Apprenticeships and Education/L&D sector, or alternatively with experience and knowledge of selling within the Manufacturing or Engineering industry.

To work with the Apprentices and Skills and Business Development functional senior management in developing and reviewing the business and sales and marketing plans to deliver growth for Apprentices & Skills business
To establish strong connections for new business with key internal stakeholders, existing clients, relevant industry and educational bodies and target companies
To work effectively with the Apprentices and Skills Commercial Manager, Centre Management, WBL teams and national Business Development teams
Impressive business record, particularly in Business Development / Sales
Experience and knowledge of the Apprentices & Skills sector, or of manufacturing/engineering
Ability to work and communicate at the highest level, to think strategically and to deliver on objectives
Experience of researching and generating sales leads
Successful track record of profitable business development
Ideally experienced in working face-to-face with clients
A valid UK driving licence is essential
Competitive salary, plus annual car allowance
The role is based from Aston, Birmingham, with regular travel in the Midlands and occasional national travel.
Working hours are Mon-Thurs 8am to 4.30pm and Friday 8am to 1.30pm - with potential for some flexibility
Pension with up to 8% matched contribution
Annual leave of 26 days plus Bank Holidays
Our client asks that all job applicants share their company-wide commitment to putting the Customer First.
If you are invited to an interview you will be required to demonstrate a good understanding and provide examples of having delivered high levels of customer service.

title: Lead Clinician - Haematology and Transfusion Scotland
description: In line with Scottish Government Health & Social Care Directorates guidance, National Services Division (NSD) is seeking to appoint an enthusiastic and highly motivated Lead Clinician to lead the work and ongoing development of the new Haematology and Transfusion  Network Scotland (HaTS).

The HaTS brings together clinical haematologists and transfusion scientists from across Scotland to work in a co-ordinated manner, across geographical, organisational and professional boundaries.  The network exists to ensure the provision of high quality,  clinically effective clinical haematology and transfusion services throughout Scotland including service redesign.

The Lead Clinician will be an enthusiastic and highly motivated individual who will lead the development of the Network taking account of the Quality Strategy for Scotland and the changing financial environment. Applicants will be clinical leaders in their  field and have knowledge and experience in the provision and development of diagnostic clinical haematology and transfusion services. They will command the respect of colleagues nationally, and will have a proven record in leading change. The ability to work  across traditional NHS Board boundaries and organisations is essential.
The appointment is for 1 PA per week for a fixed term of 3 years. The successful candidate will work from their current employing Board who will be compensated for the agreed time.
- Mrs Liz Blackman, Senior Programme Manager, National Network Management Service - Dr Catherine Colquhoun, Programme Manager for HaTS, National Network Management Service,
For an application pack please complete the online application form on the SHOW website .
Interviews will be held at NHS National Services Scotland, Gyle Square on 13th March 2019.

description: We are currently inviting final year Adult Nursing Students to apply for Band 5 Staff Nurse positions within NHS Fife. We are recruiting for posts in Acute Services, Community Hospitals and Community Nursing within the home.

title: Learning Officer
description: Becoming a Learning Officer with Knowledgepool:

Capita is looking for a Learning Officer to proactively consult with key stakeholders to identify their learning needs, their learning strategy, preferred mode of delivery and expected performance impact, matching these requirements to our direct delivery  capabilities, associates or suppliers. You will also deliver learning needs including projects and programmes.
Work within a team servicing customers, providing expert knowledge to ensure that we delight customers, meeting or exceeding all KPIs and SLAs
Take a creative approach to problem solving on customer service issues
Attend weekly calls and monthly reviews with customers to drive customer satisfaction
Process bookings, amendments and cancellations via multiple contact channels
Take responsibility for large scale programmes/requirements for customers
Qualify, plan and design the project/programme and proactively monitoring its progress
Create a schedule of events based on required dates/locations
Proactively negotiate with suppliers in line with customer operational model
Develop an effective relationship with all internal and external stakeholders
Develops a good understanding of the Learning Industry including what "good" learning design and delivery looks like.
Maintain an up to date personal development plan
Managing difficult conversations and difficult decisions
Strong Customer Service, interpersonal and communication skills
Organised, motivated with good time management skills & the ability to work under pressure
Willingness to learn and adaptable to change
Excellent English oral and written communication
High level of attention to detail

Knowledgepool, part of Capita plc, is a leader in Learning and Development Transformation. Our expertise covers everything from strategic learning consultancy to managed learning services, curriculum design and training delivery to digital and competency  management. We also specialise in apprenticeships and pre-employment programmes. You'll be joining a team who are passionate about innovation and who take pride in making learning and training the best experience possible.

Knowledgepool are part of Capita Plc, the UK's leading provider of business process management and integrated professional support service solutions. Through quality solutions, tailored to our customers' needs, we've helped countless organisations unlock  value and maximise their potential. With access to our range of unique and diverse opportunities, offering real career advancement and progression, we can unlock your potential too.
At Capita, we believe an open, transparent working environment that encourages ingenuity and collaboration - with colleagues, customers and clients - is what makes us so effective at what we do.

As well as a generous basic salary, we also give you 23 day's holidays, company matched pension scheme and access to a variety of voluntary benefit options. These include a share save scheme, life assurance, holiday buy and many more designed to suit your  own personal lifestyle, such as retail, health & wellbeing and leisure discounts.

You'll be joining a network of some of the most experienced, innovative and dedicated people in the country - the opportunities to learn new skills, develop in your career and grow and as we grow are almost endless. Our mission is to help you realise your  potential - whatever that means to you.
What we hope you will do next
Help us find out more about you by completing our short application process -
. We understand you might have some questions before taking the step to apply - you can contact for guidance.

Contribute to the rigorous application of the internal system using TPM tools & Techniques to generate continuous improvement throughout the areas of the Factory.
Apply 5S principles to deliver world-class standards of housekeeping.
Candidates ideally should be time-served with good fault-finding skills.
Minimum requirements for qualification are to City & Guilds in Electrical Engineering.
Demonstrable Knowledge & Expertise in Fault - Finding and diagnostic skills on Industrial plant & equipment.
Ability to repair machinery and equipment and provide solutions to problems.
An understanding of PLC equipment and program editing, ideally on Siemens S5/S7 and telemechanic systems.
Knowledge of 3 phase power circuits, Frequency Inverters, Motor Controls, Safety Circuits.
Flexible & self - motivated team working attitude.
High degree of Health & Safety awareness.
Experience of a modern manufacturing environment in particular automated plant.
Qualified to ONC / HNC or equivalent in Electrical Engineering.
Capable of writing original PLC programs and interrogating control systems.
Knowledge of industrial control systems, weighing machines.
Basic Mechanical fitting skills, welding, hydraulics, pneumatics etc.

title: Interim Finance Manager
description: This Dunstable based Engineering company is looking to recruit an Interim Finance Manager for a period of 6 months.

Reporting to the Financial Controller and Head of Sales UK you will manage a team of 2 Finance Assistants and be a key member of the Senior Management team running the Finance department on a day to day basis and providing financial and commercial support  to the wider business.
Daily/weekly/monthly management reporting as required to group timetable
Preparation of Budgets / Forecasts in group format to group timetable in conjunction with other members of SMT
Manage annual statutory audit and preparation of statutory accounts in accordance with group finance team to group timetable
Oversee completion of Corporation Tax return in accordance with group tax team and external tax advisors
Internal Control reporting and ownership of actions to improve ICD scores for the business
Ensuring compliance with group policies in all areas of the business
Commercial support/reporting for SMT to include but not limited to - Sales reporting, Margin analysis, Inventory management, Customer Relationship Management, Credit decisions
Assist with meeting the standards of ISO 9001
Assist in the IT management / support for ERP system
Manage/process the monthly payroll for all employees, including all required statutory returns/payments by required deadlines
Assist with the Management of any legal claims/property issues in conjunction with other members of the SMT

Management of two Finance Assistants to include annual performance appraisal, agreeing personal objectives/development requirements and mentoring development of Finance Assistant to ensure deliverables are achieved
Management of any other issues that may come to light as a result of daily business activities that require support/resolution

This role would suit a collaborative individual who can quickly establish open communicative relationships with a small team and also with the wider business community within the Group. The business has projects planned for the start of 2019 including a  systems implementation which will require the Financial Controller's input requiring this person to then deputise in his absence and take on more responsibility.

You must be a hands-on qualified Accountant (ACA, ACCA, CIMA or equivalent), willing to take on transactional processing duties when necessary, with a desire to improve processes whenever possible and work hard as part of a small team to meet targets at  key reporting times and to ensure compliance.
Proficiency in Exact and JDE (JD Edwards) would be highly beneficial as would systems implementation experience, and you must have advanced Excel skills.
This is an interim role paying £250 - £325 per day depending on experience.

title: Building Surveyor
description: Badenoch & Clark are partnering exclusively with a blue light organisations based in Sheffield to assist them in recruiting a Building Surveyor for their Maintenance department on a fixed term contract for 12 months (potentially going on longer or permanent  for the right candidate)
Please note this is an urgent role and if you are interested please contact me this week in order to not miss out on this exciting opportunity.
Management of asset based construction projects across a range of functions and activities.

Deliver the annual capital, repair, reactive, cyclical, regulatory and maintenance and environmental programmes of works across the organisations property portfolio and as identified in the Property Asset Management Estates Plan.

Provide support as required by the Property Manager on project management, environmental, capital, repair and maintenance issues and provide information and advice to corporate groups, Corporate Management Board and Elected Members as appropriate.
1.Responsibility for the project management of a wide range of schemes, projects and activities.
2.Assist in the efficient running of the Estates and Facilities Section including responsibility for the performance, productivity and operational output of the functions undertaken by this post.
3.Preparation of reports for attendance at meetings as required, including Authority, Internal and Consultative meetings, e.g. CMB Quarterly capital update reports
4.Co-ordinate and lead project teams, across a range of activities, including non construction based projects.

5.Manage project and prepare scheme and project appraisals, sketch plans, submission drawings and budget costs for identified works within the programme and such other property related projects as directed. Prepare scheme submissions for future year's budget  consideration. Undertake consultations with Internal & External stakeholders as necessary
6.Develop and maintain contacts with Architects, Surveyors, Building Service Engineers, Contractor's & Consultant's for advice, guidance and services procurement.
7.Prepare Planning and Building Regulations Applications for submission and liaise with the relevant authorities to ensure approval.

8.Work up approved schemes to provide full project documentation including consideration of all legislative requirements, i.e. Building Regulations; preparation of specifications, contract drawings, pre-tender health and safety plans, ensuring CDM requirements  are fully considered and recorded.

9.Prepare contract and tender documentation and ensure quotations and tenders are advertised and let in accordance with SYFR Financial Regulations and Contract Standing Orders. Carry out full evaluation of tender returns and prepare recommendations.

10.Undertake the Clerk of Works function and inspect works in progress on sites to assess and monitor the quality and progress against the pre-agreed programme and to ensure compliance with statutory regulations and codes of practice. Arrange and certify stage  payment evaluations and completion instructions prior to the authorisation of payment.

11.Arrange and attend pre contract and progress meetings to ensure the smooth completion of construction projects as required. To ensure that there is timely and effective consultation and communication at all times.

12.Responsible for accurate and timely input of information relating to the capital, environmental and repair and maintenance programmes into databases and corporate systems and updating of the property register including the updating of electronic plans to  support the Estates Plan.

13.Undertake programmed condition and suitability surveys of all SYFR property and land and prepare reports identifying defects and highlighting expected life of the building elements; update the facilities management software to reflect the survey. Provide  costed and prioritised recommendations for the rectification of the identified works. Provide background information and data for the preparation of Estates Plan PI's relating to role.
14.To advise the Property Manager in undertaking and managing planned, cyclical, regulatory and reactive works, programmes and maintenance regimes and to ensure.

15.Responsible to ensure that, the existing arrangements are fit for purpose and comply with all statutory and regulatory obligations and to intervene and initiate to resolve areas of weakness in control or compliance in this regard.
1.Professional membership in a property related discipline such as RICS, BIFM, CIOB or experience commensurate with such membership.
2.Degree or equivalent in relevant property/ estate management/ building discipline
4.Knowledge of occupational Health & Safety legislation and requirements.
5.Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including Excel and Powerpoint.
6.Experience working within a property services ( or similar ) environment
7.Experience of the procurement and management of external consultants, contractors and suppliers.
8.Proven experience of effectively managing a wide range of construction based projects
9.Experience of delivering environmental initiatives and projects
Badenoch + Clark acts as an employment agency for permanent recruitment and an employment business for the supply of temporary workers. Badenoch + Clark UK is an Equal Opportunities Employer.

By applying for this role your details will be submitted to Badenoch + Clark. Our Candidate Privacy Information Statement explains how we will use your information - please copy and paste the following link in to your browser: https://candidate-privacy

title: Trader
description: The Exchange & Sportsbook Trading function within Paddy Power Betfair works with various functions across the Group striving to deliver industry leading sports betting product, pricing and customer experience. The function is split into three Risk & Trading  verticals (Racing, Football and Sports), as well as an analytics & modelling team, operations teams and a trading product team. We strive for excellence in every aspect of the operation and look for people who are numerate & smart to take on exciting roles  within the function.

To be part of a team of odds compilers & traders focused on delivering a market leading International horse racing betting proposition for customers of Paddy Power Betfair and its B2B partners. As part of the International Racing team you will be responsible  for racing territories including North America, South America, France, Dubai, Germany and Australia.
Compilation; Timely & accurate of Early Prices across multiple International jurisdictions.
Trading; constantly updating markets and reacting to new information to ensure prices offered are as accurate as possible
Risk management – constant client monitoring and risk control
Reporting: delivering reports which focus on all important metrics to a successful operational and risk management performance with a view to constantly innovating and improving.

Collaboration; with other functions within the Group to deliver International racing betting product, pricing and customer experience that sets apart PPB sportsbooks from those of our competitors, with a particular emphasis on leveraging the advantage that  the exchange provides to PPB group.
Strong Interest and knowledge of International Racing jurisdictions
Keen desire to learn pricing methods across territories
Ability to work at pace and on own initiative
Willingness to drive and achieve results.
Good evidence of a numerical background either from a professional or educational perspective.
Some basic knowledge of International Horse Racing (and an appetite to learn more)
Strong evidence of capacity to think strategically.
*Proven track record of delivering excellent results, product and process.
*A third level degree or higher is desirable

Paddy Power Betfair plc is an international sports betting and gaming operator, with a market-leading presence in the UK, Ireland, Australia and the USA, as well as a range of operations across Europe including Romania, Portugal and Malta.

We operate five sports betting and gaming brands; Paddy Power, Betfair, Sportsbet, FanDuel and TVG. We are online-led, mobile-led and sports-led: and our proprietary technology, unique products and innovative marketing all combine to offer a superb experience  to our five million customers worldwide.

Our spirit, talent and ambition has taken us into the FTSE 100 index of the London Stock Exchange and we now employ over 7,000 people in sixteen locations across the globe; from Dublin to Los Angeles, and London to Melbourne. Our culture rewards innovation,  teamwork and we like to stay fast-moving in a dynamic industry.

title: Finance Process Manager
description: Being a FTSE and ISEQ listed public company can be challenging. That’s why our Finance team holds itself at the cutting edge of all the major functional disciplines, never standing still and continually innovating. Our teams are actively engaged in a diverse  range of activities which include; Financial Reporting, Group Accounting, Management Accounting, FP&A, Treasury, Transaction Processing, Financial Systems & Projects, as well as Commercial Finance & Business Partnering.
Imagine how being part of such a diverse yet agile team could provide you with unique opportunities to build out your skill set, and to do so all within the same organisation!

Our largest teams are located in Dublin then London, with distinct Finance teams supporting our main businesses and operating units located across three continents in the US, Europe, and Australia. This creates the opportunity to move geographically within  the Group or to get involved in cross-location and international assignments.

Underpinned by state-of-the-art technology, for which we were the architects, engineers and implementation team, we continually drive operational improvements and efficiencies in everything we deliver - if you enjoy setting new standards in Finance then  you’ve come to the right place.

Join us, and become part of a highly experienced and highly driven Finance community, with big ambition and bigger influence, operating at pace within a growing, innovative and dynamic Global Betting Group.
The Finance Process Manager is responsible for leading the Paddy Power Betfair Group’s Finance Process Optimzation and Automation Delivery, reporting to the Head of Finance Innovation.

The role requires excellence in leadership, with proven people management skills. The successful candidate should hold significant experience in systems development and project management, comprising operational, technical and change management elements  in a fast-moving environment.
These elements will be combined with a proven ability to deliver results, with and through colleagues and peers, both cross functionally and cross jurisdictionally.

Actively manage/participate in planning, implementation and tracking of specific short, mid and long-term projects from conception to implementation; develops projects plans, milestones and ensures projects are delivered on-time and on-budget. Projects will  be designed to support scale through efficiency (mobile and online solutions)
Responsible for planning, implementing and change management activities around Finance-focused projects, systems changes and technology improvements in the Finance organisation

support the ongoing integration and optimisation of finance systems and processes for the Paddy Power Betfair Group across the globe – documenting processes and identifying optimum solutions to be implemented across the PPB Group
Identify and implement system changes, technology projects and other initiatives to deliver process efficiencies and improvements
Drive the development/improvement of the current Financial Applications – working with Finance staff to improve functionality and system processes by leading the Finance Process Improvement Forum
Automation Delivery: Identify processes and tasks for automation, ensuring a healthy pipeline; create the change and communications plan to promote automation adoption within PPB Finance
Manage key third party vendor relationships for the Finance organisation
Lead and where necessary participate in group projects to ensure the development and implementation of best practice financial systems, reporting, processes, and procedures.
Facilitate the integration of new businesses from a Finance perspective

title: Marketing Executive
description: Reporting to the CRM Manager - Betfair UK&I Gaming, this key purpose of this role is to contribute to the delivery of all Betfair’s Online Gaming CRM campaigns in the UK and Ireland. Responsibilities cover the full CRM process from assisting with the planning  and costing, to building and execution of specific campaigns. This exec will be one of two CRM executives working in the Betfair Gaming CRM team, who work closely with the Betfair UK&I Sport & International CRM team to bring the brand strategy to life in communications.

Support the CRM Manager - Betfair UK&I Gaming in the planning, costing, building and execution (as relevant) of CRM campaigns for Betfair Gaming campaigns (across Casino, Arcade, Poker, Bingo and Live Casino) in the UK and Ireland, based on specific customer  segmentation, campaign or behavioural change objectives. This will be achieved by:* Acting as main point of contact for Betfair Gaming Commercial Execs to understand their commercial needs.* Partnering with the marketing insight team to constantly improve  targeting and campaign performance. * Work closely with Creative Studio to deliver exciting on brand content (both visual and copy).* Deliver flawless execution of campaigns across a variety of channels, working closely with CRM Data.
Contribute to the monthly planning process which is led by the CRM Manager, with a view to developing longer term customer-centric plans, which result in improved campaign execution.
Work closely with the Betfair UK&I Sport & International Execs to ensure the brand is talking to customers with one voice.
Work closely with the Betfair International Gaming CRM Exec to ensure global scale is achieved for gaming wherever possible.
Establish a strong relationship with the Lifecycle Execs to deliver integrated comms plan.
Contribute to monthly reporting which clearly links to P&L KPIs and which focuses on which activities should be dialled up / down.
Feed into ongoing budget management to meet the desired balance between ROI and spend.

Contribute to culture of continuous improvement by assisting with pilot projects to test new approaches / technology (e.g. Moveable Ink) to optimise campaigns and rolling out approach across all BAU projects once approved.
Regularly sharing plans and learnings with the Paddy Power Gaming Execs to see what can be reapplied across brands.
Identify opportunities for automation and scale, co-ordinating a breadth of teams to implement.
Acquire and maintain a good understanding of Paddy Power Betfair and competitors’ gaming products and communications.
Ability to work at a fast pace, whilst still showing meticulous attention to detail.
Highly organised and focused, with excellent project management skills.
Ability to understand the implementation of sophisticated customer segmentation.
Data literate and comfortable in using data to make better decisions
Collaborative, with ability to build strong relationships with both P&L teams, as well as other Marketing teams.
Innovative and creative – able to think about new approaches to solve problems.
Knowledge of CRM systems and processes (ESP software, planning tools & Excel).
Ability to work with raw data to analyse campaigns and draw useful conclusions.
Ability to edit HTML and QC the coding of others to a high level.
Knowledge and experience of using Google Analytics and/or Tableau.
Good knowledge of sports, online gaming or gambling.
Ideally some previous experience in CRM or a related field.
Relentless Will To Win: We strive to stay ahead of the game and achieve more for our customers and each other.
Collaboration: We win by having the best people, working well together and building strong relationships.
Integrity: We take pride in doing what’s right. No exceptions.
Agility: We adapt at pace and with purpose, and thrive amid change.
Low Ego: We take our work seriously but not ourselves, and never believe our own hype.

description: School/College Leaver - Trainee Recruitment Consultant - Top Co
-OTE: £30,000-£35,000 yr 1 - Increasing with a career development plan!
Are you a bright spark looking to kickstart your career in recruitment?
Do you see yourself as a someone with a real hunger to succeed and make money?
Are you sincerely eager to get some meaningful training in a burgeoning industry?

Screening candidates both over the phone and face-to-face
Creating revenue via high-end placements, to build and grow the new delivery department

We are a 5-year-old recruitment consultancy specialising in the IT sector, and based in Southwark, Central London. We deliver into two key niches, which has given us a great name within the industry.

In our time doing business, we have been nominated for Best New Agency at the Recruiter Awards and worked with some of the most prestigious names in the UK. From up-and-coming start-ups to established institutions, our client base is wide and dynamic. We  organise an industry-leading meet-up and conference in partnership with Microsoft, and this has taken us to the offices of some of the world's most prestigious technology companies: think Amazon, Facebook and Google.

You would be working in a small team of passionate recruiters, resulting in an upbeat but comfortable work-space. Here at Prism, we pride ourselves on our dedication both to our work and our play, meaning that you can expect team drinks every Friday to cap  off a week well worked. You can also expect a generous bonus dependent on performance (i.e. number of successful placements per month), as well as quarterly outings and trips abroad.

This job would be perfect for a young school leaver, ideally with some experience in a sales environment, who is looking to build their career and start earning right out of the gate. We offer a large amount of internal and external training, helping you  to get into the world of recruitment with ease. With great opportunities for progression and development, we believe this role really has a lot to offer.

title: B2B Telesales Executive / Account Manager
description: My client is a market leading supplier of automotive spare parts to franchised main dealers across the UK. Successful and forward thinking, with ambitious growth plans, they operate from modern premises based near Ossett, between Wakefield and Dewsbury,  close to Junction 40 of the M1 and Junction 28 of the M62.

This role will take over an existing customer account portfolio currently managed by a senior member of the sales team. 60% of your time will be spent selling to these existing accounts, 30% developing known accounts that currently choose not to buy and  10% prospecting for currently unknown accounts.

There are 750 franchised main dealers associated with the makes of car whose parts they currently supply. So there is a strong element of active selling and promoting deals and offers to a finite customer base, whose main alternative is to buy parts from  the vehicle manufacturers at a higher price.
There is also a strong element of upselling and managing product mix to achieve targeted gross profit within each sale.
Working within a small B2B sales team this is an office based role and will involve:-
Hitting targets for sales, conversion rates and outbound sales calls.
Building and promoting strong long lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs.
Driving sales, developing a solid pipeline, and continually identifying and capitalising on opportunities for sales growth.
Being aware of emerging markets, market shifts, new products and competitor activity.
B2B Telesales experience selling to existing and new customers.
Excellent closing techniques and objections handling skills.
A proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
The ability to analyse and understand sales data and performance.
An ambitious, tenacious, determined, proactive, self-motivated approach.
Knowledge of the automotive spare parts sector although useful is not a prerequisite.

My client is genuinely interested in candidates who have the ambition and ability to develop and improve. They feel totally confident that as a rapidly growing organisation they can offer excellent career prospects to the candidate who secures this role. title: Headteacher
description: Langholm and Canonbie 3-18 Schools (Canonbie Primary/Langholm Academy Cluster)

Dumfries and Galloway is seeking to appoint a dynamic leader with vision and a passion for learning. This post provides an excellent opportunity to be innovative in encouraging our culture of sharing and learning through offering the successful candidate the  opportunity to lead learning across the schools in Canonbie Primary and the all-through school at Langholm Academy for a period of up to 18 months. You will have proven leadership qualities within a primary and/ or secondary setting and be committed to very  high standards of achievement. Langholm Cluster combines Canonbie Primary and Nursery, Langholm Primary and Nursery and Langholm Academy and serves the area of Eskdale in Dumfries and Galloway. The area is adjacent to the Scottish Borders and is well served by good transport links. The current  combined school roll is 490. The schools benefit from well-established Parent Councils who are supportive of the schools and work collaboratively to ensure they are an integral part of their communities. The current management structure consists of a Headteacher,  two Secondary Depute Headteachers, two Primary Depute Headteachers and a School Support Manager. Langholm Primary School was recently re-built has an extensive campus and underwent major refurbishment, with additional development of the campus, in 2017. The  school has extensive playing fields and sports facilities integrated within the campus.
The main local industries are agriculture, forestry and tourism and good housing is affordable.
Applicants are required to be fully registered in primary and/ or secondary education with the General Teaching Council of Scotland (GTCS), Clerwood House, 96 Clermiston Road, Edinburgh, EH12 6UT.

This post considered as Regulated Work with Vulnerable Children and/ or Protected Adults, under the Protection of Vulnerable Groups (Scotland) Act 2007. We are a 5-year-old recruitment consultancy specialising in the IT sector, and based in Southwark, Central London. We deliver into two key niches, which has given us an outstanding name within the industry.

In our time doing business, we have been nominated for Best New Agency at the Recruiter Awards and worked with some of the most prestigious names in the UK. From up-and-coming start-ups to established institutions, our client base is wide and dynamic. We  organise an industry-leading meetup and conference in partnership with Microsoft, and this has taken us to the offices of some of the world's most prestigious technology companies: think Amazon, Facebook and Google.

You would be working in a small team of passionate recruiters, resulting in an upbeat and fast-paced workspace. Here at Prism, we pride ourselves on our dedication both to our work and our play, meaning that you can expect team drinks every Friday to cap  off a week well worked. You can also expect a generous bonus dependent on performance (i.e. number of successful placements per month), as well as quarterly outings and trips abroad.

This job would be perfect for a graduate, ideally with some experience in a sales environment and a 2:1 or above, who is looking to build their career and start earning right out of the gate. We offer a large amount of internal and external training, helping  you to get into the world of recruitment with ease. With great opportunities for progression and development, we believe this role really has a lot to offer.

title: Window Fitter / Installer (South East)
description: We are currently recruiting for a Window Installer / Site Services Engineer to be based in the South East Region completing remedial works across the UK. This role reports to the Site Services Manager, Melton Mowbray.
A company vehicle will be provided to the successful applicant.
We are particularly interested in candidates with installation experience for this position.
As a Site Engineer you are primarily responsible for rectifying reported manufacturing defects out on site and the completion of remedial tasks in line with our Customer Care Schedule.

The key tasks and responsibilities are to re-hang doors, glaze windows, and rectify ironmongery defects and touch-up paint defects. You will also be required to inspect Jeld-Wen products and complete the required reports for all work undertaken.
You will be expected to operate with a total 'SAFETYFIRST' mentality and a 'QUALITY’ getting it right first time every time mentality.
- Act as a company representative and ambassador for all inspections and manufacturing tasks out on site
- Ensure that all materials used are in accordance with the specifications
- Ensure that work performed is in accordance with the specifications
- Communicate with clients and keep them informed throughout the remedial work
- Complete planned work and organise your equipment efficiently to to meet agreed deadlines
- Report any quality control and health and safety matters on site in line with company procedure
- Resolve any unexpected technical difficulties and other problems that may arise

Site inspections may involve climbing ladders or visiting areas of sites where access is difficult. Appropriate safety equipment, such as protective boots and headgear, must be worn on site and will be provided.
The working week is usually 39 hours, but may include early starts or late finishes. This role may require some travel and occassional overnight stays in hotels.
- The successful applicant must be a time served joiner
- A full clean driving license is required for this role
- Knowledge of relevant building and health and safety legislation
- Experience of working in a manufacturing or construction environment would be advantageous
You will need to demonstrate the following;
Ability to champion the JELD-WEN Values
A total 'SAFETYFIRST’ mentality, understanding and culture
A 'QUALITY’ getting it right first time every time mentality
Have the highest of personal standards
Excellent people management and communication skills
Have basic computer skills and experience of basic IT software

JELD-WEN - a leading global manufacturer of windows, doors, stairs, and treated composite trim and panels - operates 90 facilities in more than 20 countries with $3.5 billion in revenues; half of which comes from outside the United States.

In the UK, JELD-WEN has approximately 1200 staff that produce and distribute quality doors, windows, patio doors and stairs. Operating across 5 factories - the UK head office and door production facility is based in Sheffield; 3 factories in Melton Mowbray  - one that is dedicated to timber windows, doorsets and patio doorsets, one that is the largest volume production facility for timber stairs in the UK, and the mill which supplies components to the other sites; and the Penrith factory, which specialises in  the manufacture of veneered, foil and moulded internal doors.

title: Customer Care Advisor
description: Customer Care Advisor – Deeside Call Centre
We are recruiting for various shift patterns,  detailed below,  to come and join our team in our Deeside Call centre.
Shift 1: 0730hrs - 1530hrs Mon - Friday, and 1 roughly Saturday a Month (when working a Saturday - you will get a day off in the week)
Shift 2: 0830hrs - 1630hrs Mon - Friday, and 1 roughly Saturday a Month (when working a Saturday - you will get a day off in the week)
Shift 3: 0900hrs - 1700hrs Mon - Friday, and 1 roughly Saturday a Month (when working a Saturday - you will get a day off in the week)
Shift 4: 1000hrs - 1800hrs Mon - Friday, and 1 roughly Saturday a Month (when working a Saturday - you will get a day off in the week)
Benefits include: £16,556 salary, free parking, discounted products and services, brilliant reward and recognition scheme, excellent career development and much more!
**Interviews are being held on Weds 20th February**

From nachos in Newark to a hotpot in a hospital, from canapés in Coventry to whole lobster at a Michelin starred restaurant, we deliver over 1.5 million items to our customers each and every day.  Your local pub, your favourite restaurant, your children’s  schools all have one thing in common – Brakes UK. We’re growing and we’re always on the lookout for people who share our big appetite for success.

As a Brakes Customer Care Advisor, you’ll be responsible for providing excellent customer service through existing customers in accordance with the business development plan.  You’ll assist in the achievement of the department’s targets and objectives, ensuring  profitable sales growth is met / exceeded. You will also be responsible for responding to customer complaints/enquiries in accordance with established procedures and quality standards
You'll be a valuable member of the Team, contributing to the success of our business whilst working with a great team of people and having fun along the way!

You’ll be a natural people person and problem solver with a real drive to deliver results.  You will also enjoy working within a team and ensuring that you hit targets and achieve results in a true ‘One Brakes’ way. Above all you will be on a mission to  deliver the best solution and best experience to your customers – both internal and external.  And of course, you’ll be proud to live and breathe our values:
Being the best we can be

Here at Brakes UK, we have a simple mission – to help businesses who serve food to thrive.  And as we have been serving chefs across the food industry for nearly 60 years, with a business built on quality, reliability, innovation and trust, it’s no surprise  that we know what we’re doing.

And with a culture where everyone works together as one team to be the best we can be, with a real focus on our brilliant people, there is no doubt that we have the right ingredients to make your career a successful one.  If you’re looking for development  we can help you achieve your aspirations. We have clear career paths and learning programmes which will support you at every step of the way – We also have a whole range of Apprenticeships and a Graduate Programme so there really is something for you at every  level of your career whether you are just starting out or are a seasoned professional.  And being part of Sysco – the Global leader in selling, marketing and distributing food products; the opportunities really are endless.
If this isn’t enough, we offer a whole realm of fantastic benefits and incentives including
FEED YOUR AMBITION. DELIVER YOUR FUTURE

Brakes Group operates as an equal opportunities employer and we welcome all applications regardless of gender,  marital status,  sexual orientation,  pregnancy,  race,  colour,  ethnic origin,  nationality,  religion or beliefs,  age,  politic opinions  or trade union membership

Brakes UK uses a third party to undertake a number of checks. Any offer of employment made by Brakes UK would be conditional upon receiving a satisfactory reference,  identity document(s),  basic DBS certificate and basic credit check

title: FX and Treasury Associate - Sales
description: FX and Treasury Associate - Sales - £23000-£25000 + commission

My client, a rapidly expanding financial consultancy and risk management company based in the City are looking to recruit 3 new FX & Treasury Associates to join their team with a start date of the first week in April.
