title: Van Driver Delivering Potatoes to Fish & Chip Shops
description: We are a potato wholesaling business supplying potatoes to Fish and Chip shops throughout Yorkshire.

Our main business is farming and we grow a variety of arable crops including potatoes, wheat, barley, sugar beet, vining peas and oilseed rape. Our largest enterprise is potatoes and we specialise in growing potato varieties that are best suited for frying  particularly for use in Fish and Chip shops. We sell our potatoes in bags to wholesalers who then supply fish and chip shops.
We have recently purchased one of our customer’s businesses and so we are now operating a wholesaling enterprise delivering our own potatoes direct to the Fish and Chip shops.
We deliver our potatoes using a 3.5ton Vauxhall transit van. We employ one full-time members of staff and one part-time and we are looking to add another full-time member to our growing team.

We operate two main farmsteads one in the centre of Eastrington where our office is based and another one mile away at Owsthorpe. Eastrington is as quiet village and is ideally situated just four miles from junction 37 of the M62, yet it has little or no  through traffic. We occupy an Old Stable block in the centre of the village, which we converted into a modern office environment whilst maintaining the character of the original 1910 building.
(i) You will be trained to carry out the following tasks:

Maintaining a clean and roadworthy van.
Cleaning down your vehicle at the end of the day.
(i) Enthusiastic, motivated and willing to learn.
(iv) Able to communicate with other employees and respond to customers in a pleasant and confident manner.
(v) Have the ability to apply common sense to practical problems.
(vi) Be able to participate effectively as a team member
The role is full-time. The working week is from Monday to Friday. The usual start time is 8am though this may vary slightly according to the number of shops within the schedule for the day.

description: Are you an experienced CHC Nurse Assessor, looking to gain more flexibility and work life balance? This role is suitable for someone with a thorough understanding of completing DST assessments who can work autonomously and hit the ground running to support the team. You will be working closely with families and other health and social care professionals,  completing DST assessments to determine eligibility for CHC and FNC funding.
Full time hours preferred however 4 days per week will also be considered.
Daily rate of £260-300 per day (Outside IR35)

- role is based in central location, close to town centre and local amenities
- An unlimited referrals incentive, giving you a £300 voucher for every nurse you refer to us

The responsibilities of the CHC Nurse Assessor will include:
- Completing DST Assessment to determine eligibility of CHC/FNC funding, assessing change in their current health needs.
- Utilising extensive knowledge of CHC framework
- Providing advice to relatives and members of MDT in relation to CHC/FNC funding
- Completing written reports outlining recommendation of eligibility
- Submitting completed written reports in a timely manner
- Completing assessments predominantly for patients with complex needs and learning disabilities
The successful CHC Nurse Assessor will be able to demonstrate:
- Strong understanding of the CHC National Framework
- The ability to produce an informative and detailed DST assessment
- Highly motivated and able to work autonomously
- Excellent people management skills with the confidence to work with individuals with varying clinical conditions

title: Production Operatives
description: International Manufacturer based in Bedfordshire seeks Production Operatives for our Management Plastics Production team based in Bedford. Here we manufacture a range of plastic rotational moulded drainage products for the construction industry. This facility  operates on 3 shifts, 6am-2pm, 2pm-10pm and 10pm-6am Monday to Friday.
Accurately weigh out or dispense raw materials in preparation for the moulding process.
Prepare moulds for the moulding process.
Load and unload moulds from the rotamoulding machine and cooling station using the gantry crane.
Operate the rotamoulding machine by selecting the appropriate program.
Monitor the moulding process throughout to ensure that the process parameters remain within control.
Trim and finish products ready for the cutting process.
Check and monitor the product to ensure it meets the quality standards including operation of leak detection unit.
Liaise with Quality Department staff when required.
Record process data and product dimensions.
Load product into, and operate, a semi-automatic cutting machine.
Apply end seals to products and attach edge rails using a variety of hand and air operated tools.
Inspect finished product to ensure compliance with specification.
Operate granulating machine to shred waste plastic ready for regrind and recycling.
Load and unload vehicles (FLT trained operators only).
Regular daily housekeeping and segregation of waste for recycling including operating baling machines.

You will be physically fit with experience of using a range of hand tools and work well in a team. You will have the ability to learn technical information to understand the production process fully. You will comply with the Health & Safety Regulations and  our Company standards at all times. Basic computer skills are required.

Working hours are 37.5hours per week, Monday to Friday, on rotating shifts 6am-2pm and 2pm-10pm. You must be prepared to work a Nightshift too which operates from 10pm-6am on a set period basis. A nightshift premium of one third is paid for hours worked.  Some flexibility will be required.
The company offers a competitive salary with 25 days holiday per year plus Bank Holidays, as well as a Company Pension Scheme and Private Healthcare is available after a qualifying period.

description: Court Social Work Assistant/Bail Supervision Officer – Hamilton/Airdrie and Lanark
South Lanarkshire Children and Justice Services are recruiting a Social Work Assistant to fill a vacant permanent post within the pan Lanarkshire Court Services team.

As a Social Work Assistant within our Justice Service you will work as part of a dedicated Court based Social Work Team providing statutory social work services across North and South Lanarkshire authorities covering the Hamilton, Airdrie and Lanark Sheriff  Courts.  Candidates will have previous experience in statutory Social Work services with a confident approach to working with court and wider judiciary personnel. Duties include undertaking Bail Supervision duties.  Excellent assessment, report writing and communication skills are also essential to this post.  This post requires the ability to be flexible towards place  of work and be in a position to travel between courts.

You will be line managed by a Senior Social Worker and your supervision and professional development will be an essential element of your post. You will work as part of South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Partnership and work in collaboration with a  range of statutory and third sector agencies.

title: Cyber Lawyer
description: We are seeking to recruit a lawyer 2-6 years PQE to join our market leading international TMT practice specialising in cyber work.

The successful candidate will have excellent academics and will have gained experience in a City firm or in a large regional practice, with a strong litigation background. We are looking for a team player who can work with different teams and lawyers across  the firm. The successful candidate must be a self-starter who enjoys business development with a track record of success in this area.

The role requires a technical TMT background including extensive experience of cyber and data privacy matters together with a strong litigation background. Experience of other contentious data protection matters (e.g. SARs and FOIA requests) would be a bonus  but is not essential.

The cyber matters we work on are often large and high profile involving significant factual, technical and legal complexity. The successful candidates will demonstrate an appetite for getting involved and strong organisational skills. Since we almost invariably  work in teams, the successful candidate will need to be a natural communicator and have a desire to work closely with others.

Pinsent Masons LLP has one of the leading and most established Technology, Media & Telecoms practices in the UK. With a team of over 30 partners and over 100 additional fee-earners, across a network of offices nationwide and international, our substantial  practice provides commercial, advisory and contentious services. Pinsent Masons LLP provides a full range of advice and guidance, including in relation to: cyber, data protection, privacy, defamation, media, intellectual property, Freedom of Information, technology,  telecoms, IT and communications disputes, outsourcing, e-business, IT product and services contracts and commercial contracts.

Our dedicated Cyber practice is a key part of our TMT Disputes team. Our Cyber team support clients and manage a full range of cyber matters including: pre-breach services such as cyber simulations; full incident response management; regulatory investigations;  and litigation arising out of cyber incidents. Members of our team have 10+ years of cyber experience. Our team is consistently praised by both the Legal 500 and Chambers & Partners for its strengths in this area, with the team having been involved in some  of the most significant cases to affect this area in recent years.

We support clients pre, during and post-security incidents, seeking to mitigate the attendant reputational, commercial and legal risks. Members of the Cyber team work closely with their non-–contentious Information Law colleagues, offering a coordinated  approach which often results in the effective management and resolution of data protection related matters.

We are currently very busy dealing with a number of high profile cyber, data protection and privacy disputes and expect this to be a substantial growth area for our team post-GDPR and as issues of online privacy come into the litigation spotlight in the  next few years.
development and delivery of pre-breach services to clients including cyber simulations, incident response planning programmes, cyber training and other cyber advisory work.

end to end management of cyber security incidents including: fielding calls to our 24/7/365 breach response line; initiating and leading CMT calls; appointing IT forensics firms; engaging PR consultants; advising on notification obligations;  notifying and liaising with criminal authorities (e.g. NCA, NCSC); project managing the incident response; appointing foreign counsel and coordinating multi-jurisdictional incidents; engaging credit monitoring and notification service providers; applying for  injunctions; and submitting takedown requests.
managing regulatory investigations including: notifying regulators (e.g. ICO and FCA); dealing with regulatory enforcement action; and appealing enforcement decisions.

Dealing with litigation connected to cyber matters including: pursuing claims and recoveries against suppliers; dealing with B2B and B2C claims; defending group litigation and representative actions initiated following incidents; and  managing other disputes arising out of security incidents.

assisting with business development activities, internally within the firm and externally in the market, in order to win new clients and to win cyber work from existing clients - this will include identifying and developing  relationships with cyber insurers, attending and speaking at conferences and writing articles, as well as cementing existing relationships.
Previous hands-on experience of advising on cyber matters including the four areas identified above is a key requirement.
A strong commitment to and enjoyment of business development is very important.
An awareness of and good understanding of recent and upcoming regulatory changes in the data protection sphere is expected.

Pinsent Masons is the 25th largest law firm in the world, with over 3,000 staff and 24 international offices throughout the UK, Europe, Asia Pacific, Africa and the Middle East. We have a long-standing reputation for delivering high-quality legal advice  rooted in a deep understanding of the sectors and geographies in which our clients operate. Our global reach ensures that we are well-placed to advise on complex multi-jurisdictional matters across a full range of legal disciplines.

Pinsent Masons has achieved more tier 1 rankings in The Legal 500 UK guide than any other firm, won the "Law Firm of the Year Award 2018 – The Lawyer" and is recognised among the most innovative law firms in Europe by the Financial Times. The firm has significant  international credentials in the financial services, global energy, infrastructure, real estate, and advanced manufacturing and technology sectors. Services provided across these sectors include asset management and investment funds, corporate and M&A, commercial,  competition, litigation and arbitration, banking, restructuring, insurance, regulatory, construction, projects, pensions, property, planning and environmental

title: SME Finance Manager
description: Do you prefer a hands-on role, working for a small business? It's a laid back culture with nice people who are all driven by doing a good job for the team. The business has seen impressive growth over the past couple of years through acquisition and winning  new contracts. That has resulted in a promotion for the existing Finance Manager who now needs to work more strategically with the MD to further drive growth.

description: The Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services in Bury is the largest CAMHS in the country. Each unit has a dedicated psychologist who is responsible to provide evidence-based treatments to support adolescents aged 12 or above.

We are currently looking for a Clinical/Forensic/Counselling Psychologist to join our extraordinary team and help us to make the difference in the lives of the young people in our care. Offer therapy and treatments for issues relating to a range of mental health conditions;
Develop and evaluate service provision for young people;

Carry out applied research, adding to the evidence base of practice in a variety of healthcare settings;
A corporate induction on company policies and basic duties;

Monthly individual clinical supervision by the Lead Psychologist;

All the applicants need to possess:
A valid psychology qualification and a three years of postgraduate training or doctorate in Psychology;
A valid registration with the Health and Care Professions Council;
Empathy and a person-centred approach to clients;
The ability to recognise your own limitations and respond to difficult situations;
The ability to apply your knowledge of academic psychology and research to clinical problems;
The capacity to work in a self-motivated, independent way;
Good communications and interpersonal skills in order to deal with people in distress;
The ability to collaborate with colleagues from other disciplines
Previous CAMHS experience or experience in forensic/secure settings;
Understanding of Personality Difficulties and attachment or previous experience with this clinical group;
Ability to work with complex traumas;

title: Retail Customer Service Advisor - Tesco - Stratford
description: Salary per annum: £7,881.12 pa / £8.42 ph + additional benefits listed below
Whether it’s a customer taking a weekend break or a couple going on the holiday of a lifetime, we want to be part of their journey to an unforgettable experience. That’s why we need you!
So, what does the role involve?

In this role, you will do more than just buy and sell currency. This role is about providing great customer service, building relationships and getting to know your customer along with all aspects of travel money! Don’t worry if you can’t tell us the difference  between a Dirham or a Baht as we don’t expect you to know all things travel money from the outset - we will provide you with thorough training to set you up for success!

We also provide you with the opportunity  to progress your career as we have bureaus right across the UK (and the world) as well as offering NVQ’s/Apprenticeships and development programmes.
What kind of person are we looking for?

You’ll be friendly and approachable as well as having an eye for detail. You’ll need to be good with numbers as you will be handling multiple currencies and accuracy is key. Ensuring our customers have a great experience is really important to us, therefore  we look for people who share our passion for customer service!

We have a clear purpose at Travelex. We understand the value of exchanged money, and the opportunities it opens up to our customers. We’re excited for them, and enjoy being part of their individual journey, whatever and wherever it might be.

Travelex has operated for more than 40 years and serves customers in over 70 countries across 6 continents, offering a range of services to both consumers and businesses, operating as a globally recognised and widely trusted foreign exchange operator.
Exciting? We think so! Your journey starts here, so take the first step to become part of the Travelex family by clicking apply.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This role is offering 18 hours per week, paying £8.42 per hour with the opportunity for enhanced overtime/bank holiday pay. In addition, we also offer 22 days holiday (pro rata with option to buy/sell holiday entitlement), pension, discounts and cash back  offers with 1000’s of retailers, discounts at staff canteen and other flexible benefits including childcare vouchers.

title: Night Care Worker
description: “Much more than just a job. It’s the way that you do it that matters.”

Here at The in Edinburgh, we don’t just see those we work with as older people. They’re someone’s mum. Someone’s dad. Someone’s grandparent. For us, providing the best quality of care is hugely rewarding and our goal is to ensure that every one of our residents  enjoys the best possible quality of life.

Something as simple as a smile can make the world of difference to our day, and theirs. If you share our belief, this is your opportunity to join our close-knit and supportive team. It can be pretty challenging at times and priorities can change quickly  so you will definitely need to be a patient and understanding individual. We work closely together as a team though – there’s always someone to talk to and we all help each other out wherever we can.

What do you need? You will be required to be registered with Scottish Social Services Council [SSSC] and ideally have an SVQ Level 3 in Social Care. In return, we’ll make sure that you have all the training and development you need, not only so you can do  a great job, but to help you build your career with us too.

The general task required of Care Worker shall be as follows, but variance in emphasis may occur in particular establishments. To work within a multi disciplinary team to meet the need of the service user. To provide wakeful night duty cover in the unit.
1. To act as a key worker for designated service users. Compile, monitor and review care plans in consultation with relevant stakeholders.
2. To ensure that the physical, emotional, social and spiritual needs of the service users are met in a manner that reflects the organisations Christian Ethos and Mission Statement.
3. Assist service users with personal and intimate care.
4. Assist service users to access and use any aids and personal equipment that is required.
5. Liaise with other appropriate health professionals at times of service users illness or/at the end of life.
6. Assist in the promotion of mental and physical activity of service users as detailed in individual care plans.
7. Ensure that service users physical environment is maintained to a high standard.
8. Ensure that service users clothing and effects are personalised and maintained to a high standard.
9. Assist with monitoring and reviewing service users nutritional needs in line with the care plan.
10. Answer emergency bells, the door and telephone, and greet visitors in a professional manner.
11. Be responsible for reading and writing reports in line with CrossReach’s Policy and Procedures and SSSC codes of conduct.
12. Participate in staff and service users meetings as required.
13. Work on a rota basis involving weekend and evening work.
14. Comply with all Health and Safety requirements in line with current Policies including risk assessments.
15. To undertake any training deemed necessary to fulfil the requirements of the role.
16. To comply with CrossReach financial procedures.
17. Have respect for all aspects of Christian worship.
18. Facilitate service users to attend Christian worship (or worship of choice).
Ideally you will possess an SVQ 3 in Social Care. If you do not you will be expected to achieve an SVQ 3 in a specified period of time.
As we do our work in Christ’s name you must be respectful of our Christian Ethos and be able to work within it.
This post requires you to be a member of the Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme and undertake the necessary vetting checks.
This post requires you to be registered with SSSC and it is your professional responsibility to ensure that you meet the standards and criteria for registration.
The postholder must possess basic computer literacy skills including use of Microsoft Office and the internet.

title: Relief Care Worker

7. Assist with monitoring and reviewing service users nutritional needs in line with the care plan.

9. Be responsible for reading and writing reports in line with CrossReach’s Policy and Procedures and SSSC codes of conduct.
10. Have respect for all aspects of Christian worship.
11. Facilitate service users to attend Christian worship (or worship of choice).
Ideally you will possess an SVQ 3 in Social Care. If you do not you will be expected to achieve an SVQ 3 in a specified period of time.
As we do our work in Christ’s name you must be respectful of our Christian Ethos and be able to work within it.
This post requires you to be a member of the Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme and undertake the necessary vetting checks.

title: Cook
description: "It’s lovely to make people smile. It makes my day.”
Work in a friendly team environment

Here at Clashfarquhar in Stonehaven, we don’t just see those we work with as older people. They’re someone’s mum. Someone’s dad. Someone’s grandparent. For us, providing the best quality of care is hugely rewarding and our goal is to ensure that every one  of our residents enjoys the best possible quality of life. Of course, making sure that they also enjoy tasty and nutritious food is right at the heart of that, which is why this rewarding role is so important.

Don’t think for a moment that you’ll spend all of your time in the kitchen though. You’ll talk to our residents, to find out what they like and to make sure they’re happy with their meals, as well as to relatives and the rest of the team here.
That’s why we used the word ‘rewarding’ earlier. Just hearing someone say “I really liked that soup” with a big smile on their face can make a huge difference to your day.

As well as cooking everything from scratch, you’ll order and check deliveries, update menus and generally keep paperwork up-to-date. So you will need to be well organised and able to manage your own time. We’re also looking for experience of CookSafe and  preferably an Intermediate Food Hygiene Certificate.

To prepare and serve nutritionally balanced and attractively presented meals and snacks to reflect the individual needs and requests of the service user ensuring a high standard of hygiene and safety in the catering area and promoting service user participation  in the life of the home.
1. To plan the menus subject to agreement with the Unit Manager, in order to provide varied and interesting meals and snacks for service users and staff.
2. To cater, where necessary, for any special diets, consulting with service users on their preferences and providing a choice of menu.
3. To incorporate and make the best use of fresh vegetables and fruit in the diet of service user.
4. To maintain a check and control of food stocks and be responsible for the ordering of stores stock.
5. To prepare, cook and serve meals to clear and wash up with the assistance of other staff, where appropriate.
6. To prepare “home baking” to reflect the service users wishes.
7. In agreement and consultation with the care staff, encourage therapeutic participation by service users in food preparation in line with Health and Safety guidelines.
8. To comply with Health and Safety requirements in the kitchen and other catering areas.
9. To ensure all aspects of current health and hygiene legislation are adhered to.
10. To be responsible to the Unit Manager for budgetary control.
11. To be involved in the life of the Unit and cater for special occasions such as parties and seasonal events.
12. To supervise and help train other catering staff in catering duties.
13. To participate in staff meetings and in training activities as and when required.
14. To undertake any other duties as may reasonably befall within the parameters of the post as requested by the Unit Manager or appropriate Team Leader.
Elementary Food Handling Certificate – training will be given if required to achieve award.
Have respect for all aspects of Christian worship.
You will be required to participate in the organisations appraisal system.
This post requires you to either complete a Disclosure or be a member of the Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme and undertake the necessary vetting checks.
Working knowledge of Health & Safety current legislative requirements.
The postholder must possess basic computer literacy skills including use of Microsoft Office and the internet for completing mandatory e-learning courses.

title: Care Worker
description: “Much more than just a job. It’s the way that you do it that matters.”
Start a career in the care sector

Here at The Elms in Edinburgh, we don’t just see those we work with as older people. They’re someone’s mum, someone’s dad, someone’s grandparent. For us, providing the best quality of care is hugely rewarding and our goal is to ensure that every one of our  residents enjoys the best possible quality of life.

Something as simple as a smile can make the world of difference to our day, and theirs. If you share our belief, this is your opportunity to join our close-knit and supportive team. It can be pretty challenging at times and priorities can change quickly  so you will definitely need to be a patient and understanding individual. We work closely together as a team - though there’s always someone to talk to and we all help each other out wherever we can.

What do you need? You will be required to be registered with Scottish Social Services Council [SSSC] and ideally have an SVQ Level 3 in Social Care. In return, we’ll make sure that you have all the training and development you need, not only so you can do  a great job, but to help you build your career with us too.
We also have part time Care Worker hours available, please state on your application form under Relevant Information how many hours you would be interested in (ie 1 day or 2 days).
The general task required of Care Worker shall be as follows, but variance in emphasis may occur in particular establishments.
To work within a multi disciplinary team to meet the need of the service user.
1. To act as a key worker for designated service users. Compile, monitor and review care plans in consultation with relevant stakeholders.
2. Assist service users with personal and intimate care.
3. Assist service users to access and use any aids and personal equipment that is required.
4. Liaise with other appropriate health professionals at times of service users illness or/at the end of life.
5. Assist in the promotion of mental and physical activity of service users as detailed in individual care plans.
6. Ensure that service users physical environment is maintained to a high standard.
7. Ensure that service users clothing and effects are personalised and maintained to a high standard.
8. Assist with monitoring and reviewing service users nutritional needs in line with the care plan.
9. Answer emergency bells, the door and telephone, and greet visitors in a professional manner.
10. Be responsible for reading and writing reports in line with CrossReach’s Policy and Procedures and SSSC codes of conduct.
11. Participate in staff and service users meetings as required.
12. Work on a rota basis involving weekend and evening work.
13. Comply with all Health and Safety requirements in line with current Policies including risk assessments.
14. Undertake any training deemed necessary to fulfil the requirements of the role.
16. Have respect for all aspects of Christian worship.
17. Facilitate service users to attend Christian worship (or worship of choice).
Ideally you will possess an SVQ 3 in Social Care.
If you do not you will be expected to achieve an SVQ 3 in a specified period of time
As we do our work in Christ’s name you must be respectful of our Christian Ethos and be able to work within it.
This post requires you to be a member of the Protecting Vulnerable Groups (PVG) Scheme and undertake the necessary vetting checks.
This post requires you to be registered with SSSC and it is your professional responsibility to ensure that you meet the standards and criteria for registration.
The post holder must possess basic computer literacy skills including use of Microsoft Office and the internet.

Experience of using Sage Line 200 and/or Epicor software would be advantageous. (Not Essential)

title: Travel Money Advisor - Tesco - Banbury
description: Salary per annum: £7,379.84 pa / £8.87 ph (£8.42 ph + £0.45 ph location allowance) + additional benefits listed below
Whether it’s a customer taking a weekend break or a couple going on the holiday of a lifetime, we want to be part of their journey to an unforgettable experience. That’s why we need you!
So, what does the role involve?

In this role, you will do more than just buy and sell currency. This role is about providing great customer service, building relationships and getting to know your customer along with all aspects of travel money! Don’t worry if you can’t tell us the difference  between a Dirham or a Baht as we don’t expect you to know all things travel money from the outset - we will provide you with thorough training to set you up for success!

Joining us will feel like being part of a family, so although you will need to be comfortable working by yourself, you will get support across the business and engage with other Travelexer’s globally on our internal blog! We also provide you with the opportunity  to progress your career as we have bureaus right across the UK (and the world) as well as offering NVQ’s/Apprenticeships and development programmes.
What kind of person are we looking for?

You’ll be friendly and approachable as well as having an eye for detail. You’ll need to be good with numbers as you will be handling multiple currencies and accuracy is key. Ensuring our customers have a great experience is really important to us, therefore  we look for people who share our passion for customer service!

We have a clear purpose at Travelex. We understand the value of exchanged money, and the opportunities it opens up to our customers. We’re excited for them, and enjoy being part of their individual journey, whatever and wherever it might be.

Travelex has operated for more than 40 years and serves customers in over 70 countries across 6 continents, offering a range of services to both consumers and businesses, operating as a globally recognised and widely trusted foreign exchange operator.
Exciting? We think so! Your journey starts here, so take the first step to become part of the Travelex family by clicking apply.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This role is offering 16 hours per week, paying £8.87 per hour with the opportunity for enhanced overtime/bank holiday pay. You will provide outstanding customer service, have good problem solving skills and be able to demonstrate excellent verbal  and written communication skills.
This position is being offered on 1 year fixed term contract to cover maternity leave.
The salary for this role is up to £20,000.00 per annum depending on experience.
Please note that this role requires the employee to work 1 in 6 Saturdays of the year with a day off during the week.
Take appropriate action to advise clients/PTE's of any significant supplier/company driven changes.
Provide support to your colleagues in retail with pre departure changes and how best to action and advise. Including schedule changes and name changes with the use of Galileo.
Provide back-up and support to our overseas agents with the handling of all in resort situations, speaking to / corresponding with clients directly when required.
In the absence of the duty officer take responsibility to ensure that all daytime calls to the Duty Officer pager are answered efficiently and effectively.
To work 1 in 6 Saturdays of the year with a day off during the week.
Respond to correspondence relating to a company or supplier driven change.

Using the Operations complaint handling database, ensure that case notes, compensation and complaint classification is correctly added and that internal systems are fully utilised to obtain relevant information.
Liaise with Product, Destination Management, and Health & Safety, as appropriate, and suggest areas for improvement.

Negotiate and reclaim from suppliers for compensation and/or costs, in cases where significant changes are advised to clients within 61 days, or suppliers fail to provide contracted services to the required level.
Work as part of a team and take an active role in the handling of emergency / crisis situations overseas.
Huntress Search Ltd does not discriminate on the grounds of 'protected characteristics' as defined under the Equality Act and other relevant UK legislation.
Huntress Search Ltd acts as a Recruitment Agency in relation to all Permanent roles and as a Recruitment Business in relation to all Temporary roles.

title: Internal Auditor
description: Internal Auditors work as members of the Internal Audit team to perform audit and other reviews. They gather relevant evidence and form conclusions to give assurance to the Board that the arrangements in place to manage risks to the Group’s assets, and to  its customers, are adequate and appropriate. This will involve discussion, reading and other tests to understand and record how business processes work and whether they are designed and operating effectively. Internal Audit’s work covers the whole breadth  of the organisation.

Internal Auditors work on their own assignments or with a Senior Internal Auditor on larger or more complex assignments. No two assignments are the same and self-learning including best practice and key risks is required before every audit. Work assigned  to an Internal Auditor will contain a moderate level of complexity, with support being available from senior members of the audit team where necessary. All internal audit work is subject to quality control by senior members of the team.

All members of the internal audit team can expect to meet with colleagues at all levels up to SLT and to be able to confidently gather information, to discuss areas of concern and potential solutions. For more complex or difficult areas, support from senior  members of the Internal Audit team is available.

Internal Auditors are expected to complete planning, fieldwork and reporting within agreed timescales and using PBS’s audit framework such that the majority of work produced needs no further modification. Having proposed and agreed audit objectives and testing  before starting audit fieldwork, the auditor must nevertheless adapt to what they find e.g., by asking additional questions or modifying testing to ensure audit objectives are met. Internal Auditors must exercise judgement to reach conclusions about the adequacy  of the control framework based on the evidence gathered, and must be able to communicate this effectively both verbally and through written reports.

Performance of Internal Audits. This involves planning the assignment, discussion with colleagues and evaluation of key risk and controls, recording of evidence and conclusions, creating a report and monitoring completion of recommended management actions.  Whilst a framework exists for managing audits, each assignment is unique.
Administrative activities within the team e.g., maintaining process notes, running reports of overdue items
Working knowledge of Word, Excel, Outlook
Good working knowledge of AutoAudit (audit software, knowledge not expected when joining the function, but required to learn within 3 months of joining the team)
Degree educated (minimum 2:2) or equivalent professional experience in a similar role.
Working towards CCAB (Chartered Accountant) or CIIA (Chartered Auditor) qualification, or equivalent.
Working in a role that requires risk management and business process/controls is desirable
Experience of working within Financial Services is desirable
Internal or external audit experience is desirable
Ability to work to deadlines ensuring expectations of stakeholders are effectively managed.
A good understanding of risk management and business processes/controls.
A good working knowledge of the PBS audit process (not expected when joining the function, but required within 3 months of joining the team)

It’s official! We’re a Great Place to Work! We are delighted to announce that in our first year of participating, we have been named one of the best workplaces in the UK in the large category on the Best Workplaces™ list for 2018.

With 53 branches and 18 agencies across Wales and the borders, Principality is the 6th largest Building Society in the UK. As a mutual society, we’re owned by and run for the benefit of our 500,000 members.

It’s an exciting time to join us as we’re currently on a Group wide transformational journey that will see our brand, technology, colleague and customer offerings updated and enhanced to really put Principality on the map and make us a brand and employer  of choice within Wales and beyond. This is supported by our recent sponsorship of the iconic Principality Stadium which has put us on a global stage.

Steve Hughes, CEO, said: “Principality is a unique organisation. We are big enough to have large ambition, but small enough to value, respect and engage everyone as individuals. Our colleagues live and work in the communities they serve and have developed  a strong connection with them. We strive to be an inclusive business with colleagues who are passionate about doing the right thing for Members.

As a business, Principality is keen to recruit talented individuals who are interested in joining a company in which they can really make a difference. Although the Society has been established for nearly 160 years, we pride ourselves on a progressive culture,  which encourages its employees to thrive.

Our culture is renowned for being friendly, open and inclusive where we actively encourage everyone to bring themselves to work. Our people are our most important asset and make us stand out in the finance sector. They're the driving force behind our success  and we're committed to creating and maintaining a great place to work

As well as a great working environment with a strong family feel and plenty of opportunities for development and growth, you can expect a generous package that includes pension, bonus and incentive schemes, free life assurance cover, critical illness protection,  private healthcare and the option to buy extra holiday each year. You can also be a part of our Sports & Social club which gives our colleagues access to discounted theatre, sporting and family events and to top it all off, we always have tickets up for grabs  for the latest events at Principality Stadium.

As Principality colleagues, we want you to walk a mile in our customer’s shoes. This is why we provide all staff with £100 to open a savings account at your local branch to really feel a part of our core business. £100 also grants you voting rights at the  Principality Annual General Meeting.
For more information about our Reward & Benefits, visit

title: Optical Advisor
description: Competitive salary, bonus & benefits, full training will be given.
The role of Optical Advisor is a fantastic opportunity to join a global organisation where our staff can grow and develop within a professional working environment and establish a thriving career.

As Optical Advisor we expect your enthusiastic personality to allow you to build rapport quickly while also identifying the needs of the customer to discuss and sell the benefits of purchasing glasses or contact lenses with Optical Express. You will work  closely with the customer to achieve a successful sale; in addition you will be able to provide advice on laser vision correction (LVC) and intraocular lens replacement (IOL).

We are looking for applicants who thrive on working with our patients and providing fantastic customer service. You will have excellent communication skills, be well presented to reflect our brand and most importantly, motivated to achieve and have willingness  to learn and progress within Optical Express.
Assisting with vision tests and teaching patients how to use and care for contact lenses (full training provided)
Using your excellent customer service skills to advise patients on the most suitable and appropriate solution for their needs.
Maintaining an up-to-date knowledge on all products and associated key features and benefits.
Accurately maintaining patient records in accordance with GDPR
Creating sales opportunities and delivering on targets.
Assisting in the running of the store/clinic, greeting patients, answering the telephone, stock ordering, stock checking and general reception duties.
Strong, background in a retail sales or service environment
Understanding and experience of working to KPIs and deadlines
Enjoy being part of a team but still have the drive to work on your own initiative.
Modern working environment with superb technology support

We’ve come a long way since the first Optical Express opened in 1991. From just one store, we’ve grown to almost 130 stores and clinics and have become the UK’s only complete eye care provider. From glasses and contact lenses to laser, lens and cataract  surgery, we’re here to make poor vision a thing of the past for our patients.

Over £400 million has been invested in our clinics and in the most advanced technology, so it’s no wonder we’re the number one choice for laser eye surgery patients in the UK. Every week, our optometrists and surgeons help to transform the vision of thousands  of people across the country.
Optical Express has more 5 star Trust Pilot reviews than all the other laser eye surgery providers in the UK combined; in fact, over 99% of our patients would recommend us.
Optical Express is an equal opportunities employer

Are you tired of using the same old legacy tech daily?
Does working in a fast-paced environment excite you?

We have an incredibly complex platform and search capability ingesting 10s of billions of data points daily, producing over 500 million individual real-time holiday packages for customers to choose from. We are planning to expand massively in the next few  years, and with a large migration to GCP on the list of priorities, there is a need to add to our team of Java Developers. That rapid expansion and growth in market share has led to industry recognition, including being one of a few companies to feature in  the top 10 of The Sunday Times Fast Track 100 two years running (#2 in 2016 and #9 in 2017), as well as winning Best Travel Agent Website and Brand of the Year at the illustrious Travolution Awards 2017, and nominated for Best Technical Team 2018.

We understand the importance of collaboration: as a Java Engineer, you will be constantly learning new thing. Love a challenge and are always willing to learn.
Have previous experience building and integrating API's
Be comfortable working with a vast amount of data.
Have experience with CI/CD tools and understand how they fit in the software development process.

Opportunity to work in a very rewarding environment, where your hard work goes unnoticed.
The chance to learn and work with new, exciting technologies.

A great benefits package, including travel discounts, training budget, cycle-to-work, workplace pension, childcare vouchers, gym membership offers, and 25 days' holiday.
A chance to put your own stamp on an established but ever-changing business.
We strive on innovation and push our platform to always be ahead of all competition, we invest heavily in our engineers to ensure we have the strongest team possible.

If you are a Mid-Level/Senior Java Engineer, bored of the same cycle legacy tech, looking to challenge yourself in a very innovative environment, DO NOT miss out on this opportunity! Apply now or contact Lanre directly at Talent Point.

title: Administrator

For this role, your annual salary will be between £18,000 - £21,000, dependent on experience.

title: Ad Operationss Manager - Programmatic
description: A fantastic client -side opportunity to work with a reputable travel corporation as an Ad Operations Manager, whereby you will be responsible for the end to end process of the campaigns. If you have a strong technical ad ops background but are commercially  savvy and are looking for career progression, then this is a well-suited opportunity.

This reputable travel corporation utilises the data it has on its audiences to sell such inventory to their external partners. As such, are focused on obtaining and targeting the correct audiences for its partners, to optimise their ROI.

As an Ad Operations Manager, you will lead the Ad Ops and programmatic vertical, as such will be responsible for the end to end process of Ad Ops campaigns. Essentially, the successful candidate will need to oversee the Ad Server set up and generate PMP  campaigns across multiple verticals.
As such, will need to manage and understand their audience data in order to upsell such inventory to the relevant partners.
Set up and optimise Ad Servers
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to ensure audience targeting is effective to maximise revenue
Troubleshoot any technical and creative issues
The successful Ad Operations Manager will have:
Extensive commercial experience working on the publisher side or within a media agency
A strong Ad Ops background, with media tagging and trafficking
Experience buying and selling inventory, as such will have monetised audience data through the setup of PMP campaigns
Liaised with clients and internal stakeholders extensively
Been a pre-sales point of contact for any technical queries
Work for a reputable travel corporation with industry experts
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Francesca Harris via the Apply link on this page.

title: Global Category Lead - Facilities
description: My client, a global travel business in London are looking for a Global Category Lead with a focus in Facilities Management. In this position you will have a broad responsibility with over £250m of spend management.

This position will require you to integrate and build relationships at executive level, and in doing so create value across the procurement life cycle and supplier process. In addition you will have a number of other responsibilities listed below:
* End to end management of several procurement projects, along with continual negotiations within defined categories
* Mitigate risks and contribute to managing the vendor base
* Create effective channels of communication, sharing best-practice across the network
* Track spend, vendors and developments within the market
To be suited to this role you will need to showcase technical competencies in a number of areas, whilst also showing the desire to grow within the business. The following areas are:
* Record of creating and implementing category plans
* Knowledge of Procurement, from analysis of category to implementation of the contract
* Strong experience in designing and executing category strategies
If you wish to express your interest please don't hesitate in sending a version of your most recent CV.

title: IT Sales Executive
description: intY is an award-winning pioneer for the distribution of Cloud services from the biggest Cloud software vendors in the world, including Microsoft, Acronis and Symantec. CASCADE, intY’s self-service portal and the original Cloud Marketplace, enables partners  to seamlessly order and manage Cloud services for their customers 24/7. This is all underpinned by intY’s phenomenal people and exceptional multi-vendor support.

Since it was founded in 1997, intY has developed unparalleled expertise and knowledge in distributing Cloud services, ensuring that partners have access to the latest Cloud solutions at a competitive price, with the training and support to go to market fast.  intY’s breadth of experience and success in the Cloud marketplace is reflected not only in its global reach, with operations in the UK, US and main-land Europe, but also in the depth of its partnerships with the biggest names in the industry. We’re recruiting for a passionate and driven IT Sales Executive to source new partners for intY. This is a fantastic step for someone with either customer service, sales, call centre or recruitment background to step into the IT industry with an award-winning  company.
You will be working with the world’s leading Cloud Solution providers including Microsoft, Symantec, and more. This isn’t your ordinary job, you’re here to revolutionise Cloud distribution.
Proactively source and sign new partners
Build initial relationships with key decision makers
Plan to exceed monthly, quarterly and annual targets
Ambitious with a desire to learn
High work ethic, focused and target driven
A 37.5h per week contract that promotes flexible working
Enhanced paid paternity and maternity leave
A recognised training scheme that pays you to learn
Free food and drink throughout the working day
Fun, collaborative environment - days/ nights out, sports events etc.
The opportunity to join a rapidly growing business within a rapidly growing industry

title: Microsoft Solution Architect - Manchester -  £110k
description: Microsoft Solution Architect - Manchester - £110k - Enterprise Projects

A leading Global Systems Integrator with a market-leading reputation for designing cutting-edge, enterprise scale solutions requires an experience Solution Architect to join their senior ranks. You'll join a world class delivery team and lead the design  of custom software solutions for their list of blue-chip clients, most of which are household names.
The Company pride themselves on innovation - you'll leverage a variety of cloud, open source and IP technologies to deliver the best possible solution for the client.

As a member of the solution architecture team, you will bring a mix of technical skills, industry insight, business acumen and leadership. You will forge close working relationships not only with the architecture and engineering teams in UK and, but also  with the many other disciplines in the business such as engagement managers and account executives. You will take a leading role in both delivery and business development to shape and design innovative, custom solutions for your clients.
Excellent knowledge of exploiting Microsoft Azure for delivery of cloud-native solutions
A strong background in Microsoft technology; experience of building scalable, resilient and secured applications using Microsoft SharePoint, Dynamics 365 and Microsoft .NET.
Exposure to and some experience of working with structured architecture approaches (e.g. TOGAF).
Experience of working in collaborative teams.

You'll work in an environment whereby just because you're an Architect, it doesn't mean you've reached the ceiling. You'll have a custom career development plan with a clear guide as to how you can reach your goals - so whether you want to go into a strategic-level  operational role or leading a larger delivery team, the options are open.
As well as a market-leading benefits package, there will be a salary on offer of up to £110k (depending on experience).
For more information, contact Graydon Winter on or email

title: Operations Administrator
description: : The Triangle Building, Shaftesbury Road, Cambridge

These are exciting times for Cambridge Assessment English as we look to modernise our systems and strive to find creative and innovative ways to improve our products and services to customers. To enable us to meet the ever increasing demand for our services,  we are seeking to appoint one enthusiastic and dynamic Operations Administrator, who will thrive in this changing environment and is motivated by delivering excellent customer service.
This role encompasses a range of tasks and responsibilities. Reporting to a line manager, you will:
take responsibility for the timely and accurate delivery of an agreed set of operational processes.
liaise effectively with customers and service providers as required via telephone, email and face-to-face, providing excellent customer service both internally and externally.
establish constructive working relationships with Operations team members and colleagues across the organisation.
proactively identify improvements in operational processes.
take part in new developments and the delivery of new products and services as required.
perform other duties as defined by the line manager.

Ideal candidates will have administration experience in a busy office environment and have a good working knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite of products. Accuracy and attention to detail is essential in this role, as is experience of providing a high  level of customer service. The ability to prioritise work effectively to achieve a number of tight deadlines is another essential attribute. The role will also require you to demonstrate good interpersonal skills, as well as the ability to work under pressure  and without close supervision.
For further skills required please see essential and desirable criteria below.
Experience of providing a high level of customer service
Ability to work effectively under pressure
Ability to prioritise workload effectively and meet deadlines
Experience of working in a complex and busy office environment
Experience of office administration / data processing
Experience of following a set of documented processes and procedures
Good working knowledge of Microsoft office products
High standard of spoken and written English
Knowledge of the Cambridge Assessment English product range

Cambridge Assessment English is a part of Cambridge Assessment, a department of the University of Cambridge. We are the global leader in English language assessment. We help people learn English and prove their skills to the world. We provide exams in English  for speakers of other languages taken by over 5 million candidates worldwide each year, as well as the leading range of qualifications for language teachers.
In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a comprehensive package of benefits to help with your life both inside and outside of work:
28 days annual leave, plus bank holidays
Annual performance related bonus and increases (discretionary)
Employee discount and cash back scheme at 2,500 retailers
Discounted access to the University of Cambridge Sport Centre, along with various other local gyms

We know that diversity of thinking, backgrounds and approaches leads to innovation and creates an atmosphere where everyone’s contribution is valued. As well as wanting to create diverse teams, we also value diversity in the way our people approach their  work. Work/life balance is important to us at Cambridge Assessment and we offer our colleagues a range of flexible working options according to the needs of the business and the individual, so please let us know of any flexible working requirements when applying  and we can see how we can support you.
The closing date for receipt of applications is 03/03/2019
and interviews will be held on 13/03/2019

If you’re successful at interview stage we will ask you to undergo background screening (carried out by Credence Background Screening Ltd), to ensure that all information provided to us is accurate. We wish you all the very best with your application.

title: SAP Project Manager
description: We are currently looking for a SAP Project Manager to join a leading company based in the Cheshire area. As the SAP Project Manager you will be responsible for delivering a £1.2 million SAP implementation to Pharma cGMP standards
Your duties as the SAP Project Manager will be varied however the key duties and responsibilities are as follows:
1. You will be responsible for the delivery of a £1.2 million SAP implementation to cGMP/pharma standards, you will be implementing SAP ECC6.0

2. You will be responsible for the full end to end project management of the SAP implementation including project scope, finance control, project planning and controls, implementation, stakeholder management and user training
3. You will need to liaise with the 3rd party supplier to ensure the correct configuration of SAP and time-scales are met
4. You will need to liaise with key stakeholders to ensure that the SAP project is delivered in time and to budget including Quality, IT, Finance and Operations
To be successful in your application to this exciting opportunity as the SAP Project Manager we are looking to identify the following on your profile and past history:
1. You will need to have previously delivered at least two SAP projects of similar value and for a minimum of six months in length
2. You will need to show demonstrable skills and knowledge in SAP ECC 6.0
3. Certified in PMP, Prince 2 or similar project management qualification
Key Words: SAP, Pharma, cGMP, Project Manager, Implementation

title: Assistant Accountant
description: Assistant Accountant Job - Management Consultancy Business - Central London - Temporary to Permanent - £35000

A sports management consultancy business based in Central London are looking for an Assistant Accountant to join there team. This job has become available due to increased workload. This business deal with sporting bodies that are trying to improve their revenue  streams, PR and marketing, and my client provide consultants to help with this.

This will give you  autonomy to build relationships and deal with the entire function. In this job you will be dealing with journals, variance analysis, balancesheet reconciliations and assisting with the management accounts production.

You will need experience in a similar job where you have dealt with journals and month end accounting. You will need to be flexible and open to taking on further responsibilities. You will need to be happy liaising with clients and dealing with issues. Having  experience using a ERP accounting software would be very beneficial but all accounting experience will be considered. You will be working with market leading sports brands a teams  and have the chance to own your own work. The office is based in an excellent locations in London surrounded by restaurants and easy transport links.

title: Financial Adviser (Non Diploma Level 4)

The role of Financial Consultant will involve working on
Reporting to the Area Manager, you will be required to achieve regular sales of new business to attain individual and company sales objectives whilst providing on going quality customer service
Advising clients on a range of financial products in their homes, including savings plans, investments, pensions and protection policies
Servicing existing customers through regular reviews, expanding existing customer sales through these regular reviews
Expanding the customer base through referrals and other direct sales techniques
Attending regular meetings with the Area Manager and colleagues.
Acting in accordance with the FCA Code of Conduct for Company Representatives

20 days’ holiday rising to 25 over first 5 years plus bank holidays

title: Key Account Manager
description: An exciting opportunity has arisen with a fast-growing Health, Beauty and Nutrition FMCG organisation for a Key Account Manager to drive new business opportunities in the Grocery and Convenience channel.
Our client is a fast-growing Health, Beauty and Nutrition business.

The Key Account Manager will be responsible for managing key accounts and new business opportunities with the Grocery Channel and other key retailers. The Key Account Manager will utilise their track record in developing business in the channel, to build  long term, profitable relationships that meet the organisations' mutual objectives.

The successful candidate will be self-sufficient in building Joint Business plans for both own label and branded projects, and managing all internal stakeholders effectively in order to meet clients' needs, including the planning and organisation of bespoke  promotional activity for key accounts. The Key Account Manager will manage gross and net profit expectations within each customer, achieving brand specific and commercial objectives, and furthermore, regularly reporting back, delivering competitor insight  and accurate forecasting.

This is a hands on role. In addition to being the go-to contact for the organisation within the channel, the Key Account Manager will attend relevant exhibitions and travel to meetings as required. It will require the successful candidate to be self-motivated,  roll up their sleeves and be a team player.
This role is field-based/working from home, with visits to the South Wales Head Office as required.
Have a FMCG sales track record
Have recent, Grocer Channel experience with an active network
Ideally have a background in Wellness, Health, Beauty or Nutrition
Be commercial, with strong decision-making skills
Have strong reporting and forecasting skills
Fit within a company that is innovative and hands on
Have a full, clean driving license

title: Employment Support Coach
description: Ways to Work is a Liverpool City Region wide programme funded via European Social Funding (ESF) to support unemployed residents aged 16 to 75 into employment and training opportunities. The Programme is delivered across all 6 local authority areas within  the LCR.

The Liverpool element of programme has 4 strands of delivery supported by a number of services within the Council; Employment & Skills, Children’s Services and Community Services. The programme supports unemployed people, including care leavers, residents  aged 50+, ex-offenders, disabled, BAME, asylum seekers/refugees and young people with special educational needs.

The Employment Support Coach will support provide appropriate pre-work/training and in-work/training support for people who are disadvantaged from entering employment. This will include participants with learning disabilities, those on the autistic spectrum,  mental health difficulties and/or physical disabilities and sensory impairments. Incorporating support to participants on the Ways to Work (ESF) programme and those that are not in employment, education or training (NEETS).

title: Employment Support Officer
description: Ways to Work is a Liverpool City Region wide programme funded via European Social Funding (ESF) to support unemployed residents aged 16 to 75 into employment and training opportunities. The Programme is delivered across all 6 local authority areas within  the LCR.
The Employment Support Officer post will be lead on supportint NEET young people in the City with special educational needs/learning disabilities back into training or employment.

The post holder will lead on the the development, design and co-ordination of employability support programmes such as supported internships, work experience, training and one to one intervention to support young people with special educational needs in the  city.

title: Sales Support Administrator
description: Hugely successful, Reading-based print and design company, est. over 30 years, still growing! Exciting projects and clients - big household names! Chance to progress and make the role your own. Fast-paced, varied role, support external sales team, perfect  for someone looking to start a sales career.
To be considered you will need some experience in a sales support or customer service role.
A little bit about the company

Our client has achieved huge success in their 30 years of business in Reading and this is an exciting time to be joining them. They are a vibrant, family run company with a great reputation for quality and innovation. As a print and design company they work  on varied and exciting projects, working with some big household names.
Based in their offices in Reading, you will be working in a varied role where you will be supporting the external sales team.

One day could be speaking with customers, following up leads and getting an understanding of customer requirements and the next day you could be collating information for the production team, entering information onto the CRM system, following up on samples  and helping with presentation preparation.

No two days are the same here and you will have the chance to develop in a sales support role, where there is the opportunity to progress and develop a sales career, all while speaking to some really exciting and well known clients!
What kind of person and background are we looking for?

For this sales support role we are looking for an enthusiastic and vibrant person who is looking to progress in their career. Maybe you have some experience in customer service and are now looking for the opportunity to get into sales - this could be your  chance - there are fantastic opportunities here to learn from the rest of the team!
Organisation is key in this fast paced role - you must be good at multi-tasking and used to speaking to lots of customers on a daily basis. The ability to use a CRM system is important too.
This all sounds great - what next?
Interviews are happening imminently so please get in touch with our team asap to find out more.

title: Host / Front of House Receptionist - Volvo Training Centre (Part Time Maternity Cover)
description: We are looking to recruit maternity cover for a part time Front of House Receptionist to work 25 hours per week - Monday to Friday 12 noon to 5 pm.
To ensure that Volvo Car UK Dealer Training & Development Centre provides a warm, friendly and professional environment to visiting customers.
To ensure that on arrival, all visitors receive a pleasant and courteous welcome.
To ensure that effective contact is maintained with site visitors during their stay.
To ensure that visitors’ needs are dealt with promptly and completely.

Ensure a friendly welcome for all site visitors and ensure they are made to feel comfortable
Attend to customers’ needs while they are on site

Interact with visitors during social times (i.e. coffee and lunch breaks)

Support the prompt answering (within 3 rings) of incoming phone calls
Manage course attendance via i-pad registration and Learning Management System update
Manage delegate "no-shows" and late arrivals. Call Dealer Managers to establish the situation
Daily liaison with Restaurant Manager to ensure accuracy of planned visitor numbers
Maintain customer information screens and room booking panels
Carry out additional supportive administration duties as directed
Encourage feedback from delegate visitors to ensure continual improvement
Ensure that all visitors’ enquiries, queries and complaints are acknowledged and recorded immediately and passed quickly to the relevant team member
Maintain and improve customer relations, thus enhancing the quality, image and reputation of VCUK Dealer Training & Development
Report to manager any losses, damage or other incidence of cost arising in the public areas
Maintain standards of behaviour and appearance as expected by visitors.
Ensure professional and courteous customer contact at all times.

You will need to be able to work 12 noon - 5 pm Monday to Friday each week.
Experience and skills within a customer-focused environment.
Calm and organised approach to problem solving, tackling stressful situations and handling a varied workload.
Knowledge and experience of retailing operations.
Capable of interacting with all types of visitors in a lucid, professional and pleasant manner.
Embrace customer care and Customer Relations Management training and development.
Pro-active approach to providing a premium customer experience.
We are looking to recruit immediately so if you feel you have the necessary skills and experience,
by sending a copy of your CV and a summary note explaining why you feel you would be suitable for this role.
The salary for this role is up to £21,000 per annum - Full time. Pro rata equivalent will be paid for part time.

title: IT Support Engineer
description: One of my best clients is looking for an IT Support Engineer to join their team in Manchester on an initial fixed term basis for 6 months with a view to extending for a further 6 months and then becoming permanent.

The main responsibility of the IT Support Engineer will be to support the Windows 10 rollout project, so we are looking for someone with good knowledge system. You may also be involved in being part of the company Application Lifecycle Process, administration  and resolution of requests and problem management processes, to facilitate effective management of the day to day IT support function.
Other Duties Required of the IT Support Engineer:
Assist in the day to day administration of the IT Infrastructure including Active Directory, servers, print services and messaging systems.
Assist in timely resolution of logged Incidents and requests following defined processes and observing agreed Service levels.
Monitoring and resolving end user support issues
Provide escalation point for IT Service desk. Assist by providing information on known errors and workarounds.
Contribute to development and administration of problem management and knowledge management processes, following ITIL best practices.
Facilitate and administer event management process.
The creation and upkeep of accurate documentation to assist in efficient running of the support function.

Assist in the administration of centralised Licenses and upkeep of License servers.
Assist in completion of projects, when required, in particular creation of documentation to assist in service transition.
The successful IT Support Engineer will be paid up to £25,000 per annum on a pro-rata basis initially.

title: Trainee Client Executive
description: HELPING OUR CLIENT GROW GREAT BRANDS

The Trainee Client Executive (TCE) is an entry level position for someone with a passion in brand communications, marketing and advertising. The TCE will work on insight projects for some of the world’s greatest brands, providing insights as part of a larger  team. The TCE’s duties will vary but will include the set up and ongoing management of research projects, producing and quality checking reports, and providing insights to clients. Kantar Millward Brown is the world’s leading expert in helping clients grow great brands - from strategic brand development through to researching creative executions, assessment of brand performance and future potential for brand growth.

Our mission is to provide research-based advice to help our clients successfully manage their brand assets and optimize the return on their media and communication investments and so create value for our clients, staff and shareholders.
 Kantar Millward Brown at a glance, one of the world's top 10 full-service market research firms:
 88 offices in more than 55 countries, around 5500 employees
 10,288 BrandDynamics™ projects and 7630 BrandZ™ projects running or completed since 1996 launch
 Powered by insights, innovative thinking and a rich heritage, we focus on providing actionable solutions to address key business issues
o Opportunity to work across a portfolio of the world’s greatest brands
o Demonstrating a passion for brands, a willingness to learn and a desire and hunger to improve your skills
o You will be expected to contribute to our collaborative culture, with a can-do attitude and a positive approach to your work
o You will work through various client projects from Design through to Delivery, with varying degrees of ownership (from taking the brief to client presentations)

o Contribute to the production of client deliverables, such as questionnaires and presentations. You will help to ensure the smooth running of research projects, and give input into insight presentations
o You will also learn how a project works from a financial standpoint, and progress to be responsible for the fiscal management of the project
o Successful candidates will learn to apply our world class techniques in measuring brand equity, evaluating advertising and getting the best return on investment possible for media spend
o Communicate to a high standard consistently with internal and external stakeholders
o Build effective relationships internally, and with clients, to ensure the smooth running and timely delivery of work
o A 2.1 in a relevant subject, and a minimum of C grades in Maths and English at GCSE, or relevant experience.
o Analytical ability, and aptitude working with data in order to understand and evidence arguments or trends.
o An interest in brand communications, advertising and marketing.
o The desire and ambition to learn, improve your skills, and progress your career.
o The ability to communicate effectively through spoken and written English. Experience presenting, or the confidence/desire to learn this ability would be beneficial.
o The ability to function effectively in a teamwork environment.
o Must be eligible to work in the UK
We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Travel Money Advisor - Tesco - Weston Favell
description: Salary per annum: £7,005.44 pa / £8.42 ph + additional benefits listed below
Whether it’s a customer taking a weekend break or a couple going on the holiday of a lifetime, we want to be part of their journey to an unforgettable experience. That’s why we need you!
So, what does the role involve?

In this role, you will do more than just buy and sell currency. This role is about providing great customer service, building relationships and getting to know your customer along with all aspects of travel money! Don’t worry if you can’t tell us the difference  between a Dirham or a Baht as we don’t expect you to know all things travel money from the outset - we will provide you with thorough training to set you up for success!

Joining us will feel like being part of a family, so although you will need to be comfortable working by yourself, you will get support across the business and engage with other Travelexer’s globally on our internal blog! We also provide you with the opportunity  to progress your career as we have bureaus right across the UK (and the world) as well as offering NVQ’s/Apprenticeships and development programmes.
What kind of person are we looking for?

You’ll be friendly and approachable as well as having an eye for detail. You’ll need to be good with numbers as you will be handling multiple currencies and accuracy is key. Ensuring our customers have a great experience is really important to us, therefore  we look for people who share our passion for customer service!

We have a clear purpose at Travelex. We understand the value of exchanged money, and the opportunities it opens up to our customers. We’re excited for them, and enjoy being part of their individual journey, whatever and wherever it might be.

Travelex has operated for more than 40 years and serves customers in over 70 countries across 6 continents, offering a range of services to both consumers and businesses, operating as a globally recognised and widely trusted foreign exchange operator.
Exciting? We think so! Your journey starts here, so take the first step to become part of the Travelex family by clicking apply.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

This role is offering 16 hours per week, paying £8.42 per hour with the opportunity for enhanced overtime/bank holiday pay. The successful candidate will be able to manage and nurture supporters through e-mail, telephone, written proposals, site visits and other forms of communication with the aim of ensuring their on-going and increasing support and achieve agreed targets through  researching, identifying and applying to/approaching existing and new legators. title: Lead BI Consultant  - Home Based
description: Location - Home Based with Travel as required
Salary - £45,000 - £60,000 + Car Allowance, Bonus, Development Plan

We're looking for a Lead BI Consultant to join a leading data analytics company. Our client are a Microsoft gold partner working across a range of industries to help organisations make improved business decisions through the power of data.

As a Lead Consultant you will be joining a growing service delivery team responsible for providing technical leadership on a variety of data projects. Lead consultants will take responsibility for being the primary point of contact on medium sized projects  whilst also working alongside Principal consultants on large scale projects.
The role is home based with travel to Yorkshire offices and UK clients, but our client offsets that with a flexible approach to working and allow you to manage your own time and work from home.
Main Responsibilities of the Lead BI Consultant:
Working with customers to estimate timescales and producing detailed project plans outlining agreed arrangements

Good knowledge of Power BI or a comparable visualisation tool
