title: Commercial Finance Analyst FTC
description: Our client, a dynamic and growing business, is seeking a commercial finance analyst to join them on a 9 month fixed term contract. This an excellent opportunity to gain exposure in a financial modelling focused role, playing a pivotal role in the bid process.

Offering a generous package, this is an excellent opportunity for a commercial astute analyst to take on a challenging and varied role. Working with a number of the departments within the business you work towards ensuring and improving bid performance.
- Supporting monthly and annual business planning cycle
- Maintaining and support Cost Revenue Estimation Model (CREM) template
- Producing financial and strategic evaluation of investment projects, utilising ROI
- Leading on the construction of financial bid models for bids as required, ensuring correct treatment for revenue recognition
- Assisting Legal and Bid teams with the preparation of Bid and Contract schedules
- Ensuring financial handover of new business wins to operational finance

The successful candidate will be a confident and credible analyst, with proven experience in financial modelling in a commercial setting. You will be assured in your abilities to work on bid processes, keen to innovate and implement improvements.

A confident communicator, you will have proven experience in being able to articulate yourself to range of audiences. The successful candidate will be advanced user of Excel with solid accounting knowledge, including a good understanding of revenue recognition.
Vitae Financial Recruitment Ltd is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.

title: IT Project Manager
description: This is an exciting opportunity to join a leading retail organisation based in Bath as an IT Project Manager on an initial 3 month contract.
My client is undertaking a major IT transformation programme and requires a strong IT Project Manager on an initial 3 month contract.
The successful IT Project Manager will be responsible for:
Working closely with wider PMO (Programme Managers, PMO, Business Analysts) to deliver a range of IT and digital focused projects
Fully scoping, planning, analysing and delivering projects within remit
Maintaining project plan and managing risks & issues, communicating to senior stakeholders where necessary
Working with a range of technical colleagues and business stakeholders to ensure project deliverables meet organisation requirements
Leading on a range of projects including digital, eCommerce and IT software delivery
Working closely with QA team to ensure delivered solutions are fit for introduction into go-live
Working closely with development teams to ensure requirements are met
The successful IT Project Manager will possess:
Track record in successful delivery of IT projects as part of a transformation programme
Experience across a range of project types including digital, software delivery and eCommerce
Delivery focus and knowledge of a range of methodologies including agile and waterfall
Relevant sector experience e.g. retail, wholesale, logistics, distribution etc.

title: Stores and Shipping Administrator
description: We are looking for a Stores and Shipping Administrator on a full time, permanent basis in Ely.
As a Stores and Shipping Administrator, your primary function will be to work alongside a dynamic and flexible team to maintain product flow at all times.
This position will suit someone who is capable of managing a demanding schedule and is familiar working to short deadlines.
Book stock into the production control (ERP) system, in a timely manner and with extreme accuracy to ensure data integrity.
Create shipping documents, commercial invoices and customs documents to facilitate accurate and timely shipments to customers around the globe.
Maintain a customer focus at all times to ensure the customer experience is never compromised.
Good verbal and written communication skills
Proven ability to work in a team environment dealing with people from multiple departments
Some knowledge of an ERP system
Neaves & Neat Employment Services Ltd. are acting as an Employment Agency for this Permanent vacancy.

title: Resource Planning Team Leader - Contact Centre
description: RESOURCE PLANNING TEAM LEADER - CONTACT CENTRE
Up to £35,000 - Plus Bonus & Excellent Benefits Package
Planning and forecasting for a multi-channel Contact Centre to ensure service levels are met and staff are fully utilised.
Analysis of MI/BI to understand performance, highlight areas of improvement and recommend solutions
Investigate data in order to effectively manage campaigns to achieve targets for tasks and outbound / inbound campaigns
Manage, develop and support a team of resource and business analysts
Working with companywide stakeholders to gain a complete understanding of inbound & outbound contact demand.
Producing and publishing short / medium / long term forecasts for a multi-channel, and multi skilled Contact Centre operation.
Real-time supervision and management of Contact Centre employee’s availability.
Volume / Forecast / Service Level related MI production at interval / day / week / month / quarter / annual level.
Interval / Daily / Weekly / Monthly meetings with Contact Centre Management team to review and react to changes in expected demand.
Ownership and management of shrinkage within agreed thresholds e.g. annual leave, sickness absence, flexi time.
Undertake other duties over and above those listed in the job description, appropriate to the individual’s skills and experience.
Support Team Leaders to ensure sufficient time allocations are provided for the purposes of people management e.g. One to one’s, team meetings, personal development time.
Keep up to date with industry best practice standards and provide recommendations to Contact Centre Manager in respect of future developments / enhancements.
Utilise BI to highlight areas which result in recommendations for improvements
Effective use of workforce management tool to create effective shift patterns that optimise resource to call flow
Demonstrate a flexible and co-operative approach towards evolving business requirements.
Shared accountability for achievement of operational Service levels.
Shared accountability for the achievement of resource related KPI’s e.g. shrinkage, schedule adherence, productivity.
The ability to work to tight deadlines and manage workloads effectively.
Ability to manage own workload and deliver a high quality of output.
Produce recommendations utilising BI information to strengthen those recommendations.
An excellent ability to communicate both written and verbally.
Be focussed on achievement of targets both for inbound contact and also for value adding campaigns.
Ability to investigate data, delving into complex queries to unearth the next best action to improve results
Ensure that our customers are treated in accordance with the principals of Treating Customers Fairly (TCF).
Act in accordance with the Company’s values with both internal and external customers to facilitate continued and improved company reputation and success.
A workforce planning/management qualification would be beneficial.
Educated to GCSE standard or equivalent (minimum Grade C in Maths & English)
An excellent working knowledge of Microsoft.
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel and SQL
Experience in resource management is essential.
Knowledge of planning theories and forecasting methods
Experience of making decisions through analysis of results
Building of BI reports to understand performance and recommend solutions
Experience of managing outbound activity including management of tasks
Experience of building demand forecast models and creating forecast plans
Experience of using workforce planning and management tools to build and manage resource plans that meet demand forecasts.
Experience of intraday (real time) resource planning would be advantageous
A contact centre background would be beneficial.
Knowledge of report writing and presenting would be an advantage.
Strong people management and influencing skills
Challenge effectively at all levels and able to back up these challenges using financial measures
Creativity and innovation - be able to recommend solutions
Attention to detail particularly around statistics
Time management skills. Able to organise and plan own and others workloads
High standard of written and verbal communication and the ability to inform audiences of all levels and experience of complex details and concepts.
Problem solving skills and create solutions
To work as part of a team leader group ,delivering required levels of resource and BI enabling the contact centre to achieve results for SLAs and targets

title: Agile Project Manager - Software Vendor
description: Responsible for the project delivery of the companies software solutions to end users, to agreed specification, time, and budget operating within the appropriate governance and reporting to all stakeholders.
Delivery of the contract including project accounting, invoicing, billing etc.
Working cross functionality within the business and in collaboration with the customer to identify, manage and remedy any risks, issues, dependencies or blockers.
Maintaining a constant line of communication with the senior leadership team.
Should an issue require escalation, you are responsible for resolution in the appropriate channel.
Looking beyond the bounds of team's working environment to solve problems, on a regular basis.
Tracking of the relevant project metrics. These are predominantly burn down charts, velocity reports, release planning and defect metrics.
Communicating the team's output to internal and external stakeholder groups at demos.
Reporting status and key metrics both to the wider organisation and back to the team as a feedback mechanism.
Taking responsibility of budget management including appropriate escalation, where required.
Ensuring project governance is adhered to and any remedial actions are completed in a timely fashion.
As an Agile Project Manager you should be able to:
Create a development environment that is creative, safe, productive and supportive and enables multi-direction collaboration.
Help the product owners understand and adhere to scrum techniques and practices while ensuring consistent, sustainable delivery.
Provide guidance, coaching, support and facilitationto the team.
Support individual efforts, address any issues that arise, and remove obstacles to help individuals be focused and productive.
Ensure team members have all the resources necessary to do their job.
Ensure that the team has solid processes and good discipline in place.
Ensure that the team drive their deliveries with quality, innovation and customer satisfaction at heart.
Able to facilitate discussions in and outside of team.
You will be great in this role if you:
Are a confident communicator, with both technical and non-technical people. Have the gravitas to inspire your teams, and help coach and mentor less experienced members.
Are comfortable in working in a transforming environment where some teams work agile and others work to other methodologies such as waterfall.
Make customer-oriented decisions and shares great stories of exceptional customer service.
Knowledge of Agile Software development processes.
Has had some exposure to Agile and/or experience of working with co-located and distributed teams.
Experience of some agile methodologies e.g. Scrum or Kanban.

title: Head of IT
description: An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Head of IT to join a huge international Christian charity in their East London Office. As this charity grows, they are looking for someone who can head up the entire technical environment within the charity including  data management, ERP, CRM, all software and infrastructure systems. This is a brilliant chance for someone to learn new skills as you will be working across various technologies and will have full control over the future development of the whole technology  department.

As the Head of IT you will work closely with the International Director of IT to identify and drive a range of new and exciting IT projects, developing a whole new IT strategy and controlling the process from start to finish. This is an excellent opportunity  for an ambitious Head of IT to enter a role where they can really develop the technical infrastructure of this charity.
Skills required for the Head of IT are:
* Previous experience of developing full IT strategy from start to finish
* Good all round experience in data management, CRM, ERP, Business Intelligence and Infrastructure
* Excellent communication skills to deal with both international and national stakeholders
* Controlling the whole IT department including asset management and infrastructure
IT Manager/ IT Data Manager / Head of IT / Head of Information Technology

title: Electrical Maintenance Engineer
description: One of my clients is seeking a talented individual to take on the role of Electrical Maintenance Engineer in a busy and challenging environment. This is very much a hands-on role, in which you will provide vital support to the business, working closely with  the Engineering Manager to strengthen our team and contribute with the smooth running of the organisation.
Skills required for the Electrical Maintenance Engineer include:
Working as a member of the Engineering Team, the successful candidate will provide multi-skilled engineering and maintenance cover across the entire production facility. Duties will include:
Completion of all routine maintenance, in line with the agreed site plan.
Repair and maintenance of the plant and its equipment, to ensure faults are identified quickly and production downtime is minimized.
Accurate recording of all work undertaken for compliance and audit purposes.
Ensuring all duties are undertaken in line with current health & safety legislation.
An experienced multi-skilled engineer with good electrical and mechanical knowledge.
Conversant with Three Phase equipment, inverters sensors and control panel fault finding.
Have experience of pneumatics, pumps and valves.
Work proactively and willing to take the initiative.

If you are interested in the role of Electrical Maintenance Engineer and have the qualities and experience for the role, then please call Devan Banton Premier Engineering or apply now with your updated CV.

title: Product Designer UX/UI - HealthTech - 3-6 month Contract
description: I am working with an exciting and disruptive Healthtech startup who are looking for a UI/UX product designer in London to transform the way we view healthcare and connect with the industry. Their customers and users play the most important role in building  the product, and you will have the opportunity to work with them across research, UX and UI disciplines!

You will be working collaboratively to build on and improve the customer journey on their Native App. There will be some aspect of Web application design also. There will be lots of application of Psychology and behavioural science to inspire and guide,  but most importantly, motivate users into increased interaction. The user journey will be key to diagnostic and patient care.

The most important characteristic is that you can wear many hats across the product lifecycle - you'll love getting your hands dirty with great UX / UI design and you'll have a passion for playing a lead role in envisioning our product roadmap and strategy.  You will work closely with the founders to combine service design and user experience to design customer journeys that genuinely enrich people's lives. If you happen to love insights data from user testing, then this role will be perfect for you.
Expansive thinking and user centric design principles to deliver delightful and empowering products for healthcare professionals and patients through different screen formats
Vision - and lots of it. You can see what healthcare could look like in 50 years' time and what we could contribute to that.
Passion to build products that enable sustainable behaviour change based on user insights derived from the power of big data
Ambition to successfully create products that are famous for delighting users and driving patient engagement
Wizardry to seamlessly weave iconography, typography, colour, motion and texture into the products to delight, inspire, engage and excite users
Crazy attention to detail - sleepless nights because a pixel in your design was out of place.
Previous start-up experience - you thrive in conditions of uncertainty and pressure
Experience in designing experiences and products that engage users in changing or replacing their behaviour using behaviour science and psychology
Experience working with remote teams of designers and developers
High value for openness, humility, flexibility, collaboration, diversity and empathy
Experience in leading a team of designers to plan, cost and communicate design tasks
High value for diversity of thought and experience, and can effectively communicate and challenge ideas.

title: Business Development Executive
description: At Grant Thornton we're driven by a purpose of building a vibrant economy, based on trust and integrity in markets, dynamic businesses and communities where businesses and people thrive. We have created our own unique culture - one that offers the opportunities  of a major organisation in a personal, close-knit environment and that is built around shared enterprise.

Grant Thornton Corporate Finance is the leading UK mid-market corporate finance team. We combine award-winning technical expertise with the intuition, insight and confidence gained from our extensive sector experience and a deeper understanding of our clients.  Our experience is in delivering the best outcome for our clients.
The Meeting Origination Executive plays a pivotal role within the Corporate Finance and wider firm departments, here within Grant Thornton UK LLP.
You will develop relationships & win new business in the mid-market by securing meetings with C-Suite directors, predominantly through intelligent cold calling
You'll help to encourage a flow of ideas for meeting opportunities into the Meeting Origination team from Grant Thornton colleagues across all grades
Review and research relevant target organisations to form a relevant and insightful approach on the back of Grant Thornton’s expertise
Manage diary appointments and update the firm's CRM for all approaches made
Network internally to develop strong and trust relationships with key stakeholders and maintain an awareness of thought leadership and ongoing activities within the organisation
Work closely with your colleagues within the Meeting Origination team to support each other to be successful
Someone comfortable with lead generation using well written and verbal communication channels
Self-motivated with a keen interest in sales
Ability to manage and prioritise a demanding workload
Commitment to delivery of a first class quality service at all times
Experience of working in professional services, financial services would be an advantage
Experience of working in a telephony based role - experience of non-scripted cold calling to source new meetings an advantage
We’re looking for people who have a strong connection with and share our core beliefs:
Profit with a purpose that leads to a sustainable business
We create sustainable value for our clients
Our CLEARR values underpin all we do

Your personal development plan will help you grow your skills. And you’ll be able to shape your career within your team or by moving across our business or going on secondments in the UK and across our global network of member firms. You’ll also enjoy a  competitive salary and a flexible benefits package designed to meet your individual needs.

Our unique culture is built around collaboration. Everybody here plays their part. Over the past few years we’ve been making big changes - moving towards becoming a shared enterprise. We share ideas. We share responsibility. We share the rewards. Put simply,  we’re better together.
The time you spend outside of work helps shape what you can bring to our firm. We value the commitments you may have outside of work and will consider all flexible working applications.

title: Finance Business Partner
description: The Finance Business Partner role will have responsibility for providing operational business partnering to a business unit. Partnering with the Plant Director and their senior leadership team, you will help to challenge and deliver the objectives for the  department, whilst ensuring the financial robustness of their results and reporting.

A successful and growing business with an excellent reputation in North Yorkshire. The business support and promote personal and professional development, making it a great place to build a long term and successful career.
As Finance Business Partner you will:
Support the Plant Director in the delivery of the short business plan, providing key financial analysis, reports and information
Support the Senior Finance Business Partner with provision of timely information on key issues affecting the plan to assist decision making

Ensure the team understand and consider the financial implications of key actions and decisions through providing clear insight. Constructively challenge the decisions being made to ensure value is being maximised
Ensure financial forecasts are aligned with the current view within the department and actively kept up to date with clear variance analysis provided to the business to understand changes
Identify opportunities and risks in relation to the department's financial objectives, and work on ways to maximise and mitigate these respectively
Drive improvements in the systems and processes used to report and analyse financial performance within the department
The successful Finance Business Partner will:
Hold a recognised accountancy qualifications (ACA, ACCA, CIMA)
Proven track record of business partnering with non-financial stakeholders - with the ability and confidence to influence and provide challenge to the business, driving change where required
Strong analytical skills, able to model and assess a range of scenarios and outcomes
Attention to detail and a strong understanding of financial control
Excellent communicator, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with senior stakeholders
Hard working, driven and keen to progress
